product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: Okay, so it's a toaster and what does it do? It toasts bread. In that, it serves its purpose almost every morning. It accommodates wider and longer slices of bread, which was my main concern when looking for a new toaster. It also toasts evenly. So I like it. I would recommend this toaster. Only complaints: The stainless steel is kind of hard to keep looking clean, but that's the downside to the stainless steel look. And there's this kind of nasty scratchy noise every time you lower the bread in the slots. It just sounds kind of cheap. I don't like that sound or feel. It sounds like cheap wire frame. But that's kind of what it is. So...it works great! If you're looking for a toaster, this might be the one for you!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Black Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Fantastic Toaster, works and looks great!
review_text: I have no idea what some of the reviewers are complaining about. I guess there are some people you can never make happy, like the twits on Twitter. Anyway, this is a great toaster. I highly recommend it. After first buying two other toasters, in the same price range (but different brands), then having to return them because they were junk, I found this little gem. It toasts evenly, is easy to use, looks great, and is the quality you expect in a $60 toaster. Save your time, money, and trouble and buy this one. Ignore the negative ridiculous comments from the cyber morons.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: White | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: I Would Purchase This Cuisinart Toaster Over All of the Other Ones I have purchased in the Last 20 Years
review_text: This is the most sturdy, well manufactured toaster I have ever had. It actually has a metal exterior. It has a retro active styling and I can toast something froze and it fits a bagel for toasting. Matter of fact, since I have lived in this house have gone through 3 toasters and I didn't use it all that often. So this does cost a great deal more than the chap's I had been purchasing. However, became so disgusted with another toaster not working with smoke coming out of one that I decided to spend the $50 for this Cuisinart brand, deciding that what I had already paid for cheapies, the $50 is a meager amount to pay for such outstanding construction and ease of use.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Black Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: and it matches my fridge. This toaster is nice and browns evenly on both sides. I like mine dark and it does it perfectly. The variety of options, (bagel, toast, etc) is wonderful. It's easy to use. It pops up well but is a little hot when pulling the bread out (so that is for any toast). I usually don't think it's necessary to spend a lot on a toaster--but it matched my kitchen re-decor. I gotta say though, I do see a difference in the toast...I love having it browned right the first time! (PS, this toaster was on the top 10 list of every toaster review article I read. I agree)

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: This morning we used the Cuisinart CPT-180P1 toaster for the first time. It's a 4-slice toaster and each side is independent of the other. We actually could have toasted the frozen waffles and the muffins at the same time on different settings... the defrost feature works to defrost frozen waffles, then toast them! The bagle feature we used for the muffins on the 4.5 heat setting and they were perfectly done. Nicely browned on one side, but the back of the muffins were warm and soft. We are looking forward to toasting a whole variety of breads in our new Cuisinart toaster.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Metallic Red | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: So far, so good. I like my toast dark, but I only put the dial up to 4-1/2 I can't imagine what color the bread would come out it I cranked it up to 11. The interior remained fluffy and the outside evenly toasted. I have always had bad experiences with toasters. None ever seem to last more than a year. It's not like the old days. I remember the toaster I grew up with. A wrapper from the Town Talk bag leaned up against it once and melted on, and that bit of bread wrapper was there my entire young life. I think that toaster finally died while I was in High School. Time will tell if this one lasts long enough to keep these 5 stars. I'll let you know!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: I’ve only had it a week. So far it’s great. We had an Oyster brand for 7 years. It stopped working so I decided to get another Oyster. It’s a 4 slice and the lever on the left side wouldn’t stay down after about one year. After reading tons of reviews from the most expensive toasters to the really cheap ones, I found that it didn’t matter the price or brand, you were taking a chance on getting a lemon. I bought the Cuisinart 4 slice because it’s the one that I was comparing the Oyster 4 slice to when I bought the Oyster a year ago. Since this Oyster didn’t last as long as my old Oyster I went with the Cuisinart this time. So far I noticed that the coils in the Cuisinart light up a lot better ( more evenly) than the Oyster. I’m no longer getting toast with one side darker than the other and light & dark spots because some of the coils didn’t get hot on the Oyster. The other thing I noticed right away is the Cuisinart’s leavers went down with ease and stayed down. I had to snap the Oyster’s leavers down hard and fast to get them to catch. That’s probably why one leaver on the Oyster stopped catching. The Cuisinart was 3 &1/2 times pricier than the Oyster so Im hopeful it’s a case of you get what you pay for. So far I have no complaints about the Cuisinart. If I was LOOKING for something to complain about on a personal level, it’s so quiet that when it’s done toasting I don’t hear it pop. Also, (this goes for every toaster on the market) it’s hard to toast pop tarts without loosing them down the sides. I’m not a fan of and don’t buy beagles or thick bread. I would pay 10 times more for a toaster that would toast normal slices of bread and pop tarts without the hassle. I will give an update after I’ve had the Cuisinart a while longer.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: I did a ridiculous amount of research
review_text: Because this is about my sixth toaster, albeit half of those were from goodwill or yardsales, and I was ready to be done buying toasters. [fingers crossed] I can confirm that this one does an excellent job, evenly toasted on both sides and dark as I want, while still soft on the inside—so, no “melba toast” effect where the whole slice becomes a dry plank. (Like when you make toast in a toaster oven.) There’s a very similar Cuisinart model at Costco that I almost bought, but prefer the rotary knobs and also this one takes up a little less space because the levers aren’t “frenched in” by moving the whole surface outward.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: This is the best toaster I have ever purchased. I have always owned the basic two slice one setting toaster and never really gave it much thought. Then my husband decided he wanted to update our appliances and talked me into this toaster. I will admit, I was apprehensive. Let’s be honest, it’s a toaster, it just toasts. I was wondering why we would ever spend more than ten dollars on something that just toasts but I relented and the toaster was purchased. It arrived in great packaging and undamaged. I took it out of the box and was instantly in love. The toaster looks so adorably retro and the symmetry of the handles and levers on both sides of the dual toaster is very nice. It is a very sleek stainless steel with black accents. The toaster not only has different number settings for the level of browning you want but it also has four settings; bagel, defrost, reheat, and cancel. Since buying this toaster, I have started purchasing dessert breads (in an amount that I’m too embarrased to mention) and freezing the excess when they are discounted. Whenever I feel the desire to have a sweet treat, I grab the bread out of the freezer and use the reheat setting. I swear to you, it tastes just as good from frozen as it does fresh. Another feature I love about this toaster is that it has separate crumb trays for each side of the toaster. I don’t know why I like that, but the thought that the company went that extra little step is just a nice touch. Overall, though I initially resisted, I absolutely love this toaster. I would recommend it to anyone and would buy it again. Just a great product for a great price.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Huge time saver for growing families!
review_text: I rather enjoy speeding up making breakfast on the weekends for my family. It is my thing every Saturday morning. There are several special options available outside of the temperature and time controls. One of the ones I’ve used the most is cancel. If I need the bread to toast a little longer I just drop them back in and hit cancel it I think it might be done. No more forcing the bread to pop up by forcing the level back up. Just hit the cancel button. Making toast for a family of 5 has been cut in half and don’t plan on going back to a two slot toaster even after the kids leave for college. Right will be my setting and left will be my wife’s setting.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: Easy to use. Works perfectly. Once you find the number that makes toast browned the way you like it, you’re all set! Works great on bagels! Have had for many months now and use almost daily so it has had the opportunity to show off any quirks and I’m glad to say, there are none. The 4 slice feature is life saver when making for quantities of toast or bagels. I researched toasters extensively and based on reviews, I went with this one. Have not been sorry for one minute. Buy with peace of mind.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Black Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: Don’t understand the bad reviews. My crap it is a toaster, nothing is ever going to be even. Best toaster I have owned. Soft on the inside, crunchy on the outside. Defrost setting is magic for my Eggos.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: My partner always used a toaster oven to make toast, bagels, etc. Strangely enough, he never grew up with one in his house, but I did. So when I came along, after moving in, I got him this item. True story...he put in a sliced bagel, and when it popped up, he said "Aww darnit!!" I asked what's wrong and he said "This thing made a PERFECTLY GOOD toasted bagel!" LOL

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: My daughter's toaster of many years bit the dust, so I looked around for something nice for her birthday and came across this model. It looks kind of retro which fits her tastes, so I had it sent to her house. She has raves about how well it works and it is the best toaster she ever had. She is not just saying that to me because it was a gift - If she had a problem with it, she would tell me. It handles bread or other items up to 1.5 inches wide. Plus the slide out crumb tray is really nice to have. It has a setting called defrost. It has controls to set the amount of browness on your toast, too. The defrost setting works good if you are just taking your bread slices out of the freezer. You don't have to wait for them to unthaw. But she loves the toaster. Says it works great for english muffins and thicker bread and she is very happy with it.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: After our $20 toaster of twelve years was ruined by a melted plastic bag, we decided to go for a four slice model. I like the look and so far it wipes clean pretty easily. It definitely toasts faster than our old $20 one, but maybe that’s not saying much. I have noticed that if your bread is tall, the top doesn’t become well toasted. But most store size bread toasts just fine. I also appreciate the reheat buttons since I often forget about toast. It’s nice that instead of burning it I can just reheat and forget about it again. ;) And personally I like the fact that this toaster just toasts. I don’t need a croissant reheated or an egg maker, that’s what a stove is for.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Quality, easy to clean. Easy to use. And it works better than EVRY OTHER TOASTER I HAVE HAD!
review_text: Love this toaster. Easy to use works EVERY TIME. No fuss temperature controls are easy to use and very convenient for both sides and since it has other controls make it very convenient. The stainless steel is very easy to clean and the crumb box is hefty and also easy to empty. The cord has pathway organizer on the bottom to keep it tidy so as to not have the cord all hanging out and looping around which is very important to me. And did I mention VERY EASY TO CLEAN. This is a quality toaster you can feel it when you pick it up.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: I wish my old toaster had died a long time ago lol, this toaster is fabulous! Frozen waffles come out crunchy, even, and quite perfect :) along with toast of different breads. I really love the reheat feature as well, what a great idea!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: This is a review for Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless. This toaster has been in daily service for three years and has performed well. It's a moderately priced appliance so I don't expect perfection, but this unit has come pretty close. The bagel setting heats the entire bagel, not just the exterior like other toasters with bagel settings. The reheat button comes in handy, especially when I space out - which happens a little more often these days ;) There are lots of toasters that claim to have a retro look but this is unique in it's old school feel. With periodic maintenance (emptying the crumb trays, using a toothbrush to clean the elements, etc.) this is a great investment. Note: I'm sorry to hear about some of the problems reported in other reviews. If it were me, I'd send the unit back in a New York second because Cuisinart needs the feedback, and more than that, the reviewers need a toaster they can count on. If you feel this review was helpful, please check "yes" below. Thanks and stay toasted!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Great Toaster - IF You Have the Power to Run It!
review_text: I really like this toaster. I only use it for plain toast, not bagels or other fancy stuff. But it toasts very uniformly and consistently from one toast to the next. Only caveat: if you are toasting 4 slices at once, it pulls a LOT of juice. In our kitchen we have to run this thing by itself; if we turn on the microwave or coffee maker at the same time, it blows the breaker. That probably says more about the crappy wiring in our kitchen, but just note that this toaster pulls a lot of amps and if you have substandard wiring and your breaker box is on the other side of the house, you might come to hate this thing. What use is a 4-slice toaster if you only have the electricity to run one side of it at a time? Other than that, a very high quality appliance. I have always been happy with every Cuisinart appliance I have ever owned.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Black Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: I just got it today so far it seems great I’ll update this later on to give a better review but one thing that does so far suck if you get the dark brushed metal one thinking that it will match Samsung appliances it won’t its way lighter in person then the product picture shows. Not the end of the world but was really wanting it to match. Update: so it works quite well.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Neat replacement for a two-slice toaster.
review_text: We really like this four slice toaster. With three people at our house where two of us like our toast one way and one of us likes toast somewhat darker, this is perfect for us. This is our first Cuisinart product and we remain very impressed with both the workmanship and the very smooth mechanisms that seem to glide in place where other toasters seem to be harder to push down. We'll certainly consider Cuisinart products first for future purchases and we would recommend this 4-slice toaster to anyone that would like a toaster that works like the manufacturer designed it be the best on the market. Thank you Cuisinart, ya'll guys did good.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: The Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless is the best toaster that I found after significant research on Amazon and other website, and in stores like BestBuy and Bed, Bath & Beyond. - First, and most importantly, it toasts properly - evenly and without drying out the bread. I tried also Kenmore Elite 76774 4-Slice Auto-Lift Long Slot Toaster in Stainless Steel but I returned it because it was drying out the toast too much and it was huge, taking up a lot of countertop space. - Not too big - never understand why some toasters are as big as a toaster oven or a small microwave... It's a simple appliance. The CuisineArt toaster is just the right size. - Beautifully designed with some retro elements - Affordable mid range price - practically 2-3 times cheaper than the expensive non-professional toasters, like Breville, etc. NOTE: I had the toaster for less than a week. I cannot comment on the product reliability or CuisineArt's customer support quality. Future will tell... :)

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Metallic Red | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: The Retro Look Is A Reminder Of Years Past
review_text: Trying to find a 4-Slice Toaster that wasn't real large or expensive with a design you like wasn't as easy as I thought it would be...especially when I also looked at what Consumer Reports had to say. What we had to do was replace our Cuisinart CPT-440 Touch to Toast Leverless 4-Slice Toaster that was barely over 2 years old because one side just stopped working altogether so you can imagine why I might be a bit hesitant to buy another Cuisinart. However, I read what people had to say about this particular toaster and decided to take another chance. So far, things seems to be working okay. Unlike the one it replace, toasting seems to be pretty even but like every other toaster we've had, you have to be aware of what you are toasting to try and figure what setting to make so you don't under- or over-toast things. The slots are wide enough for bagels and it has setting specific to cooking bagels and frozen pastries.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Great - Just Like My Same Model of about 15 Years Ago
review_text: Solid press-down prevents in some ways, toddler activation, Both pop up same time with same setting, easy lift function to remove small items, Stainless easy clean exterior, removeable crumb trays (though from the rear) and placing unplugged with crumb trays removed, in dry sink, the blower side of portable vacuum removes anything that didn't reach the trays. Loved my original and after many years, one electronic temperature popup didnt work so readily replaced with the same device.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: My first one lasted about 10 years after I caught it on fire.
review_text: No kidding. Got one of these maybe 10 years ago. Put in a frozen corn tortilla to soften it up, then got distracted. OOPS. Flames shooting out the top, my tortilla on fire. Unplugged it and tossed it into sink, ran water in it till it was out. It was about a week old. I was sure it was dead. But I put it outside in the sun to dry after shaking out as much of the burnt stuff as possible. Once it was dry, I finished cleaning it up, plugged it in and it worked. Fast forward 10 years. It finally died. Checked here, see what looks like the same model, nice and shiny. So I bought it. Yes it works well, I have control of how toasted I want things to be. It's wide enough for bagels, and I put hotdog buns on the top to lightly toast them (watching carefully). Works well.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Best toaster we've owned in over 20 years
review_text: This toaster is the best toaster we've owned in over 20 years, maybe even 30. It's the first toaster we've owned that reliably, evenly toasts our bread. It also matches the setting on the dial quite closely. A '3' is lighter than a '4,' and a '5' darker than a '4.' So for us, the experience so far is that you can accurately dial in how much toasting you want done and then, when the bread pops up in a fairly short time, the bread is evenly toasted all over. We finally found a toaster that works as marketed and sold. Now we only hope it will last a while. We have a 30 year old Cuisinart food processor that is still going strong so our hopes are high. I was even considering buying one of those $300 hand-made British toasters, that's how frustrated I was. But after reading several not-so-complimentary reviews even on those, I'm glad I chose this one. The people that are leaving poor reviews for this model must have lemons, because I cannot imagine how you can rate this toaster poorly. Oh, and my wife also really likes its design—how it looks in our kitchen—so that's a plus too.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Metallic Red | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: Our beloved Hamilton Beach toaster, which was probably about 15 years old, was on it's way out. We liked it because it didn't dry the toast out all the way through, but left the middle tender. Thanks to some prior reviews, especially the one who mentioned the toast didn't come out "like a plank" and the attractive design, I decided to give this a try, and I'm happy I did. We are getting the same quality of toast, and I love the "keep warm" and "defrost" settings. Now I can keep my favorite artisanal bread in the freezer without issue. The first few times we used it, the browning was far from even, even on one side. Mysteriously enough, the taste was consistent, and tasted properly browned on both sides. Now it does brown both sides evenly, so there appears to be a "breaking in" time, but the quality does not suffer.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: We just purchased our 2nd one, we loved our 1st one so much! The 1st one lasted 15 years and still works just outer casing came loose as we stored it under the counter and kids would carry it improperly. We are buying a cover for this one and leaving it on the counter. Seriously, the BEST TOASTER EVER!!!! We use for frozen bread, begals, thick egg bread, this sourdough and english muffins - All toasted perfectly!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Very happy I purchase this toaster
review_text: It replaced one that quit browning. We like darker toast, and this new one has up to #6 on settings. One can insert frozen bread for there is a selection to indicated you are using frozen bread. A big thing for me, is that when the lever is depressed to begin toasting, it is securely in place. Some toasters in the past would release and have to be re-pressed. When the toast is done, a definte click can be heard. The lever can be raised slightly to retrieve toast that is shallower. Sound like an ad, but I am so happy with something we use daily.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Finally a toaster that toasts evenly!
review_text: Had a cheap S..B..m that finally gave up the ghost and needed a replacement. Searched reviews ad-noisome and finally decided to go with this Cuisinart. Glad I did as it does toast store type bread very evenly. The only thing I wish it did was toast only on one side for the bagel setting. I don't eat bagels but it would be great when grilling hamburgers and toasting only the inside of the bun. Oh well, small gripe for what appears to be an awesome toaster! If it lasts, I'm an eternal fan; if not, then I will repost and let you know. But for now, just buy it!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: I bought this to replace an older toaster I have had for a good 20 years. I first ordered a different brand name because of the reviews, but, that one only made it out of the box and right back in. It was flimsy and not a solid toaster as I am used to, plus, the quality was not desirable. Now, this Cuisinart toaster was a whole new ball game! I knew as soon as I took it out of the box that it was a keeper. It is a solid built toaster with great features. It toasts to perfection and the controls are easy to use. I even used the defrost feature for frozen bread, and it did not dissapoint. If your looking for a solid built toaster that is not flimsy and cheap looking, then this is the toaster for you. You will not be disappointed.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: For years, we used a toaster oven for our toast. We had to watch it carefully and many times scraped the burnt part off the toast. We finally realized that the only way we used the toaster oven was for toast, so we gave it away and bought this toaster. WE LOVE IT! Consistent browning every time! No need to stand over it and watch. You can set each side to a different browning level and you can really tell if one side was on 3 and the other on 4! We've had it a while now, and I still look at the toast as it comes out and wonder why we didn't do this sooner. There are many different toasters to choose from, and I think we picked the best. It looks great, toasts quickly and consistently, and can be set to two different settings if you wish. I hope it lasts a long time- there is nothing more I would ask from a toaster.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: I am a fan of the Cuisinart brand, even though I am a fan, you can still get crap products even from good brands. My old toaster died so I decided to replace it will a better quality and brand than I had. I had a cheap $10, two slot toaster, although it lasted for three years. Anyway so far this thing is living up to the quality I would expect. The price is perfect and the quality is even better. So far no issues, it toasts everything evenly, no blank spots or spot that are over toasted. I did go through about 10 slices of bread getting the darkness the way I like it. Now that I found the perfect number for toasting regular bread it is perfect for pop tarts(the daughter loves them), bagels, etc., just make sure you read the instruction that came with it, it will come in handy helping you set it up and getting your to that sweet spot as well. Also make sure you register it so if there are any issue Cuisinart will take care of it. I hope I never have to find out. So this is perfect for the price and brand. Make sure you keep it cleaned out and clean in general that way it will prolong its life. This is a definite must buy!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Black Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: For the last 4 years or so, we've used a Breville 4 slice toaster and while it worked, it was great, but then it partially died. They are rather expensive, to say the least, so we changed gears. We decided to try this Cuisinart. While we have only used it for a couple of months so far, it has worked exactly as it should. It's very stylish and looks great on the counter, whereas the Breville (also great styling) was quite heavy and took up a lot of real estate.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: It's a toaster! It toasts Bread!
review_text: I bought this toaster because of the Easy to read and use dials on the front for the darkness of the toast . When the toast pops up, it does sound kind of tinny and cheap, but it does a good job, regardless of the sound. It also toasts perfectly. I looked at a lot of toasters and chose this one for the easy to see controls because I have limited close-up eyesight. Almost every review of other toaster brands rate them all The same, so I got what would work for me. I also have a cuisine art coffee mill which has always also performed well.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: In the past I have always gotten toasters that were $9.99 , $12.99....they work for a while, and then comes the day when you have to press the lever over and over and over....my son raved about his Cuisinart, so I decided to give it a try. What a difference in quality!!!! I freeze my bread because we don't use it often...so, I placed the frozen bread in the toaster, depressed the lever - and it was a solid click!!! Then I pressed the DEFROST button. I assumed I would then have to press it again to toast but no, it knew to defrost THEN toast. It toasted to perfection. The pull out tray is nicely located in the front. The slots are plenty wide. The body is not flimsy. On my old toaster I was patting it on the side upside down to remove ALL the crumbs and it dented!!! This one is definitely worth the extra money. My son has had his for years...meanwhile I have gone through 5 cheaper brands.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Metallic Red | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Just the pop of color needed...plus it makes perfect toast!!
review_text: As with all of my other Cuisinart appliances, this one is awesome, and it looks great too!! Didn't know what to do with this deep corner in my new kitchen - when shopping for a new toaster to replace a well used older Cuisinart model, this caught my eye. My husband called me at work to make sure I really ordered a red toaster - once I placed it in the corner - he got it!!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_header: Great toast, beautiful toaster, but cheap cheap cheap plastic
review_text: This is regarding the brushed stainless model. Most importantly: this thing delivers great toast. I mean, toast is toast, right? Bzzzt. Some toasters do not produce great toast. Some don't even produce good toast. This ain't those. And the design is beautiful to look at. But those plastic parts, particular the "high lift lever" and the "shade control" dial...cheap cheap cheap. Those are not quality pieces. And not even just the feel of the pieces, but feeling how the dial turns...ugh. Just awful. Still, it makes great toast, and it looks great as well.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: My sister has had this toaster for years and I’ve always coveted it. It was finally time for us to get a new toaster and I knew exactly which one I was going to get. Is it possible to love a toaster? I love this one. It’s perfect. It toasts bread, English muffins and bagels perfectly. The extra option of pushing the bread item up so you don’t burn your fingers is a game changer. I absolutely adore my toaster.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-180 Metal Classic 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Stainless
reviewed_product_attribute: Color: Brushed Stainless | Style: 4 Slice-New | Pattern Name: Toaster
review_text: I am serious about my toast, man. I have 3 kids and timing is everything. You can't be farting around w/ a 2 slice toaster when all the eggs and bacon are on the plates. You need speed, you need dependability, you need expert toasting power! This toaster was worth the extra cash. It looks great, it's easy to clean and it consistently pops out the perfectly toasted bread. Good Buy.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: The ABSOLUTE BEST curling iron that Ive come across! I have been trying to get nice CURLS on my ends for some time now, and Ive tried a lot of things. I went to the salon and my stylist used this iron, and NO HAIRSPRAY, GEL, MOUSE, OR whatever else makes curls stay, and my curls stayed in for like 3 days! I did not want to wash my hair, just because I was so amazed by the beautiful curls and waves that I woke up to! So I decided to buy it to see if I can do it myself. This curling iron out does my name brand curling irons without a doubt! I have one that goes for about 3 to 4 times as much as this one, and then I have a set that goes for a few hundred dollars, yet this is the ONE that actually works! The curls actually stay in my hair (unlike with the other curling irons), and because of how effective it is, I dont have to keep trying, and trying, and trying... all while buring my hair and damaging it! I spray my hair with a heat protector, curl small parts at a time (counting to 5 with each strand) and when I'm done I spray lightly with a flexible hold hairspray, then with a sheen spray. I run my fingers through, gently working the curls apart...and voila! I've got beautifully curled hair!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: My hair is thick and has a natural wave, so I use this to smooth my hair into a nice bob. I don't know how it works with thin hair - the temp goes really high, which is what I need. Today I tried scrunching my hair wavy naturally, didn't like it, didn't know if it would work to iron it, but it did.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: this replaces my old curling iron and I am pleased that I got this one. The coating on the handle is of a non slippery substance that makes it easy to hold on to: the spring is strong enough to hold my thin, fine hair to the iron: the barrel cleans easily if my mousse gets stuck to it. The swivel L-shaped cord takes some getting used to... my last one came straight off the iron instead of on a 90 degree angle that this one does..... have to watch or it will clear my desk. The cord is rounded and does not get caught on things like my old one... a definite plus. I would definitely recommend this product

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: An Excellent Curling iron! A MUST HAVE in my book
review_text: What a great curling iron. My hair stylist used this on my hair & I loved how it worked on my hair. She uses really nice tools for hair but most are very pricey (more than I would spend for these items) So I was really surprised to learn how reasonably priced this one was when I asked her the name of it so I could go buy one for myself. I actually ended up buying 2, one for my daughter & one for myself. Interestingly my daughter called me the day after I'd ordered hers, telling me about this great curling iron her hair stylist used on her hair that same day. I laughed telling her about my stylist using the same one on me. She was pretty happy when I surprised her with this new curling iron the next day. We've had them for about a month now & we just love it. We both have very long thick hair & this thing works wonderfully. It's smooth (hair doesn't get snagged in it), really light weight. I love how the cord part swivels as you curl too.I like how the little black knob at the end of the hot iron stays cool so you can hold it easily while holding your hair in the iron. It heats up quickly & has many different temp settings. Would highly recommend.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I have very thick, short to medium hair that has natural wave/curl. I don't wash my hair daily, so need a style that will last 2-3 days. I had tried multiple small curling irons (did I mention my hair is very thick?). None of them did the job. I needed a curling iron to simply finish my style, and have it last. My stylist recommended this brand. She offered to get it for me when they went on sale. I was amazed when I saw it on Amazon for such a spectacular price. This was right before xmas, and I mentioned it to my youngest son. Who says kids (even adult ones) don't listen? I got this amazing curling iron and could not be happier. I expect many "good hair days" from what I've experienced so far. BTW, I use the highest setting because of the thickness of my hair. I have never had any problems at this temperature. I would simply caution...know your hair before using.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I had this model years ago and it is just as good as I remember. Heats up quickly and creates fantastic volume. Yep, it's bulky and somewhat awkward to maneuver but that is to be expected with a large barrel. I have medium length hair and don't expect big, loopy spirals. On longer hair that may be feasible, but it's important to understand what this size curling iron does to shorter hair. I don't think some reviewers had realistic expectations. I'm super happy with it!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: I have pretty short, straight hair and have the half inch ...
review_text: I've been using these for years. I have pretty short, straight hair and have the half inch rod. Love, love love it. It gets super hot and lasts for years. My beautician tells me they are made to stay on all day like they are in salons. I believe they are the only ones she uses too. Comes with extra springs but I'm not sure I've ever had to use them. If I did, the iron was several years old and I use mine every single day.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: This is to replace the same curling iron I’ve been using for a least the past ten years. My old one was starting not to heat sometimes and didn’t seem to hold tightly enough on to my hair anymore.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I love, love, LOVE this tiny curling iron. My hair is naturally wavy but for some strange reason does not like to hold larger curls. So these tiny curls ate not only adorable in my hair and recieve lots of compliments, but as my hair tries to straighten over the span of a day, since it starts out tiny, all it does is turn into a full body curl by days end. Adjustable temp setting is very handy and call me old fashioned but I still greatly prefer having a curling iron with the flap to hold hair. I'm not a wand girl, as I often do hair as I'm doing other things and like not having both hands occupied during the entire styling process.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: You choose the temp you want and this iron heats up fast. I have very short super fine hair and needed to find a way to put a little lift in it. Add in Florida humidity and my previous flat iron just couldn’t cope. This little 1/2” curling iron is getting the job done!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: EXCELLENT curling iron. My hairstylist at Aveda uses this curling iron, and recommended it to achieve loose curls/beach waves. I have very fine shiny hair which is usually difficult to curl. With a bit of Kenra 25 hairspray my curls last all day! I would recommend this to anyone with healthy hair. (if your hair is brittle be sure to use a heat protectant and turn down the heat setting)

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: This is seriously the greatest curling iron ever. Buy it now
review_text: I bought this two, maybe three years ago, and it is honestly the best hair tool I've ever owned. It works incredibly well, heats up super fast (and has a temperature control so you don't fry your hair), doesn't noticeably damage your hair, it's consistently worked for the last three years, and as far as high quality irons go the price is pretty reasonable. As someone who curls her hair pretty much every day and has gone though a lot of curling irons, this is the best one by far. I also do hair and makeup backstage for my school's plays, and so I've tested this iron on many different types of hair and it's consistently worked on everyone. Other people often bring their irons in, too, and this one works better than all of them, people are constantly coming up to me and asking where I got it and if they can use it. I know people who claim they've never gotten their hair to hold a curl before, and this iron has made their hair curl. It's kind of magical. The only annoying thing about it is the cord can get really tangled up, but that's not a huge deal. Seriously, buy it. You won't regret it. A couple of things to note: I have pretty long hair (about elbow length when wet) so the 1 in barrel works perfectly for me, but I have friends with much shorter hair and it's too big for them, it only flips their hair out and doesn't curl. If you have a bob or short hair, go for a smaller barrel size. I'd recommend not using the clip, too, because you get more natural curls if you don't, but if you do want to use it it does come with extra springs if the spring breaks off, although I've never had to use them.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: This is a superb curling iron. I read about it in an email from Southern Living and decided that I had to get it after the glowing reviews. I'm so glad that I did. It's a really substantial barrel - very well made. It has a small dial that you turn for the heat setting you prefer and it heats up pretty fast. My hair is very tough to curl so normally I have to crank up the heat and leave it on my hair for several minutes. I was really impressed with the nice big bouncy curl and volume that the wand produced. It held pretty well too after I sprayed some hairspray onto my hair. There is also a nice long cord and a swivel at the bottom of the wand so that the cord doesn't continually get tangled up. Really fantastic product for the price! I got the 1.25 inch barrel but I also like a smaller barrel for a tighter curl so I think I will get the smaller size too! Love this product and it was a great price on Amazon! Very happy with this purchase! :)

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: I am very happy with this purchase - I got the 1 1/2 ...
review_text: I am very happy with this purchase - I got the 1 1/2 Inch Spring Iron. I have been looking for a new curling iron that give you light beachy waves and this one is amazing. It heats up very quickly and the heat settings are accurate. It works very smoothly in your hair and your hair glides on the iron part. With other Curling Irons my hair often got stuck and dragged during the process. Since the cable part is flexible and rotates it never really gets in your way. I have very very long and VERY straight hair and usually curling irons have not been able to make my hair curly instantly without a lot of effort and make me have beautiful waves all day long. It has always been a struggle until now - with this curling iron I am able to give my hair volume, waves or curls within minutes in the morning before work or before I go out. Again, I have VERY straight and stubborn hair, which is usually so hard to get curly but this product creates amazing results with very little effort! So happy I found it! I would highly recommend!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I'm really glad I chose this Hot Tools Professional Curling Iron. My stylist used one, and this is the first curling iron I've owned that has temperature controlled heating, a very comfortable grip that is kind of textured, and is so balanced. The instruction manual suggests temperature ranges for different types of hair, and I have found it to be accurate. I'm not waiting forever for my hair to hold a curl -- it actually is very fast, yet I didn't have to guess what temperature to start out with and risk damage.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Absolutely in LOVE with this 1 1/4 inch iron! I have never been able to get the curls I’ve wanted over the years with my hair being the length it is, but this iron went above in beyond in less than 15 minutes. I’m not very experienced with curling irons to begin with, but am already quite pleased with the look I got on my first try. Fantastic product, would highly recommend.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: This is an excellent, commercial grade product for a very reasonable price.
review_text: The most significant reasons why I bought this product are: (1) the vendor supplied the size rod (5/8") I specifically wanted and could not find in local stores, specifically 5/8;" (2) the specificty of temperature range available, allowing me to select what degree of temperature I want to use; for me this was a critical feature because I have fine thin hair and have burned my hair previously using other brands of curling irons; (3) the length of the cord is much londger than you get on cheaper products, it is also very pliable and doesn't crimp; and (4) I like that the iron has an on/off switch which is an excellent feature if you want to keep your iron plugged in, such as in a salon, and not have to unplug it after each use. I liked it so well I bought one for my stylist to use on my hair (and other customers) because she did not have an iron of this size, and I also gifted one to my sister. This is an excellent, commercial grade product for a very reasonable price. I would highly recommend it to anyone who curls her own hair.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: My hair is poker straight and white. This curling iron says it goes to 420 degrees...don't know if true or not...but it's HOT. Makes curling hair easier..one pass with rod...curls and they seem to last longer too! Good purchase.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: As far as I'm concerned, I would never buy a curling iron from anyone but Hot Tools. I had a 1 inch Hot Tools curling iron like this and I've been very pleased with it - the heat on it is nice and hot and makes the curling process quicker and better. I also love the extra-long cord. I needed to upsize the barrel because I have shoulder-length hair and I'm going for that "wavy" look, so the 1" barrel was too small. 1 1/4" was just enough of an increase to get the look I want. Again it has the long cord and the high heat that I like and it works GREAT for me. My ONLY negative was the the 1" iron came with a rubber cover for the barrel and the 1 1/4" had no cover at all - it's not something that was promised in the package, I just wish I had a cover for it.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I love this curling iron! It is high quality, holds hair firmly, heats up quickly, has a long cord that swivels easily, and most importantly, it does an awesome job of curling my long, wavy, unruly hair! I bought the 1.5" barrel and it is perfect my my styling needs, which include styling my bangs and also straightening and curling-under my long, layered hair. When I accidentally dropped and broke my Conair gold ceramic curling iron last month, I was bummed and planned to replace it with the exact same model. I was disappointed that that model is no longer made and I was very reluctant to try a new brand or model, as I thought that one was perfect. Based on customer reviews, I bought this Hot Tools Professional curling iron and I have been so pleasantly surprised and impressed! Now I'm glad my old Conair broke and that I have this one instead! Where I previously had to go over my hair 2-3 times with the curling iron, I only have to go over it once most of the time with this one! This is a huge time-saver and easier on my hair. My hair actually looks and feels smoother and more healthy using this curling iron than any past model I have tried. It also came with 2 replacement springs, so if that was previously an issue, it looks like it has been addressed. Just be aware that this model does not have auto shut-off, so you need to pay attention and shut it off yourself or connect it to a timer switch to prevent it being left on all day if you forget (like I do).

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Hot tools products are truly the best I have found in a very long time. My girl at my salon uses this on mine so I got one for myself because I love it so much and it’s so nice because the heat settings are just perfect or you don’t burn your hair and I still get fabulous curl

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: Best curling iron I've ever had!
review_text: Love this! Best curling iron I've ever used. I have medium/long hair (it comes to my bra strap in the back) and i got the 1.25 inch. It heats up quickly, stays hot, end does not burn fingers, the barrel is long enough to fit the length of my hair, and I really like the long swivel cord. I've had bad luck with curling irons in the past, for some reason my hair could never hold a curl even with the recommended products. This gave me great curls, and all I used was,a little hair spray after curling and letting my hair cool off for a bit.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I love this curling iron. I had been looking for a 1/2" -barrel curling iron but basically gave up because it seemed none of the mainstream stores like Ulta and Target carried anything smaller than a 1-inch barrel. I knew Amazon would solve my problem and it did as I was able to purchase the size I wanted in a brand that I trust. I've had a Hot Tools Professional curling iron in a much larger size forever, so I knew I could trust it. Also, this is the brand the hairdresser I've been going to for over ten years uses. That's how I knew the smaller barrel would give me the cute tiny curls I wanted every once in a while. The iron heats reapidly, and quite frankly, doesn't seem to need recovery time to reheat no matter how many curls I make. The cord is nice and long and is of a nicer, upgraded soft plastic material from that found on my old curling iron of the same brand and also of the 1- inch barrel Conair iron I bought within the last year. Now I wish I had bought that 1" iron in Hot Tools, also.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: VERY NICE CURLING IRON. I HAVE BELOW SHOULDER LENGTH HAIR. I CURLED SMALL CHUNKS OF HAIR ALTERNATING FORWARD AND BACKWARD AND GOT A REALLY NICE MESSY CURL LOOK. MY HAIR IS FINE BUT QUITE A BIT OF IT. AND I USUALLY STRAIGHTEN IT. I THINK IT TOOK ME FIFTEEN MINUTES TO DO MY CURLS AND IT FELT NICE AND WAS A NICE CHANGE AND I GOT COMPLIMENTS. IT WAS LIKE I JUST GOT A PERM, BUT MY HAIR WASN'T DAMAGED. SO IT WAS LIKE I JUST GOT A REALLY GOOD PERM. I LIKED THE TEMPERATURE ADJUSTMENT AND THE CLAMP IS FIRM AND REALLY HOLDS THE HAIR ON THE WAND. GREAT CURLING IRON!!!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: Outstanding Pro Curling Iron At A GREAT Price
review_text: I'll caveat this review by saying I'm not a hair stylist and no nothing as in zip, zilch, nada about the tools used in that profession. However better half has been a stylist for twenty years and serves as Creative Director for one of the top ten Day Spas in the United States - he knows his scissors and then some. Based on his feed back Hot Tools are a top choice for professionals for a couple of reasons: * They hold up to commercial use * Have a reliable thermostat which apparently is essential, who knew? * Solid Warrantee * Comfortable grip As for sizing the one inch is the most popular and any hair stylist worth their salt can make any size curl or wave with the one inch diameter rod. The price on Amazon was the best - beating out even the closed to the general public beauty supply houses that cater only to professionals. Over the years I've found this to be true with virtually all tools of trade and recently bought him a pair of $700 Kamisori shears for $265 with free shipping to boot. As for the curling iron it arrived in it's sealed retail packaging and again with a Prime membership you get free two day shipping to boot.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: This is my third Hot Tools curling iron. Nothing lasts forever but the ones I’ve had lasted a few years before they needed replacement. This size is perfect for my short hair. It heats very well and quickly. I’ve used other brands before I tried Hot Tools but this is as close to professional quality as I have found. So far I’m very pleased with this curling iron.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I Love this curling iron! It's the same brand and style that my hairdresser uses. The barrel on it is a 2 inch which is not an easy size to find. You can adjust the actual temperature on it and the clip is tight so it does a good job of holding your hair when you're using it. This is my 3rd one like this. I had issues with the cord/plug on the first 2 I bought after I had each of them for a little over 5 years with no other problems. The first 2 came with extra springs for the clip on the curling iron, but this one did not. However, it does give instructions on how to order a free one if the spring breaks. The clips on the first 2 I had never broke so I still have the springs from both of them to use if I need them. Overall, it's just a good solid curling iron and I would definitely recommend it.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: This is the BEST Curling Iron
review_text: After using my Hot Tools professional curling iron for 10 years, it finally quit working, so I immediately replaced it with another. These curing irons are really easy to use, get as hot as you like, and heat up quickly. The cord is also long so it can reach from a fairly distant plug.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: LOVE this curling iron! I have naturally straight/slightly wavy hair.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: This curling iron has served me extremely well. Very easy to achieve loose waves in just a few minutes. My hair doesn't usually hold curl very well, but I keep the heat just under 380 and it works beautifully. In the past couple months the clamp has been sticky and won't go down smoothly, which turns out to be because a little bearing on the spring-hinge thingy fell out of place. I fixed it once (with some difficulty) but it happened again, so I just bought a replacement. When I bought the new one I noticed they come with a 7-year warranty, so I got online to see when I had bought the first one. Can't complain about 8 years of faithful service. Everything else about it still works perfectly.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Dont bother buying anything else. Yes its expensive but worth every penny! I have long hair and love making ringlets. I can do a full head of hair in 10 minutes!! The handle is soft and the swivel is perfect never gets tangled. You can make it HOT be sure to use a heat protectant before you use it. :)

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Bought the 1.5” iron. I have mid-length hair on the thin side, wavy, and highly fizzy. This product left my hair soft with semi loose curls. If you want super loose waves definitely get the 2”. I went back and forth trying to decide but by day 2 it got loose anyway so all good. It has a nice long cord too. Love my iron!!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Before I got this curling iron, I used to take way too long curling my hair, essentially burning my hair. No matter how long I spent on my hair, the only lasted for about a hour. With Hot Tools, I can curl my hair quickly and expertly. The curls look amazing, and last for the entire day. I got this curler after my hair stylist recommended it to me, and it is so easy to use that I can make perfect waves on my own. My hair is about to my armpits (18") and the 1 1/4" iron makes the most perfect beach waves on me. I would highly recommend this curling iron to anyone and everyone.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: After using my Hot Tools professional curling iron for 10 years, it finally quit working, so I immediately replaced it with another. These curing irons are really easy to use, get as hot as you like, and heat up quickly. The cord is also long so it can reach from a fairly distant plug.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Excellent product. My previous Hot Tools curling iron finally said goodbye after many good years so I decided to purchase again from the same brand. I couldn't remember the actually size of the barrel and I accidentally ordered a slightly larger one but it didn't matter because my hair curled beautifully! Great quality and durable as well. Highly recommend.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: This is the first "professional" curling iron I've bought, as every other one I've purchased has been from a drugstore or Walmart. The drugstore ones would curl my hair but it would not hold for longer than an hour or so and I always struggled with the temperature. I am loving the Hot Tools iron for the exact flip of all those reasons - my hair now holds a curl for nearly the whole day and the varying temperature settings are perfect. The curling iron is heavy but not in a negative way, more in a high-quality way. I always hated curling my hair because it took so long but this past weekend, I wore my hair in beachy waves for nearly the entire time because I am in love with how this iron curls. If you've never curled your hair before or don't feel confident doing so, watch some tutorials (Youtube) before attempting anything too complicated and definitely do not turn the heat up to the highest setting at first. I bought this in the 1 1/4" size and am likely going to purchase one in the 2" size when I have some extra money laying around. It comes with 2 replacement springs, which is wonderful because a broken or worn spring is generally the main reason for needing a new curling iron.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I love everything about this curling iron. I love that it gets a bit hotter than most others. It’s not hot enough to scorch your hair (that happened with another curling iron I have), but plenty hot to curl difficult hair. I love that the barrel (5/8”) is the perfect size for my short hair. I love that it’s well-balanced, easy to hold and use. It grasps hair easily and holds it securely without pulling. I love that it looks like it belongs in a professional beauty salon (makes me feel like a real pro myself). I also love that it stays on so that it’s ready whenever I want to use it. I can’t think of one bad thing to say about it. I’d definitely buy this again…and likely will.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I have INCREDIBLY straight hair (we're talking it would pop the rollers off when I got perms back when they were in). I will also be the first person to admit that I'm very lazy when it comes to actually doing anything with my hair (the straightness comes in handy). But, I love curls. I bought this as soon as my hairdresser used it on me and it made beautiful curls, which she assured me I could do. Six months later, I finally decided to use it. Positive news: it worked really well and was easy. Negative news: I forgot to put product in my hair before curling so most of them didn't stick, despite the tons of hairspray I used when I finished. I fully expect it to stick around more if I put product in first and hopefully will give it another try before another six months.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: Great! A switch flipped using this iron and now I feel like I know what I'm doing
review_text: I have purchased several much pricier curling irons (the Beachwaver, the T3 whirl trio, BioIonic StyleWinder) and decided to try this one after watching several people use one — Harmony Beus on Instagram, a friend that does hair for a living, etc. — and I finally figured out how to use a regular curling iron more efficiently with this one. The clamp is tight enough to hold the hair but loose enough to be able to start at the top and pump the clip, giving me more curl, better hold and bigger volume. I think using this will be baby steps to being able to use my pricier ones without feeling like I don't know what I'm doing. In short, I don't know what it is about this curling iron, as it's pretty basic, but suddenly tutorials and things I had tried made sense and I felt like I had a lot more control over what I was doing.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: It broke after 8 years of use
review_text: It was July of 2013, that I bought this item. I used it about twice a week, when I wanted a bit of curl. Today it bit the dust. Not bad for an appliance that’s used frequently. Also noted that I’m not the easiest on my appliances (several times I have left it on all day and it’s been dropped a number of times). I have long hair (almost to my waist). I’m getting the 1” again, because my curls loosen up as the day wears on.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: This curling iron seems very nice, however it is too heavy for me to handle. I am 73 and have arthritis and tendonitis in my wrists. Unfortunately, I didn't realize that this item could not be returned. All I did was hold it, didn't even plug it in. I will be more careful about noticing if something is returnable. I found another one that is very lightweight and am keeping that one. I know this item has many great reviews and I understand why, but I bet they are mostly younger people. I am happy for everyone who likes it!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I previously had a Bed Head, 1" clipless iron that I bought for $8 at Target on sale. It definitely took practice to get to use well (I burned myself a couple of times), sometimes the curls would fall nicely sometimes not. Overall, I felt the 1" barrel was too thin for my personal tastes, but I could make it work if I tried and had a lot of time to work with it. I don't hate the iron, and I'm keeping it just in case (it can make some nice looks too!), but I wanted a new iron that fit my needs better. I bought this for myself for my birthday, so I could dress up a little and feel fancier while going clubbing or going to special events. I always wanted to curl my hair but didn't feel a curling iron was worth the investment [normally $50-$60 for a better quality iron] for me personally, as I can't imagine curling my hair often. The price of this one was just so great (a little less than $30), I couldn't help myself. Pros: --1 1/4" barrel The curls are exactly what I wanted: voluminous and sexy. If you leave the curler in you hair for less time, you can have cute waves, too. Some styling and you just look like you worked so hard. Having all of the sections in 1" curls was not always flattering on my long (mid-back level), slightly layered hair. It could look a little like a lion's mane haha, if I wasn't careful. Oftentimes I'd pull some back to do a half-up, half-down to make things look better. This 1 1/4" is just so much more ideal for me. [Maybe check Youtube videos and see what girls use when they curl their hair for examples?] --Clip The clip prevents you from using your hand to wrap around the barrel and is therefore relatively safer imo. I would sometimes not use a glove with the clipless (not recommended), but lightly burned myself once. Still, you have to be careful with either--both are safe as long as the user is safe! The clipless effect does look a little different--The main difference is the slight crease where the clip holds onto the end of your hair--but I don't mind. To me it's a little too much effort with my long hair to deal with the clipless iron. --Heat settings Talking with friends of mine who curl their hair far more often than I, I heard a couple of times that a better quality (read: more expensive) curling iron with heat settings is really worth the investment. And normally higher quality ones have heat settings. According to some previous reviews I chose not to use the highest setting right away. I generally keep this one around the same heat: A mid-level makes nice looser curls on my normal (not too thick) hair. --Aesthetic I love black and gold together, so this just looks so nice to me. The gold is also supposed to be a good material to make a barrel out of! For smoother curls. --Value $30 is not bad for a Hot Tools curling iron. Cons: --Can't think of any yet! I've had no problems.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: This is a very nice curling iron. It heats up very quickly and I love the extra long cord. If using a high setting take care to use some kind of styling gel or product to protect your hair. I like using A bit of BioSilk on my hair before it's dry and then apply some lightweight styling hairspray. Not only do they protect the hair shaft, the hair seems to curl easier and the curl has more memory and body/bounce.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I worked in a salon where all of the stylists used Hot Tools products. They recommended this particular iron, and I have loved it ever since! This is actually my second purchase, because the first once I purchased finally gave up on me after years of use! I love this iron, because it heats up in 90 seconds and is ready to go! I have medium length hair, and the 1" gives me perfect soft waves. I like a more relaxed curl, so this is absolutely perfect for my style! I highly recommend this iron to anyone looking for a quality iron that heats up quick and can get super hot! This is a professional iron that will last you years! Just make sure and use a great heat protective product before using heat tools on your hair! :)

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I really like this curling iron. My hair goes past my bra line, and when I blow dry it it’s still frizzy and doesn’t lay right. This is perfect if you want a “blow out” look. It’s not really going to do a tight curl, it’s 2in!! But it makes the hair appear soft and luxurious. Love hot tool products. Only type of curling iron I get

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: The media could not be loaded. The tool is large so the curls are not tight at all. It’s for a loosewave pattern if you don’t want to wear your hair very straight.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Love how my curls look with the 3/4' size barrel. I usually stick with 1' but 3/4' was on sale. Glad I have it a shot. The heat level is perfect for my hair I need it to get very hot in order for the curls to last all day. I use the max heat level on this one and curl for 20- 30 seconds depending on how I want my curls to look that day.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: "This product is perfect for achieving loose curls that last all day."
review_text: Product Review: Hot Tools Professional Spring Curling Iron (1’’) – HT1181 Product’s Ideal User The Hot Tools Professional Spring Curling Iron (1’’) – HT1181 is the ideal product for at home and professional use. This product is perfect for achieving loose curls that last all day. Evaluation Criteria This product evaluation is based off of the following criteria: 1. Price. This curling iron compares to others that cost less than $100. 2. Heats quickly. Curling irons should be convenient to use and require little time to heat. 3. Produces long lasting curls. A good curling iron should be one that produces long-lasting curls. Overall Assessment I have used my Hot Tools Professional Spring Curling Iron (1’’) for a few weeks now and each time I have use it I been even more pleased with it than the last. I chose to purchase this curling iron after doing some research online and finding many articles had rated this curling iron as the best. At $31.80, this curling iron seemed like a steal since it was ranked better than curling irons triple the price. This curling iron does what it says it will in the product description. It heats up quickly and produces curls that will last all day. There are variable heat settings you can choose from. The directions included with the curling iron recommend three different heat settings depending on whether you have fine, regular, or thick hair. The highest setting is 430 degrees, which is the one I use for my thick hair. It heats to temperature in under five minutes, making it convenient to use during your morning routine. One drawback of this curling iron is that it does not have an automatic shut off timer, but if you are careful about shutting it off and unplugging it after use, then this shouldn’t be a problem. Curling your hair is quick and easy with this curling iron. Within minutes, you can change straight, boring hair into beautiful loose curls with volume. The curls are soft and shiny, not frizzy. They will last all day and sometimes into the next if you use hairspray the day before. For the cost of this product, I feel you get a tremendous value. So far, it seems very durable and like it will last for years. I love my Hot Tools Professional Spring Curling Iron and will recommend it to anyone looking for the curling iron with the best value on the market.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_header: Great for beachy curls or tight curls
review_text: I was so impressed with this iron for the price! My hairdresser uses hot tools so I decided to give it a shot. I purchased the 2" iron. I like going back and forth between beachy, relaxed waves and tighter curls. You can do both! For more relaxed curls like the image, I alternate the direction of curling and start from the top of my head and work my way to the bottom of my hair. I hold for about 10-15 seconds but I have very thick hair. PLEASE do not hold that long unless you're certain of what your hair can handle. I've seen too many hair burning videos :( I was using a cheaper iron and feel that this one is not damaging my hair near as bad. Note: still use a heat spray before curling your hair! I use this iron at least 4 days a week and can still achieve different looks with it. If you're not a hair guru, check out tutorials on youtube. They even use this exact same iron. You'll also get a better understanding of curl sizes and how to make curls look different with the same iron.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: It works wonders at the lowest heat. I have 2C-3A hair and my curls are a bit kinky. This helps me make them look a bit nicer. Will not speak about the strong hold of my curls for 10 days without styling product cause I know this is probably due to my coarse hair texture and not the iron itself. What gave it 5 stars for me was the plastic parts where you can hold the barrel from without burning your fingers, the twisting cord while in use and the adjustable temperature. If you have over processed hair chances are it will melt even at the lowest temperature if you use it for too long. So you ladies with the bleach and metallic salt dyes (drugstore brands) on your hair need to be extra careful. What else can I ask for? Maybe the next pro version can make coffee as well...

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: My hair is a giant pain in the butt. I only lost part of it during chemo and when it grew back in, it did not match the texture of my other hair. So needless to say, my hair can do some pretty wild things. It's finally long enough to where I can actually style it and this curling iron is about the only thing that can convince it to submit to the will of my hairbrush. It heats up fast. The controls are very easy. The cord is super long which I really love because I end up doing some weird acrobatic yoga poses trying to deal with this mop on my head.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: Gives a very natural blow-out look. The curls are relatively big but gives you a clean and organized finish. Definitely recommend if you are doing your hair for a professional occasion or if you want to have a clean finish. If you want more bouncy curls, this curling iron is not for you!

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: The 2" barrel gave me the exact waves I was looking for. I'm not very good at styling my hair, especially with curling irons!! However, I watched a quick tutorial on using an iron, and this one delivered exactly what I expected with my limited skills, and was easy to use after I got the hang of it! Here are 2 pictures that show how it worked for me, and what I started with! I had it pretty much on the hottest setting, as my hair is super thick. It seemed to work well at that temperature for me.

product_title: HOT TOOLS Professional 24K Gold Curling Iron, 2 inch
review_text: I love this curling iron! I have shoulder length hair and normally use a straightener to get my beach waves. After seeing a beauty blogger, whose opinion I have come to trust, post about this on her website, I figured why not give it a try. I like to think of myself as curling iron challenged and can never seem to get it quite right. I always end up with spider legs no matter how many tutorials I watch. For some reason, with this one I didn't. I loved that the cord twists so it wasn't getting all wrapped up around my head and I loved that it's really long. I set it at 400 degrees as some other reviewers suggested and it worked for me. I have semi thick hair and I could probably go a little higher. I used a heat protectant on it and my curls lasted all day. I got the 1 1/4" barrel and I thought it would be too small when I saw it, but it gave me the messy relaxed beach wave I was going for. The only downside I could see about it was that it wasn't smooth when I was sliding it down my hair. The edges of the clap made it a little difficult but it didn't affect my curl in any way.
