We did not use the rain cover, our first trip out it was still pretty hot at night. We did put it on during the day, rain was forecasted. That was a bit more challenging and I still do not feel we had it on correctly. We did place a tarp down first for added protection. I cannot comment on how it handles any wind or rain. But for first timers I feel this was an excellent choice. You could fit 6 people, but I feel it would be tight. It was just my husband and I and it was great. Definitely upgrade the stakes but the ones included did work. The little floor mat is awesome. It took a couple of folds to get it back into the bag, then at home realized there is a strip on the bottom of the carrying bag you can remove to expand the bag. I would definitely reccommend this tent

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Survived two thunderstorms with no water inside
review_text: The first time using this tent, it went through two thunderstorms with no problems. We could feel water actually running under the tent, so much that it bubbled the floor, but nothing got inside. We had a tarp under part of it, but our tarp wasn't big enough for this new tent, and even in the parts the tarp didn't cover we didn't have any water get in. The screen porch did get a bit muddy in the first storm, and we hadn't thought to bring a broom or anything so it was a little difficult to clean. For the second storm, we rolled the floor of the screened part under its overhang so it wouldn't get as wet or muddy. The tent itself is spacious enough that four adults easily fit inside and could play board games while hiding from the rain. Even with a queen size air mattress, plenty of room to move around. But really, I was very impressed with the ability to weather two severe storms!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Great tent! Tried it out for the first time ...
review_text: Great tent! Tried it out for the first time this weekend (50-60 degrees, rainy weather). We had two dogs and two adults inside the tent and it felt very roomy. Six people could logistically fit but I think four people would be the max if you plan to spend any time in the tent besides sleeping. Set up was really easy, which is nice since we ended up having to set up in the dark. What impressed us the most was how the tent handled the rain...there was not a drop of water inside (that we or the dogs didn't track in). We used another rain tarp over the screened in porch and that allowed us to use the screened-in porch as a place to stash all our wet rain jackets and hiking books. The screened in area floor has a mesh drain so it still got wet with the rain tarp but was easy to drain when we were packing up. We also used a ground tarp inside (instead of outside) and it made packing up really easy and mess free. One of our dogs is a 5-month puppy that tried to dig through the tent a few times but the tent held up. Overall we love this tent!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Nice layout but very poor quality
review_text: We have used this tent on multiple camping trips over the past 6 months and it is easy to set up but the quality is severly lacking. We use 2 single cots and put our dogs bed in the middle, which gives us room to stand up in the middle. We store our items under the cots for quick access and this tent works really great for this setup. Unfortunately the floor of this tent is the worst I have ever seen. We use a footprint under the tent and lay a king size quilt on the floor inside before putting down our cots to protect the floor, but we still get multiple holes and weak spots after every trip. We patch the holes onsite before packing up the tent for our next trip but there are lot of patches after 6 months of use. This weekend we went camping and it rained the entire trip, which we were okay with but the floor began to leak around all the previously repaired areas within a few hours and the vestibule became a lake. We had to use a microfiber towel every few hours to remove the inches of water that collected in the vestibule and anything we stored up there got soaked. The vestibule is only useful if there is no rain in the forecast. The seams on the pole sleeves and the stitching on the rainfly's Velcro straps have also begun to rip. While the layout of this tent is great, the quality is poor and I would not recommend this particular tent.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: We just camped in the tent yesterday and were up for +6 hr night storm
review_text: Tent is very light, completely waterproof (as long as you set it up well - make sure the outer layer is well stretched and does not touch the lower one). We slept with all windows open and no rain came in. Heavy rain pored for 6+ hrs and we were completely dry inside the tent. The only downfall: the screen room. I wanted a screen room for mosquitoes and bugs to stay away. Works well for that and is spacious. BUT the screen room was completely soaked and full of dirt and water as a result of heavy storm. Which meant we had to clean and dry it before folding the tent (as the screen room bottom is a continuous layer with the floor of the tent), and that proved time consuming. I would recommend campers to bring an extra tarp to cover the screen room in case of heavy rain.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: We used it for camping in Colorado mountains. Torrential rain and hail for hours and had only slight leaks in the bottom back corners. This tent held up fabulous and kept us warm. Good thing I read reviews before hand and bought an additional rainfly for the front screen porch. A little water still got in but helped a ton. Really like the tent-family of 4 fits fine.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: I purchased this tent after doing some research and reading reviews on other tents. This tent would be my first tent I’ve ever camped in and wanted to make sure it was easy to assemble and big enough that I wouldn’t feel cramped. This tent gets 5 stars on size. It easily fit a queen size air mattress and an oversized twin. It could have easily fit 2 queens. It states it is an 8 person tent, but I would say 4 adults max. There was plenty of room to move around and a lot of space between the 2 beds and at the bottom of the beds. Being a novice, it took us an hour to put the tent up, but by the 2nd trip, it only took 15 minutes. You do need to buy extra stakes for the tent. The porch was the absolute best part of the tent: no bugs, spacious, easy to get in and out. I love every feature of this tent. I definitely recommend it.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: So my only complaint would be that I kinda hate how wet the "storm room" gets when it rains. Theres really no reason that they cant make that whole part windows, so you could zip it shut and keep your shoes/cooler/umbrella and whatever else up there once it starts to rain. IF YOU LEAVE YOUR SHOES UP THERE THEY'LL GET SOAKED. Aside from that, the tent is beautiful. It was so nice having that storm room on sunny days, just lounging and reading and keeping safe from the bugs was lovely. There's plenty of space for a queen size air mattress and then some. Kept us super dry in the rain with no worries of leaks(like our last tent) I love the color too. Great tent. My friend had the dark room version of this tent, which looks exactly the same but without the porch. Theirs was made of a dark fabric though which reflected heat off the tent and kept them cool during those unbearably hot mornings. So we were jealous of theirs and they were jealous of our porch!! So.. mash the two together? Screen room with dark room technology. And the option to zip the screen room closed. Sounds like the most perfect tent ever!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: I love this tent! Super roomy, but no so ridiculously large that it wouldn't fit comfortably in shared camping spaces. Setup was very easy. I like all the windows which allow the tent to vent a little when it's hot outside and the inside begins to feel like an oven. The porch area is much cooler than the tent when it's hot outside, and roomier than it looks the photos. Could probably fit 3 camping chairs comfortably. This tent got rained on and the only part that got wet was the porch, but not as much as I expected. I don't understand what other reviewers are saying about the back being open - my tent stayed perfectly dry in the rain. I would recommend this tent to everyone for any weather.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Easy up, Well ventilated and great service
review_text: FIRST VACATION IN 10 years!!!! This tent is IT and then some! I always read reviews but only write ones that I believe may be helpful! I have Severe RA and Lupus and now that the kids are grown and gone and thanks to new meds I am anxious to see if camping can be possible when you have "issues" or challenges. The sun sensitivity and extra years and weight held me back from enjoying the outdoors again. The right tent is the most important. I melt in the heat, cannot handle UV sun sensitivity from the meds, and the kids are grown and gone. So everything has to be light and easy. After getting it wrong twice (thank you Amazon CSR secret agents!) THIS IS THE TENT (No reduced priced no free merchandise) Just amazed at this. It has all this going for it 1. Light 2. Ventalation Ventalation Ventalation 3. Easy Peasy set up 4. Well made 5. Haven't been rained on but reviews are assuring. I will update if needed So I would recommend and buy again!!!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: The tent is great. Definitely good value for the money. Not the best quality. But it worth $100 and does the job. Very spacious. We had two twin size air mattress. Plenty of room to hang out in the middle. Room for the gears on the side. The porch does get wet in the rain. But dry up quickly. Inside is bore dry just like advertised. It’s a bit difficult to roll it back in the carrying bag. But not a big deal. Make sure you have the window open when rolling up. So the air can go out. The floor is very sturdy. No need to put a tarp or footprint at the bottom. We used 3 times this season about 3 to 5 days each time. The tent made it during the rain and wind. I can see the tent is getting weak and flimsy. But I think it’s okay for another season. We upgraded all the stakes. It’s not that easy to set up. Some times it took two of us 30 min. You have to put the rim in the corner ring and stake it to the ground at the same time. I think it’s not a good design. All the tent I had, the tent will stand up with the rim in the ring. Then stake to the ground. The ring is getting wear off after couple use. But it’s a easy fix. Overall, it’s not the best. But it’s cheap and will last couple seasons

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Tent stayed completely dry in multiple thunderstorms
review_text: We needed a large tent that was comfortable to spend time in other than sleeping since we were camping with our 2.5 year old and 6 month old in the mountains of NC. Since it’s summer in NC, we also needed a tent that would survive those fun “out of nowhere” downpours. The kicker was our budget, we did not have hundreds to spend. This tent was awesome. My 6 foot tall husband could stand at the center without ducking. We could easily sit with our kids inside if they needed some quiet time, and had enough room to get them both ready. The front porch was nice, we easily fit two chairs in there and used it as a place to take off muddy shoes and clothes before getting in the actual tent. That part gets wet when it rains, so we just kept stuff in plastic bins out there (like our shoes) and they were dry. We had a major thunderstorms the second day/night and the tent stayed dry. My kids wanted to sleep right up against me and somehow I ended up smushed against the wall of the huge tent, but woke up completely dry! I’ve had more expensive tents that still had condensation on the walls, but this one didn’t even after the major storm. Of course it’s a big tent, so it’s heavy, but I imagine anyone needing a tent this size is car camping anyway.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: I purchased this tent a year ago for some car camping at the Kern River. I get flustered and overwhelmed with mess easily so I figured a bigger tent for me and either my friend or boyfriend to share would be great for our mattress/sleeping pads and our other gear with room to move and walk around in without kicking stuff around. And that's just it, even with a queen sized mattress and 2 backpacks/duffel bags, there's still spare room (even for another person). The tent goes up easier than it might look to some and I really haven't experienced any issues other than trying to wrangle it back into the bag. The front patio part is great, however personally I don't think I'll get that with my next tent since I don't really use it. It does catch a lot of dirt/sand from getting into the main sleeping area and you can kick off your shoes in there, but let's be honest...the sand is going to wind up in the main room anyway. I've only every used this tent camping at the Kern River in the spring/summer, so I can't speak about much weather. Of course it gets warm sitting in the sun, but I'm happy that there are so many screens on this and I haven't had any bugs come in (although you can see them under the rain fly at night if you have a light on.) Funny enough, after the first time using this with one of my best friends I found a brand new one at a Goodwill and purchased it for her to use incase my boyfriend every came camping with us or she brought someone else. She loves it as well, and our friends definitely make fun of us for our "boujie mansions", especially when we set them both up. Love love love

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: Bought this in a rush for a family beach camping trip for a family of 5. The tent only has 3 poles and was easy to setup even in the dark. The zippers looks durable and works well. There was plenty of room in the sleeping area to fit a queen size mattress and could likely fit a king size air mattress. It was nice to have a screened off front area for the kids to play without worry to bugs getting in. The stakes were of good size and strong as well. The only cons is not much of a color selection and the rain cover could be a little bigger. It fits perfectly over the tent, but if there was rain with wind, I can easily see rain coming into the tent. Overall, it's still a great tent well worth the money spent and one of the best I've owned in the last 40 years.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Great little tent for what it is.
review_text: Ordered it on Monday for a trip on Thursday after noticing that my current tent at the time was beginning to mildew because it wasn't as dry as I thought it was when I last packed it. Got it on Wednesday. I and my 10 year old step son set it up in about 10 minutes, including staking out and rain fly. We experienced some of the hardest rain I have ever experienced while in a tent. We got something like 2 1/2 inches in a few hours the second night of our trip and the wind really kicked up. It was kind of like a mini-hurricane an that second night. Completely dry the entire three day and night trip. The one area that will get wet, especially if wind is blowing while it is raining is the screened room on the front of the the tent. However, a small non-sharp stick or pole can easily slide under the flooring and you can lift it which will make most of any collected water run right out. The rain fly doesn't reach to the bottom of the walls but the pole for the rain fly keeps it sticking out far enough that rain would almost have to be blowing vertically to enter the tent. We left both windows open the entire time the tent was set up and no rain got in because of the design of the rain fly. Definitely not a 4 season tent in colder climates because the back wall of the tent is, indeed, mesh from about half way up the back wall to the top. Excellent air flow for warmer times of the year but it would be hard to stay warm in if the temps were cooler outside. Having the screen room on the front also makes a second barrier to insects. Open the screen room, step in, close the screen room, then open the main door into the tent. Doing this should help keep bugs out very well. Also, we left the actual door to the tent open giving us even more airflow down lower where we were sleeping, instead of waiting for a breeze to waft through the windows about 2 feet above our heads. All in all I am very satisfied with my first trip in this tent. Time will tell how well this tent will stand up to use, but bear in mind it is overall a fairly cheap tent that is not intended for long term use or serious abuse. For $150.00, I think it last an adequate amount of time and take an adequate amount of abuse to make me feel like I got my money's worth. We fit a queen sized air mattress and a twin sized air mattress in this tent with ample walking space between them.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: This tent is a great family tent. I shopped around at various sporting stores and web sites viewing all types of tents and reading review after review searching for a tent that would provide the best comfort for my wife and two daughters for our first family camping trip. Having camped sleeping while hanging in trees or on cliff sides utilizing only bug netting for comfort this was new to me. We fit two twin air mattresses, one full size air mattress, all of our personnel items and still had plenty of room inside. The screened porch provided a great place for all footwear keeping dirt out of the tent providing for an additional barrier for insects and room to "sit down and play" quoting my seven and eight year old daughters. The screened porch was a favorite feature of both my daughters and my wife. The screened porches usefulness was in my opinion due to its flooring. Assembly and disassembly were simple and accomplished with ease. I had read complaints about how this tent would not fit back into the bag it came in and ignored them for the most part. It's important to remember that speed is never associated with a large tent. I had more room in the bag after I had stowed the tent than when it had first been opened. There was enough room to fit a well folded ground tarp and additional metal stakes. This made me happy, being able to keep everything organized. This tent helped make our first family camping trip a success. My wife and friends of ours are making plans for two trips next year.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: I went camping for the first time in 20 years this past weekend, and was so glad I got this tent for the occasion. I used to camp regularly as a college student but my husband had never gone and so neither had our five year old son, so I wanted to make sure we were comfortable. This Coleman Evanston tent was perfect. I put it up fairly easily with minimal help from my husband in 20 minutes or so, having pitched only standard, small dome style tents in the past when I was camping solo. Breakdown was simple and quick. We didn't get to use the porch as a porch yet because there was a huge thunderstorm right after we put the tent up... the good news is that the tent withstood the storm no problem, and the porch was a fabulous "mud room" for our wet and dirty stuff, keeping our sleeping area dry and clean. I did purchase more heavy duty tent stakes than the ones that came with the tent, and also a good tent footprint for underneath. The only wetness that got in from a really heavy rainstorm (with the tent in an open field) I think blew under the rainfly and came in through the window mesh. It was just a few drops and I'm sure if I'd secured the rainfly better it could have been avoided (the rain wasn't even forecasted, I just threw the rainfly on to help keep the morning sun out when we woke up). Other friends camping with us did not have such good luck with their tents in the storm. This tent was perfect for our family of three to have ample space and keep our packs and toys for my son in the tent with us. You could comfortably sleep four and of course squeeze in the 6 they say it sleeps if you are all packed in like sardines. I'm so glad we have this tent and can't wait to use it again.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: I want to start off by saying this tent is amazing! BUT check your tent before you go camping!!! I had bought this tent and opened it at the campsite and instantly regretted not opening it sooner. One of the rope poles had snapped so the tension poles kept coming apart without it. We eventually had to restring the poles and ties the cord together. There was also a small hole in our door, but it wasn't too bad. The tent ended up working fine, but was a pain to restring all of the poles. We ended up asking for a replacement and they sent it to us a few days later! We also ended up getting rained and hailed on with some extreme wind and this tent protected us through it all! I would definitely recommend it!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: Really love this tent! So far we've only given it a trial run in our back yard, but I am really impressed by how easy it is to set up, and the design touches are great. For instance, there's a mesh inset in the screen room floor, presumably to allow any moisture to escape that might come in through the front screen. The raised 'doorway' between the screened room and the main room, which a few reviewers have complained about, is intended to work in a similar way, by keeping any moisture out of the main sleeping area. Yes, you have to step over it, but I think it's worth it to know the tent will stay dryer. There was a nice breeze coming through when we had it set up, so I feel confident the ventilation will be good. We decided to upgrade to this tent now that we are going to start camping with our toddler, both for the additional room, and to have a space for play and putting shoes, etc. We were not sure whether to get the 6 or 8 person tent, but I'm glad we went with the 6. It's quite spacious, and we don't really notice the slightly lower overhead height. A bigger tent would probably feel like overkill for us. This one barely fit in our tiny back yard when we set it up! A number of reviewers complained about quality issues in construction, such as the use of covered sleeves for the tent poles, rather than using clips all the way across. I get this, but the tent seems well-made, and if you're just going to be doing basic car camping (like we are), it should serve your purposes well. You could get a really technical, over-engineered tent from another company, but you'd pay several times as much with not much greater return. This tent is a great deal, and I'm excited to use it.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: The front porch is not covered by a rain tarp which is a good thing. Yes the front area does get wet but seeing as how i just leave my shoes there, only the souls get wet, no big deal. There is a strip of mesh toward the front of the porch which allows the water to drain out. This gives you the ability to push the water, along with any debris, out of the front porch. As for the rest of the then it is your standard tent. Decent head room and for the price it is more than i could ask for. I did buy some sealer but did not use it just to see what would happen. Aside from condensation there was no leaks even after a couple of decent storms during the day. (we did not stay in the tent during the storms due to lighting) I would definitely recommend this to someone who is just getting started with their camping setup OR who has kids. My kid and neice already put a couple scratches in the side of the tent but nothing that could not be patched up.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: This tent is perfect for car camping
review_text: This tent is perfect for car camping. It was easy to set up by myself. (tip:it was easier to place rainfly over the tent by first placing the rain fly tent pole in the rain fly.) The inside was roomy enough for a queen size air mattress and room to spare. There were two dogs on the trip and that was the purpose for the screened porch. Plenty of room for the doggies to sleep. They were able to push open the screen door zippers. A carabiner was able to fix that easy enough. There was a light rain and the screened porch did gather a little water. I can see how if it rained harder it could be a problem. So if you are a fair weather camper you should be okay, or maybe an extra tarp for the screened area.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: The 8 man is really big, I am replacing a 6 man tent from another brand I have had for about 10 years that finally fell apart. I thought the 8 man would just be a little bigger but its substantially larger. I Just set it up tore it down and re-set it up to get an Idea of what I am dealing with and it was easy to set up it took me about 15 minutes the second time. The rain fly is the most difficult part but I think I just figured out the trick to it for this tent. I am really happy with the purchase so far, I particularly like the vestibule. its not really for storage bat a nice shaded screened area to hang out in. I can't wait to go camping!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: The screened in front porch is awesome if you don't like bugs. You can sit two camp chairs in there easily. You can also fit two queen size air mattresses in there but that is it. So, I would say this would be extremely comfortable for two people, somewhat comfortable for four people, and I wouldn't recommend a larger group unless you are planning on sleeping bags only. It took less than 20 minutes to set it up and probably about the same to pack it up. It is lightweight. We've only used it once so far and have not had poor weather - other than cold and a lot of wind. We are a family of six so we use multiple tents. Update: This tent made it through a massive thunderstorm without as much as a drop of water getting inside. We did place a tarp under before erecting it, but it was a very intense storm.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: Bought it for prime day last year, was too good to pass up that deal. When I got it set up, my girlfriend stands back and says "that's the most extra tent ever." She's not wrong, but it's very nice to have a little screened in porch, for those unexpected mosquito infestations, and it's got a little fly over it, so you can de-shoe and leave them outside so they don't stink up the place after a few miles of hiking. Spacious, I can stand in it and I'm 6'1", so that's super nice. The material is nice, lots of ventilation, with a top vent to avoid condensation as you snore away those muscles that are gonna be feeling it tomorrow morning before your cup of cowboy coffee. I wouldn't take this up Everest, or camp in a typhoon, but it's reasonable for us fair weather campers who get a weekend off work to go hang out in a state park somewhere. You could definitely fit two queen size air mattresses side by side in the tent, so your girlfriend/wife/partner can have two queen beds worth of space while you wake up with your face against the side of the tent.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Perfect for families, comfortable and durable
review_text: Can't wait to go camping with this tent. We did a test run overnight in our backyard. There is so much space in here. Iur family of four fits comfortably. We could probably easily fit 3 additional people. It was fun and we got a nice breeze come through the mesh screens. The inside pockets held lanterns for some great lighting. I don't know how long it took my husband to put this tent up. Taking it down didn't seem time consuming he did everything on his own. Only thing he ask me to help him with was closing the zipper once he got it in the bag. I'm so glad he bought this we can go camping and I feel safe from the bugs and there are double durable screens with zippers!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Fits one Queen sized mattress comfortably.
review_text: It's really an awesome tent, but we were only able to fit ONE queen a air mattress in there. Thank goodness it was only us two who were using it the first time we put it up, or there would've been a big problem (Since it says it holds TWO mattresses. I am speaking of the 6 man tent, perhaps the description for the 8 man tent was on the listing by mistake. We did love the tent tho. Butttttt the mattress needs to be blown up inside the tent, because the doorway is not big enough to even fit a small mattress through. It only unzips on the one side. If you look at my third pic, the doorway is open as far as it can go.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: I said it is a great tent so far because I have not yet had the opportunity to put it through its paces in challenging weather. It was a beautiful fall afternoon when we set it up in the Rock Creek campgrounds of the Chickasaw National Park - Sulphur, Oklahoma. Set up was easy - one person is all that is necessary, but my wife likes to help out. The screened in front porch is terrific and spacious enough that we sat a small table up at one end of it and our cooler on the other side. The tent itself is very comfortable with plenty of room for two adult sized cots and two duffle bags and other gear. All this and there was still walking around room between the cots. The tent appears to be well constructed and we're looking forward to many years of use. One thing I might add; putting the tent back in the bag it came in is challenging. I decided to put it back and store it in a regular army 24"X40" duffle bag.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: This tent is perfect! I have used it in beautiful weather and during downpours (before additional waterproofing) and I have been comfortable and slept soundly the whole time. It takes me about 15-20 minutes to set it up alone, and even less time when I have help. The screened area was a nice bonus on my most recent trip, as we were beach camping in March. It gave us a good spot to brush off sand and mud before going into the main area. It was a little chilly because it is so tall and the back side is open, but my golden retriever and I were prepared for 40s and rain and we brought extra blankets. Overall, I do not regret this purchase and I am so happy I bought it!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: By the 3rd time I could easily set it up by myself in 10 minutes
review_text: I took my 10 year old niece camping for 10 days using this tent for the first time. Traveling to different places we set up and took down the tent 3 times during the trip. By the 3rd time I could easily set it up by myself in 10 minutes. They designed the tote bag to expand in case you have a hard time getting it folded to its original size so thats a plus. Super roomy for 2 people and a queen size mattress not to mention you can stand up in it. We had some rain and had no water get insIde the tent. There are lots of screens for ventilation. We didnt have too much use for the screened room but is was a nice place to leave shoes and to dry out laundry and it certainly helped to keep the main tent area clean. I think the only changes I would make would be to add more storage pockets inside the tent and an opening to run an electrical cord through. Otherwise very satisfied.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Good tent, fair size for two and no issues
review_text: It is not light weight, but lighter than canvas. I weather proofed it prior, and it poured buckets but didn't leak. I did not think it out with rain and the screened in area which I wish I had. Put a thick tarp over that area and half tent and there were no issues. We were cold 80% of the night since the whole back of the tent to roof is screen minus bottom portion and it was 40°. Very good sturdy tent for summer camping, even in rain(minus porch) kept us dry all night, stayed in place even in the two storms. Easy to put up and take down. Nothing wrong with tent, but side note know that the stakes that come with most tents will not hold, and will pull out of ground in wind. Order some while you are ordering tent, I did and was able to use the others for tarp, and take extra guy line or rope you never know.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: We went Camping in Franklin NC . Had a Blast. Love the tent. Fairly easy to setup even when you're a Occasional like moi... Really like the screened in area. Seems like the fabric is thin (wondering about durability). We placed a Tarp under the tent to match the outline (to have a bit of padding, help keep us away from water/moisture and also to prevent snags on sharp things or stones that might damage the tent. Pros-Good things- The height (I'm 5'8" and am able to stand and not feel too claustrophobic) all the windows and screens. Fairly easy setup although we had to READ the instructions (lol) to put on the raincover. Wifey says .."Spacious,comfortable and love airflow AND the extra screen room is da Bomb" BTW- Wifey is Not a diehard camper and HAD to be convinced ...sooo that's a big YES for the tent. There was the two of us in a '6 Person' tent...i figure it'd hold family of 6 (2- adults and small kids OR overly friendly adults..eww). Pack up was fine too , everything fit b/c this time we also read the instructions.... btw- it didn't rain, but If it's screened then water will get in the outer 'patio area' however the tent ppl made the drain holes on the front strip.... we liked the tent. We setup chairs inside the 'patio', had a beer and watched the fireflies and listened tom the river and creek...No bugs inside. Cons- Fabric seemed lightweight (hope that's bc its 'Space age and also heavy duty'), the front'door'/entries are zippered and this could use a 'swing door' (made that up...but i hope you'll know what i mean' if you don't ...sorry.) In my estimation, Pros beat cons...Tent's a good buy.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Strong durable tent, keeps you dry unless there’s a tropical storm outside
review_text: I had this tent for a couple of years now, it has held up and is really easy to set up. We just recently used this tent in the Outer Banks with a tropical storm brewing outside. We decided to see if the storm would pass through. The tent held up with strong gusts and heavy rain for the most part. Rain started coming in only when the wind was so strong that it was blowing the rain sideways into the tent. We stayed dry but the floor started to get wet at the edges. It wasn’t until probably 50mph+ gusts that one corner collapsed in and broke the pole. We called it quits after that but I’ll give it to this tent, it held up until the end. I just wouldn’t recommend camping with it in heavy wind/rain, especially since it is on the taller side and not low to the ground. Use different stakes meant for sand also if you intend to camp on the beach.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: This tent is awesome. I set it up with just myself and my son (11, & he just held the poles still for me). It was really simple and easy to set up. Literally 2 poles for the main cabin, one for the porch, and one for the rain guard. Couldn't ask for an easier tent set up. Took maybe 15 minutes and this was the first set up. The room in this thing is incredible. I can stand up (5'6") with plenty of room. Take down was just as easy. The bag actually has a bit of an expandable bottom, which is great since a tent never gets rolled up the same as the factory! Two thumbs up from me!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Spacious. Easy assembly. Great price. What more can a family ask for in a tent?
review_text: This is an amazingly spacious tent. We bought the 8-man tent based on advice regarding room for a family of five, and it actually ended up being much bigger than we needed. Part of me wishes we got the 6-man tent instead, but it's generally much better to have erred on the side of being too large rather than too small. The setup was quick and easy-- I generally don't like those auto pop-up fast-pitch tents (fast-pitch tents don't strike me as being durable; whereas, if you need to repair traditional tent poles, you can easily purchase a repair kit online). Besides, this tent only came with 4 poles (two for the main body, one for the vestibule, and one for the rainfly)... so no degree in rocket science required for successful assembly. The vestibule is a really nice touch. It's nice having a protected area for shoes and other basics... and I'd imagine the kids might want to set their sleeping bags up there to enjoy the view (and some separation). As far as sturdiness goes, it does the job for us. We generally have been fair weather campers... and most (not all) of our trips are at the coastal campsite about a mile away from home.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: I was a little skeptical about this tent, since the price was lower than your average tent, however, I am very impressed. I took this tent to a music festival, where we camped for 5 days. Here is my feedback: - Tent is very easy to put together, it took 10 minutes at most to get it up and stable. - Take down is just as easy, just a matter of how well you can roll it up and fit it back into the bag. that was our biggest challenge. - Stands up well to rain: it poured pretty severely one night and the tent inside stayed completely dry with the rain guard over. - The screened in porch got soaked though, I don't recommend leaving anything there if it's going to rain. It also kind of hard to get the water out, so if you know it will rain, I would recommend maybe putting an additional tarp over it. - We put a tarp down and put the tent on top of it for additional rain protection, so I would recommend that as well. - It's pretty massive, we had two queen size air mattresses and all of our bags and still had plenty of space. It was also very tall. I am 5'3" and I can stand up fully and even put my arms up. - The tent packs away great, very compact. Overall, for the price, I am very impressed and would use it again and buy it again.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: The best tent ... EVER !! Goes up quick & easy. Looks great. I bought it for just my husband & I ~ so it's wonderfully roomy. Love the ' porch '. I put up a queen air mattress and used a rubbermaid tote as an ' end table' in the tent proper. Battery candles - cute & safe. I put a little camp table & two chairs on the porch - tho we had good weather and never really needed to sit in there. But, it would have been perfectly comfortable to hang out and play cards, drink wine, whatever - if we had. Can't say enough good things. Bought it on Prime and received it within two days. I love my tent. And so does my dog, Sugar !!

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: Just came back from wv, after hurricane ida. 3nights 4 days, rained from 3am til 11pm. Other tents were leaking water from every corner possible, leaked from underneath even with tarp placed. This tent held up like a champ, maybe 3 puddles of water, size of a quarter in the corners. It was so minimal, my queen size mattress didnt get wet. Size is 11.5×14.5. 8person tent, size is including the screen room. Screen room have its own tarp on bottom unlike other tents. Corners where the screen room meeting the actual tent, theres are small holes on both corners, which is normal, water did not leak from there, water will leak from side of the screen room, which is normal cuz its "screen room". U should buy a small tarp with tarp pole to make a cover if u dont want screen room to get wet. One bad side is it's a dome tent, I'm 5'9" unless I get to center of the tent, need to Hunch a bit. Used screen room as a potty room for my family of 4 including myself with portable potty, no privacy unless using tarp as a cover as stated above. I also took a deuce in there, vents easy. Inside, very roomy, was able to place two queen size air mattress, plenty of room to place duffle bags, big plastic containers, led light bars to protect from weather. When using during cold seasons, strongly recommend placing head towards the entrance, and feet far away from the door. Big wall is mesh, and covered only by the rain fly, u will literally get brain freeze when using during cold night. I couldn't sleep, had to rotate and place head by the door, and felt a huge temp difference. Overall 5/5, excellent, screen room is awesome, pros outweight the cons. Cons, just need to use ur head and adjust accordingly. Worth every penny.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: I am glad I purchased a 6-person tent
review_text: For a family of four, I am glad I purchased a 6-person tent! I was able to fit three twin size mattresses and one portable mat/pad with plenty of room to hold several miscellaneous camping items, and two backpacks inside the main sleeping area. We were able to attach two small lanterns and two small pouches inside the tent gave us the ability to hold car keys, wallets, and phones. We did not have any major issues with this tent during our camping trips. Good items to note: - Getting the tent installed is super easy, but I highly recommend reading the instructions at least once and installing the tent in your backyard before your first camping trip. It took about 15 to 20 minutes to get everything installed during our first camping trip and about 20 minutes to put everything away. Take time to fold the tent properly or you won't be able to fit all of the items inside the storage bag. - The tent was able to keep all of the annoying and nasty bugs outside and good ventilation inside the tent at night. - I was able to stand straight up in the main sleeping area which was convenient and I didn't expect this. - The screen area will not be dry during rain, but this should not be a surprise from the design of the tent, but it will hold three portable chairs as an escape from annoying flies and mosquitoes. Several concerns: - Two bottom corners in the screen area were not sealed properly and I am not sure if this is by design or the two areas that I noticed were ripped during installation. This was a concern because I didn't want any ants inside the tent, but we didn't have any problems during our camping trips. - I highly recommend purchasing heavy duty ten spikes and don't allow your teenager daughter to hammer the smaller spikes that come with the tent unless you are willing to dedicate one hour of your time making them straight again. :-) Overall, I am happy with the tent and it will last us for several years and I will update this review after our third and fourth camping trips.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: My son and I go on a lot of camping trips with his cub scout troop. I have used this tent twice now since I bought it back in June. This tent is very roomy, easy to get move around in, and I love the mini screened in room in the front. This is very helpful if it is raining, but mainly for keeping dirty shoes the coolers, or anything else to keep close, but outside of the sleeping area. The only downfall I have run into twice now is when there is heavy rain. Inside the tent, no problems at all. Stays very dry with the rain cover on top of the tent. The screened room though can collect water because the screen stands out a little further than the rain cover. There is a "drain" type of cut at the door of the screen room for water to drain out through, but water can still collect if your tent is not at the best angle for camping in the rain. I suggest just bringing a small broom of some sort, so that when you breakdown your tent to pack up, you're not having to deal with all the water that might have collected in that spot of the tent.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: We absolutely love this tent. We've had several Coleman tents in the past, and they've never disappointed. This is the largest one we've had (bought the 8-person), but it still fits on standard camping pads. It poured the last night we camped, and our tent stayed completely dry. We didn't add any water protectant or seam sealer - The factory waterproofing did it's job. The screened-in porch area was quite wet (the rain fly does not extend to fully cover it), but our shoes placed by the tent entrance and were dry. Whenever we buy a new tent, we put it up before camping to ensure all parts are included and there are no issues. I put this tent up by myself in the garage (I'm 5'1"), but it was much easier to put with a second person. It took about 10 minutes for us to put it up on the camp site. Very easy to take down too. We added a tarp underneath to protect the flooring material, since it's not very thick. The guylines are necessary, to keep the tent sturdy and well ventilated. We're very happy with this purchase, and highly recommend it.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: We really put this tent to the test. We went on a 4 day trip in the woods right along a river. On day 2, it POURED rain for 24 hours straight. Complete downpour. It never leaked inside the main living area outside of a very small amount of rain we found by the corners (I mean maybe 1/2 cup total over the entire day). The screened in area was completely destroyed with mud. The campsite flooded caused all that water and mud to go right through the screen and from that moment on, we couldn't keep the inside of the tent clean. We probably could have if we had brought a nice door mat to wipe off feet and paws but the inside ended up getting covered in sand and mud. I definitely recommend this tent. It withstood a great deal of abuse from that storm and two large dogs and two adults. It was very spacious for us. It started to get a little cramped when we had to spend all day in there while it was raining but it's spacious for normal use. With the top off you can get a really great breeze going through the tent which feels amazing if you just want to lay down and relax without being indoors. This is an excellent peice for an excellent tent. I can't attest to cold weather camping as we haven't used it for cold weather camping but I wouldn't suggest it below 30°F. It's not made of a material that would keep any heat in. You might be able to keep some wind out if you had every part of the tent secure but unless you're packed with good warm clothing and sleeping bags, the tent is not made to keep you warm. Great for warm summers though. Didn't hold in any heat so we stayed comfortable all night.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_text: We didn't want to drop hundreds of dollars for a tent we'd use once or twice a year. This tent worked great for us. The large size was great to not feel crowded; we had two adults (one with a twin-size air mattress) and a child sleeping in it. The airflow and system for the rain cover to overhang the side windows worked great. Having an exterior area door (we call it the "porch") worked great to keep insects out of the main sleeping area. During setup, minimally, you'll need two stakes for the front "porch" corners. Also, you'll need to tie the opposite-side rain-fly guy line to pull it away from the tent. This could be to a tree though and makes a reasonable clothes line for a few items. Minor negative items: - the "porch" area collects water during rain as it's not well covered by the rain cover. It drains at the front only. You must setup this tent with the front door down-hill to ensure drainage. This isn't a big deal but does slightly limit your options if you want the front to face other tents or the picnic table. - it's really heavy, largely due to size. You can't have everything here, if you want "glamping" size you have to carry it. This is fine for car-camping or short hike-in camp-sites but don't expect to carry this thing real far.

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Our new home after hurricane Laura.
review_text: Bought this tent months ago for a camping trip with the family. Covid 19 happened and it never happened. My brand new Colman 8 person tent was sitting up in our closet collecting dust. Fast forward to August 27th 2020. Hurricane Laura tore through Southern Louisiana. We have been fortunate to not have too much damage. Our power is out however and will be out for weeks. Sooooo. We are camping in our back yard :). The tent is great! Roomy. Big enough for our queen air mattress with headboard. Also the tent breaths really well. Even with this hot humid heat, we can relax inside with the widows open. We have to rainfly up due to the fact in the mornings the humidity is high and there is due everywhere. Also Louisiana thunderstorms are extremely unpredictable. It rained once sense we set it up and i have to say. None of our things inside the tent got a drop on them. However if your have things on the porch they will get wet. One minor glitch however. (And its strictly on me for not preparing the area properly) but make sure to lay down a blanket and/or tarp before setting up your tent. I looked over the spot before I set up the tent for roots and twigs and stuff. The area seemed clear. However after the third night camping out, I noticed a small root wearing away the material where we walk in the tent. Its not a bad hole, but it'll definitely need patching later. All in all. We love this tent. It's a great place to have when you have to rough it after a hurricane ripped through your neighborhood. Turned our unfortunate disaster into an adventure for the family. :)

product_title: Coleman 6-Person Dome Tent with Screen Room | Evanston Camping Tent with Screened-In Porch
review_header: Coleman Evanston tent put the to test --- and stays dry!
review_text: Just camped out in Pocomoke River State Park, Maryland while Hurricane Matthew was battering North Carolina. Our camp site was filled with inches of water, wind was 20-30mph, rain coming from all directions and we were under a flash flood watch. The only thing dry was the inside of my Coleman Evanston tent. Bone dry. Thank you Coleman. Attached picture is take the day after the storm.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: This is the best toaster you can buy, so save your money and buy this one.
review_text: This is the best toaster you can buy, so save your money and buy this one instead of a fancier one that doesn't work half as well, even though it looks like it should. Toaster guts are mostly all the same now, and much less efficient than they used to be. This unit isn't fancy; it has a plastic exterior, and the controls and simple and clear. The slots are wide, and can expand to accommodate bagels. I eat a thick, protein bread that is mostly nuts and just barely hangs together as bread. With our old toaster, the center of the protein bread was always under cooked, so it never really had the crunch of toast. This new beastie does the job. Thank you to Wirecutter, in the NYTimes, for the recommendation.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: UPDATE 6/2021: Y'all, I have had this toaster for 7 years. I think she has even gotten better with age! The folks with major complaints seem to have gotten unfortunately defective shipments because this toaster is amazing. ORIGINAL: I wanted to get a simple toaster after I deciding that I was wasting too much energy to heat my oven up for a bagel. I saw this Cuisinart and liked that it was compact, white (finding a white toaster in a store is evidently really difficult!) had settings for bagels and frozen items, and a darkness dial. I have used this toaster with frozen and room temperature bagels and bread, and I love it! I generally only keep it set to about 2.5 on the darkness scale because I only like my breads slightly toasted. But it gets the job done quickly and easily. I imagine if you put it on the darkest setting you would probably be eating dust. I originally used the cord storage underneath the toaster every time I used it to put it away in a pantry, but then I started using it so much more often and just decided to leave it on the counter since it doesn't take up too much space. The other thing I will note is that it does make a burning plastic type of smell for the first few uses. Just turn on a fan or crack a window if it bothers you, but it does go away and there is nothing wrong with the toaster. Love this little guy!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I have grown tired of other brands failing me and realized I have had the same coffee grinder for 20+ years and it is a Cuisinart, it is also the only Cuisinart I have owned. So I threw all my small kitchen appliances our and bought all new Cuisinart ones. And so far this toaster is working just great. I love the 4 wide mouth slots for those of us who have families and like a toasted bagel sandwich. And it looks great, feels nice when operating it.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: Great little stylish toaster which bears the name Cuisinart. Very satisfied after two weeks use. Love the "footprint" and it sits proudly next to Cuisineart (Swarovsky model - a gift!) Coffeemaker. I like the cancel feature, independent 2-slice dials to make 4 customized slices for family and guests. Well-designed in every aspect. I shopped for a long time before making this decision. Very happy I made the ideal decision for brand, features, looks, and space consideration.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: After having a few other toasters which had issues with uneven toasting or bagels getting stuck, I finally found the toaster that works perfectly. I thoroughly recommend this product.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I did a lot of looking for a toaster that wouldn’t break the bank yet one worth more than what I paid (more bang for the buck). Well I found it in this little guy. It may feel a bit cheap when you first pull it from the box but it is a great toaster and better quality than I thought it’d be. One of my favorite and most looked over things is it has a removable crumb catcher for easy cleaning and disposal of the piece that find their way to the bottom. Versatility.... It’s a toaster and will toast anything (maybe almost anything) you put in it. Does great on toast, bagels and English muffins so far...

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: This is truly a compact toaster. It has a small footprint and sits nicely in a small space. The level of browning is easily controlled and is easy to set. Some of our homemade bread slices that are a little taller than retail bread slices barely sit all the way down but they do toast. The slots are not real wide so a very fat bagel probably wouldn't slide down into the slots. It's easy to clean, it's quiet, and the defrost is wonderful when you need it. It is a no nonsense, perfectly functional toaster that performs the way it is described.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I was worried about getting this because everyone was complaining about cooking bagels with it. I don’t eat bagels nothing against them but I wanted this for toast. As toasted sandwiches or for breakfast. & I love it! Works great for what I need to do. Apparently it has a lot of power because I prefer my toast on about 2 1/2 and it goes all the way up to 6! So not sure if people like there toast super crunchy and hard or if that can cook bagels or something I’m missing? Not sure but that seems like over kill to me. But I’m happy with the toaster looks modern and fits in well into my kitchen!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: A really great toaster. I love how it toasts the outside of the bread and leaves the inside soft. Guess we needed a new toaster a while ago. I like that you can lift the handle to make the toast come higher up out of the toaster. This is especially nice with English muffins that are small and can be hard to get out.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: Had to say good bye to my Kitchen Aid toaster after nearly 20 years (coil burned out). This is smaller than my other two slice toaster which is great for storage. I'm loving the controls - 7 different settings for darkness. Additionally there are controls for defrosting, bagels and more. I like the cancel button - always felt like I was working against the mechanical parts when I stopped a cycle before. Working great - hoping it lasts 20 years!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: The best inexpensive toaster I've found, even if that isn't saying much.
review_text: How many toasters have I been through over the years? I've lost count. Some just cease toasting after a short while. Others last forever but never seem able to toast bread consistently: part of the slice is tanned, part burnt. This toaster toasts well, and it has lasted as long as others I've had. I've replaced it once, when the push-down arm stopped staying down. It would be great is someone discovered a way to make an inexpensive toaster that lasts half a decade, but that may be beyond the capabilities of modern engineering. In the meantime, I'll keep going back to this Cuisinart, unless I stumble across something better.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: This thing fuxxxx when it comes to breakfast heat needed on bagels, toast, pop tarts, waffles... like its next level and u dont have to wait to make toast for 2 ;) pew pew pew... hold up, wait a minute... its a toaster....

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Makes toast! And a good job on bagels too.
review_text: Upgraded from a 2 slice so this is perfect. For the bagel setting you put them in facing out, the inside heating elements do heat up but not as much. What you get is a toasted bagel with a warm outside. Every toaster I have had does this and my bagels have always turned out toasted face with warm bread underneath. Only dislike that I have is the crumb trays are only accessible from the back, so kind of out of sight out of mind, and you sometimes can forget to clean them out as often as you should.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Finally, a toaster to get excited about
review_text: My attitude toward toasters has always been that they are all unreliable and inconsistent, so get the cheapest one you can. That worked and I had my last no-name toaster for 10 years until one of the spring mechanisms would not stay down. After getting a cheap Sunbeam from Target that I hated, I decided to shop Amazon. This toaster had good reviews, and the pricing was a really good deal. I gave it a try and returned the Target toaster the next day. At last, I have found my dream toaster. The settings give consistent toast color and dryness, and the defrost setting lets you toast frozen bread in one cycle. I have also used it for baguette, and it did a great job. Could not be happier with this toaster.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I love Cuisinart appliances and pans. I have many of them. When I bought this toaster I thought it would be of the same quality. It is the worst toaster we have ever owned. It consistently over toasts one side of the bread or waffle. Even if we turn the bread around, it continues to heat the darker side. No matter how we try to adjust the settings or manually flip the bread it happens. When cooking a frozen waffle, the skinny ones, the inside is still cold. We have had this for less than 6 months and it is worthless. And it is also too late to return. Don't get this one.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I bought this toaster base on a wire cutter review I read and it honestly is the best toaster I’ve ever used. It toasted bread very evenly and pretty compact. One of my favorite features is the reheat option. I keep my bread in the fridge so it stays fresh longer but it causes the bread to become stiff. The toaster heats the bread just enough to be soft again without toasting it at all so it’s perfect if you just want regular bread that soft out of the bag.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: Just got this to replace an older model. Was a little worried after reading negative reviews about the temp control. You can ignore the negative reviews about the temp dial being over sensitive, they work fine. I set dial to around 4 for perfect toast, both sides toasted. Maybe negative reviewers received bad toaster. I will update if anything goes wrong but so far very pleased.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: Feels cheap and plastic-y, particularly the temperature dial which I wish was a tighter feel, but has performed well. Ample settings. Small, if you are a fan of artesian type breads I would not recommend this for you. Some people have mentioned a short power cord which I do not agree with; however it’s oriented to come out the front which I find odd. Very happy with price point.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Best Toaster I have ever owned
review_text: I bought this toaster when my toaster oven died a horrible and tragic death. I didn't think I would ever love an appliance like I loved the toaster oven, but I was wrong. This toaster is amazing. It is fast. It makes perfect bagels and toast. I adore the defrost setting because I constantly forget to take my bread out of the freezer. It is worth the money. I have had this toaster now for over a year and it is still going strong.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Love the toaster, how it arrived....not so much...
review_text: We received the toaster via UPS, and it came in its sales box, not a packaged box. The box was torn and I'm sure the toaster was thrown around, but it works fine. This is not the toasters fault, but it could have been very damaged due to the way Amazon allowed it to be shipped. Besides that: Toaster works great. Works with bigger slices of bread. I set it to level 2 as level 3 really heads the toast to burn level! Easy control and has a slide out try to catch the crumbs. Not a big deep tray, a pretty shallow tray, and we do get crumbs if we don't clean it before putting it away. For the most part it does it's job, IT makes Toast! ROFL!!!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Best toaster I’ve had in over 50 years.
review_text: This is a very high quality toaster and everything works exactly as advertised. We have used it for bagels, toast and frozen waffles for months now and are very happy with it. It toasts evenly every time. The lever can be used to push up whatever you’re roasting and makes it very easy to remove what you’ve toasted. Best toaster I’ve had in over 50 years.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I've used this toaster for a couple of weeks now, and am happy with it. Once I determined the correct settings for different types of bread, it delivers uniformly toasted surfaces and is consistent from run to run. The white plastic exterior looks good and seems easy to clean. You don't have to worry about cooked-on fingerprints as with metal exteriors. It turns out that the correct settings for normal-thickness breads are at the low end of the dial (2 3/4 for raisin bread and 3 1/4 for cinnamon bread), so you have to be a little careful setting it. I suppose the higher settings are for much thicker items like bagels, which we haven't tried. Now we'll see how long it lasts. It will have a tough time beating our old toaster, which worked well for 46 years!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I mainly bought this toaster because I trust this brand. And I'm happy to say that it's the best toaster I've owned so far. It's not entirely perfect as it doesn't evenly toast both sides exactly the same, and sometimes it can be hard to figure out the right toasting levels, but these aren't deal breakers for me. I've had it for about a year now so I've had plenty of time to figure out the toasting levels and times. I also like that the bread slots are fairly wide so I can fit large bagels in it and not worry about it getting stuck. It's also a fairly quick toaster. With other toasters, it feels like I'm literally pacing back and forth waiting for it to finish. This one gets hot quick. And there's no annoying ring when it's done. It just simply pops up. Overall this has been a great buy. I use it often and it works great.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I ordered after an older long time use Kenmore toaster bit the dust. I wanted a black small toaster with usual functions and a two slice for small footprint. The reviews were hit and miss, so I decided to try anyway and it has worked very well so far, seems to toast alot faster than the old one and works alot different on the shades of toast! the dial is "1-7" and if I go past 4 it is waaay too toasted so right in the middle at 3 1/2 is perfect, and the bagel button works well also, and it stays cool to the touch on the outside like stated, I would recommend this for someone wanting a smaller, good priced, toaster that works like it says.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I searched many consumer sites for the best and highest rated toaster. This is it! It will not disappoint! Perfectly toast anything you need toasted. Highly recommend this product and seller!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: Back in Sep '19 I bought a Willsence 4 slice toaster. What PIECE OF JUNK it was. Didn't toast bread worth a darn. Plus the stainless steel cover got very hot when using! I finally got fed up & ordered this Cuisinart model. It was on my porch earlier so I brought it in and decided to try it out. I put 2 slices of bread into the 2 right slots, turned the knob to '5' & pushed the lever down. After a few minutes the toast popped up. They were PERFECTLY done! The old piece of junk went straight in the trash! It seems I have finally gotten a toaster that makes great toast after years of looking!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: what more do you expect? it isn't showing any signs of engage lock breaking or anything.... looks sturdy enough to not light the house on fire. for the price, I give it a solid 5 out of 10, because it is just as average as I am.... but I give it a 5/5 because I am really just less than average so it is probably a higher quality toaster than I am a quality human.... sad days...at least I have toast.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: The spring loaded tactile feedback of the handle you press down to toast your bread is very satisfying. The handle is big to for extra comfort when using it. I loved this product because it is white and it matches my microwave and stove. I still need a white refrigerator to complete the look. This toaster is beautifully designed with a professional appearance. It has the power to toast your bread as dark as you want. I keep my setting on number 3 and it still gets dark. It has an LED light so you know it's on. If you want to stop the toasting, just press the cancel button. It even has a bagel button. I'm not sure what that does though because when you look inside the machine while its toasting it doesn't look any different. I tried the bagel setting with those new Thomas Maple French Toast bagels. (So freaking good) The outside was toasty but the inside was soft. Maybe that's the beauty of the bagel setting. I bought this because it was white, but I am now a fan of Cuisinart. Thanks Amazon and thanks Cuisinart for making such a great product. Update: Some people say it toasts the bread too dark. I found out that not all types of bread toast the same. You have to experiment each time you change your bread. I like to use Pepperidge White Sandwich. It requires you to set the setting much higher than other breads. I like my toast dark anyway so it's not a problem. With the Pepperidge Farm bread, you can easily get real lightly toasted bread if you so desire.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Toaster does what a toaster does, it toasts bread
review_text: I like that this toaster toasts quite fast and pops up when bread is toasted. It also has a feature where you can raise the toast even higher so as not to burn your fingers. As with most toasters I have had one side toast just ever slightly different from the other one but for the most part there isn't enough difference to care. I'm pleased with this toaster.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Great to slice toaster fast and perfectly brown
review_text: OK for a two slicer this thing is the bomb! You never really realize that you need a new toaster till you either burn too many eggos every other time or it won’t turn on. So once the 4 slicer went to toast heaven , we got this thing. we let it heat up to burn off that new plastic smell before use. I blinked twice and it popped up perfectly brown ; yep on both sides... this replaces a four slice unit from umpteen years ago ... maybe I’ll eat less Eggo’s this way. Heck by the time I butter the first waffles the second set would be done... There goes my hope for a slimmer waist.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Best toaster I have ever owned
review_text: This is the nicest toaster I have ever purchased. It has wide slots, easy to clean. I love the settings for bagels, defrost and reheat. I especially like that you can hit cancel so it will immediacy pop up. Would have sent photo but Amazon photo opp not working

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: It’s a toaster. It works. It doesn’t cost more than my blender.
review_text: After overthinking my choice for a new toaster, I sent with this one. Well known brand, plastic case doesn’t get hot, settings for defrost, reheat, and bagel, no complex LCD screen to break, no rebooting required, color disappears into most backgrounds. It does what it’s supposed to do, although my daily toast is set to almost the highest setting and it doesn’t get very brown.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: Love, love, love this toaster. I had a Cuisinart 4 slice toaster that was just taking up too much space on the counter or in the cabinet so I donated that and bought a cheap 2 slice toaster thinking that would be adequate...it was total crap and so I started searching for an inexpensive 2 slice one to replace that. I wasn't aware that there were so many choices! After scrolling thru and then comparing prices at Macy's and Kohl's, this one seemed just right. Good competitive price and what I know to be a good brand. I love this toaster! Browns evenly, defrosts properly, easy to clean and it doesn't take up much space. Well worth the $30 I paid for it and I know it will last a long time.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: The toaster replaces a nearly new Hamiton Beach al metal toaster which never toasted bread particularly well and always made the body of the toaster very hot. This toaster, by comparison, has a cool plastic body and toast bread very uniformly. It has a couple neat features as well, like a warming setting if you leave the toast in without taking it out right away, or a button to cancel the operation and pop the toast early. Even a bagel setting. Altogether just a better toast experience.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I was replacing my old toaster with this one. It's exactly the same toaster, but the old one was no longer toasting well, English Muffins, for example, had to be put through twice to get them to the desired darkness, etc. This one is performing beautifully.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: We just wanted a basic toaster without all the bells and whistles. We had a basic Cuisinart toaster before this for almost 20 years that finally started to lose some of its toasting power. We use the toaster multiple times daily. It gets a good workout. I did a lot of research and finally decided to go with the same but newer model by Cuisinart. It toasts evenly and cancels the toast process immediately when you press the "cancel" button. If you're just looking for a basic toaster, I recommend Cuisinart CPT-122.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I like this toaster very much. I had a cheap one that kept burning things, and decided to buy a good one. This one does my sliced Cuban bread without incinerating it. tI does bagels and English muffins, too. It is not an enormous big honking machine- it takes up little space on my counter. I can wipe it off and empty it easily. It is worth what I paid for it.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Defrost - I use a lot of frozen waffles. LOL
review_text: After a defrost, even set on the lowest setting, sometimes it makes the waffles dark on one side.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: If you're looking for a two-slice toaster, buy this! It is recommended (2019) by Wirecutter (my go-to review site) over much more expensive toasters, and so far it fills the bill. Seems well made and offers several toasting options (such as "defrost" for frozen items). Why pay more?

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: It's a TOASTER ... and a good one.
review_text: What can I say? It sits quietly on the counter, and makes toast. It has no wireless, no Internet, no messaging capability ... it's just a toaster with wide slots. As yet it has not led the other appliances on any sort of revolution or quest. I have the security camera aimed at it just in case, and the coffeepot is always alert to shenanigans.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Great toaster, but I'm glad I read the reviews about the smell!
review_text: Love this toaster so far! Works great and I like the look. I did read about the smell it produces in the beginning, so I was prepared for it. I read that a few people put their toasters out in the garage to air out the smell. But, if you live in the city and don't have a garage or porch, put the toaster by a window, heat it up a few times, (I needed to do it 5 times) and use a fan to push the stink outside. It worked for me. The smell is gone and it works fine. It was worth the effort.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: This is really nice, has lots of options and settings for 1-4 items at a time! Works perfectly, can be really light toast or very dark. Easy to dump the crumbs out. Easy to use, nice simple and clean design. Love it! Would order again. Came with a warranty to fill out through Cuisinart which is nice.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: This is THE best toaster I've ever bought. If I could give it more stars, I would. if you're a bagel lover then you need to buy this. It browns perfectly on the outside yet stays softer on the inside. I never realized that some toast could taste differently than other toast, but this takes it to a whole new level.
