Who would have thought there could be this many accolades for an appliance? I suppose it seems silly, but just trying to be helpful. I guess, if I could change one thing, I would put the cord rewind on the back of the toaster instead of underneath, but that is a very trivial suggestion and does not affect the operation of this at all.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Read the Instructions—Safe, Toasts on Both Sides
review_text: Appears some of the negative reviews maybe because the writers failed to read the directions. The toaster toasts on both sides of the bread if one does not press the buttons. Simply turn the dial to select how well toasted you like your bread, then press down the toaster lever. Caution: Do not toast under a cabinet...do not leave the room.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: I purchased this item in white as needed a new toaster. I was not sure which product would work best for me. I usually have toast or bagel on the go in the mornings. After reading many, many reviews on the different toaster purchase options, I decided on this one. It provides an even toast, but did require a few initial toasts to determine the perfect setting for me. It works great, is easy to clean, and is simple to use. Works great for larger bagels as well.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Quick, even toasting, and all for very low cost
review_text: Through the course of my life, I have needed a new toaster from time to time. Somehow, I have always been beguiled into buying ones that do this, that, or the other thing, or are supposedly fancy in some important and essential-to-living-modern-life kind of way. This is not that. This is a toaster. It toasts bread. Unlike the fancy one, it is fast, and toasts evenly. I assume a half-bagel would fit. It's small, simple, and just works. In this living-life-simply phase of life, it's just what I wanted.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: In the last three years I have had two expensive 4 slice toasters. Both cost over $200 each. The first one was from the famous German Company. It burned out in a year and was slow to toast. Then I bought another brand with CLAD in it's name for over $200. It burned out it's toasting elements even faster then the first toaster. Of course there are no household toasters made anywhere other then Cxxxx in the entire world. (There is one company putting together household toasters in England but with Cxxxxxx parts. I read the reviews for American made Commercial Toasters. They cost $400 to $1200 each. It appears they were designed for 220 volt power and the ones made for household 120 volts toast the bread slowly. They are the same toasters except for the heating elements. Apparently the toast is too far away for fast toasting when equipped with 120 volt elements. I wrote toaster companies pleading with their executives to build an American made household toaster and got nowhere with that idea. I finally decided to buy an inexpensive toaster that I could afford to throw away when the element burned out. So I purchased this toaster. It's a 2 slice toaster and yes the cabinet is inexpensive plastic. (I purchased a black one rather then a white one figuring a white one would turn yellow with heat over time. (I did not want to experience that wonderful experience.) At any rate this toaster looks good for it's inexpensive price and it remarkably toasts bread quickly which was a pleasant surprise. The toaster does have a couple extra toasting features and does bagels, toast and English muffins nicely. I've only had the toaster for a couple weeks but for now, all is well. If it does burn out in a year, at least it did not cost me over $200. (I'll never be a sucker to ever do that again.) One last note, don't damage this toaster or any other brand of toaster. On all of them, when you push down the bread for toasting a small switch closes energizing a solenoid plunger which catches under a shelf, thus holding down the piece of bread. When it is finished toasting, the switch opens and the solenoid bar retracts allowing the toast to pop up. If you want to pop up the toast early, push the pop up button so the plunger will release. IF YOU INSTEAD PULL UP THE PUSH DOWN LEVER, YOU WILL DAMAGE THE RELEASE MECHANISM. ALWAYS POP UP THE TOAST WITH THE POP UP BUTTON. That also reminds me this toaster allows you to pull up the lever even higher then where it sits once popped up. This allows you to take the toast out of the toaster without poking down in it to get ahold of the bread for extraction. This is a very nice feature. No more do you need tongs to get the bread out of the toaster or burn your fingers trying to do so. I definitely would buy this toaster again. I've had this toaster now for a couple months. So far so good. It toasts quickly and evenly. Sure, beats my prior $200 each toasters.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: After 12 years it was time to buy a new, simple two slice toaster. I never imagined the drama when I actually started looking online and looking at reviews. Apparently it's just impossible for anybody to agree on a toaster they like. I had two criteria. I wanted white and two slice. Hard to find a white toaster these days...who knew. this toaster seemed perfect. The reviews actually caused me anxiety about ordering this. Like this was the toaster from hell. I ordered it anyway. And I love it. So here is the thing, you have to read the directions. It tells you it doesn't do one slice at a time particularly well. And sometimes they are right. They want you to toast two slices. If you do, it's perfect. Mostly I use it for English muffins and frozen waffles. Do what they tell you to do, and press the defrost button when you are toasting frozen things. It looks absolutely lovely in my white and pale gray kitchen. It toasts what I need it to toast, without drama. I'm glad I got past the crazy reviews and bought it.

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_text: Don’t let the bad reviews intimidate you—I was skeptical at first, but the fact that I couldn’t find ANY toaster with near-perfect ratings (from a reputable brand)—aside from those in the $100 range made me rethink my options; all I want is a toaster with basic functions that won’t break after a couple years. Since this toaster is not only reasonably priced, as well as consistently well-rated from tester sites for appliances, I decided to take a chance on it. It is exactly what I’m looking for: a straightforward toaster with all the basic toaster functions (toast, bagel, defrost, reheat), and in a price range that makes sense for a small appliance that does one thing—toast bread. Additionally, it’s small, has an easily accessible crumb tray, is quiet, and the sides remain cool when toasting. But the best feature is how FAST it toasts! I find it takes a minute, maybe a little more or less, depending the setting. Its toast levels (1 - 5) give pretty distinct toast results from each level, and it toasts fairly evenly, if the pieces fit entirely into the slots—which are not long, but are just big enough to hold a bagel slice. The settings aren’t as effective as I’d like, however; for example, I find the “Frozen” setting isn’t all that different from the “Toast” setting, since toasting frozen waffles using both settings yielded similar results. The “Bagel” setting also tends to toast both sides, but maybe it’s due to the fact I like to use the higher, level 4 setting. In all, I find the positives outweigh the negatives, although I suppose it depends upon what you’re looking for. I was looking for a decent toaster for a decent price—and I found it!

product_title: Cuisinart CPT-142P1 4-Slice Compact Plastic Toaster, White
review_header: Toast From Bread? What a Concept.
review_text: Here we go again. Every couple of years I find myself looking for a new toaster because I get tired of needing to flip over my eggo to toast both sides. Every toaster I have have ever purchased (cheap or expensive) make good toast in the beginning and then they get tired after a couple of years. So I read the reviews, both on the web and on Amazon. I was actually willing to purchase a commercial toaster just to get some longevity. I chose this toaster because frankly it rated number 1 on the web and it had a great price point. When I received it I promptly tested it with an english muffin and guess what, it toasted. Of course I knew that would happen. What I liked was I how could easily inspect the progress while it was browning my muffin. When I thought it was close I pushed the cancel button and the muffin popped up exactly how I like it. Who knew? It was evenly toasted and now I had a reference point for future darkness settings. It has a nice footprint and actually fits inside my toaster cabinet perfectly which is something I've had difficulty with in the past. It looks nice, it's not expensive and it makes toast. Actually pretty good toast. My life is now complete!

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Battery cover too tight. Second go was just fine
review_text: Completely scratched the (delete expletives) out of this thing trying to install the batteries. I’ve tried everything, still can’t get the battery cover off this thing. Need it for the range tomorrow and have to find another solution. Super frustrated. Update from 1 star review to 5 star review: I never could get the battery cover off the first one. Still mad about that but I'll get over it and everyone has a bad one slip through now and then, so all is forgiven. I had to send it back. I took a chance since there were so many positive reviews. The second one I got was just fine, no issues, and a great little reflex scope. I love the different intensities in green and red. Combine this baby with a lazer bore sight and you can do 90% of your sighting in your house the day before you go to the range and save ammo, just line up the red dots. Made my little POF rebel an absolute blast to shoot and accurate as heck. Amazing fun on the range and a fraction of the cost of what you could spend on one of these. My only recommendation for the manufacturer is that instead of Hex screws to mount it put thumb screws. That way you can swap out on the range with no tools needed.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Failure (1st try) Update: replacement works great. Second one fritzed
review_text: I love this site wrt accuracy and brightness. Unfortunately after a coupyof weeks the R/g switch went down. The LED only lights in between numbers, i.e. 4 1/2 lights 5 and so on. Since it got such great reviews i may exchange for same And hope it was a fluke. Update: I’m sold! Got the replacement and it’s been perfect. It stays true for weeks and even then any tweak is minor. A great value for sure Update-update: second one R/G switch went out again. Only lights between notches. Lasted a bit longer but still bad. Cheap is sometimes the most expensive choice.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Excellent sight for my Ruger 22 with Rail.
review_text: Just an excellent sight at an excellent price. Pros: Large Battery top loading Red and Green sight Multiple Sight images Multiple sight brightness Good build quality Allen wrench used for mount and sight adjustment Very reasonable price Cons Can not be mounted directly on a pistol like a Glock or Arex Delta - must have picatinny rail for clearance.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: The sight scope is great; good and sturdy and easy to install
review_text: The sight scope is great; good and sturdy and easy to install. I shot about 500 round with on my rifle; the scope is still on target. Great buy for the money.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: These are great, cheap alternatives to the really expensive ones. I have 3 and they all hold zero and are quite accurate. I also like these with pop up back up sights because you can see them through the glass clearly. Brightness settings are great and i love the dual color for bright and low light. Fits on just about anything. I definitely recommend these if you want a reliable sight but dont want to shell out $400+.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Very effective for very little money.
review_text: This is really a very nice sight, especially when you consider how inexpensive it is. I own SIX of these. I only use them on .22 pistols where they are not hammered around. The rail they are on does NOT reciprocate. Mine are holding up very well. I really don’t think I could say the same if I put them on a center fire pistol, but they might. All I can say is that they work great on my Browning Buck Mark, my S&W Victory and Ruger Mk IV pistols.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Mounted on a remington 1100. Sighted in at 50yards with no trouble so far I have no problems and don't expect any.great red dot as good as many that cost twice as much.shot 50 rounds of slugs though it still holds on the money.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Strongly recomend, Great Red/Green Sighting system
review_text: Perfect fit on my S&W M&P Sport 2 AR15 .556 cal. Works flawlessly and look completely mean. Easy to zero. Highly recommend. Stays zeroed after hundreds of shots fired. Very fast target aquisition. Co-witness with MBUS Iron Foldable sights and stay 100% where you adjust it to which is extremely important. Strongly recommend for the price or even probably double the price. This does exactly what is advertised, extremely clear lens, stays in sight and stays co-witnessed with folding iron sights. Deffinetly recommend and i would definitely buy again.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Seems like a good reflex sight. It feels very solid, doesn’t feel cheap and seems quite secure when mounted. I like all the crosshair options (color, shape and intensity). On the brightest setting, it is plenty bright even in broad daylight. My only complaint, as I think others have mentioned is that it is a little hard to switch on and off. I had it on a CO2 .177 gun for a little while then moved it to a 5.56 NATO. I put it on a 3/4 riser. I’ve had it on the 5.56 for 100 rounds. So far so good, if anything changes I’ll update the review.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I received my CVLife recently and immediately took it out of the box and put the included (thanks!) CR2032 battery in. After fooling around with the reticle and Red/OFF/Green/OFF knobs, I eventually figured out how to turn it on, then how to select from red/green and the reticle (4 choices). I initially figured I'd give it about a 3/5 because the reticle was (I thought) fuzzy. All I saw was a fuzzy blob, that would be good only to identify center-of-target. I figured it wasn't worth sending back, for $20. I played around with it some more, then took off my reading glasses, which I need for close-up work. My distance vision is 20:15, so says my Doc'. But close up, I need to use 1.0 to 1.5 diopter readers. I mounted it to the top rail on my AR-15 and thought I'd see how well it was sighted in before going to the range. Turned on the red dot and KNOCK MY HAT IN THE CREEK! It was in perfect focus. Looking through the sight down the top rail, focused on infinity with my dominant right eye, the reticle was in perfect focus. Red is plenty bright. Green is, too, but could be brighter. In full sun, either color is perfectly useable, especially at this price. I haven't shot with it yet, but I don't expect any problems. If there are any that develop after shooting for a day or two, I'll modify my rating. But for now, it's a solid 5 stars. This sight is a no-brainer. You can pay more, and maybe I eventually will. But for now, for general plinking, this sight checks all the boxes.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: well worth buying this for your Ar-15 application
review_text: Purchased and installed on my AR-15 and I am already very impressed. It was not too hard to use at the range to get it zeroed in, and have already run 550 rounds with flawless performance. I own some expensive red dots but nothing with the open sight platform like this has, so I thought giving it a try. I will continue to use this and give my Primary Arms red dot a rest. You won't go wrong buying and using this on your AR-15!

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Ok so. This optic. Is pretty decent. I’m going to start with the pros. Its easy to install, and easy to make adjustments. Green and red options come with varying brightness so thats cool. And it stays on zero*. Now the cons. The brightness can and will be over powered by the sun rendering it useless outdoors. It can lose zero*. Ok. So i mentioned zero in both pros and cons. I shoot hot 556 rounds without a muzzle device so there is a noticeable difference in terms of felt recoil in comparison to one with a muzzle device. This optic is the shit indoors. And not outdoors. Slow shooting and this thing is as precise as you want it to be. Shooting outdoors rapidly and this optic loses zero faster than toilet paper disappearing last march. You will literally see the dot drift to one side. So if you see yourself only shooting slow to moderate speeds then this optic is absolutely for you. If your the type to mag dump then move on.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Great Product - mounted on Crosman M4-177 pump
review_text: I have to say, I am impressed. A feeling that is not that easy to come by these days. At first, I saw a cluster of dots and thought it was garbage. Then I realized I needed glasses!! Literally! The sight was very easy to mount and zero in with the provided directions (which are awesome! How often do you say that anymore??). So far, it's been vdry durable, but of course, not much kick in a bb gun. This is a very, very bright sight. In the garage, i never go past "1." I guess "10" would be in direct sunlight. It seems very accurate on my Crosman M4-177. Very easy to like after a little initial tweaking in set up.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I bought this over a year ago. It has performed flawlessly. I just purchased a Buck Mark reflex sight for my granddaughter. Imagine my surprise when I discovered the 2 sights are identical....except the price. You're paying for the name. The housings are the same, The sight covers are identical. It'[s obvious that the same company makes both sights. They just put the Buck Mark logo on one and you now pay 3x the price. The biggest difference is that this sight has both green and red dots. The Buck Mark only has red. Red is a lot harder to pick up in the daytime. I'm sending the Buck Mark back. I'm not going to pay a lot more money for a sight than I have to.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I wasn't expecting this to be as good as it is, but it is. It works great on a pcc. I like that I have a choice between three different shapes and i used all three at varying distance at the range. Being a little older, I think the default will be the green circle dot. It doesn't have "shake to wake" but I don't forsee being in a position when I couldn't spare two seconds to click it on to the circle dot position. I can't speak to the durability since it is not attached to a handgun slide. On a gun the doesn't move, it should last a good while.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I love this thing! Recently took up handgun shooting again as a covid sport. I built a range in my cellar, got some ammo and started shooting. Well a lot has changed since I last was target shooting more than 40 years ago! My eyes just ain't what they used to be. I was lucky to have all my first shots even hit the backstop! So I decided to try one of these helpers. Now I have no other similar devices to compare this to but what a huge improvement! After sighting this guy in, I put on a fresh target and got ten in the black. I don't know if this device is better or worse than others out ther but the price was right and it works great for me.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: This holographic sight is probably the best deal on Amazon right now. The sight picture is very clear and the light source is stupid bright. Anything past about 4 is way to bright, in my opinion. Mounts very easily and doesn't move. Even mounted on my 12 gauge it has held true and not moved. Pros: Price, clear sight picture, long battery life, bright Cons: Brighter than it needs to be past level 4.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Was looking for an inexpensive optic for my wife's rife and she has a hard time looking down a small rifle optic this optic enwd up being perfect for her after a little set up had it dialed and and she was shooting targets out to about 50 yards and for a red dot isn't bad at all it has red and green modes and can also adjust brightness which is perfect depending on the day and brightness around what your aiming at solid optic for the price

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Slapped this on my M&P AR15 22 and now I'm a tier one operator. Okay seriously though it was a good buy. I didnt want to keep switching my other optics and I didnt want to drop a ton of money on a new one. I'm very happy with this optic. I've seen others talk about it breaking after shooting a bit. I would say to them, what caliber of weapon did you put this on? 7.62×39? 300win? Any shotgun that's not .410? I put this on a .22 which means no recoil. I haven't had a problem.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I bought another brand off hear and it showing a red blur at bottom of the sight when on. I paid over $100.00 for it. I sent it back. So I said what the heck get this one for the price. Perfect. Zeroed it and put 200 5.56 rounds down range. NO problem still held its zero. Didnt see myself paying over $300.00 for a reflex that may not get used but once a month and not in a combat situation. Just out back shooting at targets. Army Vet here also.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Mounting was easy on a standard rail. I use it on a 22lr semi-auto pistol, Browning Buckmark. Very easy to dial in and has held its aim for over 500 rds on that recently purchased firearm. On an older, similar Buck Mark, the same sight has held for over 1500 rds and still going strong. I use the red dot instead of the green. The green dot appears larger, not a point of light, and gives me a little more difficulty target sighting. The red dot is a sharp point of light. I would buy another (and already have bought two).

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Great for the money. Will update again later.
review_text: 2/3/20 Have not used this yet. It came today and it’s already on. I’ve got it cowitnessed with the iron sights that are dialed in. The sight is sturdy and the brightness levels are good. Will shoot this weekend and update. Update 2/10/20 After the initial co-witness, my shots were about 6" low. It took all of 7 shots to get this sight dialed in. Shot maybe 20 rounds and it's still true. Love this thing for the money. I would definitely recommend this for $20. Can't beat it. Will update again later. Update 2/18/20 Bought one for a friend who has had his AR for 10 years and not bought anything for it. Will be buying another for a 22 pistol of mine.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I originally intended to just use this sight for my .22 LR but after trying it out I found that the construction and quality are really good. I ended up using it as a forward sight fir my AK-47 and i shot about 300 rounds through it with this sight on. There was no shifting and i only had to shoot 3 times to zero the optic. If you are looking for a budget red dot for any gun ( or air-soft/air rifle) this is the one! 10/10 would buy again.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Best red dot for the money.
review_text: I put it on my ruger 10/22 takedown and within few adjustments I was plinking soda cans at about 80 yards one by one with ease. It has four sight patterns in green and red within twist.It can actually save your hunting trip literally I mean if rifle dropped damaged scope just put it on few clicks to adjust (don't forget the tool that comes with it) and good to go. Also if hunting for a meal around the camp with subsonic ammo (not to scare big game) at dusk or early morning this scope is very useful. Carry an extra battery or two just in case.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Sturdy and accurate, easy to adjust brightness
review_text: This device offers a range of targeting reticles for every need and taste in both red and green. You can choose the reticle type with a selector wheel, it is rather stiff which is good because it isn't likely to accidentially change on you if you bump it. Brightness and color are selected with another wheel, there is no auto brightness here, you set and forget. However, if you leave it on, it WILL drain your battery - this is no 50,000 hour low-power setup like the most modern red dots, but at about one 10th the price, I can live with that. Just remember to shut the unit off when you are finished, make it part of your routine and it isn't going to be a problem. The unit is very rugged and has a large viewing window. This would never work on a pistol (FAR too large) but it is fine on a rifle. I actually use mine on a telescope, it makes a perfect finder scope for that. I just mounted a small picatiny rail from Amazon on my scopes and I can switch this red dot to what ever instrument I am using in just seconds. An excellent value and well worth the price.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I mounted this on my new Ruger Mk IV 22/45 with pretty low expectations. Paying less than $25 I figured that this would be a junk sight but I just didn't have the budget for a high-end optic at the time. Well I mounted it to the pistol (easy install with an allen wrench) and took it to the range. Right out of the box it was very close to zero and required little adjustment. I sighted it in at 25m and was shooting quarter-sized groups with 10 rounds! (bench rest). I put 50 rounds through the pistol and the sight maintained zero with no issues. I'm VERY happy with it. I will probably still purchase a higher-end optic soon, but I will still keep this one and put it on another gun. It also has about 4 reticle patterns in both red and green with brightness adjustment which gives it a nice variety. If you're on a budget and need a sight, I highly recommend this one.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Great gun sight installed on my Ket-Tec CMR 30 - ...
review_text: Great gun sight installed on my Ket-Tec CMR 30 - 30 rounds per magazine. Used 22 long rifle laser bore sight shell - chanked in wind age to over lay green sight - next chanked in elevation to over lay green sight. Simple Instulation and looking forward to using this excellent product at my local Shooting Range. Well made, solid materials, and a life time warranty- Can't see a single down side to the purchase. Suggest that you buy Two as now installed I can see usefulness in other guns in my collection.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Fits great on an old airgun
review_text: Used this in conjunction with a dovetail to rail converter for an old Daisy 856 pump pellet gun. I centered it and locked the mechanism with the screw on the side and it's been solid ever since. even with the kids beating it up when they're pumping, it's put up with their abuse and the kids love it. This makes shooting very accessible for young shooters and very easy for me

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Give this one a SHOT you won't be disappointed
review_text: AWESOME ..go figure.. actually does what it's intended to do for a FRACTION of the cost! You won't be fearful of banging it around like those other $500 optics that perform similarly. GO FOR IT what have you got to lose? I put it on my AR-15 and right outta the Box it was RIGHT ON at 100 yards!

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Like a sore peter... ya just can’t beat it
review_text: I bought an AR custom build with this red dot on it already... however it had a different name on it and I looked up the one on the AR and it was going for 65 bucks. I bought this because everything from the shape, details, dot selector, and reticle options were the same. Glad I did because it is just as good and saved 50 bucks. Held 0 firing 300 rounds of 5.56. Would recommend for a decent budget red dot. Like others have stated it is all metal construction, price definitely does not reflect build quality, you get big bang for your buck on this one.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Omg I love it sooo much sorry about the fedex bag in the background 😳😂 but I love it so much!!!!!! Thank you so much amazon I love it and the box 📦 omg I was like omg did I order perfume 😂nope it was beautiful box I loved it so much thank you again keep up the good work please contact me for any rating for items or packages because my gawd I love it the surprises

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Solid, well made, running on a canted mount on an MSR10 in 6.5. Stays put and has many adjustments for brightness. The only issue I had was the site adjustments are on the left side, but it’s mounted on the right side of a long range scope. Adjustments in my setup were a bit tricky, but not impossible. Still giving it 5 stars.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Mind blowingly good for the money!
review_text: I had to order this green dot/holographic sight when I saw the price. Under thirty dollars? I couldn't believe that any sight that offers four different target sights and two colors could be any good at this price. Unbelievable. The quality alone surprised me. I own a couple of red dots. One Vortex and one Holosun. both are, at least, five times the price of this sight. This sight is very clear, well made, with a lot of MOA adjustment. I mount my sights on my AR carry handle. That's not the best idea if you want the highest accuracy throughout a given range. However, it looks right, and I'm sure I'll get around to changing it to a lower picatinny on my AR. My point is that even mounting my sight this far from the barrel, horizontally, there is enough MOA adjustment to overlap my, circle sight with a green dot in the center, to my cartridge sighting laser. That's impressive considering my Vortex couldn't do that. I highly recommend this halo-sight to anyone who's on the fence about what to buy. You won't regret it.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Can't beat it for the price.
review_text: I put this on a Mini-14. It sits pretty high after mounting it to a rail, so you have to find a new cheek-weld to be consistent. Naturally, you have to click the elevation down quite a bit as well. But within fifteen shots I had it zeroed at the fifty yard point. Looking forward to getting it on a longer range and fine-tuning it. I didn't know how accurate my 14 was until I put this on. Bullets almost going through the same hole at fifty-yards.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I have a few toys with scopes that range from $100-$1000... this does the same as some of the higher end name brands

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Prefer this over my $200 name-brand red dot!
review_text: OK, I bought this to be a cheapo to put on my son's rifle. After sighting it in and using it a bit, I talked him into swapping me for my $200 sight. This one is better. I like the reticles, images are clear. My vision is less than stellar, and I'm at best an average shot, but I'm easily able to ping 12" targets at 150 yds or more with just this sight. The sight is also very clear, so when it's turned off I can flip up the BUIS and use them through it. I wish there were a better way to handle the cover ... it is a smaller rubber thing that fits well, but when you pull it off you have to put it in a pocket or something to avoid losing it. Everything else about it is great. An excellent value.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I was a little skeptical at first purchasing this sight, figured it wouldn't hold true after sighting it in, but I was wrong. Showed up and I was immediately impressed with solid and well this thing is built (for the price). I mounted it on a Kel Tec sub2k 9mm with a 5x.75 inch bridge riser. The battery is installed under the top cap so you don't need to un-mount it to change batteries. Took it down to an indoor range and after a couple minor adjustments I was hitting the bulls eye at 20yards. I only needed to use the lowest brightness setting indoors so I would imagine it will be fine for outdoor use as well. Didn't notice any ghosting between rectal images or any other funky stuff. The 'only' minor drawback is it doesn't have auto off, you have to turn it off manually, so don't forget and pick up spare batteries just in case.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: The delivery sucked. The driver put it on the very front edge of the porch, where the whole world could see it then snapped a picture. As he walked away, it started to rain. My delivery box was soaked. Since it was shipped originally from China, inside the delivery box the product was well packaged and the product is okay. We saw the whole thing on our surveillance cameras.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: It's a great reflex sight for the price
review_text: It's a great reflex sight for the price, I'm using mines on a AR pistol and loving it. I've used the high priced ones while with the military but would use this over those. Plus again a great price for this unit and helps you make the decision of buying high price if you're only taking to the range.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Surprised by such a great product!
review_text: I was so surprised by this product! I still can’t believe I got a high quality optic for such a low price. The optic comes in a very nice professional package. It is very nicely packaged and comes with everything you need for an easy quick install. I expected a cheap package and cheap box etc, but this came packaged very professionally. One of my favorite parts was the note/ card they enclosed inside. It was basically a thank you card and gives you all the information you need for customer support. I needed nothing and install is very quick and easy. The product is outstanding! I know I’ve said this already, but I’m still very surprised that a $20 optic is so nice. It has several settings and brightness levels. It comes with a cover. The optic is dead on. I’ve seen optics just like this cost $250. Don’t throw away your money when you can get this professional optic for $19! I’m very picky about my accessories and I promise you won’t be disappointed. I put this optic on a Palmetto State AR15. It doesn’t move or rattle and operates under stress. I’m so glad I found this company and product. -Very Grateful in Tennessee

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I purchased this sight for my ar 9 build so i could take it to the range and test my new AR, i was planning in using it until i could find a better sight i would keep, but i was blown away by the quality and ease of use for this sight, all for an AMAZING price. out of the box it came with an install kit and the battery, the quality of the sight felt like it was a $100+ Sight, it held zero just fine at the range and i liked it better than my Vortex sight on my other rifle. I wont be looking for another sight until this one dies out, and even then, at under 20 bucks, i may just purchase a couple more.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Great buy for the price and quality!!
review_text: Attached this to my Berretta Neos .22 pistol. I bought the pistol for my 9yr old daughter and find that this red dot allows for easier target acquisition over the standard iron sights. I've taken it to the range and it holds zero pretty well. I'm not sure it would hold up the recoil of a higher caliber pistol or rifle, but for the .22, it's great. I would definitely say it's well worth the money especially for a range/target gun for my daughter. It came well packaged and feels as if it's of pretty solid quality. It even includes a dust cover for the red dot itself My opinion, if you need a good red dot for cheap, this is the one to get. We like that you can change the reticle from Red to Green and also the shape of the reticle itself while aiming. This becomes very beneficial when shooting targets at different distances and in different lighting. Overall, great buy.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Can't beat it for the price
review_text: For the price it is great. Threw it on my sub 2000 and it was pretty dead on from the start. Few fine adjustments and she was right on.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: I ordered two of these little guys. First off, it is not a scope, it does not magnify anything so don't expect it to do so. That being said, I mounted this on a Ruger PC carbine and it functions just fine. I shoot with both eyes open and get excellent results. I hit what I aim at. 4 or 5 rounds to zero it in and its been right on ever since. I put the other one on a Windham AR 15 Government Rifle. Same results. Even if they were to go belly up tomorrow I gotten over 700 rounds with each of them so they don't owe me anything.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: PRICE DOESN'T REFLECT THE NICE QUALITY. JUST AAA++!
review_text: This red dot is one of the best hidden AR accessories for the price. The sight acquisition is easy for the eyes. It's sturdy , solid metal fits right with or without a riser. I set it up with a 1" riser to sit above the front sight. It holds zeros fairly well at the range. Don't hesitate, buy it and have fun with it.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Nice product for the price, great customer support
review_text: I bought this to use with a semi-auto shotgun. Since I recently retired I really didn't have a chance to use it. I finally took it to the range and it worked great up until the end. I couldn't figure out why I couldn't see the dot anymore. I removed it and put it in my bag. When I got home I started to check it out. What I noticed was that the lens had fallen out. I called the range to see if anybody found it and no was the answer. So, I contacted the vendor and explained what happened. They just wanted an order number and a few pictures, and I was dumbfounded when I got a response to my email. I sent the email at almost 11 at night! Usually it would take a few hours or a day, but they responded to me at 11PM with the last email from them at 2:45AM! All in all, they sent me a replacement. I have to give them a round of applause for their quick response to me and the solution they offered.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Mated it with UTG M1 Carbine Mount on Universal M-1 carbine, units look like they were machined together. Nice unit, nice options and features. Very pleased... can't wait to get out to the range and get it zeroed.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_text: Great item, great price. The only downfall is having to use an allen wrench to adjust, but once sighted in it holds. I'm not gentle on it. Firing 7.62 and 5.56 with it, and it stays in place.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Great sights! Quality control and construction!
review_text: Great deal. Easy to zero and great sight picture depending on how far down the rail you mount it. Dust cover keeps it nice and clean. Bought another one for my second rifle.

product_title: CVLIFE 1X22X33 Red Green Dot Gun Sight Riflescope Reflex Sight for 20mm Rail
review_header: Can't believe I have a sight like this for this price
review_text: Can't believe I have a sight like this for this price. Took me 6 shots at 15yrds out of my savage A22lr and I'm dead on. It takes so careful thinking between shots to dial it in. A bit different from a scope but if you know your way around a red dot then I'm assuming it's no different then any other. It's built extremely solid, on a low recoil rifle like a .22lr I don't see it having a problem anytime soon, it the right hands I see it lasting a long time but if not I paid next to nothing so I won't be heart broke I'll just order another. I am becoming a big fan of Cvlife. Real top quality stuff all shooters can efford. I love when people ask what brand my sights or bipods are then I get to brag about this awesome company.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: Works great on short hair and humidity
review_text: In the pic that was like 3rd day after washing. It looks even better and more voluminous on fresh washed hair! The style lasts for days with light touch ups. It’s especially great if you live in the humidity. The style just gets even cuter, and more natural looking. I’ve read that some people think it’s hard to clamp, or they get tired from it. I don’t find that’s the case. I’m addicted. It’s fast, and cute. What more could a busy guy/gal want?

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: Me gusto mucho esta rizadora,tengo el pelo bien delgado y esto me dio bastante volumen.Las hondas duran bastante a pesar d mi pelo bien lacio y lo que más me gusta de ella es que trae como 4 tipos d profundidad de la onda.Di quieres un estilo diferente definitivamente si la recomiendo

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: When it comes to my hair, more often than not I opt for just letting it dry naturally and literally doing absolutely nothing to it. I have about a dozen hair styling tools but I hardly ever use any of them because ugh they take so long and require SO MUCH EFFORT this thing is not like any of those! It's stupid easy and super fast, two things I like very much! I like the results too and the fact that it's adjustable so I can have tight almost crimp style waves or looser more beachy waves is the icing on the cake.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I LOVE this thing. I spent hours going through reviews and pictures on all these different wavers trying to get one i wouldnt hate and i think i made the right choice. I love that you can change the setting like flip the knob on the end and change the debth of the wave. When its all level i think it makes my hair look more kinked than waved but you can change that setting to get the desired wave. I also appriciate the heat control. It heats up very very quickly and it hurts alot if you bump yourself with it so, like, dont do that. But i use it on my daughters hair sometimes and i dont like to used a lot of heat as shes still little little so i bump it down to almost the lowest setting and it does fine. It doesnt last as long on her, but when i use products and a high setting, it lasts on my hair. Idk how many days as I wash my hair every day, but theres been a few times ive gone to sleep in it and woke up the next day with waves still. I do have to touch up my hair the next morning because they dont stay all night but i do have very fine straight hair that doesnt really like to hold curls. Someone eith thicker coarser hair would probably be able to hold theirs in longer. Ive had this for... i dunno, probably like 6 months now and its still doing awesome. It is kind of heavy and ive definitely burned myself way more than i ever had with my straitner or curling iron but hey, its a learning curve. Kind of bulky but like... how can they make it lighter and smaller without making the waves lighter and smaller as well. I dont want 80's feathered hair, i want beach waves lol

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I got this yesterday...yesterday. Got it the same day I ordered it and couldn’t wait to play with it! Still have some learning to do. Didn’t alternate how I held the iron just used it with the barrels down all the way around because with as short as my hair is it always made my end stick straight out/up. I used it with the adjustable part all the way in. I love the volume and the look for sure. I used the “on the rebound” curl cream on dry hair before curling. Definitely recommend for ease of use and the awesome waves. Does get super hot. Tried using on 350 then 375 but got best results at 400 degrees. Careful to not get too close to your scalp and watch your fingers and you’ll be fine.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: Easy to use with great results!
review_text: I'm no expert when it comes to makeup, styling my hair, or anything else that is remotely "girly." I want great results but it's just not a skill I own. With this product, I am able to get the great results I've been looking for with very little effort/skill. This tool is very easy to use. Heats up very quickly. I have pretty long, thick hair that is rather fine and I'm able to style my hair in under 15 minutes. I love the adjustable settings as it gives me lots of fun different waves. Sometimes I alternate between all 4 settings just to give my hair a lot of texture/definition. Anyone can operate this product- very simple to use. I watched the tutorial video once that's in the description just to get a feel for how it operates and I've been fine ever since. The waves also stay in my hair for a couple of days. If you want the beach wave look, I highly recommend this product as you get great results in little time!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I rarely write reviews, but I had to for this. Although my hair is not especially thin, it is very, very fine. And actually, it has thinned out recently due to thyroid problems. This little wonder made me look like I had a very full head of hair! My hair never looked this thick before the fallout from the low thyroid. As another reviewer wrote, it is a good idea to wear gloves - I burned myself twice the first time I used it. I found an old pair of long, cocktail gloves I had left over from a Halloween costume. I would never have guessed my hair could look so good (not just my opinion either)!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: Finally a wave that never fails!
review_text: Okay where to start. I have short hair and LOVE wavy hair long or short. Few things. Love the ability to adjust tightness of wave. Note to self: middle bare extended to fullest = wider waves. Middle bar lowered to match level of adjacent rods = tight close waves ending up in a super fro for us short haired folk. ( lesson learned ) MUST KNOWS: DO NOT USE THIS WITHOUT A HEAT SPRAY TO PROTECT PRIOR TO USING EEEVVVVEEERRR . YOU WILL COOK YOUR HAIR AND SMELL LIKE AN ASHTRAY FOR DAYSSSS!. I have thick color treated hair that is healthy I only use this at the 375 to 400 setting and HOLD ONLY FOR 5-6 SECONDS. PERIOD. If you want the ends to be the part that flips out than start at base of scull and crimp on down with the purple side of wand touching head. I personally think when I flipped it and did bars down towards head ( yes it's hotter ) I got more of a volume wave beginning at root and a curve in at bottom. Once done spray with flexible hairspray and tada! Waves for days! Con: Although it is meant to be a bit bulky in design to get achieved results there is not a good way to set it down. I wish it came with a stand of some sort or was a bit flatter on the purple size so that when you set it down on the counter you didn't have to scramble for it like you were playing with fire when it falls over. Overall : BEST BUY EVER!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: GREAT tool. Even for a novice like myself.
review_text: I rated 5 on presentation but it’s been so long since i bought it i can’t remember. I think it looks like packaging that you would see it in in a store like Ulta or Walmart. Anyways the product itself i LOVE. And like i said it’s been a while since i got it and it has lasted me quite a while without any signs of slowing down. It took me a little bit to get to know this product and figure out how to use it properly. Because when i started using it my parents said i looked like the 80’s spat me out, but now i look like a beach babe with my waves. My hairdresser even complimented how i can make my hair look with this tool. (cuz i suck at doing my hair if you couldn’t already tell.) if you’ve made it this far i’ll give you a tip i wish i knew (if you’re like me and don’t know squat about hair styling): point the waver downwards. it sounds obvious, but i was doing it just straight across and yeah.... no. point it a little downwards away from your face and you got the waves my friend. this especially counts at the top by the roots. but that’s just what i’ve found personally, obviously do what works for you. but i think we can all agree on how great it is to be able to adjust the size of the waves! go big or small or in between! and not every wave has to be the same so you really can look natural with this! adjusting the sizes couldn’t be easier. Last thing is i love how it shuts off automatically. i think you should always UNPLUG the hair tools even if they have this feature- but at least you get a little peace of mind in case you forget as we all do from time to time.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: As someone who has baby fine, board straight, no volume hair I’m always looking for something to add volume and body. This tool is it!! Look at my hair!!!!! Super easy to use. Section off your hair and do it in batches. Takes me ten minutes, tops. If I want it curly or even straight, I use this tool on the top only. It gives perfect volume.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I love this waver you can create the ultimate style with loose beachy waves, or tighter waves and it give you volume as well. easy to use and the heat adjust so evenly and great for fine or coarse to thick hair . would recommend using a heat protector on you hair .

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: Hands down THE BEST hair styling tool I have ever purchased. This was so easy to use and worked beautifully on my and my daughters’ very thick hair. I love big, wild, wavy hair and I’m thrilled to have found something that actually gives me the look I had been hoping for.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: always wanted my hair to have some character and the Bed Head Waver gave me that <3
review_text: My hair is naturally very straight. I always wanted it to have some character, and the bed head waver gave me that. The first two images are to show what my hair looks like prior to using the Waver. The image following, (me in a Khaki/white-ish jacket) Is how it looked just after doing my hair. The image with my friend in the yellow beanie is how it looked after a full day at school. And the last two images of me in a Black Sabbath shirt is how my hair looked a couple days after doing it. Im sure if you put hairspray or something the waves will stay tighter longer (I didn't use any) but the waver is very easy to use / requires no skill at all. It isn't heavy which I was happy to find because my arms get tired quick , so the fact that it's pretty light is a plus :) It doesn't take forever to heat up and the variety in heat level/wave definition is much appreciated. There is an other girl in my class that uses the same waver, she does her hair everyday I would have never known her hair was naturally straight like mine if she hadn't told me that herself ... Overall I am happy with this purchase.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: Stop procrastinating and get this now! I love it I am a black female with a very long and thick hair and this worked so well on giving me those deep waves and also the tight cramps that I’ve been looking for. My hair looks silky and shiny it was not too hot I turned it all the way up in my head did not smell burnt like it does with the most hair hot tools. And it’s super quick I barely have to have it on my hair that long for the waves to take a fact I won hundred percent recommend this product to anybody I love it!!!its awesome

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I recently cut my hair short and this works great! I never know how to style it but this takes a couple of minutes and I love how my hair ends up. You can do little crimps, or big beach waves. All of my friends compliment me when I use it

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: Just what I've been looking for!
review_text: I don't have a lot of experience with styling my hair. I usually just straighten it and call it good. I am not talented with a curling iron. This item was so easy to use. I love that I can change the tightness of the wave!! I have layered shoulder length thin hair and this was so easy to use! I was finished with all my hair in about 20-30 minutes the first time I used it, and the 2nd time was about 15 minutes. I used a heat protector in my hair before using the product and then sprayed a light weight curl holder in my hair, and the waves held ALL DAY, which never happens!!! I woke up the next morning and still had amazing waves!! I got so many compliments on my hair, it made me feel really good!! I also have one of the automatic curlers, that you put a section of your hair in and it sucks it in and puts curls in, when I use that my hair gets frizzy, and I don't get near as many compliments as I did with the waves!! I would suggest this to ANYONE who is looking for something easy and fun to do to style their hair!!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: This picture is from the first time I used it. Just happened to coincide with my second vaccine! It’s Incredibly intuitive to use right out of the box. The only problem I had was making it look seamless. There were areas that didn’t look natural and it took me a while to get them right. However, this doubles my volume of hair; I have blonde hair and it is thin so I really love how much volume this adds.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: The perm is back y’all , but save your money on expensive “modern” perms made with spongy hair twists and harsh chemicals that may damage hair, especially colored/bleached. This tool was recommended by my hair stylist, and I love how it has different heat and adjustable curl settings. Don’t forget to use a heat product before though. I like to curl the front section of hair in an opposite direction for added volume, and run a brush through at the end. If you love big, fluffy hair then this is for you!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: This is my new favorite hair tool!!! It's so easy to use - I'm amazed at how quickly I can get my hair styled with it. As you can see from the first picture, my hair is pretty flat and lifeless. To style my hair with the "A Wave We Go" I washed it as I normally would. Then I used "Tigi Bed Head On The Rebound Curl Recall Cream" in my damp hair prior to using the hair dryer. I used the Waver on the lowest heat setting possible. I have pictures of what my hair looks like using each of the 4 settings on the barrel adjuster. On some of the pictures I have views of what my hair looks like right after using the Waver and then what it looks like after applying "Garnier Fructis Style Wonder Waves" (for my personal taste I think I like my hair better with the Wave Spray.)

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I've been wanting to buy one of these for a long time so I finally decided to get one. I bought it about a week ago and so far I love it. I've gotten many compliments on my hair. I'm posting a picture so you can see how well it works. It is a little frizzy but that is after I've slept on it for two nights. It takes a minute or two learning how to use the waver but you will easily get used to how it works. I like the different temperature settings and the auto shut off which is one of the reasons for buying it in the first place. It's worth the money and works very well!!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: My favorite, my lifesaver, my 🦄 hair tool! Hair stays cute & Shakira-esque for DAYS
review_text: Absolutely LOVE 💜 this Bed Head crimper! I know there’s still a small amount of a strange stigma around using a crimper “wave” heated-hair tool. I think some people automatically think 80s/90s crazy crimped teased wild hair or depending on age, it’s come-back in the 2000s. BUT, this tool is most definitely NOT that! It doesn’t give that tight wave that is the “crimp” but more of a relaxed wave in comparison. It it still going to give more than a beachy-wave for sure but what i also like it the sizing of the wave is adjustable. I will admit that it may seem more adjustable than it truly is; you twist the round black knob at the tip and it either pushes the middle piece of the plate on the tool inwards (smaller waves) or outwards (larger waves). To be honest adjusting the knob doesn’t make a huge difference: what really makes the difference of how you use it! If you want smaller, more waves closer together, when you have your piece of hair, starting from the scalp, when you’re working your way down, simply place the plate closer to where your last spot that you held it on was. And vice versa, if you want the largest wave possible, which is what I like, set the knob so it sticks out the most it can, and again, always starting at scalp, grab a piece of hair that is approx 1”-2” max in “width” (you don’t want it to be a strand of hair like you’d grab to curl, more like when you’re straightening your hair, you don’t want a thick piece of hair) and place it with your hair spread evenly in between the two hot plates, starting as close to the scalp as possible but of course be very careful to not burn your hands fingers scalp etc etc etc!!!!! Clamp down on the strand and hold for a few seconds. The tool does have heat setting options which is awesome! We all know to avoid major hair damage we need to use the lowest possible heat setting that works for our hair type. I happen to have have hair that unfortunately needs high heat or 5 minutes after I do my hair it falls completely flat. The highest setting is what I use but be warned is it extremely hot! Not as hot as some professional heat tools I’ve used but still very hot. After holding the iron clamped together for a few seconds you unclamp, and I suggest lightly (because your hairs hot) holding the clump of hairs you’re working on, loosely towards the end of the hairs, that way as you’re moving down down the strands, when you unclamp, the hairs won’t fall in and be mixed in with your other, non-wavey hairs. Where you choose to place the plates on the second time and so on as you move down the scalp, will produce either more loose waves or tighter more crimp-esque waves; to get the most loose, most “soft” waves, place the end of the plate so that it starts on the last area the plate touched on the first clamp. You’ll keep doing so, moving down the strands working from scalp to tip. I will post pictures. Best parts of this tool is that it’s a great tool where you don’t need to be perfect because it looks great no matter where you place the plates really! It’s meant to look natural and wavy and wild Shakira-like! And also it stays for DAYS! I personally only wash my hair approximately 2x a week. I’ll wash my hair on Sunday night, let it air dry, use a light, doesn’t leave any tho of residue type of heat protectant in the morning Monday, use the waver tool and with a small amount of dry shampoo worked in, and my hair will last 3-4 days depending on my workout schedule lol. I’m able to sleep, wake up, brush it, dry shampoo if needed, tousle tousle and flip my head around and it looks great on days 2,3 & 4. Another great way to use this is also a half up do, loose ponytail, loose side bun, loose braids of any type or a top knot/bun. It my hairstyle 🦄 tool! My favorite styling tool: my lifesaver, 🦄 tool! Hair stays cute & Shakira-esque for DAYS My favorite, my lifesaver, my 🦄 hair tool! Hair stays cute & Shakira-esque for DAYS ( Pls don’t judge my basic girl Snapchat filter!😂😂 ....Just wanting to show how great the wavey tool works for me!😊) hope this is helpful for one person!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: Delivers on its promise of beachy wavy hair for miles...
review_text: It is rare that a hair gadget does -exactly- what it promises, but this device delivers.. Beachy waves for MILES! I have the most obnoxious baby fine straw straight hair and all the snazzy barrel curlers and wavers and ionic curlers etc... never work so well for my hair (and me) they take way too long, the curls fall out after a few hours, and i can’t get them consistent. I’m sure the devices work fine in the hands of more talent but for me they just didn’t work. Enter the Bed Head wave creator and WOW! I have the loose beachy wavey hair i always dreamed of. The contact time per clamp is so much shorter than how long I had to hold the single barrel irons i suspect that (even with heat protection) there will be less overall damage, and no ‘pulling through’ (like the flat iron technique) which also isn’t ideal for my hair. So... this works, works super well on long baby fine hair, takes a fraction of the time as a barrel iron, flat iron or curlers and looks great :)

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: BEST hair tool for MOMS-ON-THE-GO! Flawless waves day or night!
review_text: BEST hair tool for MOMS ON THE GO! I have used a waver hair iron on my hair for years on long hair and short hair. I currently have short hair. I love all the looks I can acchieve with the BedHead A-Wave-We-Go. The thing that sets this apart from other wave irons is the adjustable size. I can have a tight wave which looks classy (I get asked all the time if my hair is natural curly or permed) which is awesome! Or I can change it up and go for a mixture of big waves and tight waves that creates flawless spunky messy look ( that still looks put together) With the right hair proudcts, I only have to touch up my hair acouple times a week. I only wash my hair twice a week So I feel like this product is ultimately is saving my hair from extreme damage of flat iron or a regular curling iron.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: I have long, thin, hard to curl hair!
review_text: I have long, thin, hard to curl hair and this thing is amazing so far. My hair won't hold curls at all within 5 minutes my curls are gone. This waver and the Bed Head bumpy wand are the only two things that actually work amazing in my hair and they lasts for hours! I have only used this waver one time and my waves are so beautiful and they held up all day. I haven't tried it over night to see how long they last but when I do I will update and let you know. Also try the wand out too I can't remember the name of the wand but it's also by Bed Head and it is a wand but instead of being straight it is bumpy and its blue. I have been using the wand for over a year now and the curls last all day. Not only do they last all day but the next day I still have beautiful curls they are just a little more loose but still beautiful. If you have hard to curl hair like mine you will understand why that is amazing! Bed Head has saved me from wearing basic, flat, straight hair every day!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I’m an individual that has perfectly straight hair all the time. I’m not very skilled with curling it, and I don’t have the patience for it to be honest. This tool however is very easy to use. In the photo attached I had the heat setting to 375° and the middle barrel as tall as possible for what I assume to be the “loosest” wave. I experimented with flipping it in different directions. Barrels facing my head and barrels facing the ceiling. I really like that you can change how tight the waves are and you can do this while the tool is hot. I held it clamped for about 8 seconds before going further down my hair section each time. It’s also not a terribly heavy device which is nice because some wagers are quite large and heavy and awkward. I do believe this to be a new favorite. A bit of a warning, do NOT trust that just pushing the on/off button again to turn the tool off is turning it off because that’s how I melted my hair brush and burnt my thumb. I will from now on be unplugging it as soon as I’m finished with it. It does heat it up quickly but takes a while to cool down. Also, it made my hair smell a bit odd. I’m hoping it’s just because it’s new.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: My hair is very straight and it doesnt normally hold a curl but surprisingly it holds this type of curl and personally like ir because I think it looks more natural. It's very easy to use,the bigger the plate is, the bigger the wave will be. Its lightweight but at the same time it doesn't feel hollow inside. Highly recommended!!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I have an under cut pixie- so my sides and back are shaved close to my head and it’s longer on the top. I wanted a way to give some wavy texture to my hair instead of wearing it the same two ways all the time. I can use a curling iron but some days that just takes too long. I was worried this wouldn’t work and honestly the first time I used it I was not impressed and thought I was going to send it back. But I decided to give it a few more times and I’m so glad I did. After the 3rd time I got the hang of it on my shorter hair and now I have a fast and great way to quickly do my hair that’s not in the normal straight style. I use it on setting 4 for a more “tousled” look. So glad I invested in this wonderful tool!!!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I usually buy quality products and was skeptical about this working as good as described....but i got this for my daughter for her birthday because she really wanted a tool to created that braided look without all the hassle. This is better than i expected! It works quick and leaves a very pretty wave. it is easy to see where to place the iron as you are working your way down and it doesn't leave an "odd" looking end either. It leaves a much better result than i anticipated. It really is fantastic. The only downside is holding the iron tight is sort of tiring on the hand after a bit. If she had really long hair i would maybe get tired of that but it is very manageable and reasonable for the price. I would highly recommend! One tip is when you are starting near the scalp turn the iron the opposite direction...like upside down so the first curl isnt so prominent( looks kind of bad). then after the first wave flip it back over. Looks great that way. enjoy. Even my daughters teacher texted me the first day we used this and told me how cute her hair looked

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I never write reviews, but with this I really wanted to. This was my first time using anything like this and it was so easy. Definitely my favorite hairstyle, I could never get the braided wave look, but with this I definitely do. I got many compliments, including from my kids lol only down side was, it gets kinda heavy, but nothing extreme. Once I got the hang of it, I was able to do it faster. Definitely a styling tool that you get better with over time. If you're on the fence about buying it, just do it! I was debating for a little if I should because of the mix reviews on here and YouTube, but I'm glad I did. I only used a heat protectant and that's it, not even hairspray. The next day my hair was still wavy and I could wear it down and it look good!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I have never gotten so many compliments in my entire life when I have my hair crimped.. Its super quick and super easy. It heats up fast and it can range from a crimpy wavy to a little bit more of a relaxed wave. I am usually done my hair in about 15 minutes and it stays for DAYS. I definitely kinda relives the 80s hairstyle. I have also been asked several times if that was my natural wave. So it does look natural when you use the larger setting!! AND gives volume to those with flat straight, fine hair, like myself. Can't rave enough about this tool. I guess the only thing I would suggest, is if they could create a lock for it to shut when you want to store the hot tool because it is kind of bulky.. But is definitely my to go to hot tool.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: I saw this Product on YouTube someone was reviewing it. And I bought it online and shipped quick like in a couple of days. Lovely beach waves! My hair is color treated and it has buttons for the temperature setting and so far we went to Myrtle beach and I brought it along and got amazing results. My hair doesn’t hold curls that good so instead of brushing my hair I combed it with my fingers. And they lasted all day and slept like that too but I did add some mousse in my hair before I went to bed and it was a cute “bed head” waves the next morning. I recommend getting it and it’s easy to do. You get small pieces of hair sections for more defined waves and bigger sections for less defined waves. Wish I took a picture! Hope this helps

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: This thing is AMAZING!!! So glad I bought it. I was worried because my hair is long that it would take too long but it’s actually pretty quick. I can take much bigger sections than with a straightener or wand. It light and fluffy. I’ve done my hair with this tool everyday since I got it. No joke. I’m buying sister one cause I know she won’t spend the money on herself.

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: Wow. This wave iron is amazing. Let's get to it. I could have included pics, but honestly, there are a lot of examples of that already. I have fairly thick hair, with medium course texture - natural dark blonde, about shoulder length. The handle is a combo of purple metal and black plastic. The on and off switch and the temp guides are inside the pinch of the handle. VERY, very smart. I don't how many times I've used my regular curling iron and turned it off over and over again because the switches are placed exactly where you hold the iron - even on my flattening iron. So bonus on the well placed switches. There is a twist knob on the other end of the iron that allows you basically change the dimension/pattern of your wave... they can be more uniform, or more wild depending on the middle wave iron. There are three barrels as you can see in the diagram. The cord is long and convenient with the most important "swivel." It has 6 heat settings 250 degrees up to 400 degrees. Now, let's talk heat - it gets HOT. I would recommend using the lowest heat and testing one step at a time to find the level that doesn't fry your hair - especially if you have color treated or chemically processed hair. Lower heat, for just few seconds at the very most is all it takes. I have a pretty full head of hair and I was done in about 15 minutes. The other thing to note about the heat part is that the iron works on a "pinch" system as you would guess.. there are 2 barrels that are completely open and branding hot. So BE CAREFUL! I accidentally burned my left thumb pretty good - happens so fast! I purchased the "suggested" hot glove - I now use it every single time I use this iron. And be careful when you get close to your skin, around your face. Having fully covered the safety suggestions, I will say that the waves I did lasted 4 days (I wanted to see how far I could go) and probably would have lasted longer with NO other products in my hair. The finer strands around my face needed a slight touch up, but the rest totally stayed wavy! It was sort of like getting a wave perm or something. I was amazed. I don't get greasy looking hair, but you could use a dry shampoo to extend wear to a day or two easily. The wave "action" gives you body and fullness - like a crimper iron - but so much softer. I have "sold" so many of these in the last few days - so many people asking if I'd had a perm... what salon did my hair... and when I told them about the wave iron, where can I get one?? I've purchased sooo many hair "tools" in my life... but this is honestly one of my favs. Just remember to use extreme caution when it gets hot with the open barrels .. and use lowest temps - going up one step at time to find the perfect temp for your hair type. Don't leave on one spot too long and you'll be amazed at the result and then the staying power of the do! Having said all those things, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful. I will be ordering another one for travel soon. Would be out of this world if they included a heat proof sleeve!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: Lots of waves and they hold up!
review_text: Almost didn't order this iron -- figured it would join the other irons in the closet that will never again see the light of day. This one is different. I spray my hair with my usual thermal setting mist (Redken Hot Sets 11 or 22), separate my hair into segments and start ironing. I set on 350 degrees and literally count to 5 for every time I iron a segment of hair - done in no time ! So quick I still cant believe how much faster compared to my regular round curling irons, flat irons, etc -- wish I had purchased years ago. My hair waves are gentle but lasts until I wash my hair (I wash every 2 days). And when I want a more crimped looked I adjust the depth of the middle iron piece using the dial at the end. Love the full head of wavy hair! (My hair is naturally straight).

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: A MUST have in your hair supplies!!
review_text: I am literally so in love with my hair because of this perfect tool! The first time I tried it I was shocked. I used the 350 degree setting it starts up on when you power it. I counted to 3 and worked my way down my hair shaft. I washed, blow dried and used this 2 days this week. One day just on my clean hair. I had the beach look. Loved it. The next time I added a little coconut oil for shine and my hair was much more defined. I loved both styles. I contemplated buying L’ange’s product but there’s no way I’m sending this tool back! My newest hair bestie! (Sorry L’ange) 😉😆

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_text: Everything was absolutely perfect about this product. I used the lowest wave setting because my hair is so short and I got the target look I’ve been trying to get for months. I have already gotten compliments on it. I typically use the 400 degree setting but I set this to 350 and it didn’t fry my hair at all. It is a must buy for beach waves!!!

product_title: Bed Head A-Wave-We-Go Adjustable Hair Waver for Multiple Waves
review_header: Awesome solution for fine flat hair!
review_text: This is the best investment I’ve made in hair tools. I’ve tried all kinds of irons, wands, straighteners, I cannot get a curl to last longer than 30 mins without a half of a bottle of hair spray and a serious case of helmet hair.
