I camp upwards of 20 times per year and the most annoying thing about camping for me is I can never get good sleep past sunrise. I bought this tent in hopes to solve that and it does just that. The first time I camped in it I slept sound until about 8 in the morning. It blocks out a lot of light and for that I love it. Edit: I wanted to revise my review to state that I cannot attest to how watertight this tent is. I live in Oregon and it rains quite heavily here for a better part of the year, therefore I've always used tarps. Some of the storms here are quite substantial so I've never been one to test my tent's capabilities when it comes to water.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: I bought this bc I wanted the darker interior and it is by far darker than any other tent I’ve seen. As a bonus, I absolutely love the oversized screen window / roof panel that allows for a great view of the sky at night. Basically 1/4 of the roof. Now, obviously you have to choose between that OR darkness in the morning, can’t have both (the rain fly, if installed, covers this window and keeps it very dark inside). The porch was also useful to keep mud out of the main tent and a good place to leave shoes etc I don’t know how I’ve done without a porch on other tents! On my first trip it rained pretty heavy one night. The porch had some water as expected. There was a little water inside the tent as well. Not a massive amount considering how much it rained. I’m going to spray it with some waterproofing spray and hope that will help but overall I think it held up fine for the conditions. We actually fit 3 full size Coleman cots in there (6’2”) that was just enough room for the cots with prob 6-8” between them and about same between the feet and the door. But pretty much nothing else (storage under the cots of course). But it was doable. Overall I am very happy with this tent and would recommend it. I bought the 4 person tent for myself or maybe 2 people occasionally. As stated I ended up with 3 on the first trip and it was doable as long as you like each other. 4 would be a stretch unless you all had sleeping bags and really liked each other! I am 5’3” and that’s about how tall it is at the highest inside.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: This is an incredible tent. It says 4-Person and you probably could fit that many, but it’s the perfect size for 2 adults. Plenty of room for sleeping and storage! Super easy to set up and amazingly it actually fits back in its storage back after use! The Dark Room feature alone makes this tent worth EVERY penny. It really blocks out sunlight and keeps the inside nice and cool. Was able to sleep till 10am in this tent, well past the usual time you’d expect to wake up when camping. The only con is that the stakes it comes with are poor in quality. Buy yourself a separate set of sturdier stakes!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 6 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Great for camping with a toddler
review_text: Seems to be quality. I've used this on two trips and have been pleased. The darkening is effective and is a huge help with a one year old. I was very pleased at how thick the bottom of the tent was and that the flooring comes up a few inches from the bottom. We were able to fit a queen size mattress, a pack and play, a rocker, and bags with some room to spare. The only thing I don't love is that there is no option to extend the rain-fly over the vestibule, but I knew that when ordering.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_header: Great tent for camping with little kids
review_text: We bought this tent for our first camping trip with our two small kids (ages 1 and 3). The 1-year-old still takes 2 naps a day and we thought this might help, in addition to helping my 3-year-old go to bed at a reasonable time. My husband was able to set up this tent in about 10 mins by himself. It was very spacious for the 4 of us... we got 1 queen air mattress, 1 pack n play, and 1 portable dog kennel (for our pug) in the tent with plenty of room for our bags. We were debating between this and a roomy cabin tent, but I'm actually happy we went with this. It will fit into smaller camping spots and it has plenty of room, without the bulk. I don't know if it's weatherproof since we had nice weather when we used it. 24 hours after this photo was taken, this campground was completely destroyed by a massive wildfire. :(

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: This 4-person tent was perfect for me, my husband and our 15 lb dog. I am 5'6 and my husband is 5'11 and we had plenty of room to move around. We stored our duffel bag, dog bed, pillows, portable power station in our tent and still had plenty of space. But my FAVORITE thing about this tent is the screened porch. We left our fur baby in the porch when we were cooking and could still see him and he was happy that he could see us as well. Just make sure to purchase a tarp big enough for your tent as well as the screened porch. We also stored our shoes in the porch to protect them from dust and it also worked as a barrier for dust and leaves when we enter and exit the tent. Setting it up was easy enough and the dark room technology did keep most of the light out but since this was my first tent, I can't really compare it to other tents that do not have the dark room technology. Overall, we are happy with our purchase and can't wait to use this tent for many more camping trips to come!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_header: Dark room technology is amazing and quality is there
review_text: This tent was super easy to assemble in comparison to most other tents. We got the 10x10 and it was the perfect size for a queen size air mattress, several bags, and two adults. There was enough room to change clothes inside the tent. We are tall so couldn't fully stand up inside but that was fine. The dark room feature is amazing. It's not pitch dark, but you definitely can tell it's like 100 times darker than a regular tent. Despite being dark in color, the tent was very cool and wasn't too hot. It has great ventilation. We didn't have any bad weather so I can't say how it would hold up to high winds or water. It did a good job keeping the bugs out.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Great tent (4 person tent, not 6 person)
review_text: Plenty of room for 2 plus bunches of gear, very good ventilation, very easy for 2 to put up/ tear down, and I really like the covered porch! However, the covered porch isn't quite as covered as it could be. If it rains, the porch will get wet. It would be better if the "roof" extended farther and the side walls had cloth instead of netting. Now, this might reduce ventilation, but not by much, if at all. I addressed this by purchasing lightweight plastic sheeting and covering the porch. it cut down on ventilation (whole front of tent was covered) but everything stayed dry. Also, the porch isn't quite large enough to sit under. You can sit on the porch with the outer zipper open, but not if the zipper is closed. Still, great tent. we did get some condensation, but otherwise, stayed dry!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: We just got it today (wow Sunday delivery which i was not expecting) and put it up to make sure it worked. We are just so pleased and excited to use it when we go on our first camping trip which will be in June. It is so nice and dark inside compared to other tents.. I am not a sun lover, so this tent will work out for me. Update : we ended up using it for memorial weekend and here are some photos still love the tent

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: Came in on time, and in good condition. I set it up in the back yard, intending to give it a waterproof test the next day. It rained overnight, and there was a bit of water asking the front edge. Dried it out, then noticed the tiny zipper on the corner to the right of the door (left as you're facing the tent) for a power cable was unzipped. Zipped it up and left it to test again. It rained off and on, some really heavy storms, for a whole week, no leaks. I feel safe taking this tent camping.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 6 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: We broke this out this weekend and loved it. I appreciate being able to stand upright in the middle of the tent. I do wish the directions were detached from the bad and included specific directions for the rain fly. That was confusing. Very roomy. We fit two twin air mattresses, a chair, a bucket toilet and a few 6qt storage boxes with room to move around. The party is nice to storing things that don’t need to be in the sleeping area. Can’t wait to use it again!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: Great little tent...with a few modifications. The poles are impossible to tell apart unless you lay them fully extended side by side. So mark them with nail polish or paint. If you spend 5 minutes with a piece of cheap plastic and some binder clips you can cover the screen room in a rain storm. Clip the edge of the plastic to the rainfly and roll it up out of the way. If rain is expected, unroll a bit and clip to the front arch pole with some slack so you don't pull on the rain fly itself. You need large 2"-3" binder clips to reach around the pole's diameter. Then spread out the plastic and attach it with medium or small binder clips to the existing ropes or the tent or spare pegs or anywhere else that makes sense. I think the people who are annoyed by the lack of privacy when the rainfly is off can fix that with a piece of cloth and a few clips. Or a folded up rainfly and a few clips. Use clips to attach something to cover the electric cord holes. I have never seen binder clips from an office supply store used by other campers. Take some with you next time and uses will pop up all over. The black ones seem to disappear when I drop them so I just ordered some pastel ones.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: Took this tent to a camping festival (Nocturnal Wonderland) and it's now my favorite tent ever. I was skeptical about it being darker inside than others but my tent was cooler and darker inside than any other at the campground. I slept till 10am or even till noon one day while other campers struggled to sleep past 8-9am because their tents were too warm or bright that early. Everyone wanted to hang out at my tent and everyone kept asking where I got it. I set it up easily by myself in about 15 min, maybe less.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: I spent a fair amount of time shopping and comparing tents before taking the plunge. Videos and reviews and even busting out a tape measure and attempting to visualize this tent all helped. Nothing though compared to actually tacking the tent out of the package and setting it up. The included instructions aren't as clear as they could be, be sure to set it up once at home before fending off bugs and the elements out on your trip. The screened in area is a good size for storing supplies and dirty shoes/gear, the rain fly looks a little unstable and simply rests on top the the main poles, stabilized by it's own shorter pole and ropes, but where it clips onto the corners of the tent feels poorly planned, the fly often slips to one side or the other of the tent poles and can look lop-sided. Have no fear though, it doe's its job well. The windows and ventilation are well designed, with the fly off on a warm clear night, the sky is beautiful while laying down. There is a mesh channel that separates the front screened in area from the main tent, allowing for moisture to travel under the tent rather than into it from the front portion. I found this both helpful and frustrating, I chose a yoga mat as a "welcome" mat that covered this area as the natural moisture from below was problematic. A 10' X 12' tarp is a good thing to lay down first and will fit well under the tent.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_header: It is a Coleman and the quality is there
review_text: Coleman has been making tents for ages and their quality has always been great. While they are not the most expensive tent maker in the world, they are still the industry leader and known for their consistent quality. I was surprised to find the dark room tent with the same dimensions and labeling as my green and white 4P Sundome. If you need a darkened tent this one is what you need. The fabric actually feels a little heavier than the standard Sundome. I was in a HARD HARD downpour on the Blue Ridge Parkway. Thunder, lightening and biblical rain. Not one drop of water entered my tent. Ya gotta love it when something performs as advertised. This is my “GoTo” motorcycle camping tent. Weight is 10 pounds.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: 1. DARKROOM: I was a little skeptical about how the “darkroom” feature would perform given some reviews, but I’m pleasantly surprised. It reduces light dramatically to the point that we could get our toddler to nap in it. No way that was happening In our regular tent. To expect “blackout” is pretty unreasonable given a tent needs air circulation. This probably goes without saying but use the rain fly to achieve the darkroom effect. 2. :ASSEMBLY: If you are familiar setting up a tent at all expect to set it up solo in about 5 minutes. No instruction was needed but it comes with them. With help it could go up under 3 minutes. Very simple design. 3. BUILD: We haven’t used the tent much but the poles feel well built as does the material. The rain fly doesn’t cover the tent entirely so some water can make its way in if you experience a downpour. Any tent I’ve owned that was full waterproof in any amount of rain were $300+ so I’m not disappointed with this fact. The tent packs small and light for its size. Overall great value for the price. The only question will be longevity of the tent but on first use the quality feels great for this price range. No complaints after first use and we are very happy to have found this tent at the price.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: Nice sturdy tent, dark interior keeps cool and screened front section comes in handy for dirty boots and a sleeping dog. Tent fits two full sized sleeping bags on a blow up mattress with a little extra room. Downside is the back screened window does not have a zipper cover and is only covered when using the rain fly. Used in rain and it kept warm and dry inside tent but screened section did pool a bit of water in it which had to be dumped/dried before packing up. Nice comfortable and affordable tent, perfect for a couple with small kids.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: We purchased the 4-person version. First time going camping and this tent definitely made it a breeze. Perfect for 2 adults (comfortably) with room for 2-3 bags each. We had a queen size air mattress inside and still was able to sit our bags on the floor of the tent. We went camping with temps around 75-80 degrees. Air flow was nice and sun blocking was great. It didn't rain so can't comment on that. We did forget to pack the thin metal stakes (included with the tent) but ended up not needing them - but no really strong winds either. Setup was very easy and (surprisingly) breakdown was too. We were able to fit the tent back into its bag (which you know never happens).

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 6 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Great value, easy set-up, nice features
review_text: Love the blackout fabric and the screened in space. We have used in 100 degree heat and 40 degree chill. Both were okay because of excellent airflow. No condensation at all. Very easy setup. As a single mom 5'4", I can set up with my 5 year old in less than 10 minutes including rain fly! Also light enough for me to carry into a walk in site if neccessary Love that I can stand up easily in main space. Fits our two extra long cots comfortably, but would be hard to squeeze in a third. Might fit 3 air matresses better. The only inconvenience is the zippers on the screened space. You have to use 2 zippers each time you go in or out. It is easier if you stake one side and only use 1/2 as the entrance. But the "porch" area really helps keep the main space cleaner and I am happy to trade a little hastle with zippers to keep the leaves and mud out of my sleeping space. Overall a great buy and looking forward to using for many seasons. Does not sleep 6. Max 3 adults. Maybe 2 adults amd 2 kids, but would be a tight fit. Ideal for 2 adults or 1 adult and 2 kids.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: Bought this Tent early summer, and camp around 10k' up in the mountains of CO. Seriously holds the light out and can sleep till 8am without the sun baking me alive. I bought the 6 man tent and only use if for two. Inside I keep a Queen double decker air mattress, 3' igloo cooler and random bags for hunting or fishing gear. Plenty of room to sit and eat beside the air mattress if the weather gets bad (2adults) . I can stand up in the middle and change clothes comfortably inside. About 10 mins to set up and breakdown, 3 poles. ANNNND so far every time I'm able to get the tent AND poles back into the traveling bag.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 6 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: Took this camping the same week purchased. Really benefited from the Dark Room feature. I was able to sleep in longer than I usually do. it felt much cooler inside compared to how my other tent felt early in the morning. It kept the tent dark enough when cars would drive by. The little patio entrance helped keep the actual tent clean from dirt and leaves being brought in, since we left our shoes outside. We were able to fit a queen sized mattress inside with room on each side of the mattress and front of it to place things. You could easily fit more people on those side, (2 tops) if you wanted more people in addition to those sleeping on the mattress. More than that would be a bit cramped if you're keeping your bags or supplies in with you.I would definitely recommend this for those who find those features mentioned useful.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Wish I would've gotten this first
review_text: I really liked how easy it was to setup. The instructions are easy to follow and hard to lose since they're sewn into the bag. The bag has an option to be expanded which I needed once I find camping, very convenient. The instructions are also water resistant and durable as mine got wet and are still legible and intact. The screenroom is an added bonus to sit in a small folding chair to escape the bugs. My wife was sleeping in the tent and my pal and I were on the screenroom chatting late into the night, no bugs to bother us. The dark technology definitely helped us sleep later into the morning compared to other tents. Our friends were awake at 7am from sunlight while we were snoozing until 9am. The mesh on the screenroom floor made cleaning easy when I rinsed it down after I got home. Helped the water flow right out. There are small opening on the side of the porch between the tent which helped when I needed to rinse debris out the tent. I guess bugs could've gotten in there but we didn't notice it, could just put a lead if something over it. The tent is not lightweight. Wouldn't carry for backpacking. Wish the back wall wasnt fully mesh but rather had a vent option instead. Otherwise you've gotta use the rainy for privacy. It definitely kept cooler than friends tent, they weren't able to go into their tent to relax during mid-day due to heat but I was able to sneak a nap after lunch because Carlsbad was much cooler.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_header: DARKROOM is amazing!!! Review of 6 person tent
review_text: Absolutely in love with this tent!!! Size: the 6 person tent fit a queen size air mattress with several feet on either side. Very large inside. We are able to walk around in it easily. There are usually just 2 of us camping in it, but we still enjoy the size to be able to walk around, get changed, and stand up. Our previous 4 person tent did not allow for as much comfort. Weather proof: this tent was used during several thunderstorms and not a single drop of water got in. Very impressed with this Darkroom: absolutely amazing. The darkroom is the BEST part about this tent! It keeps the tent dark and cool in the morning. In our other tents, it would become extremely hot and bright by 6am. This tent allows you to sleep in just because you won’t be woken up right when the sun comes up (unless you open window). Love how dark and cool it remains throughout the day. I attached a photo of how dark it remains even at 2pm. Sturdiness & setup: the tent seems to be made of high quality materials and we feel very confident in the integrity of the tent. Feels very well constructed. Setup is just as simple as any other comparable tent. Nothing difficult. Overall: highly recommend, and I do recommend spending the extra few dollars for the DarkRoom. TOTALLY WORTH IT!!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: At Bonnaroo in 2018, Coleman had a few contests and I won one of these dark room tents for camping. Even though we already had a tent, the sun was unbearable and we’d be woken up by 7 am due to the heat in the normal Coleman tent. The dark room technology is a game changer. We easily slept til 9/10 am with it and it was remarkably cooler inside. Last year, we used the dark room and covered the other tent in tarps- it was still so much cooler (and darker). We bought another dark room for this year and our regular Coleman is reserved for fall/spring camping trips. Both tents are the same model and have handled rain well- we waterproofed both along the seams and have never had an issue with flooding even on uneven terrain/torrential downpour but it does feel a little damp (not a huge issue for the price). It sets up easily and is great for car camping. If you’re tired of a swampy tent in the summer this one is the way to go!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Great even in the rain, LOVE THIS TENT
review_text: It rained pretty heavily for three of the days during my camping trip, only moisture that made it into the tent was a few droplets and it was my own fault for not properly attaching a velcro that is on the fly to one of the poles.. fixed that right away and was no issue at all afterward! The guy lines are super reflective with flashlights which were nice to ensure nobody tripped over them at night. Comfortable, definitely darker than other tents but not exactly blacked out all the way, takes much longer to get warm in the daytime so it works great for those that want to sleep in a little bit and not wake up with the sun. The best tent I've ever owned, love it a lot. The four-man is perfect for a twin mattress, all your gear, and some wiggle room for getting dressed and whatnot. Due to all the rain I didn't get much of a chance to use the zippered in the entryway, but I can see how in dryer weather or for storing your drink cooler that area would be great!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: This was the best tent purchase I ever made. AS ADVERTISED. We set up the tent at 2pm in the afternoon in about 80-85 degrees full sun, no shade. It was easy to set up. I had done a test run in my backyard but still super easy. After setup I went in the tent and zipped the window and doors to change clothes. I could hardly see! I had to use a flashlight. It was great. Nights got down to low 50's. First night I had the sides of the cover extended so air flow was increased. Made it cold. I was fine but my wife, not so much. The second night I untied the sides of the cover and let them rest on the side of the tent. Perfect. It restricted the airflow and kept more warmth inside. Even took a nap in the middle of the day and it blocked enough light and heat to sleep comfortably. Definitely would recommend.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 6 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: The media could not be loaded. I bought the 6 person tent, it's very good but Make sure to buy seam sealant! Tent leaks in the seam. But overall you can definitely fit a queen bed inside not sure if two queen bed can fit inside so definitely not. You can stand up fully in the center if you are 5'8" or 9". And you can fit two or even 3 chairs in the front screen room.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: For reference, I am a camping novice and am speaking from a pleasure campers viewpoint. Why haven't they perfected the way these tents fold up and fit back into the carrying bag? This is a good tent and it was not too terribly hard to set up but the most frustrating part, by far, is trying to fit everything back into the bag. I liked that it had a little area in the front for shoes before entering the main part of the tent.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Great Cozy Tent! No sun. (2 adults max + maybe a small dog)
review_text: I have a thing about sunlight waking me up no matter where I am. This was PERFECT!!! Not exactly big enough for anyone to stand up in and a bit difficult to move around once the queen sized air mattress was up - but there was enough room for it, two duffle bags at the foot and about a foot or so along the edge. The front area is great - only issue is the front is at an angle and for me (I'm 4'11") I had to step in to start pulling the zipper down and step out to finish closing it. Does not come with a foot print but the bottom is supposedly reinforced - seemed like it, but I put a tarp down anyways all the time. Only took about 5-10 minutes to put up. DO lay out all the pools first! The size difference from the 2 large ones to the one smaller is not much. The pools do fit VERY tightly. Almost worried I was going to break a seem getting them in place. Did not make it that much cooler that I noticed - but I havent had it out in the heat yet. Looks great too! I'm so pleased with the color scheme and over all darker tones. I do wish there was some kind of better window option from the main part of the tent though.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: Love this Coleman tent! We used this Coleman tent for all various camping trips during 2018. Simple to put together, easy to take down, storage bags are great, and great quality. This tent held up all 2018 and we have no doubts it will continue to hold up all 2019. Very spacious. My husband and I fit all our belongings, comfortable sleeping supplies, our dogs kennel and of course our dog. He is a Doberman Shepherd, so I think you’ll fit your dog fine unless he’s actually a horse. Perfect in any weather. Move your items out of the screen room if it is going to rain, because there is not a fly to over it from the rain. However, that was not a concerning factor to us. Excited to use this tent again soon!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Screened area was great for shoes
review_text: Just used this tent for the first time during a cubscout campout. Just me and my 5 year old son. I was able to get it together alone and take it down alone. Screened area was great for shoes! I bought the Coleman Tent Kit to go with it and that was a great idea. It came with better tent steaks. The ones that come with the tent are short and very smooth. Only used them for the front of the screened area and had to put them in a few times before they would stay.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: Ready to setup, easy to breakdown. Like most tents in this price range, the tent stakes aren't that great. Knowing this, I bought the Coleman tent accessory kit with better tent stakes, a mallet, and dustpan/brush. We had a steady rain for about 6 hours one night and never had any kind of leaks inside. The light blocking feature is what drew me to this tent since I wake up with any kind of daylight and I was very pleased with how it performed.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: Fantastic little tent! Have used twice so far and it did not disappoint! (The dark room factor was a huge selling point for me - not exactly a morning person) First camping trip (2 adults) we were able to fit a queen air mattress and our few duffel bags, etc with plenty of room to spare. The screened room is great for muddy shoes, coolers or if you don't mind a tight fit you can squeeze 2 chairs in there to keep away from the bugs. Second camping trip (2 adults) we fit 2 cots, 3 bags/packs each underneath and there was still a decent amount of space in between to maneuver and was able to zip closed with no issue. It rained the first night, but the tent stayed leak free and on our last 2 days the wind kicked up pretty good, but this little guy held up beautifully with no rips or tears. As with most (or I should say all) '4 person' tents, this will not fit 4 people - at least comfortably - but will fit 2 just fine with plenty of room. This is a great tent for the price, Coleman for the win!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: Coleman 6P Sundome with dark room This tent stayed up in 2 WICKED storms.. even with the window and door covers open during the worst of it..one side did go to collapse during a huge gust of wind but we were able to push it back in place very quickly from inside. Super easy to set up and tear down. It's practically pitch black when everything is closed so we were able to "sleep in." **Very little rain got in and we're not sure where exactly from... Mind you we went through 3 thunderstorms on the river side and we noticed it after the third.. 2 of them were SEVERE; we were in the red on the radar if that tells you anything.. and it was maybe 2 oz. total and the storms lasted hours at a time. Note: USE THE SEAM SEALER!! And don't spray bug spray on the tent. I saw where a few people recommended doing it so I did, and it ate a small part of the material.. so don't do it!! All in all this is a great buy and super roomy for 2-3 people depending on how much stuff you have/walk room you want. We used a queen size air mattress and the 2 of us could walk all around it. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: Note that this is actually for the 4 person (not sure why it's showing 2). We finally decided to upgrade from a 2P. Not only does this tent truly make it easier to sleep/nap while camping, but WOW it can withstand some wind! Our first time taking it out, we were perched right on a cliff, and storms + 40 MPH wind gusts came through in the middle of the night. The tent (while moving around a lot...obviously) stayed put without breaking or tearing. The poles are very flexible. No rain got in the tent, and the rain fly kept us dry despite the wind. Without the fly, you have plenty of screen space for star-gazing. So happy we finally upgraded!

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Get a good night and morning of sleep!
review_text: Lets start by stating this is a inexpensive car camping tent I own a $600 18 ounce Zpacks hiking tent these are different animals. Went car camping for a week in 90°+ heat, slept with the inner tent door zipped open and the back of the fly tied out to a tree the air circulation was amazing. I seam sealed and put 2 coats of waterproofer on we had a small rain with no issues. PROS- The dark room really helps with getting a better full night's sleep. In a campground you won't notice the headlights of the cars getting in late or leaving early. I got the front porch mesh option and loved the airflow with the inner door unzipped and all the screens that open make it a great hot weather tent. Fits a queen and a twin air mattress 3 adults can fit comfortably in the 4 person option. Like the faster easier clip to the pole attachments. Easy to add a tarp to cover the front porch. Love the cary bag has a tear away strip so the tent actually fits back in the bag. CONS- Cheap poles- plastic I think? (Will bend but not break so better than fiberglass)I Would love aluminum but that costs $$$. I hate pole sleaves (on all tents not just this one) even though there are only small sections at the very top and a longer but easy section on the porch. Need a stake out point at the front of the porch or a double zipper to zip from the top, I'm going to sew a stake out point there. Would like an option for a fitted fly for the front porch.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_header: Sturdy and cooler than last tent
review_text: Used for basic weekend car camping. On a recent weekend, the wind gusts were over 30 miles an hour, and although someone else's tent ended up on the ground with bent poles, this one stayed in good condition, although it did bend sideways extremely. It has not been put to a thorough test with rain but seems like it would be fine. I am pleased with this tent over my last one of another brand because the rainfly and tent roof have a better design, allowing better ventilation and a cooler tent at night. As for the dark feature, it was definitely darker inside than my previous tent as well (day and night), but not uncomfortably or unpleasantly dark - I actually was hoping it was NOT total darkness and it was not. (if someone expects that, it isn't.) I do think it would be a tight squeeze for four people especially if they had much gear inside at all, but I think that about every four person tent I've seen...we got this size for use with three people and it's okay. Anyway, fits our needs, happy to have purchased it.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: I have had this tent for 2 years now. My most recent trip is why I choose now to write. I was camping between two RV's. Both of those RV's had more lights than most footballs stadiums which kind of ruined the outdoors feel. However, when I was sleeping I couldn't tell there was what amounted to another sun 20 feet away. The dark room tech was great (now if only someone would invent something soundproof for all the dogs barking). The other big factor were storms that came through the area. It rained extremely hard one night to the point you could feel puddles under the tent and in the morning the creek next to us had risen a couple of inches. However, we did not get wet and the puddles under the tent just felt like balloons with no water leaking into the tent. The only thing not great is the weight and bulkiness when packed up. This is not a tent anyone is going to take backpacking or kayak camping (I have a different tent for that). But overall if a family wants to camp while staying dry and keeping light out of theirs eyes at night, then this is perfect. PLEASE NOTE: My version does not have the screened in front room.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: I live in southern Louisiana, so we can have very wet and hot weather on camping trips. As habit, I set up a new tent and spray with a can of water-proofing from the local sports store. This means my review does not exactly reflect out of the box ability. Many people mistake humidity accumulating on the inside of a tent as leaking inside, so I make an effort to have good ventilation. It was a very rainy and windy trip, but the rainfly allowed us to keep all the windows open for ventilation. The porch does not stay dry nor did I expect it to, but it has a mesh strip connecting between the tarp like floor of the porch and the entrance of the tent itself. It was easy just to lift the edge of the porch to make any accumulated water drain out of the porch. We stayed dry, while staying cool. No problems to report. Set-up is not too difficult by one person, but super easy with two people.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: East to set up, durable, resistant to wind.
review_text: This is a 5 Star tent. Easy to set up, extremely affordable, fits a queen air up plus our two 60 pound dogs and a few bags. The dark room definitely seemed to help but it was also lighter in some places. We used it several times and it did great even in the rain. The screen porch is only screened so rain will get in there but it does help keep bugs and dirt out. Limited storage in the tent but it’s a small $100 tent, it’s absolutely sufficient. For actually being small and only $100 it does a absolute great job at getting my family through the holiday weekend.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 4 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: Fantastic blackout tent. Really, really cool private tent. The only thing is I wish they included longer stakes. I will purchase 12inch stakes myself for the future. The foyer feature is cool too because you can keep coolers in relative shade without putting them *in* your tent. *A little tip if you're camping at the beach ... I used a new litter box pan placed at the tent opening with fresh water to dip my feet in before going in to keep sand out of my tent and it worked really well. It's a good hack.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 6 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_header: Shedding Light on a Dark Tent
review_text: This was our first Dark Room Technology Tent. Our previous tent was of similar design, but without the vestibule and the Dark Room Tech. Even on a cloudy morning, at sunrise it was so bright inside that it was difficult to sleep. The Coleman Dark Room Tech is a big improvement in reducing the amount of light in the tent. It is not "pitch dark" in the tent. There is still quite a bit of light to clearly see in a backpack or even read, but it is not so bright to prevent you from remaining asleep. The entire back section is a screen window and the fly covers it and provides the darkness. While Coleman claims that the tent runs a few degrees cooler than conventional tents, I have no way of comparing it to my old tent. It may be a bit cooler inside, but to me it seemed to be more stuffy. I see the need for the fly to hug the tent and cover it lower to the ground, to block the light, but it also blocks some of the breeze that ventilates the tent. The vestibule is really nice to have. We placed our coolers there out of the sun, and it provided a clean place to take off or put on your shoes. It rained a day or two, some rain blew into the vestibule and puddled on the floor, but I could sit there without getting soaked. The living area of the tent remained totally dry even through hard rain and high winds. The instructions for assembling the tent consist of a set of simple drawings. They don’t show much detail, especially how the poles are oriented and attached to the tent by a tie at the top. During our first setup we noticed a piece of red tape on one of the pole ends and one of the plastic bottom receivers. That was our only indication that the poles were directional, as it is not indicated on the drawings. However, I must say that Coleman Customer Service is outstanding. I called them once before buying the tent and once after the first use for a defective strap. Both times they were friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. They answered my questions and solved our warranty issue quickly and easily. All said, we are very happy with our purchase of the Coleman Carlsbad Fast Pitch Cabin Tent with Dark Room Technology.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_header: Slept until noon at Bonnaroo in this thing.
review_text: This tent promises to block sunlight, and it does that, exceedingly well. If you're camping in a hot environment, I'm convinced this is has to be one of the best tents to have. Extremely spacious (had room for a queen sized air mattress, fans, luggage, and floor space), holds up well in inclement weather, and is relatively easy to setup! That said, if you're a smaller human, I'd recommend setting this up with some help :) the tent poles are pretty long and for people with short arms, it can be a bit tricky to manage on your own. This is a pretty moot point anyways though, because, who needs a tent this big for one person? Bonus points for affordability. Anyhoo - just buy it, you won't regret it.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
review_text: The dark room technology is awesome. It's dark enough to sleep in or nap through the day, but also very breathable. Plenty of airflow. We set it up in minutes, so easy. And it held up through strong winds as well as a heavy downpour. No water got inside. We have a tall queen sized air mattress that fits great with plenty of room for our stuff. We could easily fit another mattress in here. I'm 5'7 and can stand up straight in the middle of the tent. My boyfriend is a full foot taller and he has to crouch a little, but he's very impressed with how high the top of the tent is! We love it. Highly recommended.

product_title: Coleman Camping Tent with Screen Room | 4 Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Tent with Screened Porch , Green/Black/Teal
reviewed_product_attribute: Size: 6 Person | Style: Dome W/ Screen Room
review_text: We have now used this tent for three camping trips. The latest was Caprocks Canyon State Park, where we spent two nights in thunderstorms. Buffeting winds, rain were a little unnerving the first night, but quickly came to realize this tent wasn't going anywhere and was not going to leak. There are two minor issues: 1. The instructions that come with the tent are not for this tent. That being said, it is not difficult to set up, even for the inexperienced like my wife and I. 2. An earlier review that I had read mention that the screen porch door need to be nailed down someway so that it wasn't necessary to hold on to it to unzip. We found the same annoyance on our first trip. On the second trip, I used a tent peg through the zipper pull on the left side. We only use one side going in and out anyway, so having that side nailed worked well to make it a one handed operation. Overall, love the tent!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I usually buy Vortex products, but I decided to try a different company. I own many Sig Sauer hand guns and have been pleased with their product and service. So I decided to purchase a Sig Sauer 2 mis red dot for my new AR-15, it came faster than I thought because of the Corona virus, the box was in perfect condition upon arrival. It was easy to install, zeroing it in was very easyit was only off 1 click up, 3 clicks to the right. Either I got lucky from the factory or as the old saying, it’s better to be lucky than good. Shot 500 rounds through it and after shooting it this morning on Easter, I put it back on the bench to see if had moved again. At a hundred yards still held a zero after the 500 rounds. Well worth the money.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Leaving a quick review. As to some people complained about the product coming in a plain box, that the red dot doesn't show. The item came in the box from sig sauer with the gold seal showing it's never been messed with. Opening up the box the battery is not installed in the device. You would need to insert the battery hold the (+ button ) for a few seconds of the light doesn't come on keep pressing the (+ button) to brighten the red dot. Also it came with the high mount and low mount.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Watch the YouTube torture test- why buy anything else?
review_text: I now own two of these and I’m convinced that nothing else on the market even comes close for the money. It’s a red dot- that’s fast, up close and personal distance sighting. Glass is clear enough, battery life and management is insane, and you will never damage this unless you are actually trying to do so. Watch the torture test videos if you have any concerns about this product being “combat tough”. Why spend 4-5x as much for something that does the same thing, but really no better? $129 vs $800 for an aimpoint? Sorry, but as good as the Romeo5 is, I would consider a $500-$800 expenditure on a red dot as a complete waste of money. I can buy two of these and a high end barrel for that much money.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: SOR52001: Excellent Red Dot for Ruger PCC
review_text: There are some confusing reviews regarding the co-witness capabilities of the various models of the Romeo 5. I originally purchased the SOR52101 based on reviews that mentioned lower 1/3 co-witness. I now assume that was likely a reference to AR sights. That was not the case with the Ruger PCC. I sent that one back the same day and replaced with the SOR52001 (return was as easy as you could imagine). With the SOR52001 lower mount, I could pick up the front sight in the optic, but not the ghost ring. With the higher mount, you can easily see the iron sights under the optic, and with a slight shift, see the red dot in the Romeo 5.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: This is a great little red dot. The MOTAC system is great. Never have to worry about turning it on when you need it. It's so sensitive that I don't think I could hold a firearm steady enough for it to turn off. The slight cutout on the left side is awesome as it obstructs less of your view. Great range of brightness settings. Only other thing I'd like to see is forward light metering to automatically adjust brightness.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: This is my 5th Sig Romeo 5 red dot. I have them on 9mm, 5.56 and 7.62x51mm rifles. They have been nothing but 100% reliable. They come with both high and low Picatinny mounts. Lens caps, battery, cleaning cloth and torx head tool all included. Motac technology works great and dot intensity works for me in all light conditions. Battery life has been outstanding as well. It holds up to high power rifle recoil with no issues. I will continue to buy these sights as needed. The money saved not spending $700 on another brand can be used for more toys!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Motion activated, low mount, and push button
review_text: Vortex has the best warranty in the business but I couldn’t find one that is motion activated and low mount. I read this one is made by Holosun for Sig but I prefer the look of this one over the Holosun. It has push button instead of a dial and it turns itself off after 3 minutes instead of 10. All that for around $100. Some people don’t like auto off but it is always on by the time it reaches my shoulder. There are cheaper red dots out there but to get something that you can rely on costs $100+. I have over $3k invested in glass but this accompanies my home defense setup. I never have to turn it on or off and it won’t sit under the bed burning batteries. Leaving them on feels like a waste and I worry the batteries will be dead when I need it. I moved my Vortex over to my C02 BB gun, they are really hard on red dots I guess but Vortex will replace anything and everything.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Ok, let's face it, it's a three way tie for the best low price red dot, the Holosun, the Vortex, or the SigSauer Romeo. The SigSauer is the cheapest, and it has the best battery saver, allowing you to get up to 50k hours. That's why I bought it. On the other hand, the Vortex has a lifetime warranty, the warranty on the electronix of the Sig is only five years. Another factor I didn't like in the other choices was you had to switch it on and off. This required you to turn a dial to the level of intensity desired, rather than an instant on to your last illumination setting as soon as you touch it. I also got spooked by some bad reviews regarding quality with respect to the Holosun. Bottom line, all of these sights are great, and this is just the one I preferred.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I know people don't usually throw these kinds of optics on a pistol but it works incredibly well. The 2 moa dot and the auto on/off work awesome for my small game hunting pistol. I shoot better groups with this 2 moa dot than I do with a 2x pistol scope, and it works way better for fast target acquisition. Tight groups and the ability to hit moving targets. It's just an incredibly versatile optic. I have a slight astigmatism and while this red dot still exhibits typical issues the size of the dot and the edge to edge clarity of the optic make it very easy to shoot accurately.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: BUY NOW - Don't Read Another Review
review_text: Amazing optic. Not just for the price but overall an amazing optic. I did a 10-yard zero with 1.9-inch hold between the point of aim and point of impact to achieve a 50-yard zero, and it worked flawlessly. The dot is crisp! I was at an outdoor range from a sunny evening till a cloudy dusk and never once had any issue putting shots on target at 10-50-100 yards. After watching Alabama Arsenals "Torture Test," I knew I did not have to worry about durability. The motion activation is a wonderfully convenient feature for a "budget" optic. You can manually turn the red dot on and off as well. My only "complaint" is just me being nitpicky. I would love to have a lens cover feature similar to that of the Vortex SPARC where the caps can be clipped together to keep them out of your way while still keeping them attached to the optic. Pretty minor considering.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: No issues with the paint or finish on the one I received. Came perfectly packed in a sealed and tamper proof box. Popped the battery in and mounted it. I usually have an issue with red dots caused by my eyes (the star effect) This was no different at initial first look in the house. Once out on the range and the brightness setting dialed in the dot was clean and crisp. Much smaller 2 MOA dot feels much more accurate than other devices I have used. In less than 5 minutes I was ringing a 6" steel plate at 100yds with a quick cadence. For the price I'm really liking the optic and these features. (Always on, shake awake!)

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Mounted this on my Ruger AR556 MPR. Haven't sighted it in yet, but I can tell the red dot is more precise, less blurry, than my PA AMD or Bushnell TRS-25, even with my astigmatism. I really like the Motion Activation feature. It stays on for 120 seconds, then turns off if no motion is detected. It doesn't take much to turn it back on either. Just the slightest movement activates it. It comes with a short mount and a medium mount. The taller medium mount co-witnesses perfectly with the Magpul MBUS sights. When used in conjunction with the back up sights, co-witnessing also has the added benefit of mitigating the distortion caused by astigmatism,

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Wish I had bought this first.
review_text: Easy to install, use, and sight in. Took it to the range and sighted in my 22WMR semi-auto out to 50 yards. It was on target after sighting in and shot true for 50 rounds. I bought it after I had to return two of a rival brand which only had a dot for 4 of 11 settings. The Sig has dots from the get-go and all you have to do is pick the brightness you like for your conditions by pressing the + or - button. You don't have to turn it off and on as the MOTAC system takes care of that. I am using the low mount on my rifle's pic rail. You can shoot with both eyes open, which is cool. I would have shot out to 100 yards, but I cannot pick out the bull clearly at that distance (I'm 68 yo). I plan on using it to hunt squirrels, rabbits, and possibly raccoons.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: and super durable. I have been beating my rifle to ...
review_text: Definitely the Aimpoint Micro Killer! same profile, and super durable. I have been beating my rifle to death instructing LEO's and Military, and put this optic through its paces over the last 6 months. It has held zero, stood up to physical abuse, and endured harsh weather. Also a note to make is that I am still on the original battery life. the motion sense technology is great. Also Sig will warranty the optic if you by some chance receive a bad one. Love the optic so much that I sold two T-1's and replaced them wit these. Got to put the xtra money towards other training supplies. HIGHLY Reccommend.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: First and foremost, I can actually use this red dot despite my astigmatism! That alone gets it 5 stars. Of course I have to have my glasses on and be in direct sunlight, but thats always been the bar I expect a red dot to meet and none have till now. Viewing the dot through a peep sight does not make it any smaller or sharper, confirming I am seeing exactly what I am suppose to be seeing. Now its not all great. The biggest issue I have with this sight is how difficult it is to turn the dials. Holy crap they are stiff. Even though the dial caps have a screw head on them, the dials are too stiff to turn with those tiny caps. You have to use the supplied multi tool (a nice touch btw) to have a easy time adjusting the windage/elevation. Also I suspect the dials do not track all that precisely. The combination of these two things makes zeroing the sight a major PITA. Once zero'd though it really is great and judging by how tight the dials are, it will never lose zero. Overall I really like it. Time will tell how it holds up but I have very high hopes.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Small, easily installed and classic Sig Sauer quality!
review_text: An excellent 2 MOA red dot! Especially pleased to find its adjustment increment was 0.5 MOA per click. Very precise, easy to install on my Sig Sauer M400 Tread pistol and easy to zero. Haven’t had it long enough to comment on its ability to hold zero, but will amend this review if it turns out to be problematic...which I do not anticipate considering my experience with other Sig Sauer products.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Best red dot for the money
review_text: I own 7 Romeo 5's. Bought them all from Amazon. I also have a ton of other super-expensive sights including Eotech (2) ACOG (1) Trijicon Reflex (3) VCOG (oh my god that one was expensive), MEPRO (2) and a Trijicon MRO (3x the price of the Romeo 5) and I gotta tell you, this little inexpensive red dot is as good (if not better) than so many of my other sights, and that;s why I now own so many of them. It's like the Honda Accord of sights.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I'm kind of shocked at how nice this little sight is. I was looking for a sight for my lightweight AR build, having had horrible luck with other inexpensive sights and couldn't bring myself to send $500 for a high end sight. While this Sig lacks some of the bells and whistles of higher end options it does what it needs to do extremely well. It is simple, light, well built with a solid mount either high or low, the dot is bright even in mid day sun. Some may find the dot too big for ultra precision shooting, but it is perfect for my needs of fast acquisition. Adjustment was super easy and got it dead on at 200 yards in all of 6 rounds and only a few more clicks of the windage and elevation turrets If you're on the fence, get out. You won't regret it

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Good quality, great features ,pleased with delivery and placement of adjustments.
review_text: Fast delivery, came days before the estimated delivery time. Well packaged and includes to scope mounts. *** One thing I'll mention though after reading here of a past complaint concerning a purchaser being unable to remove the factory installed high sight mount. I also had trouble due to excessive torque when factory installed to the point that I was concerned about breaking the screws. I remedied the problem by carefully spraying a little WD-40 on the indented screw holes after covering the rest of the scope first. Placed it up side down and then went and had a cup of coffee. When done I used my own bit head inserting it into a small extension multi-driver and put gradual torque on it. Surprisingly with a moderate twisting pressure all four screws came out with moderate exertion. From there the remount of the lower base was a snap even after removing the oil from the screws. I'm happy with the overall quality and ease of use.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: ...and in this day and age, getting what you expect can be infrequent. I have not yet zeroed out my Sig Romeo 5, but it is turned on and mounted easily on my Ruger PC9. Mounting and adjustment was a breeze... Optic is clear and bright... great value for the money. I am an older shooter that has a farsightedness problem (+1.75), to the extent that the iron sight on the tip of the 16+ inch barrel was fuzzy. Now, with the Red Dot mounted far forward on the pic rail, and and both eyes open, I can see the target much more clearly. Red dot edges seem reasonably clear and crisp to me. This change completely alleviated the issue I had with the iron sights. Motion activation is there before the gun is at my shoulder. I will soon purchase the Juliet 3x to keep this Romeo very happy at longer distances.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I put this on the SBR that I use for 3-Gun competitions and I absolutely love it. This was a huge upgrade from the <$20 reflex sights that I was using, and well worth the money. It's easy for me to use with both eyes open for quick target acquisition and has very good clarity. The cheaper reflex sights were pretty mediocre for keeping the dot on target with different shooters (different cheek weld/angle looking through the sight). I'm amazed at how well the Romeo5 keeps the dot on target regardless of viewing angle. Once you understand the aim point for different distances it's easy to use for both short-range and long-range shooting. Even 12" steel plates at 200 yards have been hit in one shot. I compared this to Vortex and others at a store before buying on Amazon, and while I can't say anythin bad about Vortex, I didn't see any reason to pay the extra money for anything else. I plan to buy more of these in the future for other guns.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: High quality, great optic. No complaints. I am the one that needs work. My Optician told me a year ago I had a slight astigmatism. No real need to correct...UNTIL YOU TRY TO USE A RED DOT OPTIC!!!! It becomes very apparent my eyes need an adjustment. Took a pic through my iPhone and the dot is is a perfect circle, crisp and clear. Through my eyeball its a small starburst about the size the dot should be. Looks like the laser sight from Predator, the triple dot. I just turned down the brightness and it works! Cheaper than Toric contact lenses anyways... Looks pretty good on top of my Sig M400!!!! Perfect cowitness with my A2 post and rear BUIS.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Will NOT do a 1/3 lower co-witness with included mounts, however can buy inexpensive T1
review_text: Be aware: Will NOT do a 1/3 lower co-witness using the included mounts. The tall mount will line up as an absolute co-witness when using a standard AR A2 fixed front sight. The low mount would not work at all with a standard AR A2 fixed front sight. The low mount is NOT a spacer to be added to the tall mount as some have commented. Supposedly the Romeo5 is compatible with standard T1 mounts, so you can buy an inexpensive 1/3 mount (such as UTG) and it should give you the 1/3 co-witness (although I've read that the iron sights will be pretty low down in the sight picture). Edited 11/25/19: I bought the inexpensive UTG Super Slim T1 lower one-third co-witness mount from Amazon and it works great with the Romeo5 sight. It gives a 1/3 co-witness. The front iron sight is very low in the bottom third of the sight picture, because the Romeo5 is a little tall to begin with, but I think the front fixed sight would be usable. I only use this gun at the range, so I think if the optic ever stopped working I'd either change the battery or just remove the sight altogether and use the iron sights without this optic. I think that there's enough of the iron sights visible through the bottom of the romeo5 to zero the iron sights and then zero the romeo5 to the iron sights if that's what you like to do.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Thinking of purchasing another. Great optic.
review_text: Very pleased with this Sig. motion-activated red dot. Glass is clear and the motion-sensing Auto-on capability is a great feature to avoid having to power on my optic in a dark room or stressful situation. I have it on my Extar EP9 with cowitness to my iron sights and it holds zero after several hundred rounds. I am considering buying a second one to replace the Vortex optic on my BCM AR. I have seen varying reports of battery life, but the fact that it automatically shuts off is a huge plus as I have left other optics on in the past to find a dead or weak battery.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I installed it on lightweight 556 setup, zeroed it at 50yrds, and i could easily hit 6" plates at 200yrds with standard 55gr M193 ammo. I did multiple magdumps, and after many rounds came back to 200yrds, it was still zeroed dead on. Lots of brightness settings for sunny day or dusk. Very lightweight. I also owe Aimpoint PRO, and i was surprised how bright and clear the ROMEO5's glass was compared with Aimpoint. Sometimes i even had a feeling that the clarity of optic in this scope was even less obscured rather than in Aimpoint. It is definitely worth it, its not one of those cheapo chinese "truglo" whatever garbage, this stuff is real deal. By the way some people might get suspicious about how cheap this unit is compared to Aimpoint...well the thing is, Aimpoint's waterproof rating is much higher, whereas this device is only 1m underwater rating. Now...if you don't plan to leave your rifle on the bottom of the lake for 3 months for whatever reason...then...you don't care about it and no need to overpay 4x. Because everything else in this sight works well.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Let me preface my review by stating that I'm a novice when it comes to any kind of Optics. I've shot Pistols my whole life and only got into the AR game a year ago. Figured better by one now, before some Democrat does a mandatory confiscation! Anyhow, spent the first year with my AR shooting Irons only. Had great success, and got comfortable with my firearm. Being new to this i couldn't decide what type of Optic to purchase. Ultimately decided a Red Dot would be a good starting point, and I can always by a magnified scope down the road. I zeroed this in, on my 50yd range. Keep in mind the MOA adjustments on this are 0.5. Took some time, but I was quite impressed with my final grouping! Maybe ignorance is bliss, but this feels like a solid product, and after one outing at the range I'm feeling happy with my purchase. I'm looking forward to many great day's at the range. In my opinion for the money, this was a no brainer!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I have this optic on an AR15, and it has worked very well. I mounted this optic with an American Defense QD mount so that it can be easily removed and put back. I have sighted the optic and shot it on several occasions to find it holds zero well. I have even removed the optic using the QD mount, and when I put it back on the rifle, it is still zeroed. I have shot about 300-400 rounds so far. After 1000 rounds and 6 months to a year without a failure I'll trust my life with it, but for now I'm still in "test mode." PROS: 1. PRICE / value ... this is a great optic at a great price! 2. MOTAC (motion activated illumination) ... saves my battery, but works when I need it 3. Good co-witness with my BUIS 4. clear glass CONS: 1. I can sometimes see 2 dots. The two are close together, but I do have to choose one of the dots at distance in order to make consistent hits. 2. small (20mm) aperture ... this size is probably standard, but I have a Trijicon MRO with a large aperture that makes it really easy to acquire your target.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Best reflex sight for the money!
review_text: Just received my Romeo 5 optic and I was very impressed upon unboxing. Seriously best in-class packaging from Sig from the printing on the box, to how everything is packaged on the inside. Mine already came mounted on the high rise block which was perfect for me as I wanted to co-witness with my Magpul pop-up sights and front sight post. Since my irons are already dialed in I was curious to see how far off this little reflex sight would be. I only had to make very minor adjustments for windage and elevation was spot-on! The .5 MOA adjustments are firm with a nice click that let's you know when you've engaged them - using the caps as a tool for sight adjustment is brilliant and like the low profile lens covers. I can't wait to use this at the range and there are a few impressive abuse tests on YouTube that you should check out if you're worried about durability. All-in, very impressed so far - I will update this review after my range trip.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I bought this to replace a cheaper one I had purchased a month ago. I couldn't be happier. 1 trip to the range proved the value. Stupid easy to use and install. In full sun still easy to see. I can't speak to the battery life yet since it has been only a week but the person who recommended it to me has had the sight installed for roughly 9 months without having to change the batter and frequent trips to the range. If you're looking at cheaper alternatives I would say wait save up a little more and get this. The 50 dollar alternatives do not cut it. The only complaint I have is there are no alternative colors for the red dot or configuration. But it simply works, and works well, so there is the trade.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I have a couple of these now and I have no complaints considering the price point. The auto turn on/off feature is great and is easy to turn off if you don't like it. I also like how you can hold either button to turn it on where most red dots you have to hold a certain button. It has a solid mount and holds zero perfect. I am usually a huge vortex fan but don't feel like spending $150-250 for all of my red dots. All in all you can't go wrong with the Romeo 5. SmooterMcGavin gives it two thumbs up

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Lens coating prevents using a red laser bore-sight...
review_text: First of all, I haven't actually gotten a chance to shoot with this yet, so I will update my review accordingly when I do. That being said, I have a few observations already: Overall fit, finish and feel are fantastic, as expected from Sig. The front lens coating prevents using a red laser bore-sight to sight in...the lens coating is a notch filter somewhere in the 650nm range, which filters out specific wavelengths of light, so that the red-dot from this sight always pops out against any target (i.e. even a red one)...so, if you want to bore-sight it, you will need to use a green laser. I was able to do a rough bore-sighting in my garage in nearly pitch black with this sight on one of the lowest settings against the inside of my garage door, which is white. In just about any other environment, it would be impossible. I think the pros outweigh the cons on this feature, so I'm not really complaining...just a word of caution for someone looking to purchase a new bore sight...go ahead and upgrade to green...I wish I had! I think I will miss the cross hairs from my previous reflex sight, but I upgraded to this prism (tube) sight because I couldn't keep any reflex (open) sight that I used zeroed. The adjustment mechanism in most reflex sights adjust the mount, whereas this adjusts the internal light source (I believe), which should be easier to keep zeroed. Also, no set screw is needed and the detents/clickers on the adjustment screws provide solid tactile feedback so you know when you've made an adjustment. Also the adjuster caps double as a screwdriver, so no tools required to make field adjustments. Win. Lastly, the motion sensing feature is awesome...no more worrying about forgetting to turn off the sight and having a dead battery when you pull it out of the safe...it seems to have about a 2-minute turn-off delay if you set it down or remain motionless, and the slightest tap will fire it back up again. The only problem with this that I can see is if you keep it in your car, it would always be on while you are driving...so turning it off is still a good idea. My only complaint is that it doesn't have flip-up lens caps...the bikini caps protect well, but aren't really convenient, and have to be aligned to a specific clocking to seat properly.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: This is the second Romeo5 red dot that I have purchased. First the seller...delivered on time in the original packaging. This red dot has several really nifty features. First, it comes with a low base plate or an optional "see through" riser mount. The first rifle I mounted this to is a Ruger 10/22 and has the low base plate which gives an almost zero paralax. The second rifle is the Ruger PC and it has the see through riser that allows viewing either the red dot or the actual iron sights. Beyond all this, even with the battery installed, it "sleeps" after it is motionless for a while, and immediately comes on when you touch the gun. Very cool for longer battery life and always being at the ready. Just my experience, your mileage may vary.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Having recently purchased an AR I wanted to put a good optic on it. I did a lot of research on red dot optics having already had ARs with tactical scopes, EO Techs,etc. and I wanted a red dot for fast acquisition of targets, repeated accuracy, durability, and battery life. I decided to jump on the Romeo 05 , especially at the price it was selling for. I am more than happy with my buy! This is a deal nobody should pass up if they are in the market for a quality red dot sight. I'll gladly pass on the Aimpoints,etc; they're great but why pay hundreds more when you can get this SIg optic at such a great deal. I put this on my rifle, cowitnessed it with my back up irons and headed to the range. THe damn thing was dead on from the get go! I've read some negative reviews from folks saying they received theirs and finish was flaking off, it wouldn't turn on , the Motac feature didn't work,etc,etc. If you read the instruction manual first it might help a little. The only thing the manual left out was that you must press the (+) button for 3-4 seconds to activate the red dot. All in all a great product for the money!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: This is the first "high quality" red dot sight I've bought. I got it after seeing a Youtube video where it was put through extensive abuse - dropped onto various hard surfaces, submerged, frozen, even shot with a shotgun - and not only survived but continued to work. At the range, the automatic brightness of the dot was fine. It did halo a bit - but I believe that's due to the peculiarities of my vision and astigmatism. Windage was pretty much on but it did shoot very low at 7-10 yards. I was surprised at how much elevation I had to crank in to bring it up - more than 2 full revolutions. Once it was in, though, it delivered very good groups if I did my part - but then, that's always the catch, isn't it? Again, the elevation may be due to me - the way I hold, etc. Adjustments were easy with the turret caps set up to make them so you don't even need a screwdriver. The Holosun 507c I recently put on a pistol gave me the exact same problem with elevation. Pros - the durability, the 2 MOA dot, the brightness, the MOTAC auto on/off feature, the ease of adjustment. Cons - not really a con but it would be nice if it had a QD mount. I mounted a pair of Magpul BUIS and they co-witness fine but if you have to use them, it's always nice to get the red dot completely out of the way. There are cheaper alternatives on Amazon that claim basically the same features - they even have high reviews - but with SIG you have a known quantity and quality.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: I’ll probably never buy another Aimpoint.
review_text: I own 4 Holosun dot sights and two Aimpoints. The Holosun units are a great alternative to Aimpoint, and typically come in a little under $200.
