The Aimpoints are significantly more expensive. Generally speaking, the Aimpoints are a tad bit clearer and the dot is a bit sharper, but I can buy two Holosun units for the price of the cheapest Aimpoint. Then I come across this Sig Romeo for a tad over $100. Looks cool, has the long battery life like the others I mentioned, so I grabbed one. Turns out, this sight is incredible for the money. It’s on par with the newer Holosuns in terms of glass clarity and very close to Aimpoint clarity. No tint to the glass, dot is crisp, etc. Comparing all the parts/finshes, the packaging and everything else, I have a strong feeling these sights are manufactured by Holosun to Sig’s specifications...which is a good thing, in my opinion. To get anything even a little bit better than this Sig Romeo5 site, I would have to buy an Aimpoint at roughly four times the cost...and ultimately I would end up with a sight that I’d guess is only 10-15% better in terms of clarity. For my money, I just can’t see the benefit of spending $450+ on a non magnified optic, when I get 85-90% of the performance for 1/4 the cost. As far as other $100~ red dots go, I’ve tried a number of them over the years and not one of them was good enough to keep. The Vortex Sparc is one of them that’s popular, but I thought it was total garbage (short battery life, tinted glass, cheap looking finish, slightly fuzzy dot) and I paid $199 for it. Anyways - for my money, it’s going to be Holosun or Sig Sauer Romeo Red Dots from now on. Aimpoint makes a great sight and I enjoy the two I own, but with Holosun and Sig as tried and true, proven alternatives, I can’t justify the added cost any longer.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Mounted this to a IWI Tavor X95 in 5.56 NATO. Included riser is a perfect co-witness to the Tavor's flip-up iron sights - didn't have to shop around trying to find the right riser - it came with the unit. The unit is very compact, performs perfectly and even looks great mounted on the rifle. Multiple brightness settings are all crisp. Easy to change battery without removing the unit. Nice motion sensing feature powers on the sight. Sig optics are lifetime guaranteed - what a great price ($125) for an outstanding product. I've never mounted an optic to any of my handguns, but I'm considering doing so with this one. Buy it!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Like everyone else I love it!!!
review_text: Of course I had seen all the reviews praising the Romeo5 but I just didnt like it even though I had never even seen one in person. Well after buying a new FM9 9mm PCC I decided to try the Romeo5. Its absolutely great!! The 2MOA dot is the perfect size. Years ago I had to have metal splinter removed from my eye and due to the splinter being in there for 2 days it had produced a rust ring which had to be drilled out. This mar on my eye, plus old age, causes stuff to blur at close range and my 20/20 vision has been reduced to the point where I cant read a book without reading glasses, which I absolutely hate (Thank goodness for Kindle on a 55" TV). Well due to the fact I dont have to be right on top of the Romeo5 to see the dot, I get no blurring. All in its a great sight and I most definitely would recommend it to my friends.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: It's really sensitive and doesn't wander at all, so far
review_text: I'm a newbie for Sig Sauer or any other electronic sight, but I couldn't help but be appreciative of the battery longevity right along with the extreme sensitivity to 'motion-turn-on function'. That, from my lifelong experience with the testing business (Army Research Lab) convinced me that there was NO WAY you're going to pick up this gun/sight without turning on this motion-sensitive sight. It was unbelievable how sensitive it was. So, I played around with that for quite a while, and the visibility of the red dot was very good to my eyes, seemingly SET upon adjustment, and the overall conclusion (so far) is that I'm very satisfied with it. I've yet to evaluate the higher mount in conjunction with the iron sights on my 10/22 which I want to 'see' yet....I'm still already happy with it.....as a layman, of course......mjm

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: The best entry level red dot, period.
review_text: If you are looking for a high quality red dot that isn't $200+ dollars, look no further. The Romeo 5 is by far the best value red dot on the market and I would trust my life with it. The dot is crisp and perfectly visible in bright sunlight, has a 50,000 hour battery life, the controls are simple to use and it is easy to sight in on your firearm. As for durability, this optics can withstand being dropped from 10+ feet multiple times, left in a bucket of water for 24+ hours, be frozen solid, and even get shot with a shotgun and still function (watch Alabama Arsenal's review on YouTube if you don't believe me). The Romeo 5 features a motion activated setting that allows you to quickly pick up your gun and be ready to go if you ever need to use it in a situation where you don't have the time to turn on your optic. Overall I highly recommend it if you''re in the market for a red dot that won't cost you an arm and a leg.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: So first, I purchased this red dot because it was cheap. I have an AK that ive shot maybe twice for a total of 20-30 rounds. My plan was to put an optic on it so I could run for a while since I got a ton of 762x39. I have a number of holosuns and wanted something different and didn’t feel like breaking the bank on an Aimpoint so the Romeo 5 fit the bill. I took it to the range and was having issues matching up the sights with the red dot and still hitting zero when I noticed the sights on my AK are slightly canted making my groups hit about 8 inches to the left of the point of aim at 100 yards. Of course Arsenal doesn’t want to own up to it without me paying to ship it and fix it. I told them no thanks. Since then I’ve run maybe 1200 rounds through it and bypass the iron sights. No POI shift, flickering or anything. Last weekend I put it on a Stribog and once again it worked fine. I’ve hd it a few months now and have not turned it off. I keep it set around the mid brightness level. What I really like about this optic is that it comes with two mounts. So far I’ve been running the low mount exclusively but it’s nice to know I have the tall one as well in case I run it on something else. As for the negatives… I don’t find it particularly attractive as the logo is a little on the large size. In addition the front lense is very reflective which gives the optic just a little bit of tint. It’s not a huge issue but at dusk it is a bit darker than a holosun or T1. Otherwise I think think this optic is a great value for what it is. I don’t anticipate taking this thing into battle anywhere so I don’t need something crazy durable as it’s durable enough with me bumping it around when I run drills. If I need a battle ready optic I’ll run an Aimpoint or eotech but for range trips and drills and normal stuff it’s just fine.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Maybe better than Holosun 403b? Good nonetheless.
review_text: I recently took the plunge from "budget" (see 30 dollar Chinese made "red dots") to these "entry level" (still Chinese made, unfortunately) red dots. I have 2 holosun 403bs and now a Sig Romeo 5. I like the Sig slightly more but both models are vastly superior to the 30 dollar sights I was using. Pros for the Sig.. I like that the MOTAC cuts the sight off after 120 seconds. VS 1 hour for Holosun (on it's lowest setting). The dot on the Sig seems more precise to me even in bright settings. It's by a slim margin, but it does appear more defined and concise to me (which should obviously translate into better shot placement). CONS. Even with the MOTAC cutting the sight off much sooner than Holosun, SIG claims a 10000 hour inferior runtime, but that still translates into 4 and a half years of constant runtime. The SIG weighs about an ounce more. They both fluctuate price some but right now I'm able to get the Holosun for about 15 bucks less. Other than that, either choice should be great for low cost optic options.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Best Red Dot for The Price!!
review_text: I shop around excessively when looking for something like this. I read reviews and compare and labor over it for days. It has become a hobby in itself. When I decided on this optic, I was down to two choices and this one won out. It came in a very nice box, with easy instructions and a great warranty. The two mount options included were a huge bonus as I didn't have to order anything else to get started. I used the taller mount on my M&P 15-22 Sport and can cowitness with the Magpul iron sights no problem. I sighted it in quickly at the range and had great accuracy, even with cheap rimfire ammo. Adjustable brightness is nice. I lowered it so the dot was smaller.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Best RDS for the money, period!
review_text: This is my second Romeo 5. I was considering a "low budget, high value" RDS for my AR pistol build and was looking at AT3, Bushnell, and Holosun. When this red dot popped up at $120 on Amazon, I bought it right away. I could have bought a less expensive red dot, but for the value, this is the best RDS on the market. It's durable, accurate, holds a mean zero, the red dot is extremely crisp at various brightness levels and the auto on/off function is worth it's weight in gold. Plus, a lifetime warranty from Sig Sauer....come on. I've absolutely put my Romeo through the perverbial ringer with water, weather, rounds and overall poor handling on my part. It sits in my truck with no constraint and has the marks to prove it, but I've never had to re-sight for zero, it just keeps driving tacks wherever I put the red dot. If you're considering a RDS that has functionality and durability well beyond what you pay for (value) this is definitely the RDS for you. Yes, you can buy far more expensive red dot sights, and I have, but you are getting the same functionality and durability for less than half to three times what you'll pay for this baby. In my opinion, you can't go wrong with this RDS. Stop worrying and purchase the thing, you won't regret it!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I have several of these mounted on multiple firearms, and love them. It will Co Witness with Mag Pul pop up sites for backup. If you're looking for a close up red dot, this is it, but if you want magnification buy a 1X4 or 1X6 scope. A red dot with a magnifier is STUPID! SEMPER FI.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Needed a new red dot for a new build. This looked good and the price was a little higher than some but not too high to be off putting. This exceeded my expectations. It's small, mounted right up and co-witnessed with my flip up sights without using the included additional mount. It comes with everything you need to put it on and use it. Without any adjustments it was on paper first shot. The dot is clear and small and there are plenty of adjustments from dim to super bright.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Rated as good or better than more expensive competitors.
review_text: Outstanding red dot site. Bought for use on recently purchased Mossberg Scorpion ATI. IMO much easier/faster target acquisition in a broader range of light conditions than original sights. No need for on/off with MOTAC. Motion sensor turns on sight with any movement. Turn off after inactivetivity. Easy battery replacement without removal of sight. 40k to 50k hours battery life. Did a lot of research. Default zeroing almost perfect - tested with boresight. Appears to be best bang for buck Only rated 4 on accuracy because gear is so new it's seen no actual range time yet. Will update after live fire testing.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I absolutely love this red dot. There are several other brands that offer essentially this same thing but this is by far the best bang for your buck. Red dot is long lasting, of course that is due to the battery used, holds zero well, shake to wake feature, etc. I use this on my AR15 as a 45 degree sight and on a .22 and absolutely love the convenience, look and fit. This knocks Vortex's $150 equivalent completely out of the ball park. My favorite feature is the dim/ brightness buttons on top being digital rather than a dial and they are low profile.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: ALL BUYERS FUTURE AND PRESENT. PLEASE READ!!
review_text: I noticed my Sig Sauer Romeo 5 sight was constantly giving a starburst image. I tried turning the brightness image down to no avail. It was still a starburst?? (This problem is often experienced with people that have a lot of astigmatism. Glasses won't help!) Quite by accident, I discovered that I always had bright indoor lights or sunlight behind me. Once I turned around and faced a different direction, the starburst was gone!! Then I realized the problem. Light coming from the back of the aperture was the problem. NOT THE SIGHT! It's a great red dot sight that exceeded all my expectations. Hope this helps others.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: So good that I had to buy 2
review_text: Bought one at my local shop a couple months before I bought one on amazon because the local shop wasn't getting stock in fast enough. The first thing I noticed was when I first turned it on there was no dot. And then I remembered that the first 2 brightness settings are for night vision. Every setting above that it crisp and easy to find. The shake awake feature almost DARES you to try and sneak up on it. I've tried, and as soon as you touch whatever it is mounted on it wakes up and is ready to go. Also it holds zero great even after removing and remounting. And it is pretty durable too. There's some torture test videos on youtube about this specific optic and it survived beyond what the specs say it should......and still held zero. On a side note, comparing this to something from holosun makes me think they are made in the same factory or at least by the same design. Both are great optics for the price point.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Much better than my old Eotech
review_text: This is far better than my old Eotech... for a much lower price. My old Eotech was nice, felt almost like cheating when at the range. Big problem was battery life. Eotech ate batteries like mad. Half the time I turned it on, the screen would flicker - low battery. Sometimes it was soo dead it would not even come on. This was mounted to my duty AR.... not very reliable if I actually ever needed it. I switched over to this Romeo5 sight a few months ago.... awsome!!!! Perfect co-witness with irons. Set your brightness, adjust if you need if conditions change.... that's it!!!! No need to turn it off, it will auto shut down. If so much as a fly farts on it, its instantly back on at the brightness you left it. Also, because its LED vs laser, the battery will last way longer than Eotech. Add in the fact the unit auto shuts down, I expect the battery to last quiet a while. Would have gone thru at least another set of batteries in my Eotech by now. There is only one down side... this is a red dot, not a fancy crosshair like Eotech. Turns out I don't miss the fancy crosshairs. Just sight the red dot where you want a hole at 50 yards.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Fantastic, one of my favorite sights!
review_text: Love this! I have a EOTech which I love and I have to say this has the quality of EOTech! I put it on my KSG 12 and it holds zero with no problems!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Being right handed with a dominant left eye, it is now possible to shoot with both eyes open and no problems as far as sighting or shooting ! This is the best thing for me personally that I've came across.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Unboxing this, I really felt like I received quality. So when I first turned it on and seen that the dot was more of a cluster I thought something can't be right. I'm a newbie to red dot sights, but I heard mention of different eye types affecting how the dot looks. Soon into my online search I found a guy posting about having the same issue with every sight he had and sharing ways to tell if it's you or the sight. Easiest way was looking through a hole in a peice of paper which will lesson the distortion caused by astigmatism. Or do what I did and look through the small peep on your rear sight with cowitness setup. Sure enough when doing so it was a nice small crisp dot. Seems to me that those low star ratings complaining about the dot are people unaware of this.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: Best RDS for the price and even competes with more expensive RDS
review_text: I did extensive research before buying this dot sight. I checked out soecs and reviews from several other sites, as well as stress test videos on YouTube. When it arrived for me, I was excited like a kid in a candy shop. It came with simple, yet thorough instructions, the riser cowitness mount attached, a low profile mount in the box, a battery, lens cloth, lens covers, adjustment and mounting tool, all tucked neatly into sturdy foam. The elevation amd windage are extremely easy to adjust and what's really cool is that the screw on covers of the adjustment knobs can be turned over and usd to make the adjustments. The lenses are crystal clear and the dot is bright and round. It does starburst at higher settings indoors but that's easily avoidable. It has good field of view no matter where you mount it. I'm still geeking out about the motac. The only caveats or downsides to the sight, keeping the price in mind, is that the outter lens, towards target, is reflective when viewed from an angle, and this sight does have slight parallax. As long as you maintain your cheek weld, you'll be fine. I paid $170 on Amazon for mine.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: I would prefer flip down covers like the Aimpoint
review_text: Comes with the absolute co-witness mount (which I prefer) and a low mount. It uses the standard Aimpoint Micro mounting system, so any of those mounts will also work. Dot is crisp and bright, auto-on feature works as advertised, and it has held zero through some abuse. I would prefer flip down covers like the Aimpoint, but the bikini cover is quality and fits well.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: If you dont have one you're missing out!
review_text: Absolutely love this thing! Mounted on my Marlin 1895gs chambered in 45-70 govt with an American Defense T1 quick release mount. Holds up to the recoil and honestly i couldn't have picked a better optic and mount. The setup was zeroed in 4 rounds and after that i felt like i couldn't miss! I keyholed rounds between 50 and 100 yards all day. This sight didnt miss a beat and i will be buying more. I love Sig optics and they have yet to let me down and this one is worth every penny!!!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_header: MOTAC (or whatever they call it) is the business
review_text: It's on in a 10th of a second with ANY movement. It's so sensitive I can stomp on the floor next to a table my gun is lying on, and it will activate. The obvious advantage is you don't have to fool with it, you can just set-it-and-forget-it like iron sights. 2 minutes after you set the gun down, it's off again. That's nice, because you can go a solid 5 years between batteries. Plus it's as tough as my Aimpoint, which costs four times what I paid for this. Win-Win. UNLESS you mount this to a patrol gun that rolls around in a car all day. It will smoke your battery in record time. LEOs be warned. That's really the only disadvantage I could find, everything else about this optic is pretty wonderful.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: Best sub two hundred dollar micro red dot. I have this on an American Defense Micro Aimpoint mount. Clarity is on par with my Aimpoint H-1, its seems durable, and comes with both a lower 1/3 co-witness mount for AR-15's or low mount for an AK Ultimak Rail, etc. This is now my go to red dot when you need to get sights on your other weapons. I believe this red dot is reliable enough to put on your go to home defense rifle, and I would be confident on running it on my Patrol Rifle for duty.

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: This is an awesome optic for the price. I really like the auto on/off feature. It is really sensitive though. I'd image if you used this optic for a trunk gun, it would be on pretty much the entire time your car is moving. I keep the tool inside the grip on my MPX, but you can use the caps for windage and elevation adjustments. So far, it has held zero. Well worth it!

product_title: Sig Sauer SOR52001 Romeo5 1x20mm Compact 2 Moa Red Dot Sight, Black
review_text: I received this in the factory sealed box, and with the factory tamper proof seal in tact! The sight came boxed with the, Mounting key, Lens cloth, Battery, 2 mounts, lens cap, Instruction Sheet. This is a very nice sight, easy to mount, clear optics. Clearing up the misinformation about this sight. A few things that's important to know about the optic! (1) Read over the instruction sheet, don't just think you've had these types of sights before and you know how this one works and end up leaving bad reviews. (2) Yes! the sight has an auto off after 120 seconds of "No Motion" and auto motion ON so, yes if it stored in a vehicle the motion of it will keep the red dot illuminated and cause an unnecessary battery drain. If you've read the instruction sheet it informs you that the sight also an actual Power Off and Power On option, to use this option you only have to hold down on either the + or - button longer than 1 second, and the same thing to power it back on. (3) reports of the sight not working in MOST cases is caused from one of couple of things, when you first install the battery you will not be able to see the red dot until you turn up the brightness, so click the + button (Don't Hold It Down At First, Just Click It) 3 or 4 times if you still don't see the dot assume the sight is in its Powered Off Mode and push and hold either the + or the - button for 1-Second to actually turn the sight on, then click the + (plus) button a few times until the dot becomes bright enough to see. (4) Another possible problem that could happen is with installing the battery, mine had a safety peel off sticker that HAS to be removed, well due to certain conditions when you peel these off it leaves adhesive (glue) on the battery so its possible to leave enough as to cause a loss of battery contact. Make sure when you peel the sticker off from the battery that all the adhesive is cleaned off of the battery itself. _______________________________________________________________________ !Caution! the brightness adjustments in either direction ISN'T A PUSH & HOLD operation!!!!! its momentary CLICKS! That means that the brightness setting isn't a constant veritable, its in CLICKED STEPS! !Caution! holding down for more than one second on either the Plus or the Minus button actually turns the optic sight OFF (totally powering it down) meaning that just clicking the brightness buttons (Plus or Minus) will not do anything until the optic sight is "Turned Back On" Bottom line on the misinformation of this optic, its has some higher level electronics then the standard red dots, its not rocket science to understand, but its cause for a lot of these being returned and the reason for a lot of the low rated reviews. Its NOT only "Auto Powered Controlled" it can be Turned Off, and it can be done so by accident. PLEASE read over the instruction sheet FIRST before you box this sight up and return it, its quality enough to deserve that much attention. Bottom line on the optic sight itself. Let me make this clear! This review is from a 64 year old AR-15 (5.56 NATO) gun owner!! The sight responded well to adjustments! Seems to be holding ZERO very well with what ammo I've fired so far! It has very clear optics! Having the turret adjusting bits built onto the turret caps works very well! There is no issues with the quality or function of this sight that I can find, but I'm thinking that the same sight upgraded to the larger tube and lenses might be NICE! but it would be larger and it cost more! Very Nice for the money!

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: CVLIFE is my go to for weapon accessories
review_text: I own a lot of high end airsoft weapons, these weapons can support a wide range of accessories so I was looking for quality weapon accessories without spending the 300+$ it would cost to have a REAL weapon scope or laser, I have a CVLIFE scope, and just now the bipod, the bipod is great quality , very sturdy and the weapon fired well while prone, while this isn’t necessarily recommended for competitive shooting with a lot of movement , I feel this might break if dropped a few times, but it serves its main purpose and can be used in real firearms so far as you don’t mistreat the bipod

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I'll be honest. I was having some buyer's remorse shortly after purchasing this bi-pod, only because I expected to receive a product of garbage quality, but man... I was honestly surprised when I received this. I opened this up, mounted it to my little sibling's 22LR (which is whom I bought this for), and was REALLY surprised at how sturdy it was. I have a more expensive Harris bi-pod on my own set-up, and let me tell you, you would most likely not be able to tell the difference if you were handed these two blindfolded; the springs are great, the metal feels robust, the screws thread nicely, and the legs shoot out with a decent amount of force. I can't say that this is the PERFECT budget bi-pod that you can throw onto long-range, hunting, or competition rifles, but you can't go wrong with this item if you just plan on using it for plinking around at the range.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: THIS is the affordable bi-pod you've been looking for!!
review_text: I've never really thought I needed a by-pod to hit what I was aiming at. And for 50 years, I was right. NOW that I'm half way between 60 and 70, my hands shake a little to much to hold a steady bead. Well, before I put one of these on my AR's anyway. Now I'm putting lead down range and reliving the days of 1" groups at 100 yards. I love this bi-pod! I'll be ordering 2 more in a week or so because I'm tired of swapping them from the AR's to my Savage 93 .17HMR and Rugar 10\22. They are very adjustable and very stable even at the highest position. The fold flat enough to fit in the same bag as before so I don't have to look for a bigger bag. All in all, THIS is the affordable Bi-Pod you've been looking for.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Great bipod at a great price!
review_text: Works like a charm, and the adjustable legs are an added bonus. Fit my AR well and have had no issues with it coming loose after firing 150 + rounds. Installation was a little difficult, and I had to refer to YouTube for assistance. Once I figured it out, I had no issues. It even has mounting holes designed for sling attachment. The included instructions left a little to be desired, but overall I am pleased with this purchase. I would recommend this product wholeheartedly!

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I haven't shot w it yet. just to get that out of the way. but i bought this as a replacement for a broken foregrip that had spring loaded bipod legs. that was a piece of crap and didn't handle more than a couple basic range trips. so pathetic. so i got this and it seems to have a good build quality. and seems like it should be perfect for a range toy. at this price point i don't anticipate iraq war rugged reliability. but as long as it can handle regular trips to a simple range and maybe an occasional trip out into the bush, it should be fine. this things seems to be fitting the bill. will update after some range time w it. Update: Finally shot with it. It was stable and reliable. Still seems solid and in good shape. It's already lasted longer than the last cheapo product I had on there. I purchased a foregrip with extendable bipod legs that literally broke after the first range trip. This one's already beaten that. And I like it. It really seems like a good solid product and investment. I will say after the range trip, the set screw seemed to have loosened a little bit, but nothing a little locktite won't resolve.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: This bipod is great! It is sturdy yet light. I previously had a bipod that I bought at a gun show. This one weighs about half as much and is more stable. The legs are spring loaded and automatically extend out with the simple press of the button. The bipod is also very easy to install. Simply bolt on the holder the holder to the picatinny rail and remove the plastic insert on the actual bipod. The pin in the holder has a hole where the two pins on the bipod fit. Then just turn the knob on the bipod until it tight. It is very simple. There are several you tube videos which show it. Easily the best bipod I have ever owned and I own several.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Great price, works as it should, Love it!
review_text: This Bipod is hard to believe for the price! I haven't had a single problem with this unit. It mounts securely on the rounded forearms commonly found on hunting rifles. However, it doesn't mount very well when attached to the wide, flat bottomed forearm on bench-rest type stocks. I stand 6' 3" and I shoot from a sitting position at a bench. I've found that the 6-9" bipod works well for targets that are equal in elevation or down-hill from my shooting position. For me, the 6-9" height is simply too short for shooting uphill. These Bipods are priced well enough that I didn't hesitate to but the 9-13" version as well - Love it!

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: This one works great. Just as good as a Caldwell or Harris ...
review_text: I originally bought a different brand but returned it when the brackets that lock the legs in place were not working properly. This one works great. Just as good as a Caldwell or Harris at a fraction of the price. Once you move up to the swivel Harris model, it's a definite upgrade. But this one seems nearly as good as the non-swivel model. Harris feels to be made a little better, but I don't see either one of them breaking under normal usage conditions. Great value.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Great Portability; Perfect for my rimfires
review_text: This worked good enough with my Savage 22 Mag that I bought another to switch out between my A22 and Mark II. Through each of the 100-round sessions I've used them for, I have not had to make any re-adjustments or re-tighten any of the attachments. I can't comment on how they'd perform with heavier center-fire rifles, but for my 6-pounder 22s they work great. I deducted 2 stars because it arrived without any instructions whatsoever. Took me a few minutes to figure it out. Then I gave back one of those stars when I discovered how well it seated against the stock and also that this bipod can be attached to most any stud without the need for a permanent mount or adapter (which they include). Which means I can easily switch it out between different rifles.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Came with no instructions but it was easy to figure out. I used it on my killer instinct ripper 415. It mounts forward of the quiver mount on the rail, kind of hangs off the front of the rail a bit but no problem. It adjusts easy and is easy to level the bow side to side. I would recommend this to anyone, for the price it's bad ass!!!!

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I looked at several different bipods for my savage 10 and this was by far the best value. It works absolutely great, was very easy to install, and a great price. I will definitely buy some of their other size bipods and be confident in the quality of their products. I would definitely recommend their products to others. Note: This model does NOT swivel but they do have a 360 degree swivel model. Also keep in mind the size you might need for your specific reason for a bipod. This size works great for shooting from a table or stand but wouldn’t work so well for a larger person to use in a prone position. If you plan to use one in a prone position I would recommend buying it in the 9-13 inch size.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: So far so good! Great budget bipod!
review_text: I've had this bipod for about two years now and it has served me well. I'm admittedly not an expert on bipods, but quality wise it seems fine. I transfer it between rifles with some frequency and haven't run into any issues. Everything is still tight on it and works well. The legs are still solid and the spring system inside seems to work just fine. For less than $20 this is hard to beat. Are there better bipods out there? Certainly. Would this bipod survive in Fallujah? Probably not, but if you're just using your rifle for range shooting or hunting I think this bipod is more than adequate enough.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Pros: works for what it needs to do. Sturdy construction. not used a crazy amount, but looks like it will hold up over time. Cons: mount is a little fiddly, not bad, worth noting. Once on it is good to go. Thoughts: I'd buy it again.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: ... picked this up for my AR-15 and it's extremely sturdy and works great for keeping it balanced
review_text: I picked this up for my AR-15 and it's extremely sturdy and works great for keeping it balanced, when firing at the range. I would definitely recommend this.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Stable and sturdy Bi-Pod..excellent value under $22.00
review_text: This is my 2nd CVLife BiPod purchased via Amazon. This 2nd purchase is much better than the past Bipod purchased. This model is stable, no movement. Sturdy and moderate weight. Not heavy, not light. While these bipods are meant for tactical rifles, they serve the intended purpose very well for under $21.00. Keep in mind while many of us own tactical rifles in either .22lr. .223, 5.56, 308. 9mm etc. we don't apply tactical combat. We enjoy our tacticals and want them to look good, but also function with the accessories we place on them. This will do the job on .22lr and .223 or 5.56. Anythng else I suggest a better model. All in all, I was impressed and expect you would be too. Fits a 20mm Picatinny rail without any issues. Easy to install and remove. Enjoy your shooting.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I’m giving this 5 stars, but thought about 4, the only reason being it did not ship with installation instructions. I had to contact the seller, and to their credit, they responded in less than 24 hours with a PDF of the installation instructions. I could not figure out how to attach it to my rifle without the instructions. For the price, this is a very sturdy bipod, which I have mounted to a Winchester Model 7 in 270. You could easily spend many times more $ on a bipod, but this provides the stability you need to take an accurate shot. This 270 has quite a bit of recoil, but after firing a bunch of rounds, I feel pretty confident that this bipod is not going to move on me. I did need to make one simple modification - the posts on my strap are 5/32”; and the receiver for the posts on this bipod are 1/8”. So it was a simple matter to enlarge the holes with a 5/32”drill bit, and everything fits perfectly.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I have a friend with a Harris bipod like this and I really liked it, so I started to do research. After watching a youtube review on this CVLife bipod, I figured that it was worth a try at $16. So far I love it and it works great. Put this on a bolt action rifle and it's nice to have when setting in your sights, not to mention it's useful when cleaning after a trip to the range to hold the rifle up and in place. Amazing value for what you get and it's hard to believe that it's only $16. I highly recommend it.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: This is worth twice the money.
review_text: Wasn't sure about the brand but was pleasantly surprised at the quality, sturdiness of this unit. The extensions are spring loaded and snap crisply into LOCKED PLACE, The springs are strong and will hold the legs rattle free when folded. All at a GREAT price. Now own 3 of them. I have a Harris that cost $169. Is it better, um yes. Is it $139 better? UM NO. You won't be disappointed

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Can’t beat it for the price.
review_text: Can’t really complain at the price. I had to take a drill to the strap mounting holes. They were a touch too small to fit the pin through so a little drill work and it went through. Once it was installed (takes all of five minutes to install) it seems pretty sturdy. I don’t know how long it will last but it’s definitely not rattling around after the initial install. I’ll take it out for a few hunts and a session at the range and report back if it doesn’t last.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I chose this bipod because it offered good value for the money. Once I figured out how to mount and adjust it, it worked fine (A good set of instructions would be welcome! Thank goodness for YouTube!). It wasn't clear to me when I ordered it that I would need a mounting rail to attach it to my rifle (probably my oversight). After selecting one from UTG with a picatinny universal design, everything worked!

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Very well constructed and the price is fabulous
review_text: Was looking for a a rifle bipod to put on an mcx sig Sauer AR15 with a keymod attachment. So when I asked the gun store where I purchased my rifle from us than explained to me that the only one that he had was a Wilson bipod so he went and got it for me he than told me the cost with a very disappointed look on his face he than told me the price $300.00. I told no way than left the store and did my research on Amazon and came across this model for $19.00 checked out all the reviews and decided to purchase this one from cvlive very well constructed strong and not sorry that I purchased this brand anyone looking for a bipod but cvliv e you will not be disappointed

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Excellent product for the price...installation was simple...feels like it wouldn't take a lot of abuse but definitely gets the job done...and sure beats paying two or three times the price for something only marginally better. Update - 1 year and about 1000 rounds later it is still holding up great. The springs that assist in extending the legs have gotten a little sluggish, the legs don't pop out quite as forcefully as they originally did but that is negligible. I did lose a screw for a cross bar on the under side, probably caused by the high force of the 7.62x54r, but after removing the bar I have not noticed any change in performance. I have been so satisfied with this product that I just purchased a second one for my new .22lr.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: LOOKS GOOD! FINGERS CROSSED! Can't beat $$
review_text: This unit looks like a Harris or Caldwell and appears to have the same primary features. Unlike the more expensive units, this comes with a mounting adaptor to attach to a Picatinny rail. if you don't have a traditional "sling stud". The unit's (sling stud) mounting apparatus is a little less "refined" / "foolproof" than the others. BUT YOU CAN'T BEAT THIS PRICE and I'm looking forward to trying it out. I have not had a chance to check the weight against my Harris; but, if weight is an issue, you probably don't need a mounted bi-pod and should use shooting sticks instead.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I use mine for bench shooting support, and on the lowest setting it is every bit as sturdy as the Harris bipods I have bought for past rifles. For the price, there is no reason to pass this one up. It will mount directly to your sling swivel mount, but also comes with hardware for mounting on a picatinny rail. I'm really not sure how much more you can ask for at this price point

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: CHEAP but good enough for rimfires and AR15s in .223
review_text: This is a one-step-above barebones bipod. You can see dozens of similar models on Amazon. They are knock-offs of the Harris bipod but cost 70-80% less. Corners are cut to get to that price. Is it junk? It depends on what you use it for. I put in on a .22 rimfire rifle and it works FANTASTIC. I moved it to an M&P 15 AR15 and it works - but it was a bit of a hassle getting an acceptable adapter to hook it up to the hand guard. Not CVLife's fault. It comes with picatinny rail adapter but I haven't tested that. What's wrong with it? It's cheap. I mean it's not built robustly and i would expect you'd have trouble on rifles with a bigger recoil than an AR15 in .223. The screw that holds the bipod in place doesn't look like it would hold tight but it hasn't worked loose at all when I shoot with my .22 rimfire. I haven't used it as much on the AR15 but I test the tightness every magazine and it has stayed tight so far. Once I get another bipod I'll be able to leave this one on the AR15 for keeps and I'll put a dab of lock-tite on it to make sure it doesn't work loose. Yes, I like this well enough that I'm buying another one from CVLife. Installation might confuse you - watch a youtube video and you'll say "OH, OF COURSE - THAT'S SIMPLE" and it is simple, once you've seen it done. That would be for installation on a standard swivel attachment. If you're installing on an AR15 with the round Colt style hard guard you'll need an adapter. Trust Me. Spend a few bucks extra and get the Harris adapter (#5). It costs twice as much as the junk adapters you see online but it doesn't fall apart from something as simple as folding the legs of the bipod. The reason I say this is one-step-above-barebones is that you can adjust the length of the legs. Very handy, you'll need a lot of extension to keep the banana magazines of the AR15 from bumping the ground. If you haven't used a bipod before be prepared for a shocking increase in accuracy. Not as good as sandbags but a lot handier.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: You can get better, you can get lighter, you can get more stable but you will not get a better value. I used loctite on the threads once I decided how and where it will mount. ONE note I got this July 2017 and only now am reviewing it Aug 2019.. This is a value item but not perfect so make **SURE YOU mount it to a HIGH quality rail or rail attachment point ( not polymer ) Also some have said it will not work with a 30 round mag THEY ARE WRONG!!! see picture. fully extended there is zero issue with any 30 round mag. DONE

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Great price for a good mount
review_text: Great bipod. It came with the picatinny rail mount attachment.i am not a huge fan of how it hooks to the base but its effective. I would be concerned for it holding up in a combat environment as it relies on the base with a slit to be the threads for the screw to hold tension. If it were to warp or twist it would come loose. The springs for the legs are fair quality but needed a little oil to keep from sticking. The height appears to be adjustable in 1" increments and is kinda annoying to do so. However with where I mounted mine the full extension allows my magazine to not rub the ground or base under the riffle.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Most of my rifles with scope optics I have a bipod mounted on. Usually I am shooting long range and I don't mind laying in the mud snow or dirt when I go hunting. I also use them for sighting in. The CV life bipods work excellent. I was a little skeptical at first and figured I wouldn't be out much if is was junk... However I found them to be of great quality. They serve me well and I will probably buy a couple more in the future... I have owned the cheap ones and the expensive ones that you can find at your local outdoors store however these are really nice and functional and well built. Highly recommended

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Great bipod, saves you money for ammo
review_text: Mounted onto a Bergara BXR 10/22. Bipod looks great on the gun. Haven't used it in the field yet, but mount is very sturdy, yet doesn't add much weight to the rifle. I mounted to the swivel sling insert, but this also comes with the rail adapter. Don't spend 100's of dollars on a bipod, when this item does the job! Thank you, CVLife.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Works wonderfully on my Remington 710. The bipod feels sturdy despite having a single mounting point on the rifle [It mounts to your shoulder strap front bead] when tightened down it wont go anywhere, after a few dozen rounds and being re-positioned it shows no sign of coming loose. For a budget Bi-pod i would recamend this to anyone who is just getting into shooting or even a pro who needs a new bi-pod on the cheaper side. The Rubber boots on the legs do a good job at keeping the rifle from bouncing around when firing my 270 rounds down field, No clue how it will fair vs higher calibers.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Disclaimer: This is my first bipod, so I have no previous experience from which to draw. I ordered this for my Ruger PC Carbine. My buddy has an AR with an expensive bipod, and I enjoyed being able to sit down and shoot from a shooting table. Not knowing if I wanted one for my plinking gun, I figured I'd purchase a cheaper one. This one received good reviews, so I gave it a shot (no pun intended). This bipod is very well built, and it is extremely sturdy for me at all extension lengths. Granted, my Ruger's recoil isn't as violent as an AR, but for what I need it for, it's perfect. The only issue I had is that it did not come with any instructions. Since I'd never used a bipod before, it took me about ten minutes to figure out how everything went together. But, I'm a moron, so if I can figure it out, anyone can.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Don't let the low price fool you. This is a good bipod. It does come without instructions, but the assembly is pretty straight forward, thanks to the several reviews on this site that describes what you need to do to attach it to your rifle. Two points that helped me the most were to put the Allen wrench, supplied in the kit, inside the picatinny adapter so that the attachment post stays out of the adapter. The other main point is to turn the adjustment knob, under the bipod, so that the attachment pins are raised up out of the body of the bipod. This helps to separate the pins far enough to fit into the attachment post of the adapter. The bipod is well made, and the legs work well. I have a Ruger AR 556, and was able to attach a Magpul picatinny rail to the original handguard. I mounted the bipod so the legs fold forward, but either way should be fine, and can easily be changed if desired.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: It was a very goodbye for me.
review_text: Have you got a 450 and I needed to be able to stabilize my shots due to the length of the distance that I would be shooting. I saw the reviews looked at the price thought maybe this might be it. All I can say is yes it was definitely worth the money I love the way it mounted it folds up very nice and you're able to adjust each leg independently if you're on a awkward angle. I can see where this may not be for everyone however in my situation I'm normally shooting out of a deer blind and I need to raise it up just enough and being able to pivot it it's exactly what I was looking for. My accuracy and shooting went up dramatically and this was a very worthwhile investment.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Looks nice, works well great price...

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Unless you are familiar with this product you may do what I did. Return it because it comes with no directions at all. Will not mount to a sig sauer m400 tread without changing out the hand guard. Product seems sturdy enough but doesn't meet my needs. After doing research and learning that I needed an mlock adapter, I was able to easily mount the bipod and am very pleased. It's sturdy and functions perfectly. Glad I figured it out and didn't return it. My bad for being a newbie. Would highly recommend it.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I was pleasantly surprised to find the High Quality Materials and craftsmanship in a bipod of this price, it went together on my Barnett Whitetail II with no difficulty. It's solid (once I tightened it securely to the picatinny rail adapter) I highly suggest using Loctite Blue or Red on the tensioning threads for the rail adapter, I'm looking forward to Elk bow hunting season this year (I live in the Black Hills of Wyoming) I found this set up to be easily deployed and retracted, adjustment of the legs is nice as well- Thanks Amazon for another High Quality Product at an affordable price, quick shipping as well

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Whats's great about this bipod since it attaches to the rifle's ...
review_text: Whats's great about this bipod since it attaches to the rifle's sling swivel is that there is a sling swivel on the bottom of the bipod you can then attach your sling to after attaching the bipod to the rifle. Win-win. The Bipod didn't come with directions but the directions were posted on the amazon page as the last picture you can look at regarding the product and I saved it to my computer and used them to attach the bipod to my bolt-action rifle. Basically just unscrew the big screw till it's loose but still attached and push the two swivel connectors (that will end up attaching to your rifle's sling swivel) through the hole (remove the piece of plastic that connects the two swivel connectors) then with your fingers apply some pressure and keep them apart so they don't fall back through the hole again. Then line them up on each side of the sling swivel and start tightening up that big screw again. It will draw those swivel connectors in toward the rifle sling swivel and also brings up the bipod towards the rifle's stock. Make sure you get your fingers out of the way as you're tightening it up. Turn the screw till it can't turn anymore and your bipod should be attached fully.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Fits the rail perfect on my AR. I had a longer one but it added too much weight and just didn’t look right. Keep in mind however it only extends to 9” that’s not much. Sitting at a bench or laying prone on the ground it’s fine tho and it doesn’t add a lot of weight. Overall I’m satisfied if anything changes I’ll update my review.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Go ahead and buy it, you can't go wrong!
review_text: I bought my first one back in July. Ok, it's not the most robust Bipod you can own, but for the price it really can't be beat. Sure, you can buy the Harris for about $100 and from what I've seen it's beefier. But do you need it? I use this for benchrest shooting with .22lr and .223/.556 and it does the job just fine. I'm not going into combat with it. Here's something else to think about: the CVlife guys actually stand behind the product. One of the small tabs that secure it to the sling stud came off. I contacted the company to see if I could get just the replacement part, and they ended up sending me an entire brand new Bipod! No drama. You really can't ask for more than that at this price! So if you want a functional Bipod that is at least 8/10ths of the Harris for a fraction of the cost, coupled with great customer service, this is a no Brainer. Buy it, you can't go wrong! I bought a second myself.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Once I figured out how to attach the bipod to the swivel mount it went without a hitch. I questioned the strength of the mounting system, but it seems to be an industry standard and though not heavy duty ... is quite sturdy. My first experience with this mounting system and tjhere were no instructions with the product ... but not too difficult to figure out.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Best value bipod for tactical rifles and general target shooting
review_text: After watching a YouTube review video by "Twang and Bang", I decided to get this. It's almost a clone of a higher end product that costs over $100. For the price and features, this product can't be beat. I'm using this on a heavy barrel Voquartsen 22 LR (Ruger 10/22) with a heavy stainless steel barrel. What's great? This is easy to attach and comes with a rail adapter. I recommend mounting direct to your sling mount or buying a MLok sling mount to reduce the height. It's sturdy without being too heavy. I had no problem mounting this. I highly recommend watching the Twang and Bang video for some tips on making it more secure. I made a small drill indentation where the tension screw contacts the base plate, added a drop of blue Loktite, and added the zip tie as he recommended. The legs snap firmly into place. The biggest advantage is how the legs deploy. You can pull them out and they lock into one of the cut out leg rings. No more messing with spring legs and a tension screw trying to get the legs even. To retract, just push the button and push in. Note, I also recommend mounting the legs facing forward when collapsed. This lets you lean into the bipod when shooting without collapsing the legs. Why this isn't a $100 bipod: This does not have a front swivel for fine adjustments. If you are doing any precision shooting, you are going to want to buy the UTG or a premium bipod. Even the model this clones doesn't have the fine adjustment to level out your rifle. That being said, I'm shooting a 22 LR at 200 yards with this bipod and getting sub 2" groups. I would not recommend putting this on a lightweight rifle. There are some basic, ultralight bipods that are better for that usage. This is much better for tactical or target rifles. Also, I don't know if I'd want the added weight on a hunting rifle since I shoot offhand almost exclusively. If I was bench hunting or maybe out west, then this would be a good option. The legs are long enough for my, but check to see what you need for your shooting bench. I use additional sand bags as a base if I need to get up to shoulder height. Overall, I couldn't be happier. This was a significant step up from other bipods I've used, and is actually cheaper. I'm now considering ordering more for other rifles.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: For under $20 why wouldn’t you buy this!
review_text: So your still on the fence with pulling the trigger on buying this accessory for your rifle... ok let me start with the fact that if the commitment is under $20 you’re not running a huge risk. I decided to order this for my ar-22 just to fulfill my couriosity and let me assure this product exceeded my expectations. It is very sturdy and functional. If I paid more I’d still be pleased with my purchase. The install is simple and the usability is great. If you purchase I think you’re going to be pleasantly pleased and if not just what exactly were you expecting??? You could pay more but that said I’m just not sure what extra value you’d be getting.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Stop whatever you are doing and buy this bipod
review_text: It's $20. It feels like it's worth $80. It works like it's worth $80. Probably wont age like an $80 bipod, but I have it on my 22LR so I see it lasting many years. I'd buy it again.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Very happy with this bipod, especially for the price. I have this on my Spike Tactical ST15 and held up very well, although Ive only put about 100 rounds through with it on. Its a good looking bipod, with spring loaded legs that extend out to about 9 inches. With a 30 round magazine in and my stock extended, the magazine does not touch the ground sitting on the bipod. Seems to be pretty solid, although this decreases slightly the further you extend the legs out. That being said, I had no issues with it moving or flexing when I did shoot with it fully extended. I just found it to be a bit more stable with the legs on the lower levels. Time will tell how it holds up, but so far so good.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: Dead ringer for a Harris-- at one-fifth the cost
review_text: I wasn't sure what to expect of this bipod for the price, but I was happily surprised. After owning half a dozen Harris bipods over the years, I decided I didn't need to go fancy on my six-hundred dollar Remington 700 project rifle. The finish on the legs looks good, the buttons that release the spring-loaded legs have an affirmative feel, and the rubber feet are soft-enough so as not to mar whatever you're resting on. I will say that I ordered an inexpensive carbon fiber bipod the same time as this steel and aluminum one (only the tubes are really carbon fiber). It's called the XAegis Carbon Fiber 6"- 9" Rifle Bipod. For five dollars more, you get an even cleaner look, a little weight savings, and the addition of M-LOK and KeyMod adapters. If that's of interest to you, I'd spring five bucks for the extras. But if you're a traditionalist used to Harris, this CVLIFE will serve you well.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_header: No regrets. Good product and great price.
review_text: Excellent product. There is absolutely no reason I can see to spend the amount of money that companies like Harris want for a simple bipod set, when you have plenty of reasonably priced options that work just as well right here on Amazon. I bought this for my cousin's Savage .22 and its perfect for it. No functional problems to speak of at all to date. The springs that maintain the tension on each of the legs (to move them from their "up" position under the rifle barrel to their "open/deployed" position) are admittedly quite taut which can make their deployment a little loud if you do not maintain control of them as you bring them down, but I don't find that to be a detrimental failure by any means. The telescoping legs are easy to deploy and put away. Mounts easily to the forward sling swivel OR a rail because it comes with parts for either option... Overall this set does its job and does it well. Definitely gets my endorsement.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: This is a great addition to my riffle (AR15). I received it very fast , very easy to put on , very well made...I've put 500 rounds threw my riffle and it held up and did its job. And lets not forget about the price..what more could a gun person want..

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I bought this bi-pod for my S&W AR-10, which weighs 9+ lbs w/o mag or ammo or scope or muzzle break, etc, so it's a little heavy. Since this was my 1st bi-pod I didn't want to spend a lot of money until I found out what I really needed, so I decided to go cheap and this was less than $20. Well, it turned out to be made very well and meets all my needs for a table top bi-pod. So I am sticking w/ this, and I even just bought one for my son and his AR-15. I can't say if this is better than everything else out there, but I know it has everything I need, and therefore recommend this highly. My only negative comment is that the instructions are not that clear. Believe it or not, I needed to look on YouTube for instructions to join the base to the legs.

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: Price is great for those who need something for occasional use on a benchtop. Mine did not come with instructions, so if you are reading this, be sure to read further, and look at the pictures in the product photos for the two pages of instructions. If you know your way around mounts, then this is a straightforward installation. If this is your first time, then the bipod has jaws if your firearm has a mounting point for this bipod. Take a look at the rail adapter for the piece you should look for. If you do not have this mounting point and only have a bare rail, then you can use the included adapter to attach the bipod to the rail adapter. The bipod comes with a 'hose piece' placed between the jaws, and the only way to remove it is to loosen the adjuster on the bottom to allow the jaws to move forward to get the hose off. If you have the bipod adapter, then just get the jaws inbetween the holes and tighten. If not, use the adapter, and then rail mount it. Overall, the bipod works just fine. The feet are spring loaded with a tiny spring and they can be positioned at different heights. There are specific increments for the feet position, so if you are on uneven ground, you may not be level. Couple this with there not being any side to side movement, leads me to believe that it would work really well on a benchtop or other similar flat surface, but not as well in the field. It is certainly better than nothing at all though. My only fear is that the tightening screw (the one to tighten the bipod down to the firearm or the rail adapter) may strip at some point, as the threads seem pretty fine, and that the piece holding it on, I could not tell exactly what it is threading into. See pictures for what I mean. While nothing has happened to mine, I will see over time what happens. I plan on using a bunch of thread locker to make sure everything stays where I have it. The rail adapter is robust, and overall the finish is pretty decent for everything. For the cost though, I am happy with putting it on one of my inexpensive firearms. If anybody has any questions or needs more pictures, be sure to ask!

product_title: CVLIFE 6-9 Inches Picatinny Bipod Adjustable Spring Return with Picatinny Adapter
review_text: I looked at both the positive and negative reviews then compared features and prices. This bipod came out on top! It was easy to mount to my rail, with the included adapter. It seems very stable, so far. For the price, you can't go wrong!

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: If you're looking for a simple reflex site for a good deal and not sacrifice quality, this is it. I must say I was impressed with the materials/durability. I think the company selling these has gone through some changes, because some of the negative reviews I've seen had pics that the packaging and other things looked different. The packaging was great, with sturdy foam to keep it tight. It came with 2 batteries, a microfiber cloth, and 2 allen keys for adjusting. Super easy to mount, made for picatinny rail. There are red and green sights with several brightness levels, with crisp reticles. Just remember this is a reflex site and not meant to be a scope; so if it seems blurry, try keeping both eyes open and focus on your target and not the reticle itself. On the sight I received, the dial for adjusting the reticle would not turn. I didn't want to void any warranty, so I contacted the seller. They sent a brand new one out and did not even want the old one returned. The new one worked perfectly! Even better, I was able to (mostly) repair the old one and may try to use it still. I think some of the ultra powerful adhesive they use in assembly may have gotten on the bottom of the dial. Admittedly I have not yet been able to test fire with it yet and test any shifting/accuracy, so we will see.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: Feyachi is expanding their line of dot sights and my experience has found them to be concerened sellers providing more product than you pay for. Maybe not world class quality but good usable equipment at a friendly price point. I would buy from them again and am happy with them and their products For whatever reason I am unable to leave seller feedback for them so a tip of the hat to them and their product here. They deserve it.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was skeptical of this item's value, to say the least. However, having used it twice now, and fired at least a few hundred 9mm rounds while using it, I can honestly say that I am, so far, perfectly satisfied with its performance. I had to initially zero it at very close range (approx. 15'); but, once that was done, I moved back to 50' and it held a near perfect zero. All the adjustments (windage and elevation) held tight and worked as they were intended. Be sure to keep the mounting screws secure, and I'm fairly certain you will be pleased with this product. BTW, I am also using the Fireclub Universal scope mount, so my scope is not directly attached to my HK frame. It also is just high enough so that I can co-witness below the sight. I'm happy at about a tenth the cost of most other similar sights. OK, now, a few weeks later and a few more range outings; I continue to feel that this sight is a good value. I do have one new negative comment however, and that is that it is not holding the zero from one outing to the next. That is not necessarily a big deal as I am only doing casual range shooting; and it doesn't take that long to re-zero. However, I also have a slide mounted sight on another pistol and it never needs to be rezeroed; but then again, it cost well over 10X as much as this Feyachi....

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: This went on my Browning Buckmark Target 5.5 .22 pistol. It took some normal sighting in procedures but it did so with expected results. I haven't used it other than sighting in and went through 6 mags of Winchester ammo, very happy with end results. I may update after a full day at the range but so far, so good. I had tried one other holographic sight on this gun and it wasn't worth a dime as it constantly shot all other the target. I won't mention the brand as it may have been one that shouldn't have got pass QC at the plant.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: Solid build quality, all metal, everything can be tightened down, doesn't wiggle anywhere. Holds a zero well, adjustments are so easy that if you're clever you can adjust it while you look down the sight. I zeroed this using a bore laser, and once that was done, I found that the center of the reticle barely moved off the bore sight dot at all as I looked through the sight off-center. That means this sight has fairly low parallax, and for the price point, I'm impressed by how low it is. It comes in a very nice box, with a nice plastic cover for the sight itself I promptly lost within a day, every wrench it needs, a microfiber cloth, and a basic manual. Selecting between four reticles and five settings each of two colors makes for some definite cool factor, overall, I highly recommend this sight. Overall, I can't think of a single thing I don't like.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: I bought this for my HK416 .22 lr. It worked great setting up and zeroing in. However, the locking screw was stripped and woukd not work. I contacted Feyachi (through Amazon messaging) and what a pleasant surprise! The person who contacted me was apologetic and very nice. They sent me a new scope which I received two days after that. I could not be more pleased with Feyachi. I would recommend them highly.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: It is all metal which shocked me given the price. It has both green and Red for the settings. The sight pictures are good and clear and bright. The cross hairs can look slightly blurry if you do not hold it right but I did not notice any issues as long as I held my paint ball gun correctly. I was also pleasantly surprised to see that it came with an extra battery and a cleaning cloth for the lens. Simply a great sight for the money.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_header: Works Well, Can't beat the value
review_text: This sight came with two batteries and it works perfectly for my P90 airsoft rifle by Cybergun. It took a little fiddling to get the elevation zeroed in because the barrel is pretty far below the scope (about 4.75 inches). I can now hit a small target with precision from 50ft, I haven't tested it out on 50-150ft range yet which is where I will be using it most. Pros: Price, It actually doesn't feel cheap when taking it out of the box. It was nicely packaged and came with everything you need to put it to good use and take care of it. The variable brightness of the reticules really helps. The different reticules all look good. I can't wait to use this in a close to mid range airsoft game! Cons: The Shipping (amazon's fault) had no bubble wrap or paper to keep the scope's box from banging around inside the rather large box. I was kind of disappointed in that. There are better scopes out there.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_header: Great scope if you plan on rough housing your gun
review_text: 16.99 and it works. 5 stars because obviously its made cheap but i bought this expecting it to break. Great scope if you plan on rough housing your gun. Came with two batteries. Now that's a homie hook up. The lense on this is completely clear which is great for low light situations.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: I have a Tasco Red Dot on my Ruger 10/22, and like it a lot, but I found this while looking got something to put on my new PC-9. I've had it out several times now, and put about 150 rounds through the rifle, and this sight is performing very well. Everything is still tight and solid, though the PC-9 has a more kick than a .22 or air rifle would have. At this price, this thing is a steal. I wrote this 2 months ago, and it somehow didn't get posted. In the interim, I got another of these for my 10/22 (the Tasco went bad), and it works just as well on that. Feyachi sent me a message saying the sight may be blurry at first, but to let it warm up for several minutes the first time. I did not experience this, but it was nice to know. For the price, this thing cannot be beaten.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_header: better than i would have expected so i got a second one.
review_text: i originally got one to put on an air soft gun when i started playing that with my nieces and nephews but decided to slap it on my AKM whew i got a scope rail to put on it. i originally slapped it on as a joke and was surprised when it not only was fairly close on already but held zero. i ended up shooting a good 6 mags of 7.62-39 that day and it held zero the entire time. i even purposefully dropped the rifle on the redot first of the sentiment and it still held zero shockingly enough. "don't worry the AK was unharmed i wrapped everything but the red dot in a hoody". so i have bought another because it has infact held up better than more expensive one i have bought. though it is still not as nice as an eo-tech but hey those are 13 times the price.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_header: THE FEYACHI REFLEX SIGHT IS IDENTICAL TO ONES OTHERS ARE SELLING FOR $50 OR MORE... WHY SPEND MORE?
review_text: The Feyachi reflex sight is the BEST dollar buy @$26.99 for anyone looking for this type of reflex sight. Compare the appearance, dimensions and specs - all of the offerings for this reflex sight design are made in China, and they are identical right down to the cheap "Star-Bully" CR2032 batteries. DO NOT MISUNDERSTAND, being made in China is NOT a deal breaker. The overall quality is VERY good, the reticle images are CLEAR and BRIGHT, and fine tuning impact adjustments are easily made. THOSE are the qualities that make a good reflex sight! And don't be mislead by phrases like "veteran-owned company" - they DO NOT MAKE the reflex sights, they just import and sell them, with varying levels of support from seller to seller. It'$ your $$, $o $pend it any way you wi$h, but do $o with your eye$ open. Feyachi is as good as any in the under $70 range.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_header: You WILL NOT find a better sight at the price point!
review_text: For the price, you cannot find a better sight!!! Mounting is solid and reticle are BRIGHT! Comes with 2 batteries and a nice dust cover to keep your glass clean! Also comes with allen wrench for mounting and windage/elevation adjustments. Other buyers have stated that the glass has fallen out, but in have put a lot of pressure and jarring on the glass and it DOES NOT MOVE!

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: My Feyachi sight arrived on time, very easy to install. I have it on a SW22 Victory pistol. I mentioned pistol because it wasn’t clear in product description or reviews if it would work, most seemed to have it on rifles. Anyway, took me about 20 rounds to zero it in and it seems great. Definitely nicer then iron sights! After two sessions of 100 plus rounds it still stays adjusted/accurate. Seems to be a good value so far.

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_text: This Reflex Sight has proved to be one of the best buys I have made for Optics! It was simple to mount, came with the tools needed to do so and two batteries were provided!! Multiple sight windows, two colors to choose from and several power levels makes this a great buy! If you were considering getting a reflex scope but didn't want to invest heavily this will be the deal for you with high end results!!

product_title: Feyachi Reflex Sight - Adjustable Reticle (4 Styles) Both Red and Green in one Sight!
review_header: Nice value priced red / green dot.
review_text: I mounted this to my wifes Ruger Charger "10/22 pistol", the sight snugged to the rail without having to over-tighten it. WHAT I LIKED: While shooting at 25 yards I found the cross hair reticle to be quick to find in red and green, that reticle was just my personal preference.
