I also love that it locks for better storage.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_header: Love this more than I thought I would
review_text: I am surprised at how much I like this product. I’ve been using straighteners for decades now, the idea of which has never seemed too challenging. Curling irons and, gasp, wavers, are way too complicated for a simple girl like me. I went outside my comfort zone and purchased this waver when a new haircut caused my naturally wavy hair to do some wonky things. Once you figure out how to position it so it doesn’t interrupt the wave pattern, it’s actually very easy to use. It also doesn’t take very long to do my whole head and it holds up well for entire day without any styling product. Definitely recommend!

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_header: great product and easy to use
review_text: I never seem to get good results with a curling iron - partly b/c I'm terribly uncoordinated. This tool is super simple to use and the waves look very natural. I do not twist the sections of hair before crimping them - as some reviewers suggested. I did followed some YouTube tutorial advice and when crimping the top front sections, I flip the tool and crimp the hair the other direction. For me the waves last two (maybe three) days so I'm exposing my hair to less heat than I would curling it daily. I do finish with a dry shampoo/texture spray for extra volume and I add hair oil to the ends for shine. I highly recommend trying this waver and at less than $30 it is priced well.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I love this waver! I was going for the look on the right but I do not use hair tools so I ended up getting what you see on the left, but I loved it! My fiance also thought it was beautiful, the waves also lasted 2 days, in Florida, which is saying something cause my hair does not hold, it's so long and heavy that curls fall out within just a few hours. But these waves still looked good the next day! If you're thinking about getting it do it! Btw my niece used it and she has more experience with hair tools and was able to get very deep beautiful beach waves.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: This little gadget absolutely rocks for shorter hair! My hair is pretty robust and can be hard to heat style, so I went into the waving iron maiden voyage with a very jaded heart. I was pleasantly surprised by the extremely successful and speedy results I achieved. It took all of 12 minutes to wave my hair, scrunch the crunch with some texture cream and slap a headband on. The Wave Artist gave me really defined deep waves that lasted the first half of a 12 hour split shift in a very busy nursing home. I’m not holding the fact that it pooped out by the end of the night against the styler, because nothing short of a miracle was surviving that particular poop parade. Even after my waves fell, I had a really cute piecey look with lots of volume and texture. I also noticed that this iron doesn’t give your hair the weird scorchy metallic smell some cheaper heat tools do. TLDR: Works well on moody hair, registered nurse proof style for 6 normal hours of work, hair still cute at hour 12 post poop parade, no weird scorch funk. 10/10, would recommend

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: The first picture is exactly how straight my hair is naturally, no workm or product put into it. And the other two are how amazing and mermaid-y my hair is after this waver! I use it with göt2b beach trippin texturizing spray after and it'll last two whole days. Which is astounding because curls typically come out immediately. And it's super easy to use. My only issues are that the temp control slide is in a weird place so it's very easy to accidentally up the temperature while using it. And the finger grip can be uncomfortable after using it for awhile.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I just received this yesterday. Before I go on, let me say I am a total spazz with hair. I have NEVER been able to work a curling iron without either burning myself or having hair sticking out of my head. I tried this last night on my work dirty hair and WOW did it look good. I did it the regular way and with a twist, and I liked both. I have a short bob of frizzy unruly hair, and with only a few minutes it looked like I had someone do it. I think that with some practice, I will be able to get my hair looking good all of the time. I have received nothing from Amazon or the manufacturer for this review. I am just a regular person in NYC with bad hair who is glad to finally find something I can use to make my hair look better! I would recommend everyone try this iron. So far, I haven't found anything about it I don't like.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: Firstly, my hair does not stay easily with styling and i have A LOT of hair. Hair stylist have always commented about the amount of hair i have... So nothing work well for a prolonged period of time, unless i use loads of hair spray. I bought this iron, and it works! I still used alot of hair spray and gel to keep it from coming out, but i was in the bathroom for maybe 30 minutes total styling my hair. Thats NOTHING! I did it the night before my bday dinner, slept on it and it mostly stayed until the next day. Granted the waves started falling out in the early afternoon, but im pretty confident that was due to the extreme heat and humidity we had that day (93 degrees with 80%+ humidity). So overall I'm happy and confident that this iron works well and that i will continue to use it on occasion (I literally never style my hair).

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I have smooth, straight hair...but I love curls! Always have! For me, perms are very damaging so this wave iron has been a dream come true! Using a regular curling iron, you pull the heat to the end of the hair and then roll up, which means the end of your hair stays IN the heat for a long period of time, again causing damage, but with this iron you start at the scalp and work your way down the hair. Heat is applied evenly throughout the entire length of hair...no damage! I have long hair and can do my whole head in about 15 minutes and it stays wavy for the whole day!! (I wash my hair daily so haven't ever tried longer) my ONLY complaint is that you need good hand/arm strength because there is no finger hold at the end of the heat element for your opposite hand to hold the wand closed. I suppose some people would 'lock' the irons closed on the hair, but that scares me. Otherwise, I am loving this curler! Easy to use, no bad smell, less damaging option to have curly hair!!

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_header: This is a great hair waver!
review_text: The pic attached shows my very first use of the waver. I didn’t do the best job, but I liked it. After couple of uses I got used to the waver and I love t now. The only thing I don’t like is that the heat setting “knob” is located exactly where you’re holding the waver when you’re all up in your waving business, and it can easily happen to change the heat settings without knowing. So I keep checking making sure it’s on the right setting all the time. It’s really no biggie, I noticed this on many hair products, especially with heat settings “knob”, but they should update that. The hair is really nice and silky when done. My hair stays wavy for about three days. Long enough for me! I should mention, I have really thin, fine hair. Hope this helps!

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I was skeptical about this but after some practice I love it. The waves last in my hair. The pictures are after wearing this hair style ALL day. Even day 2 my hair is still beach wavy. The only thing I dont like about it is you can't see the temperature your on. It goes from low to high. I try to keep it in the middle. Even so I'm glad my husband bought this for me.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_header: Easy, Fast and GREAT results - even the first time!
review_text: From the super straight hair that I was born with to natural looking volume and waves in 10 minutes! After reading lots of the reviews I was prepared to handle with care, make sure temp setting was where I wanted it and that I didn't engage the locking feature accidentally - I was so hoping to get the wavy hair of my dreams. This Bed Head Artist Deep Waiver does not disappoint! Really, it's super easy to use and gave me volume and waves that lasted until I shampooed 2 days later! The wavy pic is from the first time I used it, straight pic for reference as to how stick straight my hair is naturally. Made my messy bun look super natural and much thicker than normal too! As for the temp dial not having any numbers or other way to indicate the setting, I found my hair waved best with the dial in the middle - medium setting for best results for me. Love this tool! Get it, you won't be sorry.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: Love this product! It cuts my hair curling time in half when I use this. Waves hair and heats up very quickly!! It definitely does its job 👌🏽 My three cons of this awesome product are the following: -there’s no cover on the outside of the wave irons, so it’s very easy for even a grown woman like myself to burn myself when trying to put my hair in the iron or if I have it too close to my neck -it’s very large and bulky (part of the reason I’ve burnt myself before), so you can easily burn yourself. I also wouldn’t consider taking it on vacation unless I had a lot of room. -if you’re not very careful you can make your hair look crimped, not waved. Practice makes perfect, so angling the iron differently with each chunk of hair will give it more of a waved look. I also mix it up with an actual curling wand OR straightener (to make waves) every other layer of hair as to not have the crimped look. If the cons don’t make you hesitate, buy it! You won’t regret it 😊

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I very rarely find a hair tool that I immediately fall in love with. This tool is it. I have medium length hair and it's relatively thick. Typically my hair doesn't really hold curl too well. After 12 hours and sleeping I still have a really nice wave to my hair. It gives you a super cute wave. I feel so sassy!! It took me less than 10 minutes to do my whole head. I absolutely love it with a half up/down look. Gives tons of volume. I had been eyeing this waver for a while but couldn't bring myself to spend 30$ but I bought this as a black friday special for 17$. It is definitely worth the 30.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: After seeing this product demonstrated on youtube, I wanted to buy it. I ordered it and tried it right away. My hair is color treated and several inches past my shoulders. I sprayed a heat protectant on the hair, then sectioned it as not to place too much hair in the appliance at once. The appliance does get very hot, so you may need to experiment with your hair and timing a bit to obtain the type of waves you are seeking. I counted to about 10 each time and moved down the length of the section of hair leaving about an inch at the bottom. After I completed the whole head, I let sit for a few minutes. Then, I sprayed some hair spray on my fingers and raked them through the hair. Fantastic waves!

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I bought this because I was trying to create waves with my regular flat iron and although it's doable, this makes it way easier. My hair isn't very thick and is mostly straight. I also have a very short bob so I just press once in the middle (you don't want to get too close to the root otherwise it won't look very natural) and I'm done! I am legit done in no more than 5 minutes in the morning. I cannot speak for my boo's with the luscious thick locks lol so I'm not sure how that'll work for you but if it helps any I'm not even using this at full heat and my waves last the entire day. It looks even better the next day too! I just put a little dry shampoo in my roots the following day and I'm out. I don't even have to use it again. Love this!

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: This wasn’t what I had expected. I was hoping for deep elegant looking waves. This Gives you something more like beach-hair waves. But 5 stars because the waves lasted pretty well. I have long, thick hair. It took me about 15 - 20 mins to use this. I separated the top of my hair from the bottom, and then waved portions of it at a time. I did my hair at 330pm and at midnight my hair was still cute wavy. That’s pretty good because my curls usually don’t last longer than a couple hours before falling. Also, it’s a good price.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I really love the dramatic waves this gives my hair! I have long, full hair and it takes me approximately 25 to 30 minutes to do my hair with this iron. In order to get good results, you must only curl small portions of hair at a time. The curls stay in all day, and even into the next. However, if I actually brush through them, it turns into a huge frizz monster! I recommend spraying the freshly-curled hair with hairspray, and then finger combing after the spray has dried. The biggest downfall to this product is that it doesn’t come with anything to set it on. I have stone countertops and I’m afraid the heat will crack the stone. I had to steal a silicone oven mitt from the kitchen to place underneath of it. Overall, though, I really love my hair when curled with this.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: We bought this for our teenage daughter. She says that girls at her school braid their hair and then let it out to give it a crimped look. This basically does that, but without the weird kinks where the braids start/end. It took about 10 minutes to crimp all of her hair (and she has a lot). The plastic seems a little flimsy compared to the curling/flat irons I already have, but hopefully it holds up okay. I do like that there is a spot on the opposite side of the handle where you can hold it with your other hand. Using old-school crimpers when I was a kid, there was no features like that and we would constantly burn ourselves while holding the clamp shut. I really hope this holds up because it makes a super cute wave and is easy to use.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: So glad I didn’t pay $120 for the one at Sephora! My hair is thin and straight and it’s hard to find products to hold a style. You can’t beat the price and the waves stayed. First picture is when I did it (10min) and second is 5 hours later. No product put in my hair before. I read reviews before buying and some people said it burned their hair. It didn’t to mine and I had the setting on high...I counted to 5 for each wave so didn’t have to keep it on my hair long. If you have thick hair or longer hair the only concern is your hand may get tired from squeezing it shut.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: Thin, fine, short hair here! 🙋🏼‍♀️ I love this waver iron! My hair is so difficult and frizzes easily, and I've always had the type of hair that can hold a curl with minimal product use (I use an Enzo Milano 19mm curling rod iron if you're looking for a curling iron for my hair type lol), and I was nervous this iron wouldn't hold waves in my hair. But it does!!! They easily last 3 whole days, sleeping on it and everything! Minimal hair spray needed!!! And if you have hair like mine keep the heat setting low. I hold it for 8-10 seconds per strand and this is the outcome. Those reviews that call this bulky are just plain wrong. It's actually easy to hold and nothing as heavy or hard to hold up for a long time like other wavers that truly are bulky (and might not even hold a wave in your hair if your hair is like mine!). I love this hair tool! You'll love it too.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_header: Love it for short and long hair!
review_text: This works so well on my short/thin hair as well as my daughter’s longer/thick hair. I was worried it would give her too much volume, but it lays so pretty and she loves it. The temperature dial is just ok. It’s impossible to know how low or high the heat actually is by the dial setting alone, so before every use I turn it all the way down and then adjust as needed so I don’t fry my hair. I like the locking feature for storage but only use it when completely cooled. Comfortable to hold and fairly easy to get the waves in the correct placement as you go down the length of your hair.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: Ive always been a fan of crimps! I used to crimp my hair back in middle school. I was so excited to see them coming back in style. I saw a YouTube review on this iron and thought it would be perfect for me. Whew was I right. It’s so easy to use and it gets hot really quickly! Be careful though because it does get HOT. I love It. Great iron for the price!

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: Where has this been all my life! I’m in love! I have long, fine hair that doesn’t hold curl very well. It tends to be very straight and I always have it back in a pony or up in a messy bun because it has no volume. This wave iron gives it tons of body and volume. It’s like magic! This is all my hair—I do not have any extensions in.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: The media could not be loaded. I got this for my two daughters and myself and we have loved it. It gives you the big beach waves and add so much to the hairdo and it's super easy and quick. The key to using it is not to start in the same place so doesn't have that same wave that goes straight around the head.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: This was on the Treasure Truck yesterday for $16 (2/26/19). I read reviews where all these chicks be like "BUY THIS NAO!" and "This totally works on my super fine crap hair!" So I'm like, ok, I'll try it and it'll end up in my drawer of "I don't use these curling irons anymore because my hair don't hold jack". My super healthy (shiny) yet thin hair NEVER HOLDS A CURL! I can unload a bottle of hairspray during a curling session and it'll be flat before I'm even out the door...no joke! I got a perm for the first time in my life 3 yrs ago and it didn't take!!! I had straight hair again a month later. But I plugged in this baby and tried it out on my gross post-gym hair yesterday, just to see what happened before I showered, and it WORKED!!!! So I showered, actually blow-dried my hair (I never do that) just so I could REALLY try it out: I did my whole head, again, NO PRODUCTS AT ALL and here I am reporting back to you live, 24 hrs later, and I'm still flaunting my beach waves!!!! I have no idea how this thing got it's magical powers, but I HIGHLY recommend every woman own one! I would happily pay 4x the price I did, soooo worth it! OMG I can't believe I look like I belong in Cosmo magazine or something!

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I love this iron. Was Leary of reviews but went for it. Me. Super fine straight hair. No products ever. Wash and go. Did a test run yesterday, little tricky at first but took 20 minutes the first time. Woke up. Still had waves. My hair never held a curl ever before. Setting on at Midway. Hard to tell if her is moist or if ya accidentally slide it your hair smokes a bit. Today, it took less than 10 minutes I'm extremely pleased with this and Happy I bought this.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: Works like a charm. Love this look. I have Longggg hair so it took a minute.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: BUY IT NOW!! I absolutely love this for my hair! I usually use this tool on my hair On day 2 after washing! The waves last me 4 days!! All I use instead of hairspray is the Texturizing sea salt spray and my waves last perfectly! My hair actually doesn’t hold curls very well but this Wave Artist makes them last so long! I feel soooo Va Va Voom beautiful with the waves it gives me!!! Loooove

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I really love this waver. My hair is already wavy, curly but is can be crazy (as any curly headed person knows). I can use this for all over conformity to my waves, or just add a few kinks where it got smushed when I slept. The only thing I dislike is the location of the heat adjustment. It’s right on the handle right where you grip and it’s a ‘spinner’ knob - - no clicks- - so it’s really easy to accidentally change the temp without knowing. Other than that it’s Fabulous. The picture above is from the curls I did yesterday , I slept and haven’t TOuched my hair. (Didn’t even comb through with fingers ) and this is how it still looks. Unless we’re having a wet / rainy day, my hair will stay until I wash again, 3/4 days, with only a slight touch up if I’m going g somewhere snazzy. Also, if I want a little more craziness to my curls, I do some ‘upside’ down.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I'm always skeptical on new hair tools, as I've been burned many times (pun intended). However, I kept seeing posts about how great this tool is, so I bought it. I love it! My hair is to my waist and very thick and naturally curly, and it worked very well. it took me about 15 minutes to waive all my hair. The tool is light and has a comfortable grip. I use the highest heat setting and hold it on my hair for 5 seconds on each portion of the section of hair I'm working on. The waves can hold for days. The one trick is finding out how to style it the way you want, for the look you want. A great tip I learned is to flip the tool each time you use it on a section to alternate the way the waves face, it makes the waves look more natural! I highly recommend.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: I got this because I've always wanted that beachy, loose waves look. I'm not terribly skilled with a curling iron and this seemed easy enough to use. It's basically a crimper, so no need to twist the iron to use it. The hardest part is getting the back of your head, but since you don't need to be really precise with this, it isn't too bad. The first two pictures were taken right after I used the iron. It's a little too crimped looking for my taste. The second two are after I'd slept on them, taken the next day. I prefer the way it looks after having slept on my hair. The waves look more relaxed and natural. My hair does hold curl pretty well, but I feel like a curling iron wouldn't hold as well as this does. I don't use any product in my hair, and I use it on clean hair (I wash my hair every day). The waves last all through the next day until I shower again. Biggest complaint for this product is the temperature control dial. It isn't digital and there are no numbers on the dial, so you really don't know how hot it is. The placement of the dial is near where I grab the iron to use it, so sometimes my fingers probably rotate the dial on accident and change the temperature without meaning to. Small annoyance and could be designed better, but other than that, I'm really happy with my purchase.

product_title: Bed Head Wave Artist Ceramic Deep Hair Waver for Beachy Waves, Purple
review_text: The media could not be loaded. Me encantó la apariencia de las ondas que consigo con esta tenaza!!! En relación con su duración no lo sé porque solo la he usado una vez pero se ve resistente!

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I’ve always loved Magpul products but especially the bipods. I’m not a fan of the springs on other brands and the top of the line bipods are almost $300. This is a sleek design and it’s stable on most shooting surfaces. It only has two positions; up and down. But it’s short enough and extends enough that it fits most of the scenarios I would need it for. If I need the front of my rifle resting between open and closed I just use a sand sock or shooting bag. The butts on the bottom are a type of rubber that causes the rifle to bounce less than other bipods, or so I’ve noticed. Magpul makes great furniture and most of the time it’s pretty pricey but the quality is worth it for the money.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Whats not to love a Magpul
review_text: The legs ar3e for my new AR15 M-Lok handles. The leg are sturdy and feel very secure. Lock into place and button to release are also very secure. Feels like good quality legs and not filmsy at all -- good thing who wants the gun to give way when shooting. Very light weight. Now can they improve my shooting-- yet to be seen

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Perfect, works awesome with my AR-10. Very strong and sturdy, lightweight and easy to use. I couldn’t be happier, I recommend it constantly.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: A.R.M.S. 17S Style | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_header: The A.r.m.s. mount screws are included & hidden in bottom of packaging.
review_text: This bipod is amazing!!! I read a few reviews saying that the A.r.m.s. mount screws were not included so I ordered them too. After opening the bipod's packaging, I found a set of Magpul screws in the bottom packaging holes where the bipod's feet rest!!!

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I ordered this through Amazon’s other buying options link and found that it was $8 cheaper because it was used or the packaging was damaged. I knew I had amazon prime so if there were any damaged issues I can just return it. But the product looked new and it was fully functional with zero defects. I was impressed with the bipod. I will definitely trust amazon for future buys.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Low cost alternative for AR-15 platform rifle bipod
review_text: I want a bipod and the name brand was too expensive even though it can be easily removed when not needed. This bipod is more or less going to stay on all the time for me.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Black
review_text: I’m a complete n00b in long range shooting and sandbags weren’t working for me, so I wanted to try a bipod. The reviews for this made it a toss up, but I got it anyway for a Tikka T3x CTR in 6.5 Creedmoor. Super easy to install, and one of the two included mounts fit perfectly with no play. Aesthetically it’s also a perfect match for the gun. No problem with any of the functions, and I was able to set the cant exactly where I wanted it. You can do a little swivel and tilt to get on target, and what movement is there was not an issue for me. The instructions specify that that range of motion is intentional. Forward/backward movement was eliminated by loading, also without issue. I’m going to say that it’s really rock solid for a bipod, because it’s not intended to be a gun vise, and I think that’s where the contrary reviews are coming from. I would have no fear taking it into the field, and again, that’s as a newer shooter, so I’m with the 5 star people. Maybe a bigger gun wouldn’t do as well, but it’s definitely worth trying out.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: I bought this bipod with a little trepidation. Some customers reported that it is unstable. I installed it on my Savage .223 Rem. The stock is narrow so I used the narrow grip. It is rock solid. I have the option of loosening the pod to allow it to swivel should I desire that feature. It is smooth, strong and easy to use. I love the internal springs versus the older external spring systems. Best bipod I have ever owned.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Easy M-lok install. Easy to adjust and great stability. You can tighten or loosen it to adjust tension. It rotates side to side if you want and has some back and forth flex for shooting.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Black
review_text: Good looking bipod. Price could be a little better. Fits good and secure on my ruger American with the sling stud. I like that I can still add a sling while using the bipod. It looks way better than other bipods with the exposed springs.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Black
review_header: Sleek, snug, sturdy. Don’t listen to the bad reviews.
review_text: Fits snugly. Nice sleek design. Well made/sturdy. Tiny bit of play between legs and mount but mount to rifle point is super snug. I almost didn’t get this because of bad reviews but they’re wrong. I’m super happy. I’m sure the people who complain of wobbling aren’t mounting this correctly. I have tried it on 3 of my rifles, a wood stock, a synthetic and a laminate, and it fits snuggly on all three. It comes with 3 mounting plates for different stocks and I didn’t even try the other two.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: 1913 Picatinny Rail | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: I had some keyboard *operators* tell me that they didn't like this bipod. I'm glad I didn't listen to them. This product is simple, well constructed, and solid. Everything you've come to expect from Magpul.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I haven't had a chance to test this bipod out at the range yet, but if feel super sturdy and well built. It's no Atlas bipod but it gets the job done at fraction of the cost. I've been doing dry firing tests since I got the bipod and it's very robust. Ill be shooting a .308 so I know what to expect as this is not my first time at the rodeo.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: M-LOK | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_header: Definitely the choice of many well respected shooters
review_text: I noticed 98% of the reviews are at or above 3 star. Personally I am extremely happy with the value. Very happy to have a functional, durable, and well proven product. Lifelong rifleman and outdoors person. Verified purchase.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Very happy with this bipod. Purchased the m-lock version and it went on very easily. Anyone complaining about it moving around needs to learn how to tighten the thing. That was the biggest complaint I read about. And I don’t see why one would complain. One is on a 5.56 ar. And the other is on a 300blk ar. I guess the only complaint is that the replacement feet from atlas are very expensive. Magpul needs to come out with their own.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Great bipod for AR's or Precision Rifles
review_text: Put this on my precision rifle and it work's great. It is compliant where you want movement and rigid and secure where it needs to be. I will be buying more.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Literally a think plastic bipod with metal rods inside for stability, rubber pads so you don’t scuff your coffee table after you set it up to show your wife, even though she doesn’t give a rats ass

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Amazing bipod. Initially I went with a different bipod after seeing the reviews about this one. But after doing more research I decided to give this one a try. I am very happy with it. The wiggle that people are unhappy with is a function of the bipod, not an oversight. I have no problem with it and actually prefer it. You can still load the bipod no problem. The only problem I had was with the mlok screws. I had to swap them out withother mlok screws I had lying around because they would not screw in.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Excellent for the weight and price
review_text: Certainly not a Atlas, in terms of stability or smoothness... but excellent for the weight and price point. I see this as the best bipod for AR-15 class rifles where you're looking for decent stability in a small caliber mobile platform. I wouldn't use this in an AR-10 or precision bolt-action application where stability over weight is most important. Built well and feels sturdy enough to extended field use. Neither the Picatinny rail or MLOK versions are readily detachable, but are likely lighter and more durable than QD-mount or lever-mount styles. I would buy 3 more right now if they were available-- they are sold out in early 2021, everywhere.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: Great bi-pod. Simple to install and is rock solid on my Savage 110.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Good quality product. Not an Atlas or GG&G Very light, serves its purpose, very stable under heavy recoil. Was hesitant about a 100.00 bi pod but MP generally makes a good product. This is used in real world not on a cool guy range toy. It serves its purpose. Its been banged around, used on dirt, rock, concrete , grass etc and works fine. Someone somewhere said it cant be pre loaded...nonsense..they must be bench shooters.... for the money its worth it.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: M-LOK | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: I've been working on a .223 rifle build (Ruger American Predator with the Magpul American Hunter stock) and needed to get a bipod. I've always used Harris bipods, but given that the price was similar, I decided to give this a try. The M-Lok works great for attaching it to the stock and it looks great. I like that the bipod has tilt and pan and that the pan can be locked out if you don't want it. The knob on the bottom to adjust how easily it tilts/pans has a great texture and is easy to manipulate. Great product!

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: A.R.M.S. 17S Style | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_header: Is good, no? Its very good, yes!
review_text: A) imo, worth the extra price vs the pic rail mounted model. 1 bipod, 3 guns, 1 throw lever. B) Needs A.R.M.S. #17s pattern mount. I got an American Defence Manufacturing mount, they were in stock. (Pictured is the tan/coyote/fde/whatever-its-tan coloured option with the 'tactical extended lever' or whatever. The tan looks like SCAR16 kind of tan, and I'm not sure id recommend the extended lever. My other mount from them has a reg lever, I like it more. Just my opinion. Also, maybe just get black. Kind of regretting my 'anodized fan's look with the rest of my normal tan items)

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: 1913 Picatinny Rail | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: FIRST, I ORDERED THIS LATE ON A FRIDAY EVENING AND RECEIVED IT ON SUNDAY MORNINNG. I ORDERED ANOTHER VERY SOLID UNIT COSTING ABOUT HALF THE COST OF THIS BIPOD. I LIKED THE DESIGN AND IT WAS SOLID. HOWEVER IT LOOKED CHEAP ON MY FDE SPRINGFIELD SAINT VICTOR. IT HAD A SERIOUS DEFECT THOUGH. THE UNIT WOULD NOT CLAMP TIGHT TO MY PICATINNY RAIL. I'M AN HONEST MAN AND WOULD NOT HAVE SENT IT BACK IF THE CLAMP HAD BEEN CORRECT. HOW THANKFUL I AM THAT I WOUND UP SPENDING FIFTY BUCKS MORE AND GOT SOMETHING THAT ADDS VALUE AND GOOD LOOKS TO MY AR. THAD CURTIS

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Black
review_text: Installed on a CETME wooden foregrip with a Harris adapter nut. When I preload the system, the foregrip torques and causes uneven pressure on the barrel, which makes a 0.66MOA gun open up to about a 3-4MOA group size. This makes me sad, because it;s a very good bipod, and the flaw is down to the poor design of the CETME foregrip. SO like most of the rest of the gun, I am currently redesigning and rebuilding the foregrip from scratch for optimum accuracy. What I like about the Magpul bipod: -Lovely light weight. Minimally interferes with balance. -Grabby feet. Can preload reasonably well on concrete shooting benches, mowed grass, roofing shingles, asphalt pavement. -Quick and positive locking system makes for fast and easy deployment and retraction. -QD Harris stud model is genuinely very quick to detach if you want to stow it and go. Not as fast as a cam lock, but there are concessions to be made if you want the slimmest and lightest option available. What I'm not so crazy about: -I got spoiled by the UTG Mlok bipod legs and their otherworldly stability. This Harros QD model does not have that and lacks proper transit capability to make up, offering only a roll feature. -Feels flimsy when you manhandle it. I have not broken it yet, but the extreme light weight does not come without cost. -Model lacks 45-degree lock for legs, so it's not easy to brace up against vertical or angled cover. You kinda just have to mash it in, adjust pressure on the weapon, and hope for the best. Final verdict - I am unsure of how it will hold up over time. More modern plastics have a way of being tougher than first impressions suggest. SOME TIMES. It ends up being more about the design than about the material with polymers. Magpul seems to grok with this pretty well. For this reason, my estimate is that the stripped-down feature set was the corner that was cut to achieve such a comfortable low weight, rather than durability. Only time will tell, but I've beaten on it rather a lot so far. I have had a lot more tooth-grinding, oops-did-I-just-break-it moments than I have with any other bipod, but this could also be down to my having had the audacity to bolt it to a beastly13lb tactical SASR rather than the typical M4gery. If this holds up to abuse, the light weight will be a worthy reason to add it to my rifle permanently once I sort out a homemade handguard to isolate the barrel. That's definitely an "if", though.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I went with the M-Lok version that does not need to attach to a rail. The installation is extremely easy, thanks to the M-Lok system. The bi-pod is very nice quality and feels sturdy. It has no external springs, everything is encased inside the polymer casing. The legs rotate down and snap into place, and are locked in place until you press the side buttons to move them back. The legs also extend in locking segments, with a button on each leg. The bi-pod can pan and title, and has a very easy-to-use large grippy nut that adjusts the tension. This nut also allows you to spin the legs to either be pointing forwards, or backwards when mounted on the rifle. I love my Magpul Bi-pod and will definitely be using this product on future builds! Highly recommended.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I needed a bipod for my 50 Beo. I have the severely excellent and unquestionably expensive Atlas PRS on my 308, and it lives up to its billing and provides excellent value for the money. But I wanted to find something even lighter, because the Beo is already heavy enough as it is and I'm not getting any younger. Fortunately, I found the Magpul Rifle Bipod. On paper the MRB supposedly offers an Atlas like solution (cant and pivot, really?) for less than half of the price of an Atlas, so I ordered one with a heavy dose of scepticism despite the Magpul name on the product. Well, it is just a fantastic bipod. Well designed, well built, light weight and (really) easy to deploy. It isn't an Atlas, but is WAY better than ANY similarly priced bipod you'll find and just as good or better than most you'll find at higher price points. Highly recommended.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: M-LOK | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_header: Adequate for a variety of purposes
review_text: This thing is not as absolutely bomb-proof as the Atlas bipods... but it comes darn close in features and toughness for half the price. There's a bit of play by design that lets the rifle and bipod absorb recoil without the feet walking on you. You can lock or unlock the pan setting. You get more degrees of panning/tilt than the atlas. The adjustments are easy and intuitive. You can also loosen the adjustment all the way and flip the legs around backward if you wanted to have it stow away backwards or something to move through heavy brush or whatever, than engage and use the bipod in that position or flip it back around. That's not really advertised as a feature, but the functionality is there. About the only thing you don't get that the Atlas bipood has is the ability to lock the bipod at weird angles to shoot with greater flexibility at extreme inclines or out windows and barricades and stuff. I'm not sure how useful it really is to have that feature.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Watch some video reviews. You will be sold.
review_text: Read a bunch of reviews on this and many were negative. Watched a good video review that addressed many of the complaints I had read about. Decided most of them were probably user issues. I purchased it based on the product video and review,. Glad I did. It's a really well made product as you would expect. Mounted quickly and adjusted the pan/tilt. When used correctly it should perform very well. It's not a combat quality unit but certainly stout enough for a 5.56 used on a regular basis. The price point is very attractive and a very good dollar value. I will purchase another for a different gun.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Solid for what I use it for
review_text: While this bipod isn't going to provide quite as stable of a platform as an Atlas, it's sufficient for use on an ar-15 (400yds with 600yds being the practical maximum). I like the bipod's tilting feature, but If I was doing serious long range shooting I'd want a more tradtional bipod design that can completely lock out for extra stability.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: So I usually buy the cheap bi-pods, some are better than others, but this thing is just downright sexy when it's mounted. The others look like I bandaged on legs to my rifles, this thing looks slick and performs great. My wife bought one when she bought her FN DMR, and it looked and performed great. She knows me, so she bought me this one because she knows I wouldn't spend that kind of money on a bipod. But man is this a great bi-pod for me. I currently have in on a 300 blackout and it has performed great and stays out of the way when I'm not using it. Some of the cheaper ones tend to start coming apart after a day on the range, but this thing stayed solid. It's a great bi-pod if you don't mind the money.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: Awesome Look and Fit on my Mossberg Patriot Predator .308 I like how I'm still able to use a sling with it. The Flat Earth is an awesome choice to go with this. It will definitely blend into my surroundings , a match made in heaven.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Magpul is still king of MODS
review_text: There are a lot of products out there when it comes to bipods. I chose Magpul because of the minimalist design and I am very happy with it. Not only is it slim, lightweight, and classy looking but it is very sturdy and the swivel action is more than enough. Top notch.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Black
review_header: PERFECT FOR MY APPLICATIONS / EXCELLENT / ORDERED A 2ND
review_text: Ordered despite some negative comments. Wasn't sure it would fit my applications. Fit perfectly on my CZ syn with double sling swivels. Design allowed me to reverse mount so the legs will fold toward the bolt so I can fit the rifle in my safe with it attached. Also test fit it on my Ruger Gunsight 308 single stud. Mounts perfect so I just ordered a 2nd one for it. I can confirm (1) it does have swivel mount on pod to reattach sling for those that have only one stud (2) it has TILT adjustment of 50 degrees total (+ / - 25 each side). (3) Legs adjust individually & in increments of 1/2 inch thru 7 locking positions........ Very Pleased with Magpul quality & design on this product.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Granted, the more expensive bi-pods have a spring to take up the perceived "slop" but ALL bi-pods have that play in the legs for a reason. If that play in the legs was not there, the recoil of the rifle would move the position of the bi-pod's feet with the recoil of the rifle and force you to reset the shot. Whereas the play in the legs (with and without the spring) gives room for the recoil to occur without causing the feet of the pi-pod to shift. This means as your body and the rifle return from the recoil you are right where you started and can take a second shot quicker. I love this bi-pod. I like how light it is. Its sturdy and does it's job well. I do not miss the spring. I set my shot and lean forwards to load the legs. The recoil from my rifle length gas system is light anyways so this system is a perfect match. I would buy thing bi-pod again.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: A little expensive, but worth it
review_text: I have been looking for a good bipod for my long range AR-10 for a while. Considering that everything I have bought from Magpul has been high quality, I was willing to drop a little more then I had been looking to spend. This bipod met and exceeded my expectations. The operation is smooth and precise. The m-lok attachment fits precisely to my handguard (which is good, considering Magpul came up with the system!). It works much better then the older way I had it set up, which was to have a picatinny rail attached to the handguard, and a cheaper bipod attached to that.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Not too ridgid, not too wobbly, light weight
review_text: As with many other Magpul products, this bipod is a good balance of rigidity, weight, and price. The bipod has enough give to aim, but steady enough for shooting. It's also light weight and reasonably priced. I bought the damaged box from Amazon warehouse. Other than the box, the bipod was brand new, and got the best price on the net.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: Very well made, and in line with it’s price point. I have read other reviews citing problems with too much slop, or looseness, in the tilt feature and legs. I didn’t experience such problems. The bipod is as taut as you’d like it to be, provided you tighten the adjustment knob enough, and ‘load’ up the legs. Finally, There must be some movement allowed, otherwise, you couldn’t easily acquire your sight picture on the target..

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Lightweight and Durable, with Outstanding Performance
review_text: I was having a difficult time trying to find the right bipod for my Noveake 14.5” AR when I saw one of these at my LGS. I was prepared to spend a couple of hundred dollars on an Atlas or Harris model, but the light weight, maneuverability, and performance that I found in other reviews and equipment tests moved me to choose the new Magpul bipod. It’s made of durable Magpul polymer so I know it’s durable, and the easy adjustments and the variable adjustments for each leg help form a highly stable platform. I couldn’t find a unit that offered similar lightweight performance and great looks, and I’m glad I chose the Magpul Rifle Bipod.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I love this bipod. No goofy springs and widgets. Easy collapse and easy fold. Several different heights to get that perfect shot. I have it mounted to my 308 and plan on mounting another to my 6.5 creedmore.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: M-LOK | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: Perfect, lightweight, reliable bipod! Makes life easier on these Old Marine bones. Semper Fi

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I love Magpul products so I was excited when they release their own bipod for the market. I've put almost 200 rounds through my Predator with this bipod attached and have been pleased with it. It's very functional for what you're paying for it and I will definitely be getting another for MLOK

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: M-LOK | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_header: A game changer...however know its limitations.
review_text: This is an exceptional bipod for AR-15s and other rifles under 10 pounds. First and foremost it is extremely light weight. Possibly the lightest on the market with the features it brings to the table. The price is outstanding as well considering the impressive list of capabilities is has. I dare you to find another bipod in this price range that is this light with the ability to cant and pivot the weapon. It has a considerable of flex, and is meant to be "weighted" prior to pulling the trigger by pushing or pulling the gun. The knurled knob is excellent and makes on the fly adjustments easier than getting your dog to eat of bite of steak. When stowed it can be cranked down preventing the pod from moving around. It is not as stable as a Harris with spring loaded legs but to pull of a 11 oz pod with the same features as a Harris sacrifices must be made. The legs adjust super fast with push button retraction and will not fold up when loaded. Not being spring tension legs, you also do not have to worry about unexpected folding and the bloody hands that go along with it. Magpul always comes correct with new products and this is no exception. Just realize the limitations of this pod before buying. This is a light and fast style pod meant long patrols or long humps to that tree stand or final firing position. If you just shooting of the bench at the range there may be better options for you.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: If you read any of the reviews, and there are many, you see many repetitive complaints; it wobbles, it's plastic, it's just wrong, so on and so forth. I liken it back to when auto makers stopped making metal dashboards and started using plastic. People whined back then, also. Didn't matter that the new dashboard was safer, didn't matter that the new dashboard was better, all that mattered was it was different. It wasn't the way it always was. Fast forward to now. Bipods used to heavy. Bipods used to be all metal. Exposed springs like some steampunk contraption at a festival. Close a metal bipod the wrong way, you got blood on your hands. Literally. Enter Magpul. Magpul reinvented the bipod. Lightweight polymers (not plastic), no exposed springs. Streamline. More features are standard that cost extra on other metal bipods. More advanced then the 1930's style metal bipods so common, even today. Let's look at the "faults" that those who hate to evolve and accept technological advances have repeated over and over; 1. "It's wobbly.". No it's not. If you know how to USE a bipod properly, it's not wobbly. Load the bipod correctly (and if you don't know what that means, don't buy a bipod) and it's rock steady. The "wobble", per se, was purposely built into the bipod so you CAN load it properly. 2. "Too much plastic". First off, it's Magpul's proprietary polymer that they invented, it's NOT plastic. Same polymer that their stocks, mags, grips are made of. No one finds faults with them, only the "bipod people" find faults with using their polymer. Metal is used where it needs to be, but because it's different, it's too modern, purists refuse to adapt. They want the bipod they started using in the 70's. Those days are gone. Those that hate this product probably still whine about the good ol' days and still miss their pagers and flip phone that only made phone calls. Now to those that think I'm a young'n whining about the old folks, I'm 60 years old. I ain't young. But I'm not afraid of technology. The "good ol' days" weren't all that great. THESE are the good ol' days. To those reading the negative comments, disregard them. They know not of what they speak. This is an excellent MODERN bipod made in the USA by a reputable company.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: 1913 Picatinny Rail | Color: Flat Dark Earth
review_text: I'm reviewing this at a $74.00 price. At a higher price, I'd probably pull a star. I mean, it's functional, and reasonably sturdy for my needs. My rifle is heavy, but it's more for range and groundhog use, than PRS events. So, it isn't taking that level of abuse from me. But, I like it. The pan and tilt are functional, easily adjustable, and very lockable. leg adjustments are also reasonably easy to make, even under stress, when a violent, psychopathic groundhog is coming straight at you. You know, when you've got to be all operator and such.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Black
review_text: These Magpul Bipods tend to be a bit pricey compared many of the other options flooding the market these days, but after having tried several different brands I can see these are made quite well, and the minimal design means less things in the way to get caught up when trying to get settled in position. The polymer is lightweight but strong. The legs hold tight but the internal springs are not so tight that they're difficult to collapse, or noisy even when extending. If you catch one on sale, snag it right then and there, it's worth every penny but paying a few less makes it that much better.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: For 100ish dollars, this bipod is built solidly and has a wide range of positions. Strength wise, this appears to be on par with, or better than a Harris Bipod, but in a smaller package. However, I got the M-LOK version, and for some reason, its virtually impossible to take M-LOK items off once you've installed them.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_text: I am sure there are bipod purists out there that won't give this device a second look but I absolutely love it. As a comparison, I have a Harris and have moved it from my AR-based 6.5 Grendel to a bolt action 6.5 Creedmoor, simply because I like the Magpul bipod better. I can't tell you how many times I have banged my fingers on the handguard when collapsing the Harris legs. This is due to the spring loaded action that are built on. On the contrary, the Magpul legs are kept in place and lock in a couple positions with a button and there is no tension, so my fingers do not slam into the frame of the weapon. The magpul bipod has a knurled knob that allows both tilt and rotation functionality. Overall, this is a very easy to use bipod with as much flexibility as any other 6-9" device I have used from other manufacturers. If you watch Amazon, you can often find great deals from Amazon Warehouse, as I have done twice. Each time the bipod that I received was in excellent condition, though the box was rather beat up. On the last one, the MLOK screws and nuts were missing, but a quick chat with the Amazon CS team resulted in a credit to my account, which was enough to cover a new set. Full disclosure - I don't have a ton of rounds on either of the Magpul bipods but I have "played" with them several times and really like what I have seen so far. If I do come up with any issues at the range, I will provide an update.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
reviewed_product_attribute: Style: Sling Stud QD | Color: Black
review_text: Oh damn this thing is nice... couple details that I believe are QD model specific: 1. I don’t believe this has a pan feature like the others are described. Well mine is locked out anyway. 2. Kinda tall. With the QD clamp and everything the front end of my rifle sits kinda high. 3. There is no tilt lock out... so when you tighten up the knob you have to kind of crank your rifle over to level out the cant. 4. It’s too sexy. It looks tacticool. And it knows it... All that crap aside, it’ll get the job done. Magpul has never let me down before... I have a couple slings, shotgun forend and stock and there hardware is durable/reliable. Yes, I love it, buy one.

product_title: Magpul Rifle Bipod Gun Rest for Hunting and Shooting, M-LOK, Black
review_header: Great product, you won't be disappointed
review_text: They are light easy to adjust and offers great features like tilt and pan for the price. Handles recoil great, doesn't feel like it will break. Highly recommended if you want a light, versatile, quality bi pod that won't break the bank. I am not a Magpul fan boy, only calling it how I see it, they made a great product.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: I've had this rifle for abt 2 weeks. After reading tons of reviews and getting some serious trigger time myself, I've come up with the following observations/recommendations: Feels very real in your hands. Flip up sights are cheap junk and really don't look like they belong on such a great looking rifle. Crossman should really pony up and put some decent flip-up iron sights on this thing. How much could it cost at such volumes? Anyway, I took them off and replaced with cheap red/green dot scope before the first loading. https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B019MN7N5U/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 After handling his rifle for a few hours now I believe it would be excellent for introduction training for a real AR. All controls work very close to a real AR (except fwd assist which rarely gets used anyway). Trigger is a bit stiff and appears to behave like a 2-stage trigger. At abt 90% of trigger force applied, there's a faint click, then a bit more squeeze and it fires. Not sure if this was an intentional feature but it's very consistent and I like it. At 30 ft, with fresh co2, I'm grouping 25 rnds within an inch in semi-auto (with a rest). Holds elevation pretty well for first 6 mags. Elevation drops 2-3 inches @ 30 ft. on last (7th) mag. When co2 gets low, rifle occasionally does some weird stuff like double firing or dry firing. When co2 gets really low, you have to use the charge lever between shots, but by then it's time to replaced co2 anyway. From what I've heard, to extend the life of the rifle, you shouldn't run full auto with fresh co2 cyls or near empty ones either. Shoot the first mag in semi-auto then switch to full-auto for a couple of mags, then back to semi-auto until co2 is gone. Also, not too much full auto until you have a few hounded rnds thru it. Seems like good advice since moving parts need to wear-in. First 1500 BBs were Hornady Black Diamond since I heard they load easier (and they are). Speed loader takes a little getting used to, but after you get the hang of it, it's great. I spray a little Rem oil in the loader, load it between 1/2 and 3/4 full then another quick spray of oil. Then shake it to distribute the oil around. Switched to Daisy zinc coated BB's since local store was out of Hornady's. They are a little more difficult to load but so far no issues with first 1000 rounds. Daisy grouped as well as the Hornady's. When speed loader plunger jams, don't force it. Just flip it upside down (while still connected to mag) and gently work the plunger until it un-jams, then flip it back upright and continue. At first it didn't seem to shoot more than abt 75-100 rnds before running out of co2 (semi-auto only). When removing right (secondary) cylinder, a LOT of co2 escaped. Inspected piercing pin and it looked OK. Next time removing co2 cylinders, I loosened the right cyl very very slowly. Noticed after abt 1/4 turn loosening, the right cyl got cold but wasn't leaking. I was then able to fire another 75 or so rnds. Next time I loaded 2 new cyls, I tightened the left cyl normally. On the right cyl, I tightened until it was abt as tight as I could get it with the supplied wrench, then backed it off exactly 1/4 turn. Now it works as it should. I've ran 6 cyls thru it this way and so far so good. There's something odd going on inside the mag that makes the right cylinder not flow if cyl is screwed on really tight but this appears to be a good work-around so far. Microscopic manual says to oil after ~1000 rnds. That's what I did. Maybe Crossman wants to parts to wear-in before oiling?? I applied pelgunoil to the co2 tips and everything else that moves including the seal. Feels significantly smoother now. I've heard pelgunoil is actually non-detergent ATF. When the pelgunoil tube runs out, I'll probably refill it with ATF and keep rolling. EDIT: After a hit more research, looks like silicone oil is supposed to be used on the green seal, in the cyl where green seal slides into and on the seal at output of the magazine. I'll be switching over to silicone oil for these parts. Still using pelgunoil for tips of co2 cyls. IMHO, this was a steal at $145. Even at $180 it's still a bargain. I've had a lot of fun with it and actually feel I'm improving my target acquisition time and muscle memory. Hats off to DPMS/Panther Arms/Crossman for releasing such a BB gun.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: Right now cheap .22 lr runs 4 to 6 cents a round, requires appropriate range and backstop for shooting. This is less than 1 cent per shot. I'm comparing this to the real thing for those interested in at home training: -Upper and lower receiver and rail are plastic, but I havent perceived this to be detrimental. -sights are super cheap (I put on a super cheap red dot and dont plan on using the plastic irons) -weight is decent, though a little light toward the muzzle. There is obviously weight added to the body and the magazine is weighted. -there really is a little recoil. I can see my red dot point of aim twitch when I shoot. Makes for much better realism. -the trigger is way too heavy. Other reviews have tested it around 9 lbs. I wondered what that would feel like. It feels seriously, distractingly, slow down your rate of fire heavy. It's not like a heavy double action trigger. More like a normal mil spec trigger during take up, but that takes twice as much effort to break the shot. I'm going to try to get the (housed) trigger mechanism out to see if I can modify this. Not a deal breaker though. -the side picatinny rails on the fore end are removable. I was happy to discover this, as it helps slim down the grip. Probably not intended as a feature, but I took advantage of it. It looks like you do need to out the rearmost screws back in to resecure the fore end to the upper receiver. -I didnt think I would use full auto much, and maybe I won't in the long run, but it's way more fun than I thought it would be. Because of the reciprocating bolt it feels quite substantial. Significant giggle factor. -the charging handle feels and latches like a real one. It is lighter and has less travel than on an AR 15, however. I think it's actually aluminum. -adjustable stock locks up decently. -Safety/fire selector is lighter (easier to move) than normal, and feels like it's in a slightly odd spot. I could be off, but sweeping it doesnt feel quite right. Not a big deal. -bolt locks back on empty, stays locked back when you remove the magazine, bolt release works like normal to drop the bolt when you reinsert a magazine. Overall super pleased with this purchase. This is a steal for a gas blowback air rifle. I'm really glad I went with this over a comparably priced electric airsoft rifle. I got through 4 or 5 magazines on two CO2 cartridges. In bulk they are less than .50 a piece, so this is very cheap to shoot. I will come back and update if I have any significant disappointments down the road.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: It is amazing. Super solid, seems like I could beat it up. I loaded it up with accessories. Looks like crazy zombie gun. My speed loader worked flawless unlike other reviews. Co2 lasted longer than expected, even lasted overnight. The only thing I can agree on from others is the sights are trash, but they can easily be replaced with the same ones but metal for super cheap. I mean usable, but in my case they are just off and not off like I can adjust, but the Mold or something is just terrible, so you have to aim a little off, but I am not ever gunna use them anyways. If I could give 10 stars I would

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: I usually don't write reviews unless it's freaking awesome. So here I am. It is unmistakable from the real deal unless you either detach the magazine or read the caliber on it. It blasts 30 BBs out in a second and the velocity is impressive for a full auto bb gun. Accurate and much louder than I thought it would be. Cycles thru the ammo and has enough recoil to make you laugh and say *#@ yeah! Handed to a friend who had no idea until I told him it's a bb gun. Authentic and lots of fun, two thumbs toes and eyebrows up...

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Pretty Bad Ass! Accurate at yardages that ill be using it.
review_text: the owners manual states that the magazine BB follower can be locked back to load. Wrong. It has to be held back while l,oading which is kinda a pain in the ass. other than that this gun rocks!

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: wow really nice simi or full auto
review_text: what i like, metal body, speed loader works good, soo much fun to shoot simi auto, full auto is fun but co2 runs out quick. no jam yet, fire about 20 co2 packs, so 10 change of co2. i like this gun much more than my sig mcx and it only cost 100.00 on black friday. what i thought was lacking. silencer, so i printed one, works good only thing u can hear is the blowback action, being bb only, its really not accurate at all, the co2 and bb are all in cartidge so its quite heavy. the plastic iron sight. it may seem like alot of negative but for the price its a fun gun for plinking, u might not get a nice grouping of shots, but u will shred the taget to pieces! i have both this and the sig mcx, mcx cost more and more accurate, but this one is more to wieght of real ar15, mcx is rather heavy, mcx is also not full auto.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Wow....Cool pice of hardware and completed my collection
review_text: Looks and feels like the real thing. Quality piece of hardware. Accurate and a blast to shoot on full auto. 9mm shells are about a dollar each, and BB’s cost less than half a cent each. Fun for target practice, and the noise will not disturb the neighbors. I had a friend that wanted to see it when we were in a parking lot...before you knew it, I had 4 guys and 4 ladies gathered around, and one of them ordered one for himself. Highly recommended for those stay at home days that we are having. Get plenty of CO2 cartridges, and BB’s....also recommend a metal box target to collect spent rounds.....

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: Great gun, the sights seem a little bit off but I think it's me. Very fun to shoot on full auto, short bursts or just semi automatic. Not very powerful though but I was using copper bbs and I guess you should only use steel. Great little toy for the price!

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: Great shooting full auto bb rifle. Accurate, tough, and especially like the real action of the bolt. Read reviews that the loading bbs and co2 change is hard and a pain but those who wrote that are either slow or have not seen crappy design of other platforms. Highly recommend this. Additionaly, full auto is fun but as with any full auto weapon, you can go through a mag quick. Recommend making the commitment to buy at least 2 extra mags to increase the fun.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: The gun was amazing. I took this in my dried up creek. Feels and looks real is durable. Not only this however but so far its the only full auto i seen the rest are on burst.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: It's pretty awesome to shoot! High speed pic takin of me firing it.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: This thing is a beast. It has a quick and snappy fire rate, and the realism makes this gun all the more better. You will find most of the controls in their proper places, all functioning realistically. This gun is also highly versatile. I have fitted it with a plethora of my own attachments to it, which makes it look much more tactical. The only downside is that the primary build material is plastic, but highly durable plastic. I give this behemoth a 9/10.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: So much fun and very realistic.
review_text: Purchased this to practice with the price of bullets and get my girlfriend use to the AR platform. I LOVE this thing. So much fun and gave me a chance to run drills without blowing all my ammo. My uncle has been shooting his entire life and let him play around with it, next week he ordered one for getting rid of chipmunks around the yard. I’ve had 5 friends shoot it and they all walk away with a smile. The fact that you can break it down and clean it like a real AR is super impressive. I would recommend oiling everything down as you would a real rifle as it makes it function a little smoother or at least sounds like it does. Accuracy drops off after a bit as the gun gets cold. Warm the rifle and mags up before use and it shoots very accurate. I was shooting 25 feet away and kept my shots within 4 inches compensating for drop. Get an extra mag to warm the spare up in your pocket if it’s not warm out and it’ll keep it accurate.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: I originally bought this to start teaching the kids about rifle safety and how to shoot/handle the AR platform. While it does function as a pretty good training tool before we step up to a 22lr, it's also just a barrel of fun. For the money, there's few better ways to spend a couple of hours on a warm afternoon. PROS: Good C02 life...I get about 14 (or 350 bbs) magazines per pair of cartridges running full auto, and about 16 magazines if I run semi-auto. Muzzle velocity and therefore accuracy drops after about 8-9 magazines, but moving a few feet closer to the target when that happens negates this change. This functions about 85% the same as a standard AR rifle, so its a great platform to introduce the kids on. Accuracy is pretty good for an inexpensive bb gun. We shoot it between 5-10 yards depending on weather conditions and C02 charge, and it makes consistent hits on the target (6" rubber "gong" in a homemade bb catch box). My rifle has been 100% reliable since I've owned it...it's had somewhere around 2500 bbs down the barrel. I do lubricate the rifle each time we change C02. CONS: Included sights are junk. I put a spare set of UTG flip-ups I had laying around on it and they've been much better. Trigger pull is a bit heavy for young kids...I have to squeeze the trigger for my 2-year-old as she learns to point and steady the rifle, whereas she can work the trigger on our Crosman PSM45 pistol on her own. I haven't put a gauge on it, but I'd estimate it's about a 7-8lb pull. I don't have a whole lot of luck with the included speed loader, but it only takes about 20-30 seconds to load the magazine by hand. I have a few spares that are on backorder, so it'll be nice to have those. The screws that push the C02 cartridges in place use a hex key (one is included). This is fine, but I'd rather just have a phillips slot so I could just use a regular screw driver. Overall, I've been very satisfied with this product...yes, it's mostly plastic, but it's well made and if you take care of it and realize that at the end of the day it's a toy, it should last for a long time. I'll probably end up ordering another one so we can shoot more than one at a time.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: I Bought one, fell in love with it. Then immediately bought a bunch of gun accessories, laser sight, red dot scope, flashlight, 4 extra magazines, an extra speed loader, i even got slip on quick pull tabs for the mags since you have to take them apart to load the c02. and a harness to tote everything around with. Lol this summer I'm gonna be going zero dark 30 on the extra rabbit population around here. It's seriously so sick. It's like having a full auto ar in your back yard. Which is the closest a lot of people are going to get to owning something like that, And its a blast to shoot. So far everyone I've had try it cant help but smile when they flip the switch and let off that first crisp burst. It's still decently loud. Not to to where you need earplugs but It let's you know you're still technically shooting a weapon. I like to describe the noise as a small air powered jackhammer or nail gun. Its actually pretty dam accurate too and the red dot scope even lines up with the laser I mounted and holds a pretty tight grouping at about 15 yards. I'm almost wondering how long until they ban full auto bb guns, because it's way too much fun to be legal. Just gotta make sure to buy plenty of ammo and c02 cartridges with it because it eats them. One full mag of co2 is good for like 200 shots. So fill up 5 and you got yourself a pretty fun afternoon. Like I'd plan to be ordering a steady supply of them off Amazon (packs of 40 co2 cartridges for 15 bucks) or just stock pile them because it is that much fun to shoot. I also just barely ordered an umarex m712 mauser broomhandle as a backup with another spare mag as well. Super excited to have that as my "sidearm" carry when I'm plinking in the backyard. Apparently that also has a full auto selector switch. I've definetly found my new hobby. I used to have bb guns when I was a small kid but this is a game changer. It's like being able to collect and own weapons I always dreamed of. but safely and affordably.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Just buy it.. you won't be disappointed!!!!
review_text: So if you are on the fringe of buying one 9f these things please just take my word for it and do it... You WILL NOT be disappointed. This thing is awesome!! Have been shooting it everyday now for a 2 weeks and has had zero issues. One 9f the concerning things to me was loading the mag and people saying the speed loader was junk. Don't listen to that, the speed loader works awesome and it takes about 3 seconds to reload the mag. There is really no need for a second mag it is so quick and easy. I already put some accessories on it for my 7 year old son and this thing is a blast to shoot!! My only regret is that I didn't buy one sooner.
