product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: OK, if you have an AR, this 'feels' like an AR. Literally has the same heft and balance. Controls are the same, from the safety to the charging handle. Trigger is probably similar to military grade, but heavier than most civilian ARs. To shoot, you pre load the 'magazine' with Co2 cargridges - 2 of them using the supplied tool, and noting which one goes in first - and fill mag with BBs. Both are pretty straightforward, and easy enough to figure out. The mag feels 'heavy' but when in the gun, it gives the gun a similar heft and balance of an AR. It even has Picatinny rails to add a light, laser, or dot sight if you want. Standard sights are fold down plastic, with a knob to adjust windage. Front sight is fixed, but mine shot low, so it was simple to sight in by filing it down a little at a time. The sights are not that clear to see through, with quite a bit of glare in the rear peep. I'm thinking of trying to find a needle file or something to rough it up with. Rear sight has two apertures, I use the large one most of the time because of the glare I just mentioned. Accuracy is decent for a BB gun, but not stellar, but I don't think anyone bought this gun for maximum precision. Where this gun shines, is maximum FUN. Flip the safety from semi-auto to full-auto and it's a blast. Empties the 25 shot magazine in something like 2 or 2 1/2 seconds. WOW, just WOW. The action even moves back and forth, which gives a feeling of recoil for each shot. This thing is way too much fun! Best if used in 3-5 shot bursts, otherwise you'll feel like all you do is reload, which is a good excuse to get a second magazine. The mag seems pricey, but looking at it, most of the 'wear' items are in the mag. By this I mean the Co2 holders, and associated seals, as well as the BB feed mechanism, is all incorporated in the mag. If a seal goes bad and leaks out Co2 between shots, replacing the mag should solve it. The gun even breaks open to clean, the same way an AR does. It is realistic enough I almost wish it had a bright orange tip on the barrel so everyone would know it is not a 'real' firearm. It takes 2 Co2 cartridges at a time for operation, and seems to easily go 100+ shots on those 2 cylinders. Has a positive 3 position safety. Safe, semi auto, and full auto. All controls work smoothly, and all are the same as an AR, as in safety, mag release, charging handle, dust cover that opens when you charge the gun, or shoot the first shot, to the collapsible buttstock, that works the same way as one on a traditional AR. Not cheap for a BB gun, but build quality and fun factor actually make it a bargain.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: The most fun you can have with your clothes on!
review_text: The gun is shipped in its retail packaging and I was a little concerned because it was not taped closed very well when I received it. But when I opened the box and took inventory nothing was missing. I watched several videos of this gun before I bought it so I was already familiar with the set up and basic operation which is fortunate because the instructions are written in the tiniest font imaginable. I was also a little wary of the speed loader because so many people have complained about not being able to make it work but I found it extremely easy to use and very efficient. Also, I don't know if the manufacturer redesigned the magazine but mine has a tab to hold back the spring which is key for using the speed loader and others have commented their magazine doesn't have one. After setting it up I put up a full size silhouette target and fired off a couple of single fire shots to get accustomed to the flip up sights. The sights really are terrible but I have a spare red dot I'm going to mount on the pic rail so I don't really care about them. At about 20 yards I was placing shots accurately so I decided to fire a few bursts. Man oh man is this fun! I tore up the target with tight groupings on full auto, reloaded and repeated until I burned through my first 2 cylinders of CO2. The trigger pull takes some getting used to because it is very heavy but that doesn't diminish the fun. If you're on the fence about buying one my advice is to just pull the trigger and get it. It really is about the most fun you can have with your clothes on.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: I don't regret my spontaneous trigger finger response of buying this gun
review_text: "Fired" with the copper .177" bb's from crosman, and the co2 from Crosman. Loaded with speed loader, did not have an issue. Zeroed within 2 clicks of a cheap 50 dollar Amazon scope. 1 inch groups at 10 yards, 3 inch groups at 40 yards. Maintained same grouping on both with full auto. It's easier to load than an ar, load bb's within seconds. I bought the quick loader 300 round magazine from Crosman, I haven't tried it yet. But I don't think you'll have to buy multiple magazines to be happy. But for sure buy a lot of co2. These cartridges only last a few magazines worth before they're out. "Bullet" drop will start after magazine #3. I had no issues with this gun, the magazine, or the speed loader, I bought to train children about gun safety, and proper marksmanship.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: Love this bb gun! I bought it after watching a video and it does not disappoint! It’s perfect for using as a substitute for my 5.56 AR pistol to practice handling, maneuvering in house, and dropping and loading magazines. It’s also a much better deterrent for the deer that seem to think my wive’s, oops, wife’s garden is for their enjoyment. If a couple of well placed shots doesn’t chase them off, full auto sends them into overdrive! After about a week, they’ve learned to give the property a wide berth!! Now, i have to shoot at cans to get my kicks. The feral cats learned quicker. Before anyone starts whining about animal cruelty, I don’t shoot at close range, and 95% are probable misses. Also, it beats the alternative. I had a friend shoot at me with fresh CO2 powerlets at about 75 feet, just to show my SlaveMistress that it is NOT harming the animals, but it does sting! Don’t try this yourselves; take my word for it. The Ole Ball&Chain didn’t mind me chasing those four legged lawn mowers off with a bb pistol, but the scary looking “assault” rifle caused her Mouth to utter complaints and whine at 119 decibels, until i served myself up as a pretend deer. Buy one, you will consider it to be money well spent!

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: You need to buy this. It is more fun than you can imagine!
review_text: Pros: This gun is so much fun to shoot! Full auto mode leads to spontaneous giggling from the shooter and spectators alike. Weight and balance are very much like the real thing. Charging handle, safety/fire selector, are very realistic, although the forward assist is non-functional. Did I say how much fun it is to shoot this thing? Surprisingly accurate. The attached photo is from my 1st 100 shots. The tight clusters are from 3 25-round full auto bursts. The others are from semi-auto file as I tried to use the flip-up sights. All were at 30 ft. Cons: The flip-up sights aren't much use, at least for my eyes. In most lighting conditions, I found that the smooth inside surface of the cylindrical rear sight aperture was too reflective, causing enough glare to block out the front post sight entirely. It is far too loud to be back yard friendly, if neighbors are close. The loading tool is temperamental at best, jamming frequently. It is made of light plastic that feels like it will break at any moment. When it's functioning properly, it is a major improvement over hand-loading, but of 10 loading attempts, I only had 1 load the full 25 BBs without failure. Final take: If you are interested in this gun at all, BUY IT NOW. Once you fire it, you will honestly wonder why you waited at all. Ignore the loading tool. Buy your BBs in the dispenser with the little tapered spout. Just hold the bb follower back with your thumb (manual says "lock it back", but that's a misprint), tip the mag so the top end is a bit downward, and pour the BBs into the feeding hole till the slot is full. Release the follower. Don't worry if you spill some, cuz you'll be spilling a lot more real soon. Order extra magazines! The 25 rds go so fast, you'll be glad you spent the $50 a piece, just so you can keep shooting. Mount a Red Dot reflex optic or Laser for better point and shoot target acquisition.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Use caution reading the customer reviews !!!
review_text: I read the reviews and was a bit skeptic about the purchase of this DPMS Crosman BB gun. If you will purchase the proper oil and use it sparingly on the seals and CO-2 cartridge tips I have had no issues with leaks at all. Also the speed loader gets a lot of bad reviews, all I can say is if you hate yours please feel free to send it to me. The speed loader works great takes about 20 seconds to fill the mag. and is extremely easy to use. If you have issues try not filling it all the way up and when you fill it add three (3) drops of oil shake it gently and use it without a lot of force, works great. Only reason I gave it 4 stars on materials was the sights they could be broken pretty easy so be careful. Buy this BB gun you will love it and I challenge you not to smile the first time you use full auto. Great buy!!!!!

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: I'm quite the novice with this sort of thing, but I'm very impressed with the accuracy, build quality, and overall performance of this rifle. Even at full auto (which I wouldn't recommend using frequently because it eats away at CO2 rather quickly) it's on-point. It comes with an angled foregrip, one magazine, and a BB speedloader. If you're looking for a high-quality BB gun that feels a lot more realistic than most others, then this is the one I'd recommend. It's well worth the money.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: I say damn!!! :0. I wasn't really ready for all that
review_text: This thing when cared for and maintained properly and used with care and caution is probably the meanest most powerful and potentially the most destructive bb gun I've ever owned it fires FAST and extremely far but the flip up sights are junk...sorry but they sucked lol. But a holo reflex sight sighted in and look the #*!*/@ out definitely useful for varmit control ..prolly illegal to use on cats or dogs unless defending yourself but I don't recommend walking around with it as no one will know it's an air rifle and may draw alot of unwanted attn. Also very important that you have proper back drop as these BBS will bounce and deflect for many yards if they hit a solid object even a tree or the ground is NOT a good place to shoot at with this take good care of it use and store it properly so not to ruin the seals and enjoy trust me you will enjoy it emmensly

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Fun Time. Puts a grin to your face
review_text: When they designed and built this SBR they really woke up on the right side of the bed. The weight, looks and workings on the AR look alike is amazing. From the adjusting shoulder stock the magazine the lock back on the bolt the safe, semi auto, FULL AUTO button all on the same side as a regular AR is fantastic. On semi auto it is fairly accurate plinking at pop cans or what have you. On FULL AUTO you'll have that can dancing away and putting a grin on your face from ear to ear Nothing to dislike bout with this SBR, though you get to wishing the mag held more ammo. Definitely recommend this to any one that's looking to have a fun time.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: This is the 3rd Crosman rifle I’ve bought and I own 5 of their hand guns all preform great. I’m An older man which spent 6 years in the military during the Vietnam era as a tank gunner . This goes out to all the GI Joes out there that don’t know the proper handling of a weapon. Good care and maintenance and familiarity of the gun and it will give you years of service and enjoyment. Their not toys, handle it as real. People will respect the use of you and your BB gun. Be careful. I rate this with 5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Stars and a 👍🏻Up. Enjoy your gun.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: A lot of fun for a BB gun!
review_text: I should have bought more mags. It’s fairly accurate but it’s hard to miss anything when this thing sprays out the entire magazine in less than 2 seconds! I read some reviews on how the plastic sights are junk...and they truly are. I replaced them with a cheap red dot. This thing is almost as customizable as an AR which is awesome. Maybe I got lucky but the re-loader works great as long as I only fill it up about 3/4 full. More than that it jams up a little bit. This BB gun is heavy. With the magazine in, it weighs as much as my AR. My 9 year old loves shooting it. We've put 500+ BB’s through it with no issues. Would highly recommend this product! Quick update: I have found that in cold weather (approx 40-50F) this thing performs poorly. Which is pretty standard with CO2 guns. Shot consistency goes out the window and in full auto it has a tendency to run without locking the slide back. I'm going to guess that this is from the bolt not being sent far enough back because of the lack of pressure. Heating up the CO2 cartridges restores the fun.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: Not a bad airgun. It's very fun to shoot, the blowback is a cool feature but reduces the amount of shots per co2 cartridge. I do wish I had handled one before purchase, if I would have I may not have got it. Umarex makes one I would like to try, at half the price it may be a better value. The body of this is plastic with some weighted pot metal parts, it throws the balance way off. The sights are plastic and there is no elevation adjustment, for the price they could have included all metal, fully adjustable sights. Would have also been better to make the muzzle thread something common, 14mm ccw is fairly common with airsoft though so adding a metal muzzle accessory may help with the balance. As stated, it is fun to shoot, especially on full auto. They could have designed the mag a little different and made capacity 40 or 50, 25 goes really fast. I have seen several reviews saying the speed loader is worthless, I personally think its awesome. It takes a couple times to mesh it right at first but is pretty slick once you get the hang of it. Loading is pretty easy even without the speed loader though.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: I am so glad I spent the extra money and bought the one with the red dot scope. It's a perfect replica of a real AR15, the fully automatic function is unreal and just awesome, being able to dial in the scope is great, it's built extremely well, and is surprisingly realistic from its weight, its size, the magazine, the red dot scope, etc. I half-expected it to feel fake, not shoot well, have cheap plastic parts, and boy was I wrong. You will not be disappointed.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: I have owned bb guns (specifically co2 for about a year) the biggest issue I have come across is proper lubrication on those moving parts and properly putting in your co2. Keyword. Properly. These are still engineered to shoot a .177 bb, not a bullet. Their parts are constantly frozen by the co2 passing through making them run cold. Some metal composites under extreme cold temps and constant beating snap. By following all co2 cautions and ensuring you know which moving parts require special care. Let's move on to the best part. This gun shoots darn good. Solid kick. Trigger feels great and switching between semi and full auto is just pure fun. The stock extends fine. ADD A PROPER SIGHT FOR OPTIMAL ACCURACY. Keep it at 25 yards or under. Cons: The clip is stiff and dont click with satisfaction. This is in pure comparison to the CAK1. That clip locks in with a satisfying click. So... On this DPMS, make sure to slap that clip at the bottom! Make sure its firmly in place. Once figures not such huge con. Overall, this is a great bb rifle to get serious into plinking. If you dont take care of this DPMS SBR expect a jam or it not firing all together. However dont panic. Watch some videos, SEE WHAT YOU CAN DO FIRST BEFORE BLAMING THE PRODUCT. This particular item is one of those. Last thoughts. Feel like this is a but much. Get the cak1 first! Then move to this one. Cheers fellow plinkers. (***never recommended for self defense or to harm others***)

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Don't run around the neighbourhood with this
review_text: This thing is sick! It came and I was all excited. I opened the box and was like, crap I'ma end up in trouble. It doesn't look like an Airsoft. So don't go walk around the neighbourhood with it. Or town. Or anywhere public that doesn't let you shoot these at each other. Heavy, great build and easy breakdown for cleaning. Iron sights are nice for plastic. "Heavy duty" railings are solid. Very happy with the buy. Shot kinda wonky the first clip or 2 but once worn it it's had no issues. Plenty of room for all the attachments. You want this. You know you do. Oh, clips are $50 each. Painful lol but helpful if you want full auto.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Great gun ruined by a poor accessory - edited
review_text: I was excited to get this after all the hype I saw online. It arrived and I was all set to try it out, but the speed loader malfunctioned. When depressing the feed shaft it immediately got stuck and would not move. I know about the special attachment to hold the magazine slide back while feeding in the BBs. I have several Airsoft guns and bout eight speed loaders, all work perfectly. This is a problem in manufacture or design, I tried several things to get it to work but it wouldn't. It made loading the magazine very cumbersome, a latch to hold the feed spring back while inserting BBs into the magazine would have been a simple design feature to make loading BBs in simpler. I will contact Crossman to see if there's a fix for the speed loader and maybe I can give this the five stars I would have liked to. With all the time I spent trying to get the speed loader to work it got dark so I wasn't able to shoot it much. Contacted both vendor and Crosman, both gave quick response. Some BBs are larger than others and will not feed as well, Crosman said to add a few drops of airgun oil. After working it a while I can now get it to feed. It appears to be a copy of the Umarex BB speed loader, slight grip shape difference but internals are identical (I took both apart). So now the speed loader works I can happily shoot this gun and it's a lot of fun!

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: This was an impulse buy and I immediately regretted it. I left it in the box for weeks before getting it out when the ammo shortage hit and live fire practice got very expensive. There is no doubt it looks and feels like my other AR's but a cooler Short Barreled variant. The plastic sights are a bit naff so I bought a $30 red dot for it and started to practice IDPA Pistol Caliber Carbine runs at the range. And under 25 yards there is no practical difference between practicing with this and a 9mm carbine. Neither recoil, so the only real difference is noise and cost. And cost is a big difference at the best of times, and right now it's the difference between practicing and NOT practicing. And full auto is a real hoot, although that was not the reason i bought it. For reference I get over 75 shots from the two 12oz CO2 capsules, outdoors at about 40F. I have yet to shoot it in the summer months, but i expect more shots then.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Almost more fun than allowed by law!
review_text: Let's get the negative items out of the way first, okay? One, the User's Guide. I literally had to get a magnifying glass out to read it! SUPER tiny (i.e. 1 pt., maybe, font size) letters. Two, the "mystery tool" that's included, and never mentioned in the guide. Turns out, it's a really spiffy (we're into positive comment territory now, kids) speed loader! Dump a pile of BBs into the hopper, use the hook bit on the bottom to drag the mag slider down and the plunger dump 5 BBs at a time for you. So, overall, this is a nice toy. Weight and recoil are like the real deal. Front sight post if WAY too tall, but once you compensate for that, it holds a zero nice nobody's business. Great tool for CQB drills and the like, while less expensive than actual 5.56.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: IGNORE PEOPLE WHO ARE COMPLAINING. As long as you lubricate prior to use, and maintain the rifle ( like you would with a real AR ), you should be fine. I suspect most people didn't do that - hence why they have so much trouble with it. You wouldn't drive your car without oil - so why wouldn't you lubricate working metal parts? Don't buy this for accuracy. Buy it for fun. CONS: ( -1 ) - Accurate to about 10 feet. After that, expect the equivalent of spray and pray. Be prepared to cant your shots at anything over 20 feet away.[ - C02 canisters last for around 8-9 loads, then will be fairly useless. Be prepared to buy in bulk - Very little power - zero penetration at distance. - Reloading is a PITA. Reloader is useless. - Additional Mags are expensive, but they also hold CO2 - Plastic sights should be removed asap. They are useless for accuracy. -6 points PROS (x2 ) - This is SO MUCH FUN!! - Reloading is easier if you manually load BBs. A straw will be helpful to hold the BBs. - Single-shots will yield 15% more C02 than full auto. - Decent control when shooting in bursts of 3-4 bbs. - Expect 8-10" of accuracy at 40ft for the first 50 shots in semi-auto. PROS (+1) - As long as you APPLY lubrication to the tops of CO2 canisters ( oil not provided ), you should get a decent lifespan from the rifle. - Compared to my 4 ARs - this feels REAL. You can also add a faux reverse threaded barrel shroud at the end to eliminate the SBR aesthetic. It has the right weight, the right balance. - Breaks down just like a real AR. Pop two pins, remove "BCG" and clean/lube for longer life. Use charging handle, fire select, mag eject, or BCG release just like a real AR. *forward assist is only there for aesthetics. - C02 cartriges are WAY cheaper than 5.56mm rounds. - Rail is plastic, but it will easily accomodate a holo or other optics. Add a cheap ACOG style scope, you can achieve a decent aesthetic if you so desire. +15 Overall - This is a 10. I can't emphasize how much fun this is.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Great for testing real gun accessories
review_text: This is a lot of fun and worth the money. If you have a real gun this is great for testing accessories in the back yard. It is a very realistic copy of a real AR-15. Only problem is it comes with a very useful "autoloader" for the BBs. However if the spring lock mechanism releases while using the autoloader to load BBs you can accidentally put BBs into the spring which is a fatal mistake and makes the loading magazine useless as well as the gun! You can only extract the BBs by expanding the spring so the BBs can fall out. Small scissors or scissor like tweezers used in a way to expand the spring can extract the BBs. Trouble is if you stretch the spring too much it will become very difficult to retract to lock it in place and load BBs. I gave up and ordered a new magazine for $50 and threw the original away. This is a common problem if you review comments on line. Also the trigger pull on this is way too hard. But it's worth all the trouble.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: This is a fun little knock off of my AR's. It is so fun to teach my sons how to shoot with. The mechanics of the gun duplicate my AR and i am able to teach them how to properly work the platform. Due to its applicability, i am able to teach the boys how to keep the gun in their workspace and operate everything. It does get a little off target as CO2 cartridges get low, however, this is and should be expected. And i also read several comments on the speed loader being "crap," well, i bought four guns and everyone of them work to near perfection and the loaders do as well. All i can say is make sure you are reading the instruction booklet and oiling the sills as stated. Have fun.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: A little weightey compared to my actual AR but solid rifle!
review_text: This thing has been pretty cool so far! Considering Covid, I haven't had the chance to run it at the field yet, but for idle fun. Its been fine, reliable and consistent opetations-wise. The issue I've personally had is how heavy the mags are, I can pick up mags for my actual AR, and they're about half the weight. Granted, I can understand why considering the CO2 canisters are in there and need to have a good seal, which as odd as it seems, it's s a cool idea. Run out of gas? Change mags and you're back in the fight. One thing I am a little salty about is how expensive the extra mags are, $50 a mag is a little steep, but, again, I can understand why I guess.

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_header: Long Way from the Old Red Ryder!!!
review_text: This was quite a surprise...clean accuracy....quiet...and just amazing on rodents!!!! Wish it came in a miniaturized version my Chipmonks could use against those aggressive Red Squirrels!! In the meantime my "Chippy's" have Me!!!

product_title: DPMS Full Auto SBR CO2-Powered BB Air Rifle with Dual Action Capability, Flat Dark Earth DSBRFDE Black/FDE, Caliber: .177
review_text: Bought this for my boyfriend. Super fun & thick, heavy, durable, and accurate.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: I bought a toaster ten years ago for $10, and I wondered if I would use it enough to be worth it. Well, I used that toaster at least 4 or 5 times a week for the last 10 years, until it would go on when you pressed the button, but then would stay on, until you unplugged it. Toward the end, it was SO frustrating. I had to replace it, and I wanted something that would be frustration-free. So, this time, I got a toaster that's perfect. You can see what's happening with your toast through the window. If you set the dial too low, and your toast isn't brown enough, there's a button that lets you give it a few seconds more of toasting. Just enough to turn nearly white, but heated bread into beautiful toast. And I love the bagel setting that just toasts the side you can see, not both sides. I haven't tried the defrost setting yet. But the best control on the toaster is the button in the middle of the dial that will just make it stop toasting and pop the bread up if you can see that it's getting darker than you want it. And it REALLY pops the bread up, usually, it goes airborne just enough to sit on the top of the toaster and stay warm. Read the instructions because there are some buttons that aren't available on most toasters. Once you understand the controls, it's easy to just make perfect toast.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: I hesitated buying this product after reading some of the reviews. Fortunately I did it. It looks great and works very well. The heating elements are 4 bars along the bottom and top of the appliance -not the flimsy wires in other toasters, and it works great. The toast comes consistently done and you can decide which setting to have by just looking as the bread toasts. When it looks the color you want. Bing. that is the setting. Some reviews referred to the size, not being able to put two slices of bread at the same time. For most breads (and bagels), that is not a problem, but some brands of bread have a wider top and I found that 2 slices bearly fit. No big deal -after the toaster has toasted one slice, the next is quite quick (as the elements are still warm). It looks great and clean.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: Have used this toaster for about 5 months now. I really like to try products in a variety of ways before writing a review. Had owned my last Oster horizontal toaster for about 20 years and hated to trash it primarily because the crumb tray plastic holding tabs broke. Pros: Wide range of settings expressed in numerical form for ease of repeating Bagel setting works well for one sided toasting of bagels and English Muffins Crumb tray is super easy to remove, clean and replace. Defrost cycle helps me toast a frozen waffle without burning the edges. Toasts consistently for 1 slice or two. Grandchildren think it's cool to watch it toast. Cons: Activating lever on the end required open positioning on counter instead of my place of choice.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: You can see how toasted the bread, muffin or bagel is without ejecting the item to check.
review_text: It really matters to be able to visually see how much toasting has happened without ejecting the toast which cools the toaster, and if you keep an eye on it there is no way you can burn your toast. It is too soon though to evaluate the more advanced features otherwise. This toaster in fact has such a wide slot it is virtually impossible to image anything typically toasted that won't fit in it. Today we used it with toaster waffles. The top opening is 1-1/2 inches wide and the width is almost 10-1/2 inches. At least 1/4 inch of the width is restricted by guide wires in the device, but how many things do you have greater than 1-1/4 inches thick to toast. Of course do not put in anything that will melt or cause a hazard. You do not want to have to figure out how to clean up a sticky mess inside a toaster of any type. It is though ideal for toasting bread before buttering and frying it to make grilled cheese on a frying surface. For that I use a pancake griddle myself, but by toasting the bread before buttering both sides lets it keep proper shape as you turn over and combine the bread with cheese in between. It also adds a crispness that is missing from most done by restaurants.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: I got this in black and it is freakin’ beautiful. I mean...it’s a toaster so you are probably wondering what’s so great about a toaster? It just toasts bread, right? WRONG. It beautifully and wonderfully toasts bread and it’s settings are perfection. You can toast bread, English muffins, bagels...even has a reheat button for when your treat has grown cold. It has a window, which can be removed for easy cleaning, where you watch your bread, brown so effortlessly. Easy to clean crumb tray that glides out from the side. BUT the thing that makes it a star for me, above all the other great features mentioned above, it’s not the normal bulky looking toaster that just takes up room on your counter. This is longer and more narrow, in fact, the bread sits in the same slot, not two individual slots. The design gives this a streamlined appearance...clean lines and no bulk. It can sit against your counters backsplash, freeing up valuable space. Whomever designed this is like the the Frank Lloyd Wright of toaster architecture! I sound like I’ve been compensated for my review. I can assure you, I have not. I just love to right a great review for something that has exceeded my expectations!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Good looking, well working toasting machine!
review_text: This toaster is so cool! It looks super nice. I love the window where you can see how done your roast is. Defrost feature works very well on frozen waffles. It fits all different kind size and thickness of bread, which is one of my favorite features. As others have mentioned, lighter/smaller pieces of bread might catapult out of it, but I’ve only had one toast actually fall behind the toaster. Mostly it will just land sideways on top for you to grab- I guess I can count it as unintended feature. Honestly, doesn’t bother me at all! Slices raise up quite high so even the smallest bread will be easily reachable. (I guess that’s why some slices jump so high!). It warms up quick and is easy to keep clean. I decided to get this toaster, because we got their mini waffle maker some two years ago and it has been such a good quality fun thing to use! I really feel like I can trust the Dash make! Ok gotta go eat my toasts!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: After a much more expensive brand changed their double long slot toaster, several years back, I've had a hard time finding a decent toaster that could toast sour dough bread well, EUREKA, I have found it! The only thing that would make it better is if it was a long double slot, but it toasts really well and pretty evenly. One side gets a touch darker than the other but it is subtle. I love being able to watch it through the window and get it toasted to perfection. If there is any such thing as a toast snob, it is me, and I highly approve of this toaster.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Pretty good with a few flaws.
review_text: If you want a unique-looking toaster, this is a good option. The extra long, sideways orientation allows it to remain on the counter without taking up much space. The window and overall exterior design elements are nice, so it looks good if you do leave it out. The only complaint about the design is that the tray that holds the bread is pitched downward when the handle is not depressed. Because there is a window, when the toaster is not in use, you can see the metal tray angling downward. It's not a huge deal, but it ruins a bit of the aesthetic. The function is typical but comes with a few minor issues. In order to use the reheat or bagel settings, you depress the handle and start toasting normally - then press the button for those specialty functions. Again, minor, but it would be better to select that option first. Second, the slot is about an inch too short to be able to toast 2 large pieces of bread at once time. If you make homemade bread or buy "double-wrapped) breads like Brownberry/Pepperidge Farm, you have to orient one up and one down and then squish them in. Toasting quality is fine, but is not completely even. I did have an issue with product quality. The first toaster I received only lasted a few months before the front toasting element broke. I was able to get it exchanged and the new unit has worked without issue for the two months I have had it. Overall, I feel the minor issues are overcome by the appearance and I would recommend it for anyone who wants a unique looking toaster - just know that there are a few issues that could be a deal-breaker for some.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: I sooo wanted this to work...with update
review_text: I read the reviews on this before I ordered it but so desperately wanted it to have been a fluke THEY ordered and mine would come out alright. Nope. I LOVE that this toaster would accomodate the miriad of artisan breads I bake and still be able to toast a bagel so I ordered one. When it arrived, I plugged it in and poof....there are 4 heating elements and only one fired up. Having been in electronics in the AF, I thought its just a loose wire somewhere so messed with it a bit and poof, all 4 elements lit up. But then it would not latch down the handle in the on position.....then the three other elements went back out again. Major league bummed, MAJOR. If they would just spend a little more time on QC, they would have a GREAT product. Until then, dont do it....step away from the toaster, its just not going to work out... UPDATE: I requested and promptly received a replacement toaster for the one that didnt function properly....and I am DELIGHTED with it! This truly is the toaster of my dreams and I LOVE it. If you get a toaster with problems, request a replacement....it is worth it! I make artisan breads and it is IDEAL for them and my English muffins. LOVE the see-thru window.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: I really do love this - No more burned toast
review_text: I read the reviews and was a bit worried about the strong pop-up at the end. It is pretty strong but most things have enough weight that they do not get launched. There was an issue mentioned with the handle being faulty but the manufacturer has included directions on how to properly reassemble the toaster when the window has been removed for cleaning. It appears this was the issue. To address the orange glow that makes it difficult to read how well the toast is done that just takes a couple of times to figure it out. If you have any common sense you will have this down in no time at all. The only issue i have had is that the toast seems to more dry the bread out than toast it. Even as i am writing that it sounds odd but it is a very minor issue. I do love this toaster. IT also toasts English Muffins better than any toaster i have ever had. I put it in on low and toast it once and then once again on the bagel setting.. it works like a dream. I would definitely buy this toaster again. I do not know why i waited so long before buying it this time.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: I LOVE this toaster! Mine is aqua. It's adorable, plus it's efficient. I've been baking my own bread, thanks to covid, and to keep it fresh I immediately freeze my bread pre-sliced. I pop in a frozen slice into the toaster, hit the defrost button, and a short time later out pops my perfectly defrosted, toasted slice of bread. Because my loaves are oversized, I usually turn the toast top to bottom and hit the reheat button to make sure the top and bottom are toasted equally, since sometimes the size of the slice extends out the top of the toaster. Since the opening is long to fit two slices side-by-side, rather than one in each opening, I can fit long slices of sourdough in the toaster easily. The crumb tray underneath is easy to remove and empty. Honestly, you can keep your expensive Dualit toasters. This one has just as much style, and is better designed (with the one long opening) and you can't beat the price. Three cheers to Dash!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Amazing artwork that also makes toast!
review_text: Received the toaster today and found it easy to set up. The extra long, single slot is quite spacious, and accomidates 2 standard need slices easily. I found the ingenious inclusion of the glass protector behind the view window easy to extract so cleaning your view will be less of a chore (I have yet to hear if it is dishwasher safe.) Overall, the soft orange glow during toasting is soothing and almost like watching art. The spring is powerful enough to fully extricate the toast, and at least at the moment, setting it a little under 4 gives me a nice, even, golden brown on both sides. I have yet to try out the defrost, reheat, and bagel functions, but I imagine Taco Bell leftovers will work nicely in a foil wrap for reheating. Overall, great job on a well designed toaster, and the aqua that I bought to save a few bucks actually looks nice.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: So far we like it. Very even browning
review_text: So far we like it. Very even browning. Perhaps takes a little longer to make toast. Be sure to use the Cancel button (in the end of the darkness selector wheel) instead of forcing the lever up. I suspect some people had issues because they forced the handle up when they wanted to cancel.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: This toaster was rated the best (under $100) toaster on the market by Americas Test Kitchen. I jumped up to order it, and apparently, everyone watching the show did as well. It took a while to get it, but what's the rush, and it was worth waiting for. My old toaster made by a quality brand, smelled so bad I thought twice before I would use it. This never had a smell. There are lots of settings for how toasted you want it and best of all you can see how brown it's getting through the window. It toasts on one side for bagels. I haven't used defrost or reheat, yet. The packaging was truly creative and functional. The box is well secured, but I didn't have to get a pair of scissors and I didn't break a fingernail opening it up. The literature is fun and easy to read. Excellent experience all around and for years to come.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: I love this toaster so much
review_text: I love this toaster so much. Let me just say that I read ALL the reviews - for every toaster. I needed one that was longer, that could manage bread that was wider than your average piece of wonder bread. Seriously, how they did decide on 5.5 inches as the standard when most decent grain breads are larger than that... then there’s SF sourdough so dont even get me started. I bought hideously expensive models and they disappointed. So I thought, this is a cheaper toaster... what do I have to loose? Best toast decision Ive made to date. I almost fear giving this toaster such a glorious review for fear that something will go wrong. I put it through the paces, even with frozen hamburger buns. Perfect. It also looks lovely on my counter.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Good toaster. Nice quality. Sometimes under toasts but form factor makes up for it.
review_text: I bought this at Christmas. I've had it for almost 6 months now. Initial impressions were good. Its nice quality. Instruction manual was impressive for a toaster. Packaging and Branding on spot. I've used it for Bagels and toast and frozen waffles. I found my only complain with is sometimes it under toasts. 7 should be dark ALL THE TIME, not 80% of the time. When it does under toast it's on the first cold toast of the day. Maybe the machine thermostat needs to warm up, I don't know. I'd expect it on second or third consecutive back to back toast, but its always the first one. That's the only flaw with it. Oh and I eat big bread. It won't hold two slices nicely, so one slice gets in front of other causing a cold un toasted spot. I guess if it was bigger it would be too big. I really like the form factor and the fact that its easy to clean. Looks very good on my counter with the other black appliances. Window is easy to see in for desired level of toasting. Overall, the consistency is the only flaw and I don't think that is enough to ding a whole star. Maybe half stars. I'd give it 4.5 / 5 stars.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: What a neat little toaster. After reading the reviews and laughing at the flying toast warnings, I went ahead and pulled the trigger. My "51 Chevy Belair (aka Aqua) toaster landed on my doorstep 2 days later. The long slot design neatly toasts large oval artisan bread slices. 4 quartz lights replace the old fashioned heating wire, to toast evenly and fast. The window allowing one to watch the toasting progress is just plain neat. So, did my toast do a high jump worthy of an Olympic gold medal? It not only jumps high out of the toaster, it lands on top! Whether I toast artisan bread, sandwich loaf, or plain old "bread", it all jumps out of the toaster, and lands on top, unfailingly. This entertainment alone is worth the price of admission. Maybe we should all get together for an annual bread jumping contest. So, if you like toast and have a sense of humor, this is your toaster. BTW, it's also very nice looking on the counter.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: I'm in love with my everything Ciabatta rolls AGAIN!
review_text: I love Ciabatta everything rolls toasted with my breakfast. Toasting this little beauties are not an easy task for a toaster. Because of this love, I have bought $199 EU gourmet toasters, state of the art digital $100+ toasters, toasters with 5-Star reviews - name name it I've probably owned it. All for the quest of a morning toasted everything Ciabatta roll. In desperation I've all but given up on my search. But this little Dash Clear View toaster was on Prime pricing. Intrigued with the modern look and open window, I had that toaster in my Prime Day cart 5 or 6 times. I had bought so many items on Prime Day I lost track of this little toaster and really didn't recall it in any order I bought. So i was surprised with it delivered just a day later and am I glad it did. Take a look at these pics - on bagel setting an #7 on the dial. FINALLY A TOASTER THAT MAKES FLAWLESS EVERYTHING CIABATTA ROLLS! And at that super duper Prime Day price...the toaster itself fits perfectly with my modern kitchen decor! Note in the pics the even toasting. The back and inside were soft and yummy with that toasted crunchy front. And realize the top and the bottom are NOT the same thickness. Who would have thought? BTW I also own a Dash egg cooker. I'm really impressed with Dash products. Their designs are great and quality control is clearly on top of their list. I'll be looking for other Dash products on Amazon.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: At first, I was a little disappointed with how plastic-y this looks (more so in red than white) but it looks fab from across the room, and plastic keeps the sides from getting scorching hot. I bought two of these, one for my celiac son to use, and one for regular bread to prevent contaminating son's food with gluten - so it was important to me that the toasters do not take up too much counter space. These fit the bill nicely and they do a better job than I thought they would. I can toast mini-bagels and retrieve them without having to poke something inside the toaster to get them out, and I can toast door-step slices of tall bread. There's a rod that glows along the top and bottom of each side of the toaster which (so far) do a good job of evenly toasting. I haven't tried yet, but apparently you can pop the side out to clean the glass which I hope means it will be easier to clean out if/when a piece of food breaks off inside (a common hazard with gluten free foods as they can be fragile).

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: It's very pretty. Mine is white. The window gives a warm glow when the toaster is on. The toast setting is accurate. We like it at 4.5 The only disappointment is that I can't put two pieces of the large slices in Dave's White Bread Done Right. It has to go on it's side or the top inch is above the heating elements. --Not a great disappointment as we usually do only one slice at time. I bought because of the review on America's Test Kitchen on YouTube. It was selected as the Best Buy. Their only drawback was that toast can be ejected from the toaster on pop-up. It hasn't been a problem for me, often I place the plate on the edge of the toaster to warm it. Toast is held in. Toaster is on the back of the counter, so toast, if ejected, falls in back of the toaster. It's less likely to happen with two slices toasted together.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: Toaster ownership being one of the undeniable benchmarks of adulthood, I searched for several months to uncover the perfect bread-warming unicorn — retro, stylish, functional, affordable, well made and more technologically advanced than a $10 dorm unit. This was all those things and I'm certainly happy I waited. I actually enjoy seeing this thing sitting on my countertop. I'm too old (and clearly grown up) to care, but I know if I had had this thing when I was 8, I would definitely have been staring through that window every morning, watching my bread deliciously brown. I can attest, however, to other user's complaints about the strength of the spring. Doesn't bother me at all — I'd much rather have too much spring than not enough. But you'll likely want to keep this thing towards the back of your counter or your perfectly heated bread will be perfectly heating the floor.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Great toaster, well worth the money
review_text: Initially, we wanted a 4 slice toaster to replace our 6 year old discontinued West Bend Toaster with Egg Cooker which was barely browning the bread and popping it up. After seeing the ATK equipment review video for toasters on YouTube, we splurged and got the Dash toaster, and we're really happy with it because, after figuring out which setting (which is 3) gave perfectly browned toast, we could reheat the bread or bagel if it had cooled too much, or reheat it to get it a little more browned, which saves arguing about who turned the setting up or down. Nothing is worse than burning your last slice of bread because someone failed to tell you they turned up the darkness setting the day before. As other reviewers have stated, the toast gets ejected with excess force. It's so strong, that the toast has landed about a foot from the cabinets on the floor, which is funny as our previous toaster didn't make it 10 years, and barely popped. We're looking forward to seeing how long this toaster lasts.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: put it on setting seven and it came out perfect. I did try it on lower settings and ...
review_text: My main objective in buying a toaster is to get one that can toast evenly. This one does. I used a frozen piece of bread, put it on setting seven and it came out perfect. I did try it on lower settings and it didn't come out quite as evenly though. I'm very happy with it. Hope this helps.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: LOVE THIS TOASTER! I can’t believe that I’ve gotten so excited over a toaster!
review_text: I LOVE THIS TOASTER! It makes great toast. I can’t believe that I’ve gotten so excited over a toaster. I haven’t been able to find a durable, reasonably priced toaster that could accommodate long slices or bagels, etc. Additionally, I have had to be gluten-free for the last 10 years and gluten-free bread has to be carefully toasted in order to be good. All the toasters I have ever owned had those fragile, thin wires that heat up & glow to toast the bread. And when they broke, which they inevitably did, the bread toasted unevenly. THIS TOASTER has unique coils in the bottom, so that you would expect unevenly toasted bread. BUT NO! It’s the most perfectly toasted bread I’ve had in 30 years. (I can’t remember past that!) I would have liked to have had 2 slots, but I’m guessing that the bread would not toast as evenly with 2 slots. After a little trial & error, you can learn & dial your preferences for each type of bread you like. And you can watch through the window to see your desired brownness. Now, many have complained about the toaster ejecting the toast when done. It happened once for me, so I picked it up off of my clean counter top and put it on the plate! One piece does often jump out of the slot onto the top of the toaster! It’s actually amusing! It puts a smile on my face and a little happy in my day! DID I MENTION THAT I LOVE THIS TOASTER!??!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: Easy and intuitive to use. Many feature upgrades from a standard toaster, yet not complicated with a bunch of electronic controls...you do not need a user manual to make toast! Clear viewing window is really nice as you can see if the toast, pastry, etc is browning properly. The push-button "Cancel" control allows you to stop toasting or heating without having to pull up on the main control handle. The heat controls are accurate and it has a different setting for thick, dense,items like bagels. The racks on the inside of the toaster move inward to fently grip the item being heated so that it does not fall over inside the toaster, such as a biscotti. The ejection of the heated items is gentle and the inside rack rises up enough so that the finished item can be easily gripped and removed without having to reach inside the toaster. I could live with this toaster forever and I have found no complaints yet. Easy to clean.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Plug it in. Plug it in. Plug it it.
review_text: I got it a week ago and after reading all reviews stating the toast lever does not latch the first thing out of the box I did was try the lever; it didn't latch. The latch is electric; a electric magnet! Plug it it in and try it before returning it it. The crumb tray is a safety, make sure it a all the way in. The long version; After 45 minutes with a rep who was trying hard to be helpful but not trained to know what he's helping with, I took to cover off to realize it's not a timer or mechanical latch but a magnetic latch that only works when plugged in. I put it back together and plugged it in. It works just fine. Oh dang it! I could have saved everyone time and could ahve been having buttered toast on honey toast all week if I had just plugged it it in.😲

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: I like everything about this toaster!
review_text: After 20+ yrs, our toaster finally gave up the ghost. I went looking for the same brand, but they don't make toasters anymore. I took quite awhile researching other brands, and then came across this one; different and interesting, with its long shape and see-through window. The reviews were good overall, so I bought it. We use our toaster alot and have been using this one for about a month, now, and just love it! The see-through window is perfect if you toast different types and thicknesses of bread. No flipping up the toast to see if it's done or waiting til you see smoke to know you went too far. It toasts very evenly, much better than our old one. You can easily fit 2 slices of bread or 4 pcs (2 buns, cut in half) of the smaller hamburger buns, side by side, into this toaster, and each piece toasts perfectly evenly. At first I wondered about the long length taking up more counter space, but it really doesn't because it's so much thinner than the traditionally shaped "thick slice" toaster it replaced. It not only performs well, it's also a nice looking toaster (I got black, mostly because it was a few dollars cheaper than the other colors), and people are always very intrigued when they see it. As other reviews have mentioned, it does pop up with considerable force, and sometimes (not very often), the bread will jump right out of the toaster, more so if toasting small, light weight pieces like half slices of small buns. In spite of that, I really like this unit and give it 5 stars. The only thing I CAN'T rate yet is how long it will last. I have my doubts it'll still be pumping out toast in 20-25 yrs like the old one (things never seem to last like their predecessors anymore), but we'll see. In the meantime, this gets all thumbs UP!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: Cons: It has a tendency to launch small single slices out of the toaster Pros: Easy to clean, with a crumb catcher that actually gets most of the crumbs Very consistent toasting: the second batch comes out the same as the first The viewing window is a great idea and well executed My old toaster's primary function was to get crumbs on the counter (no matter how often I emptied it) so I'm particularly pleased with the crumb tray on this toaster. It catches all the crumbs, is easily removable without moving the toaster and is easy to clean. The darkness is very consistent: The same bread with the same setting gets the same darkness every time, even if you do two batches in a row. The viewing window is a great feature. You can really see what's happening. The window is double pane for insulation. The inner pane is removable for cleaning, but it doesn't need to be cleaned very often. The toast lifter is a little over-enthusiastic. A single normal sized slice of bread will often leave the toaster, especially if the toaster isn't on a level surface. On the rare occasion when I make a single slice I just put a plate in front of the toaster and call it a feature, but I can see how it could annoy some people.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Great space saver, evenly toasts, looks great!
review_text: The main reason I purchased this toaster over others is because it fits into the space of my previous toaster. I wanted something long and not wide and this fit the bill. But what I really like about this toaster is being able to see how it's toasting through the window, something you can't do on most toasters. I find that helpful because I don't like my toast too crusty and brown, but on the other hand I don't want it barely toasted, either. This is particularly helpful when I put in thinner or larger breads/rolls/bagels. The thin pieces of bread can burn pretty quickly using the same setting I would use for a medium thickness slice of bread. I love the color, the toast settings are easy to set, and it's great to monitor the progress rather than waiting to smell burning toast to know that I've got the setting too high. Feels very well made (even better than my Braun, which I had for more than 10 yrs). I would recommend it if you want to save on counter space and also see your bread as it toasts.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: I had a 2-slice toaster with a wide slot that would toast bagels and was long enough to wide pan breads. It began burning our toast and needed to be replaced. We had a very hard time finding a toaster with one long, wide slot like the one we had. This toaster was half the price of other toasters and has a window so you can see your item toasting. It handles frozen items such as waffles and English muffins easily. It toasts whatever we put in it perfectly with a hot ceramic rod down each side. I'm not sure how it toasts so evenly, but it does. I'm very happy with this toaster.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Best toaster I have ever owned!
review_text: This is the best toaster I have ever owned. I had been wanting to purchase a far more expensive toaster (roughtly three times the cost of this one), but those are out of stock. My old KitchenAid toaster bit the dust, and toast is something we make daily, so we needed something. After doing some research, this DASH toaster appeared to rank well in several comparison ratings, and the price was certainly right. I am so glad I bought this one and not the one I thought I wanted! First, the toast is very evenly done and the controls are as simple as it gets. The toast pops vigorously when it's done, not just a lackluster pop, but one that will actually eject a very small piece of toast. The housing is thick, and sturdy plastic that reminds me of some vintage appliances. The controls also feel sturdy. Most of all, the window! Oh My God is that genius! Perfect toast every time! I could not be happier with this purchase!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: Hate to say it (because who does that) but I love this toaster. The quartz heating elements are so much better than the old wire ones on cheaper toasters. Even toast, every time, Love the reheat feature. Puts the heat back in to the toast without getting it any darker. I was going to plunk down serious $ on a Breville or something else, but just couldn't justify it. Cons: 1) If you use wide toast (Peppridge farms, Arnold, etc) you can't QUITE fit two slices in lengthwise, Standard square-profile toast will fit 2 slices just fine. 2) It's fairly plasticky. For the price, it's what's to be expected. 3) crumb tray doesn't catch all crumbs, so you'll have to clean up underneath a bit more than you expect. Other than these niggles, it's a great toaster.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Great support for those that have "failed" units...
review_text: Have you tried contacting support? Dash have great US based live phone and email customer support. My unit stopped working 2 months after purchase. The lever wouldn't stay down to turn the unit on, no matter what I tried. 1. The product comes with a 1 year warranty 2. They have a product registration portal to extend the warranty for an additional year, for a total of TWO years. 3. They have email and phone support. 4. The person on the phone is US based. 5. The first thing the agent suggested was to remove and re-seat the glass pane. This is a feature that I was not aware of. It makes cleaning the toaster much easier. 6. The latch to remove the glass has a safety trigger that prevents the toaster from powering on without the glass in place. Re-seating the glass pane fixed the issue I was having. I would highly recommend this product. The support experience was exceptional.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: I bought this toaster after watching a Cooks Country review on toasters. It wasn't the most expensive one but it was their "best buy". I've only used it a couple of times, but it seems to work really well. I've re-heated bread and made toast. My last toaster (ok a $10 toaster) has little tiny heating elements, this one has 4 huge heating elements, it gets HOT. It toasts really fast, at least half the time of my previous toasters, like, you're getting the butter out of the fridge and the toast is ready. It toasts evenly, it takes up very little space on the counter, the glass is simple to pop out and clean, it all seems heavy duty and durable. Thank you Cooks Country for your reviews!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: We bought the $130 Breville toaster 3 years ago. It was a good toaster.. but 3 years later the electronics quit working. That is an expensive toaster to work for only 3 years. Also, the browning slowly deteriorated. We bought another toaster before this one - clearly (no pun intended) it was not the one (thank you Amazon for your generous return policy). Finally bought this one. The toasting elements are different on this toaster than others (obviously because there is no wire grid in front of the window) and they seem to work much better! The toast is evening toasted, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. And most important - the crumb tray is the BEST I have ever seen on any toaster. Catches all of the crumbs, easy to remove, and easy to replace. The window is meh.. I can take it or leave it. Once you get it set the window really doesn't do anything for you. The only thing I would change is to make it about 1/4 inch wider. We make all of our own bread in a bread machine. 2 slices will fit side by side in the slot, but just barely. So it totally works.. but it would be a bit less fiddly if it was slightly wider.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Review of 4 toasters - DASH toasts very evenly
review_text: I tried 4 long slot toasters with different bread types: Oroweat, Molly Stone Levain, ACME boule (walnut), Ezekiel (seeds), As Kneaded Bakery (flax), making 1 or 2 pieces at a time, Trader Joe’s pita. No toaster is perfect, but both the DASH and BREVILLE are good. DASH (1 slot): kept + you can see the toast while it gets done, toasts evenly. Outside stays cool to touch. Broad carriage holds even small/thin slices securely Did not stink (as many toasters do) from the get go. - toast jumps out if it’s a single, light slice (occasionally to the counter) Back side gets a tad more done than front. CUSIMAX Glass (1 slot): returned + The glass sides let you see the toast as it makes the toast. Toasts evenly. - Makes a ridiculously loud, aggravating beep when it's done. The outside gets hot to the touch. The motor driven carriage is slower and less convenient than a conventional lever/latch. Required 8 empty runs before it stopped smelling like burnt electric cables IKICH 4 (2 slots): returned + Outside remains cool to touch. - Toasts very unevenly, burns the edges, leaves the bread too chewy inside. Edge catches. Required 12 empty runs before it stopped smelling like burnt electric cables BREVILLE (2 slots): kept + led shows time left, can increase time and/or raise the toast to see it while it’s toasting. Toasts reasonably evenly (not as perfectly as the Dash), but fine. Outside stays cool “New toaster stink” went away in a couple empty runs. - tines are too narrow, so thin / small slices can fall inside, and then it’s hard to get them out.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: I was somewhat nervous when I went to use this new toaster this morning when it didn’t work was reboxing it to return when I can across and insert that said this is not damaged push in some lever on the bottom and Voila it worked, so far so good toasted by English muffin perfectly.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: If you need a toaster, this is the one.
review_text: There is nothing I do not like about this toaster so far. It is everything that as advertised except the launching of your toast into space. This unit pops up gently and relatively quietly without much fanfare. It seems to be well made and is easy to clean, the viewing window even comes out to clean...😎👍 Follow up.... have had this toaster for several months now and still love it. I have had two moon shots with the ejector seat but it was more comical that an issue. I do suggest that if you decide to eject ther toast early, that you place your finger just above the lever to let it up easy when you push the stop button and the problem is solved. Still give it 5 stars...

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: It's like having a sideways toaster oven for toast!!!!!! Since we have been purchasing items online over the past COVID YEAR, I take time now to research items I purchase. I think it's pretty funny that there are all these test kitchens for TOASTERS!!!!!!!!!! This one kept getting high marks and scored either #1 or #2 (a Breville beat it once but the Breville was also +$50 so...........). Some people have written that it flings their toast in the air, I use artisan bread and have not had an issue. It might do that with waffles as they are lighter but have not tried that yet, I just love how this is a narrow toaster and doesn't take up a lot of counter space. I got the red one and it looks great with our slate appliances!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Works Great. No more burned bagels!
review_text: Got this about a week ago and I’m VERY satisfied. I’ve had none of the issues other reviews mention, such bread getting launched out with too much force. No such issues with my Dash toaster. Things I love about it: 1) It has quartz rods that I’ve read are a more expensive, higher quality build than other heating elements. Heats up quickly and the toasting is even and the settings, reliable. Different bread densities require different settings. 2). I like the glass window a lot. I’ve burned a lot of toast and bagels and it’s so frustrating when you burn the very last one. The window is so helpful to gauge what setting to use in the future, for a particular type of bread. 3). I really like the design of one long slot. So much easier to toast Shepherds or Sourdough slices. 4. Nice wide slot is wide enough to toast a thick bagel or bun that’s been sliced in half. 5). Takes up minimal counter space because it sits horizontally against the backsplash. And it stays pretty cool. No problem heating up the nearby cupboards above or next to it. I paid a $10 more for it here on Amazon because I’ve had bad luck buying small appliances in a club store. The club store purchases always seem to have an issue. Maybe I’ve been unlucky? But this toaster, bought on Amazon has been a very good buy. I have no complaints! Just be sure to use the cancel button to pop up early! The lever is intended to push down only. CANCEL button to pop up!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_header: Everything I Wanted to Toast Just Right!
review_text: After a long and arduous search for a reasonably priced toaster to replace my husband's ancient cheapo plastic heap of junk, I came across this unique and beautiful toaster. Of all the toasters on Amazon (and believe me, I looked at them all, even the insanely expensive ones), I settled on this beauty for a number of reasons. First of all, it's design is unique and beautiful. I wanted the red but talked myself into the black because it's got to sit on the counter all the time. Only the top silver rectangle around the opening gets hot. I can touch both the window and the black plastic surround while cooking without discomfort. The window is both pretty and functional because you can gauge how you bread is toasting at any given time. We gave up on the last toaster because of how unevenly it cooked, and because my husband is fond of what my mother-in-law calls "warm bread not toast", it's important it doesn't get too brown for him. Having the window helps ensure that. Which leads to my next point... Even toasting. I chose this toaster because I could tell by looking if it was toasting evenly. I have had it for several months now with use 2-3 times a week, and my toast comes out just the way I want it to every time. My preferred setting is 3.5 on the dial. This gives me my ideal all-over light brown crunch that I enjoy. For my husband, 2 is the preferred setting--just a hint of brown across the bread with just a bit of a crunch. A 1 basically just warms the bread to melt soft butter--no crunch. I haven't tested anything higher, but based on those settings, I'd say lovers of a dark brown toast would be happy on the 5 setting. Who would use 7, I don't know. Ha! Indeed, the opening is wide enough to accept a bagel or thicker homemade slices of bread. The double-wide length and bigger opening was important to me because I'm delving into the world of bread making, and homemade loaves are imperfect and cannot readily fit into a traditional toaster. Extra wide loaf slices can fit in here if you do one at a time. Though many other toasters had all kinds of fancy high end features, this one had what we really needed. We have a toaster oven for pizza muffins and grilled cheeses so no need for sideways settings, and we don't do much more than toast, though this does have a defrost feature which I never use nor will I ever really use it (nothing to defrost). Be sure to unplug between uses to save yourself ye olde appliance energy drain!

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: Bought this in 2015 after trying many more expensive toasters. Going on 4 years and still works great. Latch stays down and love the fact you can see just how brown the toast is without having to raise it. I keep GF sliced bread in the freezer and pop in a slice frozen into the toaster on setting 6 1/2 and it comes out perfectly toasted every time. Price has increased however from $27 back in 2015 to $43. Still good value in my mind. If you're looking for a modern style functional toaster I'd recommend this one.

product_title: Dash Clear View Toaster: Extra Wide Slot Toaster with See Through Window - Defrost, Reheat + Auto Shut Off Feature for Bagels, Specialty Breads & other Baked Goods - Aqua
review_text: Let’s be real, we are talking about a toaster, a TOASTER! Why should anyone want to write a review of the most used and easiest to forget ancillary appliance you own?
