If this is going on a home defense weapon, you'll be able to illuminate the room you're in easily...and hallway...and the yard outside. Hell, your neighbors will see it.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: TL:DR bright, compact and light. Great buy
review_text: *UPDATE* OK I've had this about 6 months and it does great. Added photos of my back yard. The machinery is about 80-100 yards away and the dog is about 30-40 yards away. I've had this about 3 weeks now and I really like it. For ¼ the price of a stream light I got a pressure pad, mount, 2 batteries and a charger. It's really bright! So for indoors and CQB I'd say this is too bright. Outdoors is where it excels. It will easily light up to 300ft clearly and somewhat light up 500 ft or 0.1 miles. I was unsure buying this but I really like it on my AR15. It's mounted very far forward next to the muzzle brake and the lens has not shattered or anything. I do however reccomend thred locker on the mounting screws and mounting nut. Especially the nut that holds it to the rail. It likes to come loose. My only complaint is that there is no double sided tape or velcro to mount the pressure pad. It also comes with a standard click button rear cap if you do not want to run the pressure switch. The pressure switch its self is dual function. You can have momentarily on or click a button for permanently on. I find that very nice. I reccomend this over a surefire or any name brand for the price. If I ever break this I will definitely buy another. This light does get hot after about 10 mins of continuous use. I've run about 150 rounds through the AR15 with this light and it worked great . Night hunting for animals, I havent shot but have lit up a deer's eyes about 550 to 600 ft off my back porch in the field when my dog got agitated about something in the back yard. I think this is a great white light hunting light for nuisance animals. It doesnt add a lot of weight to the rifle and mounting it to the right side of my rifle I dont notice it is even there. TL:DR great bright light. Would buy again

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: Okay, right off, the boxing and 'shadow box' shipping package was great. Keeping this one for storage JIC. The light is 'aircraft aluminum,' grade, even as a A&P I don't know what metal they used, but still, VERY sturdy construction. It bolted right onto my ATI Bulldog 12ga, sitting directly in front of my red-dot: luckily the mount is an off-set style, also VERY sturdy, came with all the necessary hardware and an equally sturdy picatinny attachment bracket. It slid right onto my rail with no problem. Tightened down with no problems and it stayed tight even after running 50 rounds of 1350 FPS '00' buck and slugs through the Bulldog, slow and rapid fire. No retightening required, after. But of course I did, anyways, because I always do. Don't want hardware falling off at the wrong time. The light is plenty bright: blinded my neighbor at 30 yards and was "...annoying..." (his words) and made it so he couldn't see me, at 50 yds, which the Bulldog is sighted in for. So, blinding and then picking off boogiebuttbois and members of the Retarded 38 (and falling)% will be no problem. This is a great addition to your weapon. Tough, reliable and bright!

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: Very nice. A complete kit. I took a chance and I am quite surprised. The quality rivals any brand. Switches are crisp and positive. The beam is a focused center cone with a more than adequate, wide halo. Very functional. The accessories, charger, batteries, " item" mounts, are very good quality. For the price point no buyers remorse here. If you smash it or break it, you can afford another. Let's face it. These are intended to be mounted in a position that lends itself to abuse in real world use. Pictures with the same brand laser that I also purchased and reviewed.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: I have always debated putting a flashlight on my AR15 as it seems to me that it would make a fine target for an opposing force. I finally got tired of hearing those in the know say it was a must have and that brought me to this. I figured at a very fair price I could at least see what all the fuss was about. Turns out everyone is right. It could easily turn a blind situation into a darn near daylight situation. While it would give a bad guy something to aim at, it is bright enough that it would be difficult to look towards and is extremely intimidating as well. Looking clearly through a red dot into an otherwise black darkness is a remarkable thing. These lights are more than substantial. They are bright, seem rugged, operate smoothly and come with a high quality picatinny mount. In fact, I liked it so much that I had it less than a day before I ordered a second one for my AR10.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: I have many flashlights since its something I believe is a must to have. This light is great right out of the box. It seems to be well made and even though the batteries are not fully charged when you get it, the light is blinding in brightness. The switches are crisp and function well. This set comes with two batteries and a charger so that you always have a backup battery when needed. I needed a charger for my CR123a batteries so this is a definite bonus. So far I am very pleased with this purchase and I am sure it will function well as a tactical light.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: Great value and features, very bright!
review_text: The media could not be loaded. This tactical light is very impressive for the price. Construction seems solid, flashlight body is all aluminum and the pic mount is well made. Single operation on/off is practical for tactical use. Love that I can use it as a stand alone flashlight as well as a rifle mounted one. 2 rechargeable lithium ion batteries is a big money saver over disposable batteries.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: Bright light, long lasting battery. Read my full review
review_text: Its great that this comes with two batteries and a charger, excellent value. Also comes with a light mount for a pic rail. Takes 3 hours or so to charge 1 battery. Battery life is about 4 hours. Solid construction. Will update in a couple months to see how it holds up to my AR. Overall I would definitely recommend this light. ____________________________________________________________________________________ Mounted it on my AR-15 and took it shooting, I only shot around 60 rounds thru my AR with the light mounted then came back home. When I tried to turn it on it flickered, but would not turn on, I took the battery out and put it back in and then it turns on fine, I bumped the light with my fist and it turned off again. Taking the battery out and putting it back in made it function. I do have a muzzle brake on my AR and the light might've been mounted a little too close to it. I returned the defective one and got a replacement. I will mount the replacement farther away from my muzzle brake to see if that makes any difference. I don't believe the recoil of my rifle broke the light, I believe it was the concussion of my muzzle brake. I will update this review once I shoot my rifle with the replacement light on (mounted further away from my muzzle brake). _____________________________________________________________________________________________________ Been using this light for awhile now, its holding up great, batteries still last a very long time. After mounting the light behind my muzzle brake, I have no issues at all. Super bright, I would recommend this 100%, I am going to buy another one to put on my CZ Scorpion. My only advice is to mount this light a little bit before your muzzle device so it doesn't get hit by the concussion.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: This is a great light. Its very bright and the battery will last a long time. The kit comes with light, mount, 2 batteries, and a charger. The batteries are not like any I had seen before. Sorta like oversized AA batteries. But since they gie you the charger its not a big deal. I mounted mine to a picatinny rail on my rife. The momentary switch works great and has yet to fail me. It also has a 'full on' button. My only problem with the light is the switch covering material. Its a silicone rubber. And nothing sticks to it. So you have to get creative to mount the switch on the frame somewhere or it will just be dangling. I put velcro on the lower just above the mag well. And then cut a strip of the matching velcro and wrapped it around the switch like a sleeve and just stuck the 2 velcro parts together. That has held it in place so far and doesn't interfere with its function.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: It's pretty amazing what you get for 30 bucks these days. Not only are these lights INSANELY bright, they're also focus-adjustable, so you can have a really wide beam or a really tight beam. The pressure switch works well...the only thing that worries me a bit is the cord on the pressure switch (specifically, where it goes into the end cap on the flash light), so we'll see how well that holds up over time with repeated battery changes. And even if it does break, the light comes with a push-button activator cap as well, so you just use that instead and mount the light in a spot on your rifle where you can turn it on with your thumb...definitely not the end of the world. The light is made of some pretty durable aluminum and mounts to 1913 picatinny rail slots. Stays in place like a rock (but don't forget, ALWAYS Loctite EVERYTHING), and it's pretty lightweight so there isn't a noticeable change in inertia when you shoulder or sight your rifle. Bar none the best feature about this light is that it comes with 2(!) rechargable(!) 1200 mAh LiPo batteries and a charger. That's a huge deal...usually gun lights use weird, obscure, expensive batteries and taking that out of the equation entirely is an excellent move. I went ahead and bought a couple for my rifles. I'm considering getting a few more and putting them in my cars.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: Top Tier for a Low Price
review_text: When buying this flashlight I was skeptical of the price and the quality. But upon arrival, I was greeted with surprise as this flashlight is extremely bright and sturdy. When attached to my rifle, it doesn’t have any play in it what so ever, making the provided mount very sturdy. It lights up a whole room in the dark, and is definitely close to 1200 lumens. This is a top tier flashlight running in a low budget class. Having the light configured with the touch pad switch, you can have a constant beam on/off function or a momentary on/off switch that you can strobe with your of your fingers. Also, with the longer wire attaching the flashlight and touchpad, it allows the touchpad to be placed where the user feels it is most easy to use and comfortable. For me, this is a choice between my foregrip and rails on the opposite side of the light. I had a one problem with the pressure switch and contacted Feyachi through Facebook messenger. They responded very quickly and professionally. I sent them a video of the problem and a new switch arrived on my doorstep one or two days later. The customer service team at Feyachi is top of the line and it shows they care about their customers. The new pressure switch has worked flawlessly and is a newer style than the older one, which seems to be more robust. I would and have recommended this product friends and family or to anyone looking into purchasing a light for their firearms. This light is a fantastic edition to my AR-15 and I do not think I would have it any other way. Thank you Feyachi team for creating a fantastic product and having a great customer service team.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: Look no further! Easy to install and a great, much needed addition to my XM15. Came with everything shown neatly packed. My favorite thing about the mount is the offset design...having a floating hand guard system with a rail at the top was not an issue...was able to mount it without blocking my front and rear iron sights! It does in fact also come with a crisp pressure switch that you can mount with the light as well. Overall, it's a good deal considering everything you get at the price marked.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: I recieved the flashlight, when I opened the box. I was pleasantly surprised at what came with the flashlight. I charged both sets of batteries and when I tried the flashlight to my disappointment it didn't work I tried many times it feels like there's something loose on the inside and I don't want to try to take it apart and put it back together. It's unfortunate cuz I really do like the flashlight it seems very sturdy and it's well built unfortunately it just didn't work for me. I had to fix my last review.. after writing my review , the company reached out to me and replaced the flashlight. Best customer service on here. And I shop amazon a lot.. the new flashlight works great.. feels sturdy.. live the brightness.. perfect flashlight..

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: You get what you pay for
review_text: I have this mounted on my AR for "oh poop" situations, so far so good, i mean you literally can't do any better for the price, super bright, it's lightweight which is usually a con for something like this(quality) but also it's getting mounted on a weapon more than likely so that's also kinda a pro(at least for this price point). I did end up purchasing the M-Lok mount since i went a different way with my firearm. I'll recommend this for mounting on something that doesn't/won't get used and abused that much, if you're buying this for your issued weapon/putting your weapon through hard abuse i would definitely for safety reasons not go this route and buy something a bit more tried and true, but for my use it's perfect!

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: So far it's worth every penny!
review_text: *Update* I've run about 75 rounds with the light attached and on (it was dusk) and it worked flawlessly. I will definitely purchase another one for my next home defense tool. 'Initial review' The delivery arrived as scheduled. Assembly was quick and easy with the included allen wrenches. The tactical light fit perfectly on the picatinny rail on my Black Aces Tactical Pro semi-auto 12GA. A small amount of glue allowed me to place velcro strips on the fore-end grip to hold the on/off/manual strobe switch in the perfect position. The light is extremely bright so for home defense it's great for blinding any intruder while also providing a well lit target. I guess battery life is good as I don't do night hunting, but having 2 batteries with a charger makes this an even sweeter deal. I'll see how the light holds up after multiple rounds of range practice (not too much of that happening thanks to the COVID-19 ammo shortage).

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: So far so good. I haven't had a chance to test the durability under shooting conditions but am very satisfied with the light produced from this. The best option I found for the pressure switch was to use inner tube bands from a bicycle. Heavy duty Velcro adhesive wouldn't adhere to the rubber switch. Build quality of the light and mount are robust. A great fit on an AK type rifle using the "UTG Universal Single-rail Rifle Barrel Mount, 5 Slots" .

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: Extremely Bright !!!!! Do Not Stare Into Beam !!!
review_text: I've only had this flashlight for a few weeks, so it may be a bit premature to write a review. I purchased this at 3 AM while I was mostly asleep (along with quite a few other items - sleep-shopping, as it were). I bought it initially thinking it might be useful to mount on on, oh wait, never mind. I ultimately gave it to my beloved wife, who is very particular about many things (not in a bad way). This flashlight falls into the Goldilocks zone - not to large, not too small. The beam is long range enough to pick out skunks at a safe distance (> 100 yards), and the lens is designed so that there is a center long range spot beam and also a softer wider beam for closer range illumination. I cannot speak to battery life yet, and have not owned it long enough to comment on overall durability. The build quality it pretty good and I think it is good value for the money, especially when compared to flashlights that cost 5 times as much or more. It is too small to be useful as a club, one would have to get a large Mag-Lite for that.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: The value in the accessories alone makes it worth buying. Even as a stand alone flashlight it's a great deal, very bright, and includes 2 rechargable batteries and the charger. The pressure switch seems well made, although I see from some reviews that it occasionally fails, but I'm not concerned because the customer service seems outstanding. Besides, you could always get another switch assembly down the road.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: Very sturdy light and terrific value.
review_text: I ordered 2 of them on an impulse last night (I needed something for my 930 and AR anyway so it was a win-win). Overnight delivery and I had them when I woke up. My Mossberg SPX 930 got the light first. Fits perfectly in the Elzetta ZSM Tactical Shotgun Flashlight Mount I have attached. Nifty little setup and I'm sure it will be very helpful in illuminating bad guys 😁. I don't really see a need to use the remote pressure switch but maybe one day I will. The batteries came already partially charged so I tested it right out of the box. Very bright. Recharging the batteries now and I'll install them fully charged. I removed the lanyard because I can't stand it flopping and hanging down. Perfect. Terrific product for the price. Very solid light. Phil

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_header: Came with a faulty part, but Feyachi took good care of me...
review_text: I ordered this for use with a firearm. I first thought I would mount it with the remote switch for turning it on and off, but quickly found that whatever rubber surrounds the remote switch is like Teflon and nothing I had would stick to it. I found based on hand placement that the switch right on the rear of the flashlight was going to work great anyway, so I switched to that. Turns out that switch was bad and would not stay on. Opened up a ticket with Feyachi and they got me a new part out right away and everything is working great now. The flashlight is crazy bright and mounts up well. I did use some blue Loctite for some of the metal to metal connections. I would for sure buy this again for a similar application.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: I was really nervous that the negative reviews on this light would be true. However, I'm pleasantly surprised! Brightness: I'm no expert in lumens. But this light is going to cause a target to be disoriented for sure. It's brighter than any other light I've owned. Durability: Seems like it'd hold up well against light to moderate impact. But full disclosure, I only just received and mounted it today. UPDATE 4/12/20: The light began to malfunction. Feyachi customer service is absolutely wonderful. They are taking excellent care of me! 4/22: They replaced the entire light for free! Size: It's short, which makes it more difficult to prevent the barrel-shadow when mounted to a weapon (depending on your weapon), but I love the size because it keeps it lightweight. Looks: Honestly, this is just a great looking light on a weapon. I love the matte black finish. The switch remote: This is what I was most worried about based on some other reviews. While I agree that the switch isn't "high" quality, it certainly is far above the garbage grade it received from some other reviewers. For a $33 light that comes with a weapon mount and a switch, I'm pleased and impressed! Mount: Easy to mount to the standard picatinny rail. It's offset as well, which I like. 4/12/2020: CUSTOMER SERVICE: It's clear that Feyachi wants satisfied customers. Pan in customer service is taking AMAZING care of me. Highly recommended! UPDATE 4/22/2020: First light had a defective remote switch, Feyachi replaced it and shipped it quickly. New light works great!

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: I put this light on my AR build. I love Feyachi lights because they look good, are made well, are super bright, and come in at a budget price. Easy to mount, and comes with everything needed to get it on right. If you like the pressure switch, it's also included. Definitely a great deal when you don't want to break the bank on a weapon light.

product_title: Feyachi FL11-MB Tactical Flashlight 1200 Lumen Matte Black LED Weapon Light with Picatinny Mount, Rechargeable Batteries and Pressure Switch Included
review_text: I mounted this on the side of my AR. It comes with 2 end caps. One allows you to carry this as a regular flashlight. The other is connected via cable and has a mountable switch that allows for an on/off finger switch as well as a momentary switch. I mounted mine on the side of my fore grip handle and it works great. I love the momentary switch function. The switch itself is rather large and can be activated from pretty much anywhere along the length of the switch. This means I don’t have to try to situate my finger(s) on just one point. I grab the handle, my fingers wrap around and (almost) fall perfectly on the momentary switch. Pretty close to a perfect setup. As usual with anything like this, the mounting of the switch is problematic. Double sided tape does not hold well, and certainly not for any duration of time. There isn’t a lot of room on either end to grab on to, so I used a combination of things. I used removable 3M double sided adhesive under the switch (my handle has a cutout for a light switch). I then took electrical tape and wrapped it around the top of the switch, where the cable goes in. This gives it a lot of stability, still blends in, and, in a pinch, gives me a little extra electrical tape I can remove if I need it somewhere else. This light is super bright. The charging process takes a little bit (it says quick charger on it, but I’m not convinced it is). But, it comes with 2 batteries and they seem to keep their charge for a decent amount of time. I have not done a test yet to see exactly how long they last, but since I prefer the momentary bursts of light over the on/off switch, I imagine I’ll get a lot more use out of each battery. The light is not zoom-able and has no other functions (medium, low, strobe, etc). It is just full on or off in either constant on/off or momentary via the momentary switch. For me and for what I wanted, this light is perfect! One thing I almost forgot - when I first plugged the battery in and left it to charge, I came back several hours later (description says 3 hour charge time). After checking on it at 3 hours, then 4 hours, and then 5 hours, I went to pull the battery out to see if it was seated properly. As soon as I touched the battery, the light on the charger turned green. I let go of it, and the light went back to red. I decided to turn (spin) the battery in the charger and the red light flickered between red and green. I decided to switch batteries and the next battery charged for a few hours and then went green on its own. When I put the first battery back in, it did the red/green dance again. Not sure if this is a charger problem or what, but the battery is in the flashlight and has been working fine, so I assume the charger just has a problem with it’s indicator somehow.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Upon ordering I spent hours around looking for a red dot for my AR Pistol and came across this! Upon my order getting delivered I rushed to install the item and got it zeroed out and went to test it...... It worked actually flawlessly! The packaging was done right and wrapped in bubble wrap to make sure it wasn't going to get damaged during shipping. The quality on this red dot is durable and isn't just cheap plastic like others out there. There are different settings for the red dot and the power button option is just right for this item. While taking the rifle to the range I got many complements on the red dot and people were surprised for the price of it and were looking to get their hands on one too! I would highly recommend getting a red dot like this before it's sold out and then your out of luck!

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: I finally got it installed and bore sighted. I have a few minor tweaks to do but I'm impressed with the sight for sure! I bore sighted this by looking down the bore of my AR at a target 35ish yards away and kept moving the crosshairs till it lined up with where my role was pointing to. Put it all together and I was right on target! I emptied several magazines as far as I could to try and jar it off target but it held very well. With current ammo prices I didn't do much else. But intial reports: this sight is underpriced for the quality and ease. It's got great sight picture with crisp, sharp, clear images. It adjusts easily and mounds painlessly. Another quality product from Feyachi. This is why I use their stuff!

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: After using this reflex sight for a while, it holds up nicely. I went to a few airsoft games and it is very durable, the glass didn’t break when it got hit and there were no skid marks on the metal. Shooting with this sight at the gun range and realigning the sight-line was easy as it can get, it’s very comfortable to deal with and it’s not too hard to put on or takeoff the rail the only problem I have with the sight is it has no ON and OFF switch/button witch is ok though because of the price I got 16.68 USD and the two batteries it comes with is a great. It’s not too hard to switch them out after using. it was an amazing sight and price 10/10 would buy again as a gift for a friend or if the sight ever breaks but I don’t see that happening anytime soon because of the durably! so far it’s Seems to be water resistant I went out in the rain with it it didn’t seem to fry it or sort Circuit but at one point while I was shooting at the range it turned off randomly and I thought it was the battery so I took it out and put it back in just to be sure and it turned right back on after that, i haven’t experience any real problems with the battery throughout my experience. but i do I love the different levels of radicals but there's only one I really use is the circle with the plus and the dot in the middle and it’s really nice to have low light levels and high levels also I really like how you can unscrew the rail all the way off your gun without the rail on the sight falling off which is a neat feature. I drop this thing in mud I think twice when I was at a airsoft match after I cleaned it off it seem to be OK, it holds up pretty well against .20g BBs there’s no marks on it or scratched paint but I do wish it came in different colors like tan and Woodland green or a light green but at the end of the day you’re getting more for your dollar which is amazing I do wish that they would make a A mesh screen protector for it tho Price it at like five or six bucks that would be amazing because from the front it is very shiny it’s almost like a beacon staying over here !

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Received this reflex sight the other day and installed it yesterday 7/20/20 and so far, so great! The reticles are as bright as you want them to be, I prefer the dot myself. Found the sight very easy to zero out to 50yds and it was accurate. It got a nice clear sight picture and target acquisition is easy and quick. Very easy to move from target to target on my personal shooting range. A great CQB and backyard plinking sight. Feyachi customer service is superb and a reason I will continue to purchase their products.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: The first unit that I received had issues. The glass was chipped on the side and caused a strange glare. Also the retical was tilted counter clockwise. Seller sent me another unit and did not request a return. The following unit did not have any issues. Unit has held up well in field testing. Was easy to get zeroed. Has held zero though 500 rounds. No abuse testing was conducted to date. Vaule for the dollar is high for this unit.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Great Value. Bright and adjustable makes aiming easy.
review_text: Works perfectly. I installed this on my shotgun for turkey hunting and couldn't be happier. It has helped my aim considerably so much easier to line up my shot. The red dot is super bright and adjustable as well the reticle is changeable and spot on. Feyachi is a great brand for value priced accessories I have a laser from them as well that works great.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Best Red dot scope for the money
review_text: Right out of the box the scope felt solid-quality. I installed it on a marlin 15 shot .22 caliber rifel. I bought a weaver to picatinny conversion rail in order to install on that weapon. I bore sighted the scope. Then I finished sighting at a target.That took me all of 5 shots. When I was finished, I put 6 rounds into a half dollar sized circle at 20 yards. Thats all I need for varmint. The scope has 5 reticles. I chose the one I wanted and sighted to that. I believe that in order to change reticles accurately, another sighting would be required. Overall, I am EXTREMELY happy with the scope. I highly recommend it.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: This review is an evaluation of the product and the level of customer service. The unit I originally purchased worked fine the first time I used it. When I attempted to turn it on again, nothing happened. I contacted customer support and they offered a few suggestions to remedy the situation. However, none of the actions worked. Feyachi then sent me a new unit without returning the old one. It works fine. The product may get four stars but the customer service is without a doubt, five stars.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Close to Zero Right Out of the Box!
review_text: I recently added this to a 9mm carbine at the range and found the site close to zero right out of the box. The sight picture allowed me to see my front site and with the two grooves on this site I lined it up and my first shot came in at 2 o'clock. A couple clicks and I was at center target. The image shown has some of my drops/errors, and shows the carbine will never be a tack driver, but this site has you on target with eyes open in a moment of time -- exactly what it was designed for. The brightness and type of cross-hair are changeable and, as always, batteries (including an extra) are included! Feyachi has yet to disappoint me. These low priced sites are worth much more than their price would lead you to believe! If you are looking for an economical, dependable, and well-designed optic for fast target acquisition and shot placement, but this. You will not be disappointed.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Excellent Budget Sight. Holds zero, very durable and lightweight!!
review_text: Amazing sight for the money!! Tested this on my .223 and my AR-12 Shotgun and it held zero perfectly. Pros: *Brightness button easy to adjust *Battery Compartment very easy to get to and you dont have to remove sight and loose zero to change *Lightweight, very durable! *Reticles are crazy bright *The coated lens is really nice, glass quality good. Cons: *There is only 1. On the cross hair reticle the reticles are not perfectly straight Other than that this is an excellent budget optic. Would highly recommend. Fraction of the price of an EOTECH and less than half the weight.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: wide lens, solid mount, and bright reticle
review_text: This RS-30 reflex sight is clear and bright. In full sunlight the reticle is easily visible on the lowest or second lowest of the six brightness settings. The simple dot pattern is the only one that requires a higher setting. The reticle was easy to adjust and has stayed zeroed. Adjustments require the use of two hex keys. For some situations, this will be less convenient than if it had a slotted screw that could be turned with readily available objects (e.g., the rim of a cartridge). More thorough instructions would be helpful for less experienced users. For example, the manual does not mention that the locking screw must be loosened before making elevation or windage adjustments. Another important feature is durability, but I haven't had it long enough to know. Only time will tell. Based on the way Feyachi interacts with Amazon customers, I’m confident they will honor the three-year warranty if there is a defect. At this point, I give the RS-30 a thumbs-up.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: I installed this on a Keltec KSG 12-gauge shotgun. Feyachi says this sight is rated for 12 gauge use. I hope this is true. The alternative is a true glow tube-style red dot, and I'm not too fond of those. I am very impressed with the build quality so far. I have not had a chance to zero it yet. I will update if there are any issues with durability due to the 12-gauge concussion force. I also added a set of Feyachi buis and loved the ability to co-witness!

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: The sight appears to be made from quality materials, and comes with everything you need to fit it, including Loctite. Unfortunately mine appeared to be DOA. NO PROBLEM! I emailed the manufacturer, they replied the following day asking for a video as they didn't understand what I meant. (Non gun guy!) However, no quibble received a new sight within a couple of days. Superb service. I will leave another review once I've used it.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: The multicoated lens really makes a difference!
review_text: Excellent product. I bought this and a few competitors based on Amazon reviews and it was a big step up from other budget reticles. The closest competitor is the RS-29, but there are pros and cons between them. I have multiple platforms on which I tried them (and others) and I really like the RS-30, overall. First off, the images were clear. I had two other models that had blurry images in the viewing windows, regardless of relief depth. This and the RS-29 are both clear and the projected images were sharp. Next, the controls were both intuitive and smooth. The press-button on/of is a bit different from a dial but it was easy to do by feel. Both the control button and the image selector are both smooth to operate. The color options and variations in images are pretty standard but at least all of the bases are covered. I really- REALLY - wish it also went green. I almost passed on this because I like the green dot over red but with the coated glass and the clear picture I quickly got past the single color option. The weight is on par with other similar open reticles, though the thicker lens and full shade hood added a few 1/10ths over the RS-29. Using it was great. Kids adapted to it quickly and were able to keep both eyes open, which helped them be relaxed when using it. It held zero over 250 cycles and was easy to get dialed in the first time. Overall, this is a great budget open reticle sight!

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Works surprisingly well for an inexpensive optic
review_text: I'm old and my eyes are so bad I have a hard time seeing iron sights anymore. I didn't want to spend over $200 on a name-brand optic since this is for a pellet gun I have on my front porch to keep neighborhood cats away - so I took a chance on this cheap knockoff. Been shooting it a couple weeks now. I usually go out every morning and plink a few rounds at targets with my coffee. Holds zero pretty well. Especially for what I paid for it. Some things other reviews said that are true: the battery that comes with it will die on you within 10 minutes of using it. However - they include another battery and that one seems to be a better quality because 2 weeks of shooting it daily and still hasn't died yet. So I suspect the installed battery is just a "demo battery" or something. Also - the crosshair reticle is tilted a little to the left. Not dramatically. Maybe 5 degrees. It doesn't seem to hurt the aim - just looks a little weird. I find myself using the red-dot reticle anyway just because it's no so big and gaudy looking. All in all - I'd recommend

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: I have been putting this optic through torture and abuse for a few months now and have not had any serious issues with it. It has handled the recoil of a Winchester Model 70 chambered in .300 Win Mag, an AR-10 in 7.62×51 and an AR-15 in 5.56×45 without issue. It held ZERO through some pretty rough handling bordering on slight "abuse". It is very easy to mount and use. It has several brightness levels and is very easy to see. The price is really good and the optic is built tough!! I would recommend this to others for sure.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Product well made, customer service even better
review_text: Just to start, I mounted sight and saw that the reticle views were distorted and slightly Todd center to the right. After a few rounds it became a distraction to shoot on target. After contacting Feyachi about the issue, they didn’t hesitate to send me a new sight. Received it within 1 day of shipping. Mounted the sight and it was to say the least perfect. For this price point, it definitely can’t be beat. Far from perfect , but not that far

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: High quality sight for an awesome price.
review_text: First off I own many Feyachi products and have never been disappointed with any of them. I received the package on time and the sight was packed in a small but efficient well padded box that did a very good job of protecting the sight during shipping. When I unpackaged the sight I was impressed by how well made the sight felt. I have several reflex sights from the eotech and holosun, to a trijicon and this sight impressed me immediately for the price. I already had a 16” 5.56 rifle set up for it That It mounted up nicely On with no problems. The sight is low profile and has an aesthetically pleasing design. I was able to bore sight the sight and get it close enough to finish dialing it in at the range. Once at the range the sight zeroed easily and seemed to hold zero through all 1000 rounds we fired. The glass is very clear for the cost of the sight. I like the different options for reticles that come stock as well as the brightness options. I also like that it takes a very popular easy to find battery size. One thing I was not able to determine as I have not had the sight for long enough is the battery run time. I have had not been able to run the battery out since I purchased the sight. Another feature that I like about the sight is that it has the absolute cowitness ability with stock sights. Time will tell how this sight holds up but I am very happy with my purchase and will buy another one for my truck rifle. This sight is a very nice sight for the price point and overall has far surpassed my expectations. Thanks Feyachi for another great product.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Pleasantly surprised how good sight was
review_text: Great sight for the money. I tried it on my AR15, AR9 and 22lr Charger. The sight only needed minor adjustments to zero when changing platforms. I put at least 300rds on each weapon and the sight held zero well. The different rectiles worked great on different target types and were easy to change. The brightness settings were adequate I had to use the brightest setting all the time, probably due to old eyes. If you want a good sight without paying hundreds, this would be a good choice. For the price I will be getting one or 2 more.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Dot is fairly tight, nearly perfect circle, easy to see even while shooting in sunlight. Took just minutes to get zeroed in at 100 yds. For the price, I am very pleased. Held accuracy throughout many rounds so far. Very easy to install and adjust. Love the option to change dot image. Very cool. Full disclosure: I originally purchased another brands' sight which was only about $20 cheaper, and it absolutely is inferior in every aspect compared to this Feyachi sight. Wish I would have just bought this one the first time.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Easier to View Dot Sight for my Birding Photography
review_text: Compare to the more expensive Olympus EE-1, this one is much easier to view. To me, it is easier to view than the scope types like the Feyachi RDS-22. Both Feyachi dot sight works well, feels solid, and high quality. I now prefer this RS-30 because ease of use and easier to view. I got this mount to go with the RS-30: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B075D3BCF8 Another good mount that fits more securely is: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B06XYBR4P2 but is more of a hassle to put and remove to the hot shoe of the camera.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: This is my first Feyachi product. Ive owned many many different holo sites of all different price points and this one is the best quality for the money in this price range. I havent torture tested it yet and will update after sone hard use. So fae, seems like a very well made piece of equiptment and has a nice weight to it. Probably going to buy a few more and have already shown some friends on a budget and they also plan on buying one.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Very light weight but rugged build
review_text: Like most of the feyachi products, this reflex sight is a study in simplicity and functionality. You have a range of 4 reticles and the brightness settings should suit most practical shooting scenarios. Its a rugged yet light weight unit that wont break the bank and still has a wide objective so you dont feel like you are looking through a straw like most other red dots in this range. Simple 1 button operation with memory so that it turn on to the brightness level that was previously selected. Perfect pragmatic approach for outifitting multiple guns with optics at a budget friendly price.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: This is an absolute GREAT buy! Very good qaulity & well made. Functions are easy to operate, and works very well. DEFINITELY worth the money 👍

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Love the build quality for the price, had a problem with the reticle not being very defined even on 20.20. inspection so Feyachi has sent out a replacement for free. I will be updating this review after first range tests for durability and accuracy for holding a 0 whenever I can get out to one. Update 1 (6.7.2020) Replacement showed up and great build quality as last besides the first one's problem and happy to say the replacement's reticle is clearer to see and a tad brighter. Range test to soon-ish hopefully, still waiting on a pic mounted Feyachi laser and flashlight to show up to test on the same outing.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Looks good, haven't put many rounds through it yet.
review_text: The first one I bought had an issue with the horizontal adjustment. Contacted the seller and they immediately sent a replacement. I've only put a dozen rounds through it so far, no trips to the range, but it works great on a 10/22. Only real issue I've found is the on/off switch. Sometimes when I turn the red dot off, it will sometimes turn back on.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: If you are looking at the crosshair style you only need to move the style switch. you can even it out as it goes up on the right and left as you turn the selector. Not sure why people cant see that or figure it out. move the selector gently and you can adjust to your preference. I have not fired yet with it. that is this weekend and I will provide an update.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Is this the best red dot sight available? No. It is not but you get what you pay for and, for this price, you won’t find anything better. I use this on a 12 gauge shotgun and I’m very happy. It’s not the sight I would use for wet weather duck hunting, but for every day it’s just fine. Solid enough and looks very good. Reticles are very functional and dimmable for use in low light.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: I purchased this Feyachi RS 30 red dot for my new AR 450 Bushmaster. Upon receiving the product I was able to quickly install it onto the rail and start to sight it in. There were tools provided to lock the product down and an extra battery was even included. The power button has easy access. The product has the ability to adjust for elevation and wind. I was pleasantly surprised to see there are 4 styles to choose from with the reticle selector. A standard red dot and 3 other cross hair style options. When you've chosen the option that is best for you, hit the power button up to 4 times to brighten/dim that option. This process will cycle through as many times as needed. Just hold the power button in to turn the product off. Last - a 3 year warranty is hard to beat. So far this seems like a solid product for a great price.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: First of all, I like this reflex sight. It’s size, weight, stout construction, functionality, and price is hard to beat. The field of view is more than adequate for fast target acquisition, plus various reticle brightness settings allow preferences in different light conditions. Combined with a variety of reticle choices and the fore mentioned features, it’s very hard to outclass this sight given its price range. And it looks cool on an AR-15 or variant rifle. Has to look cool. As rifle owners and builders add components, functionality and gadgets to their builds, rifle weight increases. Personally, I’m concerned with weight. However, weight aside, besides the rifle itself, the sighting system is critical in the build. The sight must function according to the shooters requirements and provide accurate placement at various ranges. The RS-30 in my opinion provides excellent sighting in a compact, lightweight, easy to use package that doesn’t add unnecessary functionality and weight, such as lasers. Sighting in the reticle is accomplished using the provided wrenches. Reticle lock down is provided. Regardless of eye position, the retical holds target adequately. Iron backup sights work exceptional well through the lens. Construction is robust. The hood is stout providing a glare shield and should protect the lens area quite well. Rail attachment is good given the overall weight and profile of the sight. This is all accomplished by not creating a huge lump on top of a rifle keeping the overall profile of an AR-15 quite low and attractive. Looks cool. My opinion’ a good job Feyachi. Electronics provide the on-off button location for a right-hand shooter’s support hand operation. Strong side left hand shooters should be able to adapt to this location with practice. The reticle selection lever is located in a protected position however easy to reach and adjust. Battery storage is good plus provides a coin operated cover for easy removal. Batteries are readily available at local stores I’ve not tested the one-hour auto-power shut-off feature. Battery removal may need to be revisited. To my Feyachi friends, a couple of suggestions to improve on an already good sight. My suggestions would no-doubt add price to the optic however would significantly increase the reliability, desirability and overall functionality of the optic. This optic can compete with much more expensive optics. First, a positive ‘click’ positioning lever on the reticle selection feature would insert the reticle precisely in the lens eliminating minor adjustments to center the reticle Second, windage and elevation adjustments would be more convenient with coin operated adjustment screw; currently the operator must always have the adjustment wrench available. Watch out for painted directions on the optic as some builders paint their rifles. Third, add a quick rail attach or detach feature protected from unintended release. Lastly, and no-doubt the most costly improvement is providing some degree of waterproofing to the electronics and lens. Given the existing sight and with these improvements, I would not have an issue paying more. Plus this sight could complete with optics costing hundreds of dollars more. Thank you for the opportunity to provide you my personal feedback to your RS-30 Reflex sight.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: I recently purchased the Feyachi RS-30 Reflex sight for my new AR. The sight is very sturdy and it mounted very easily. I love the 4 different reticles, and the 6 different light intensities are great from low light to very bright. I had a slight tilt to the crosshair reticle that was a problem for me. I contacted Feyachi by email and explained my problem. I received a response in less than 24 hours. After understanding the situation they offered to send me a new replacement sight which I received in 4 days. The new sight is perfect. I will definitely buy from Feyachi again. They have great products for the money and even better customer service. I highly recommend buying from them. Thanks Feyachi.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Surprisingly good quality for the price!
review_text: Im really surprised with good quality of the product. I have a $750 red dot mounted on one of my rifles. Just bought a cheap 22 rifle the other day and decided to mount a cheap red dot on it. I bought this sight and to my surprise this sight is just as good!! After taking the time to zero the sight, all shots were ver consistent afterwards. FYI was shooting a bullseye the size of a grape 10 yards a way. Im writing this review same day I received the sight by mail. Check other reviews to learn whether or not it “holds the zero” over time and also to learn about how the sight behaves in rain. Thanks

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: This is the one to buy! Tremendous value.
review_text: Let me start off with saying I love testing these budget friendly options of sights. I've been involved in the firearms community over 17 years now. I worked with training companies and shops. I've handled everything from bottom of the barrel, to the top of the line. I've tested several products from feyachi, this sight by far is an the absolute cherry of the feyachi offerings. I've had a few units in the past with some reticle issues. I must say feyachi's customer service is second to none. They've always without hesitation taken care of any issues. That in itself is worth 5 stars. Pan has been an absolute pleasure deal with and their customer service cannot be beat. This sight is SOLID! I will list the pros and cons below. Pros : - This unit is rock solid. With budget optics it's tough to find something of quality. Is this an eotech? No, not by any stretch, but It's also not $500. - I love the switch on this unit. It has the 4 way reticle selection at the rear, and a simple on and off button on the left side. I've never really like the rotating dials commonly found on these types of sights. I really like how it has the intensity control built into the button.A quick push and you can manual cycle through 6 different options. 1 is fairly dim, but 6 is super bright even in direct sunlight. You press to turn on, click to adjust brightness and press and hold to shut off. I haven't had a chance to test, but this unit supposedly turns itself off after an hour of time if it's not moved around. I cannot confirm that as of yet. - The adjustments on the unit have a firm and positive click, and lock solidly into place. This fit perfect on the rail system on an AR pistol, with little to no wiggle or play. The reticle selector is firm and positive when you switch through the options, but still very easy to engage. The power button is a positive click when pushed. Overall a very solid unit. This also cowitnesses perfectly. - The size is just about perfect. This is pretty small and low profile for what it is. I think some people may find it a bit small, but it's just right in my opinion. Alot of value in a compact package. - This unit has a small rear sight built right into the rear part of the unit. It cannot be adjusted. I thought this was just an awesome addition to this sight. It's very rare that on the unit itself there is a way to have a backup. I have not tested accuracy of it yet, but absolutely love the concept. It should help you in a pinch if you have no rear back up option. - The reticle selection. Oh the reticle selection. Four great options. Each option is super crisp and clear. I had 4 people look at it to tell me what they thought of the clarity. 3 said fantastic, one said fuzzy. It seems very dependent on if you have an eye issues like astigmatism, or corrective lenses. No issues, but something to keep in mind. They varying intensity is fantastic. - I love that the adjustment Allen wrenches and an extra battery is included. This comes with everything you need to throw it on, tighten it down, power it on, adjust, and clean it. Fantastic value. - I also love the lens coating. It seemed to work really well at keeping down glare, it also makes it look pretty incredible! Cons : Honestly I dont have many cons to list here, I'd say its more nitpicks than anything else. - The finish isnt the best. The unit arrive safely and packaged well. My unit had some chipping on some of the edges. Minor for me, but I thought it was noteworthy. A dot of sharpie or black paint would take care of that in short order. My unit also has a small, almost rubbing kind of wear on one spot on the rear. The item I recieved was all factory sealed and in brand new condition. I could only assume it was maybe from handling in the factory. Very minor. - The hardware to attach was a little gritty. Some oil and running the screws in and out a few times took care of that quickly aswell, again, not a problem, but I thought it was noteworthy. I had no issues with soft or stripping screw heads or anything like that. - The reticles, while bright and crisp, have the slightest counterclockwise lean going on. It's not perfectly vertical, just every so slightly tilted to the left. I don't forsee it being an issue, but did notice it. Also as mentioned above. Four people looking at the reticles. Three said they were crisp, one said they were fuzzy. It seems dependent on if you have any eye issues or wear corrective lenses. All in all, this sight is a solid purchase. This will be going on an AR chambered in 300 AAC. I will come back to update as it sees some use. I cant speak to longevity or reliability at this point. If your looking for a budget optic, this is the one to buy in my opinion. With those minor nitpicks aside, this thing is of good quality, it feels solid, and the reticle selection and brightness are really stellar. I would highly reccomend this sight, and give this 5 stars. It's a tremendous value, and it has many features found on sights upward of the $90-$100 mark. Well above its similarly priced competitors. You wont be dissappinted, and in the off chance you are, Feyachi's awesome customer service team will be more than happy to take care of you.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: I mounted this sight on a Ruger 10/22. Mounting is simple as it fits any standard picatinny rail. The reticle is clear and bright. The lowest setting is fine in low light. I used it in bright sunlight on the highest setting and had no problem quickly acquiring the target. There are 4 reticles. I shot with all four of them and saw no shift in point of impact when switching between them. Accuracy is perfectly fine. It’s a red dot, not a precision scope. It’s quick to place on target and has a fine enough dot to not cover too much target area. I fired 500 rounds with the sight attached and found no shift in impact and no loosening of the base. Overall, I am very satisfied. I ran through a bunch of drills and practiced transitioning between multiple targets. The sight is great for fast target acquisition and allows you to keep both eyes open for quick transitions. One nice thing I wasn’t expecting is the solid click of the power button. It isn’t mushy at all and you feel it when you click through the settings.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Exactly what I wanted for a great price.
review_text: I received this product for free in exchange for a review, but this did not influence my opinion of the product in any way. When I first received this reflex sight, the first thing I noticed was how sturdy it felt. I've had other ones that felt like they were cheaply made toys, but this one is made of metal and feels solid. It was easy to install and came with the tools to do so, so no extra purchases were necessary. I really like that the brightness of the sight can also be adjusted to fit different lighting conditions. I couldnt find much to dislike about this product except that a couple of the sight projections are not perfectly straight by a couple degrees, but it's not a big deal to me as I usually use the crosshairs that are round and don't have straight lines. Overall I think this is product is perfect for what I need it for. I don't do a lot of shooting outdoors or in harsh weather conditions. I mainly stick to indoor ranges, so I'm not sure how well this sight would perform under those circumstances.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: I am very pleased with Feyachi and it's products. I recently ordered a reflex sight and it was shipped very quickly. Upon arrival the build quality was excellent and material used felt very premium and sturdy; however my sight had a slight defect, before I had a chance to email Feyachi they had sent me an email to confirm that received the product and that it was operating to my satisfaction, I informed them of the defect I noticed and without any further questions they sent me a new sight which arrived just as quickly as the first, this time the sight felt just as premium as before and without any defect. I appreciate how quickly Feyachi responded and resolved my concerns. Feyachi has earned a customer for life.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Could be a tad brighter in the bright Texas sun!
review_text: A really solid-feeling sight. Performs well and holds its Zero true enough but was a bit dim in bright sunlight and If I could have a wish, I would wish for BOTH red AND green sighting....as advertised, though: red only....I'm not complaining....just preferences. It was extremely easy to sight in...I did a laser bore sight on the neighbor's fence the night before going to the range to get it close. 3 clicks left and two clicks we were at ZERO. 400 rounds later still zeroed at 25 and 50 yards. I have a couple of Feyachi sights and have not been disappointed with the performance, looks or utility. The front reticle is bright red reflective...I found it attractive but not gaudy....just not stealthy...if that's an issue...it's a great sight and now my Wife wants one one for her AR to replace her old red dot 1X28 scoped sight.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Put this on my micro conversion kit for the Glock 19 gen5. Simple to sight in and it works great. Took about 5 minutes to adjust. Maybe the one of the best buys out there. No reason to pay many times more.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: The Customer service department is top notch
review_text: I purchased this sight 10 months ago and was very happy with it. All of a sudden it went off and I could not get it to turn back on. I contacted customer service and they did not even flinch. They immediately sent another one and it arrived within 5 days. Of course things can happen with any product but you cant speak highly enough when a company stands behind their product without any question. Not only would I recommend this to a friend just because the company is good but the product is great.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: So far, this is a great sight!
review_text: I installed it in minutes. Took it to range and sight in on 50 yard range. I shot a dozen rounds and it was on target. I didn’t even need to adjust the thing. Couldn’t believe it. So I shot three more magazines or ninety rounds and it held the target with movement! Happy so far. My experience with the 29 model was terrible but the company made good and sent another 29, but I haven’t had opportunity to try the replacement yet. I would have to say it’s a good company as they want you to be satisfied.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Great sight for what I paid
review_text: Overall, I'm giving this red dot sight 5 stars, but only because there's not a 4.5 stars option. See below for my pros, cons, and summary. Pros: - Seems to be a quality build, with all metal parts except (ironically) the built-in iron sight. - Includes (forementioned) rear iron sight. - Great price for the quality that you get. - Adjustable reticle, with four options. - Quality mount built in. - Batteries included (including spare). Cons: - Parallax is an issue. Tested from 3yds to 15yds, the point of impact changes based on where you look through the sight window. On many red dot sights where parallax is an issue, it becomes a non-issue at 50+ yds; I didn't test it this far out. - Slightly uneven reticles, most noticeable on the star one at the far left; the points are not exactly horizontal/vertical. Summary: So why 5 stars with the obvious parallax issue? Because this is a $44 sight. Parallax free sights are going to cost in the hundreds, not in the tens. I wouldn't recommend this sight for any situation in which precision is an absolute necessity, but then again, you wouldn't be buying this sight if absolute precision was a requirement. It's absolutely great for the price, and I recommend if you're looking for a casual red dot sight for your gun.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Well I had an open mind. I had looked this unit up and saw a warning that a astigmatism could cause some blurry issues. But much to my surprise NOPE. I like how you can dial the light of the reticle WAY DOWN for me thats a must. Its a easy on but also easy off the rail for quick range changes. You can change the reticle type and while this may seem not to big a deal it is. And YES Absolute Co-Witness with Iron Sight .....NICE Very nice package job Fast shipping and an all around good product.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Great scope for a great price.
review_text: I just received my Feyachi RS-30 Relex scope today. With my aging eyes my intent was to get a relatively inexpensive red dot scope to mount on my Ruger 1022. I have had some good experiences with a Feyachi’s RDS-22 scope on a Glock 22 fitted with a MCK so I was looking forward to the RS-30. The RS-30 mounted easily to my Ruger’s picatinny rail with the included scope mount. Also included were allen wrenches for installation and adjustment and a complete second set of batteries. Although I have yet to take it to the range, a quick co-witness with the existing metal sights suggests the new red dot is fairly close to zero. For the price the RS-30 has some nice features. There are 4 reticle patterns: dot within a circle, dot within a cross, solitary dot and finally, dot within a circle within a cross. Each of these patterns have 6 brightness settings. Setting 4 seemed the best for me. The pattern is turned on by pressing the on switch. Pressing the switch briefly cycles through the brightness setting. Holding the switch down for a couple of seconds turns off the reticle. Additionally, to preserve battery life, the sight will turn itself off after one hour of inactivity. A nice feature is that the scope remembers your last pattern and brightness setting so when you turn it back on you are set to go. The reticle itself is large and easily lends itself to shooting with both eyes open. If you are hunting this allows you to remain situationally aware while providing a clear sight picture. The fit and finish of the scope itself is beyond expectations, particularly given the price point. I look forward to getting to the range and putting this scope through it’s paces. Given my experience with the RDS-22 I do not anticipate any issues.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: This is a reflex sight and it is the best one I have seen. It is rugged and has features that the company doesn't mention such as the automatic shut off. The batteries last a very long time and adjustment is very easy. I have taken it to the range several times and find the ridicule to be exactly on target after sighting it in. I turned it off target, both up and down 10 inches, then turned it back to zero. It was exactly on target I can hit 6" plates at one hundred meters with every shot using a 300 blackout and 110 grain bullets (super sonic). This sight is larger, diameter wise, target acquirement is very easy. I will likely order several more. I didn't realize there was something this good out there for this price. I can not get over how easy it is to use. I would strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a good sight. I have several other products from this company and customer service is excellent. I am convinced that this company wants their products to work for you. Two month later...I have been using this, a number of people at the range have used it. No one has anything but good things to say about this sight. It gets on target fast and it's ease of use is excellent. The features addict you to the unit. I am going to be ordering more of them!

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Seems well built, for the cost. No rattle, nothing feels too cheap. Reticle is bright, auto-off function works. But be aware, this is a "you get what you pay for" product. If you're looking for high accuracy at 100 yard+ range, this probably isn't it. The sight is a lot of fun to use, great for under 60 yards! The auto-off feature is a smart addition. 100% worth every penny. ~~~~~~~~~~ OK, so the first range visit, put it through 200 rounds of .223 at about 30 yards, and it worked FANTASTIC. Took and kept zero, reticle is bright. Held up well to the use. Loved it. On the second trip after about 50 rounds, the "locking screw" on the side walked out, fell in the dirt at the range, and is gone forever. Now it wobbles and won't hold zero. Waiting to see if Feyachi can replace the part, or if I have to buy a new sight altogether. ~~~~~~~~~~ Feyachi is amazing. I wrote them to see what could be done, thinking I would maybe hear from them in a day or two... And within 30 minutes, they wrote back, and shipped me a replacement. Lesson learned? TIGHTEN DOWN THOSE NUTS!

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: You want to know, Is this the best Red Dot? Well no, it isn't. What is it then? It is the best Red Dot in its price range. I guess it all comes down to what are you going to use it for & how much abuse that you are going to subject it to? I should add if you are a Gun Snob, this Red Dot is not for you or your friends. For me, mounted on a side mount of a Serbian AK, this Red Dot exceed all my expectations for this lower priced sight. Anyone who knows AK's, knows that the side mounts & amplified shock from the recoil of this rifle, destroys most lower priced optics. 7 Magazines & 210 rounds later, I was out of ammo, my armpit was a little tender(I have got to shoot more) & this Red Dot was still holding aero & functioning perfect. When I get another rifle, this is one of my top choices for a optic. I know 200 rounds is not a true test for durability or reliability, so I will update this review, if issues ever do come up & my AK seems to bring up issues with optics all the time, usually within the first 100 rounds.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: This product has great reviews and it is for a great reason. Not only is it budget-friendly but it is also reliable. I've done many reviews for the manufacturers products and I must say that the products are all consistently well made and do exactly what their purpose is meant to do. Don't get it twisted I'm not recommending this site for combat or hard use but it is definitely perfect for the budget-friendly shooter who just likes to go out and plink on the weekend.

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: I put it on a scar17 lol
review_text: This reflects light does work as advertised you press the button it turns on now with that being said This isn’t really designed for a serious rifle or any sort of combat or defense style of use If you’re going to buy this it should be put on a 22 Long rifle or an airsoft gun I put it on my scar 17 just to see how I could handle it and the recoil is making it have zero shifting issues On a 22 Long rifle I don’t think that will be a problem

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_header: Great company, with some QA hiccups.
review_text: Edit: Feyachi contacted me directly and is replacing the sight. I updated to 5 stars until I am able to test the new sight and verify reliability. So far the company has gone above and beyond in customer service. I highly recommend doing business with them. Edit: replacing the batteries seems to have solved the always on issue. Updated to 3 stars. I really wanted to love this optic, and before I mounted it I was hopeful. I noticed it was a little tilted, but based on other comments I thought that would be the case. I was impressed with how bright it is. That's where the good things end. Once it was mounted I noticed that the reticle was always on. I can't turn it off or change the brightness setting, which is set to the lowest setting. Removing the batteries, unmounting, and tapping it seems to do nothing. I would consider this for a toy gun, but nothing more unfortunately. Pros: Inexpensive Clear glass Easy to mount Cons: Tilted crosshairs Reliability

product_title: Feyachi RS-30 Reflex Sight, Multiple Reticle System Red Dot Sight with Picatinny Rail Mount, Absolute Co-Witness
review_text: Look, its cheap AF and it works. Anything less than 10 yards and youll get a bit of parallax (Not really bad considering at that range if the reticle is on target your going to at least hit a part of the target anyway). At 10 it shoots a tiny hair above center reticle. Not really an issue if your shooting at anything bigger than a grape. 10+ yards - 25 yards its spot on. Haven't tested it pass that. Shot around 200 rounds and on 2 different days. 1st day was the zero 2nd day was to shoot some more, held zero 2nd day no problems. Im not a super serious "gun" guy and I know the only time I will possibly ever use my weapon outside a range is if someones busting into my house trying to put stuff in my butt. Its really cheap for what you are getting and it works. Auto off is really nice, and its super bright. Comes with 2 sets of batteries.

product_title: Conair Double Ceramic Triple Barrel Curl Styling Waver
review_text: Got ready in 10 min. So happy to have something easy and look so good.

product_title: Conair Double Ceramic Triple Barrel Curl Styling Waver
review_text: I was a little hesitant when I purchased this item but I’ve heard such great things about them. My hair lacks volume but when using this product it makes it so full! I love it! So easy to use and takes me about 10-15 minutes to do my whole head and I have medium length hair

product_title: Conair Double Ceramic Triple Barrel Curl Styling Waver
review_text: I have extremely straight, fine hair that's to the small of my back but this works perfectly! I cannot even believe how good this product works.
